column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This location is one of four throughout NYC. They had a great selection of pastries and treats like breakfast empanadas, petite French toast, and cruffins- as well as espresso based drinks *coffee is by Intelligentsia*. There is indoor seating along the window under the fiddles, and two communal counters with barstools. All gender bathroom, too! I would pay them a second visit for another try at more pastries.
No comment
None of the drinks were very flavorful, mushroom latte especially just tasted like milk. But nice ambiance
Good coffee, a variety of pastries (including one vegan muffin), food, and both indoor and outdoor seating. It's very cute inside and outside and is a nice spot in the center of Dumbo.
No comment

While in NYC Butler will always be a go to spot for me! While strolling through the Dumbo area I ran into this jewel of a spot. It's a favorite neighborhood spot and the locals are there in full effect. They are known for their coffee/espresso and freshly baked good. A long review isn't necessary; EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!!! Check out the pictures I've uploaded and check them out.
Very cute interior - nice spot to do some work in! But drinks were pretty overpriced for the quality in my opinion.
No comment
Coffee is always good but the price went up so much and I was charged for a tip I DID NOT pay, which is illegal. Ended up paying almost $7 for a coffee.

A chic little chores shop tucked right into the heart of Dumbo, just a short walk from the iconic bridge photo spot. I stopped by with my coworkers to grab an afternoon pick-me-up and loved it. The interior was spacious and airy, with lots of seating and people working. They have a cute, covered outdoor patio with tables as well. The baristas were super sweet and helpful, too. I got the chai and it was a TAD on the sweet side but still really yummy -- I would totally come back again!
No comment
No comment
Very cute interior that's well decorated but coffee is just okay, not anything outstanding.
No comment

This place is a little too trendy and expensive for what it is BUT! I am the fool who got the $10 oatmeal and I've gotta say, it's actually so good. Full of not too much turmeric and sweetness and pecans and apples and dried blueberries and all this other stuff that's really hearty and delicious. I don't know what compelled me to spend $10 on an oatmeal but if you're a fan of oatmeal, I say, get it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The place is very cute! I was stressed about ordering a latte once I realized they didn't have flavored syrups, and only use simple syrup. Well, let me tell you! They don't need flavored syrups because their beans are so good and the coffee is so flavorful. It was delicious!

This coffee place was easily one of my favorite spots when I visited NYC. Really liked the customer service, all the baristas were friendly. I came here twice and ordered the matcha, and iced latte with oat milk. Both drinks  were so good and smooth. Also, the breakfast empanada and sandwich are perfect for an on-the go snack. I also tried the olive oil muffin and it was so moist and not too sweet.

Wow one of the few places where the hype actually meets the quality of the product. I remember seeing Butler when there was a collab done with them and Prada. I was too busy to go, but didn't realize there was a location in DUMBO. Immediately, I went to go and the sticky date muffin and the croissant are divine. I was surprised that even the cold brew is divine as well. When I was walking back to the office, the cold brew and pastry made me smile which says a lot when good food has the energy and soul to do that. Where as, the only downfall would be price as their prices here are astronomical. However, the justification is that you are paying for quality. I think their drinks are better than % Arabica.
Giving Butler 3 stars because the baristas and employees were extremely nice but the latte tasted like oatmilk and water. My best friend said her matcha was super good tho
No comment

The cruffin is worth trying. It's a decent size. The taste is great. The mini sausage roll is Big considering the name is mini, but not as big as the sausage rolls you might be used to across the pond.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Butler is on top of my most favorite bakeries in the city now. I love their selection of pastries and the ambience in their beautiful locations! They also offer pistachio milk for their coffee. Can't wait to be back to try their other pastries.
Love their oat milk cappuccino and fresh baked pastries. Nice vibe and decoration as well as good service and location

Upon arrival, you are greeted by an open green space, due to the plants, with lots of natural light. The environment itself is pleasing & welcoming. The lighting is warm & comforting & the employees are extremely accommodating. We came later in the day but they still had a few gluten free options available. The matcha was AMAZING, (I still think about it weeks later). Water was available to the side which was a nice accommodation. The overall experience was truly great, I will definitely be back.
Great coffee at this place, but their cakes and pastries took the spotlight for us. We tried a couple of things and were very pleased. The date muffin was my favorite. Try it.
No comment
Great spot to enjoy a cup of coffee with an amazing view of the Brooklyn bridge! Also make sure to try the avocado toast. Did I mention they have pistachio milk?!
Ordered a cold brew today and found something slimy at the bottom of the cup. I have no idea what it is and it's gross. Don't buy the coffee here, this place doesn't seem sanitary.
No comment

Very wonderful restaurant and amazing food and coffee. Such lovely place with welcoming atmosphere. The menu is pretty excellent. The Breakfast empanada and petite french toast is really good and so delicious. The coffee is good and has smooth flavor. Reasonable price and has great service.
No comment
Cute place near the famous street where people take picture of the Manhattan bridge. Food tasted great.
Veggie empanada was ok, however, my cappuccino was amazing. Perfect espresso to foam ratio! Reasonable prices
No comment

Dangggg! The lady that yelled for vaccination card, relax we got it! No need to be aggressive . Food? So-so. Service? None. Got yelled at and mixed up what we wanted at the register by the same lady with glasses, checked! Feel like we are beggers not customers. Are they busy?!? Not when We walked in. Ridiculous! Go to the other locations. Possibly less grumpy.lol. Overall badddd experience!!!

The coffee was smooth and tasty.   Service was great.  I even saw the cute black haired female staff run out to give a customer a cellphone he forgot in the pouring rain.  Staff had smiles all around.   You can tell the team is proud of their work.

My girlfriend and i did a quick search and found Butler. We saw a huge line, but luckily decided to wait. When we say we had the best breakfast sandwich we have ever had, we mean it!!! We live three hours away and would come back simply to eat here. Service was quick, staff was friendly, and we were surprised that we got a seat. The location is excellent with lots to do around Dumbo. If you're in the area, I can't recommend this place enough! I don't ever write reviews, but this place was too good!

Doesn't have enough staff to deal with orders properly, 10 minutes wait for a drip coffee, which was cold, and they bumped their prices blaming the pandemic, I hope the staff is getting paid that bump in prices because they been really overworked.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had a wonderful, relaxed time here in the beautiful space! We came over the weekend for a mid-day coffee, and the cafe was not too busy or loud. My latte was deliciously smooth and served beautifully. Butler is located in a very convenient place in DUMBO and is the millenial cafe lover's dream. Slightly pricey but in-line with similar boutique cafes.

We got cortado, mocha and a croissant. One of the best croissant I have ever had! The inside was soft and airy while the outside had the perfect crunch. We regretted not going there sooner. Definitely a must visit! Will come back again!
Decent food but horrible service with unfriendly and aggressive tone. Not worth the trip.
No comment
No comment
Enjoyed my day in dumbo and found this comfort place on the way to the Brooklyn bridge. Love their lattes especially the ginger one - little bit spicy and really warm you up with such windy outside.

My favorite coffee place in the neighborhood by FAR. Everything is pricey, but so is everything else in Dumbo... good coffee and phenomenal pastries--their parfait is the only one I'll order in a restaurant. Staff is kind and understanding--this morning in my caffeine-deprived state, I forgot to ask for an ICED latte. Despite being in a Sunday morning crush, they were able to get a new one to me free of charge in minutes. Also the decor/setup is very cute, so that always helps

Butler has such a cute exterior, and great merch. While waiting in line, you can see everything they have to offer except the drinks. I was planning on getting a hazelnut americano, but I peeped the woman's  mocha iced coffee in front of me. Babay, that mocha spoke to me, I decided mid order to get the iced mocha($4.50) instead. The lady helping me rolled her eyes, ehh I wasn't to fond of that, but it's all good the coffee was tasty. I also order the breakfast empanda ($8.50) scrambled eggs, smoked bacon, arugula, cheddar cheese, topped w/ dukkah. It was so fluffy, piping hot and every ingredient was fresh.

The perfect place to enjoy a cup of Joe and get a good view of the bridge.  I visited in December so this place was just what I needed to wind down and warm up.  The service was friendly and the cappuccino  was delish too.  I also really enjoyed the date muffin I tried.

The walk up window was a good idea but the protocols are lax af. I saw the guy at the window touch two different dogs who jumped on the counter and hand them dog treats with his gloves on. I finally saw him wipe down the space after the second dog (the 4th customer behind me). I'd suggest wiping down the iPad too. The other guy walked out of the establishment and came back in and continued to make coffee with his scarf dangling off his face and his bare unwashed hands. At one point his scarf was below his chin while he was laughing around with the guy at the window. Guy at the window proceeds to grab someone's coffee and rim it with the lid of a sometimes-y sanitized glove. If you're okay with these standards then their pastries are pretty good as that was the only reason I came to Butlers.
No comment

I love this Dumbo location - it's such a great addition to the area. Must get the avocado toast. Yes I know kinda basic but really - as you can see in the picture, it's really colorful and shows in the way it tastes. Bright, acidic, creamy/fatty, crunchy. The breakfast empanada was OK. For some reason I remember it tasting better at the Williamsburg location. Also how cute are their coffee cups?

Afternoon decaf latte w/ oat milk was quite tasty, like a graham cracker dipped in coffee... yum! Grateful that they had outdoor seats and wifi so I can pretend that we're back in normal times, working out of coffee shops. The barista seemed a bit flustered and came off a bit rude but I can't say I understand what it's like to be working in the food service industry at a time like this so, *shrug*
The cappuccino here is nothing exciting: milky, overpriced, in the wrong cup. A list goes on as you try to order food here. Understaffed at lunchtime so there is a bit of a wait.
No comment

A delightful way to start your day. Everything about Butler's is fantastic. The staff is friendly and helpful. The coffee (served in a home style mug) is rich and flavorful.  Though the baked goods on display looked mighty tempting, I ordered the Breakfast Sandwich instead and am happy I did. A treat for the eyes and the belly!
Butler has AMAZING food with AMAZING views. It's clean, aesthetics are on point, and in such a cool spot of Brooklyn. Grab a coffee and walk the waterfront with great views of Manhattan. 10/10

Lovely spot with a wonderful view of Brooklyn bridge. I ordered the cold brew with almond milk and sat on the couch with a mini table. Cute decor and great tasting coffee - made better with an amazing view!!
Very kind staff and very chill vibe, the kind of hole in the wall feeling. I had a gluten free bakery item and it was delicious. Latter was wonderful as well.
No comment
No comment

There's a lot in the area which we didn't get to explore but I ordered a almond milk latte togo at the take out window while my Lyft was 10 minutes away. Got my drink on time and very delicious / perfectly made. The pastry assortment look delicious but didn't order worried about our  time restraint. Random but real cute togo cups. We had some rain and their take out window had a roof that also covered their bench seating. Nice.
They are super welcoming and friendly, have great tasting espresso, and a nice aesthetic :)

I really love this place. Delightful little cafe in DUMBO. Usually pretty busy, because it's so great! There is plenty of seating, and everything I've had here is delicious -- from the drinks to the lunch to the snacks to the pastries. Solid place if you need a quick cup or want to hang out for a bit.

Pastries and coffee are yummy, but I really wish they offered a meatless breakfast sandwich option. It's frustrating to pay the full $11 even if you omit the bacon, and then be asked to pay $3.50 extra on top of that for avocado instead.
No comment
No comment

Breakfast at Butler is wonderful. You have a nice view of the bridge and a good cup of coffee. Their pastries are also sumptuous and their sandwiches are extremely satisfying. The avocado sandwich we ordered was so refreshing. Their empanada is filled nicely.
I've found my happy place. Intelligentsia coffee, warm ginger molasses cookies, gorgeous decor, and 90's tunes. What more could I ask for?!

Lady at the register in glasses was really rude. I asked for 2 croissants and was handed only one. They were busy so I understand no problem. I asked for the other and she said she didn't hear me order two and needed to ring me up. I had already paid over $18 for 2 croissants, a matcha latte and a water. She called me out in front of the line like I was trying to get a way with stiffing them on a croissant? Lol. Once she realized I had already paid she tried to play it off like I was still in the wrong and said to just take the croissant that she "doesn't care enough." I understand working at a fast paced food spot can be stressful, I've been in those shoes before but no reason to be so hostile, snippy, and blatantly rude to a paying customer.

Seriously, if you appreciate a really good cup of coffee or a fresh baked pastry, this is where you need to be. I enjoy that atmosphere and their coffee is pretty good!  Everything was fresh, flavorful, and totally tasty. Fast and friendly service. Anyway, they have a good thing going here and I'm glad I stopped in.
Great new coffee spot in DUMBO: excellent coffee and pastry, great ambiance and sexy barustas. What else do you need?!

Amazing breakfast sandwich . I'll totally be back again next week. I'll be working over that way again and I'm excited to try other menu options... anytime I'm around I'll be stop back to try the breakfast empanadas for sure . I'm back again for the 3rd time !! Love the coffee smooth delicious flavor . Super Friendly atmosphere. Today I tried the avocado toast it's amazing!!! Taking home the Empanadas egg bacon and cheese with everything seasoning on the outside. I had one of those the last time they're out of this world that's why I'm buying three to bring home. Love this spot!
Crowded but really good. Coffee? Unbeatable! Atmosphere? Out of this world! Croissants? Extraordinary! Barista with Australian accent? Amazing! My life? 10x improved after going here!
No comment
No comment

Firstly I very rarely write reviews, the coffee shop was nice however when stretching my legs (while own the phone) the owner came over and interrupted my call. Telling me "I'm the owner, get you feet off my bench" Proceeding to put his hand and head into my face to shake, which normally wouldn't be a problem but this man breathed on me without a mask. I'd understand if I had been siting like that however I had only been stretching my legs for less then 30 seconds. I'm sure he will see this and all I have to say is there's a way to do things that that was not it... I will not be paying $5 for an iced americano and a side of covid again, woudn't recommend going here.

Hot coffee was delicious! Pastries were really good too. The petite french toast was so soft & yummy, not overly sweet but so so good. Also got the pecan roll which was less flavorful in my opinion, but very flaky and soft. Great place to stop for snacks and enjoy with the view of the Brooklyn Bridge!

The coffee is really good but the food is fantastic. I ordered the stone fruit salad and was in complete heaven. I would have taken pictures but I was too busy enjoying the magicalness of all the flavors in this salad. It was so satisfying and at the same time so refreshing. I wish there was one in LA because I would go there all the time. (For coffee too)

Still not a big fan of overpriced coffee, but if you want it it's really easy to get here. The quality is worth the value. I got the cappuccino. Location is convenient to DUMBO and with ample space for seating. They do brunch and bakery snacks here. 3/10 would come back here because I'm really not interested in paying this much for coffee, but if you must and you're in the area this one is a good convenient option.
No comment

They have a small window just for take out only. I like that idea so you don't have to enter inside and be in close door. I like the coffee and my friend likes it because they have the coffee that he usually drinks in Chicago
Coffee was okay just a little overpriced for what you got. Also, would skip the sandwich unless you're looking for something kind of basic. Wasn't wowed by this place but it was fine.
Amazing Scones!  Order the chocolate cherry scones.   Ryan is a Michelin star chef.   Lucky to have him in Brooklyn.   And take his cooking class.  Legit.
I love their Avocado Toast and the Breakfast Sandwich!! One of the best Avocados I have tried and it worth every pennies I paid!
No comment
No comment
Ordered the ginger turmeric latte and granola. The Granola Parfait surprised me, they actually use fresh fruits instead of canned fruits.

I am a Butler FANGIRL. I tried the sticky date bun and was sold. I will get this again and again and again and sit in the beautifully decorated interiors with the most pleasing color palette and feel amazing. I'll be back to try their other delights soon.
No comment

This place is lovely! The coffee and pastries are delicious and the atmosphere is great. All the food dishes that I have tried are also very good. The staff is always friendly and they have a window you can order at if you have a dog (they also give out treats!). Only cons are that it can get very noisy on the weekends and the prices are a little high.
No comment
No comment

I LOVE Butler.  Great coffee, amazing food, gorgeous setting, friendly staff right in the heart of Dumbo.  If you're looking for a coffee and snack on the run, a treat from the bakery or a full meal you'll be happy at Butler .. I am a fan of their spot in Williamsburg, and the one in Dumbo is even better.  Do This.
Love it here! I get to order from the side window with my dog. Best avocado toast I have EVER had. Coffee great, too! They give dog treats, too!

I wish I lived in NYC so I could come here more often. I had a medium regular coffee and their Sticky Date Muffin. It's GF and so moist and delicious!! Definitely going to come back when I visit the city again. The staff is welcoming and warm. The atmosphere is nice, too. It's small but cute with a modern feel to the interior. I definitely recommend eating here.

This was a great little place to stop and grab coffee before seeing Washington/Water St. It was recommended by a friend, and I got a mocha; my go-to for new coffee shops. I was completely blown away! They put cute designs in their foam, and it's served at a perfect temperature. It was incredibly smooth in a sweet way without compromising the coffee/chocolate balance. It was simply decadent. The baristas are somewhat standoffish, but that is perfectly normal for New York. They have a water station where you can get free water, and there are lots of different types of seating options. I can't wait to return sometime soon!

Excellent cafe in DUMBO. I can imagine it always being packed here. The food is delicious. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but breakfast is especially good. The coffee is great and the location is perfect.
Amazing place! Healthy and tasty food and great service. Menu has vegan and gluten free options. It's a coffee shop and a little cozy restaurant at same time.

I tried to book the airbnb experience, "Bake with a Michelin Star pastry chef" and it was absolutely frustrating. After expressing my interest via message, I hadn't heard back for over 4 days. As there is no phone number for this bakery on their airbnb page, google, yelp, or instagram, I reached out via Instagram DM. Someone eventually reached back out to me, but it was too late and we had already booked something else. I responded to the dm with constructive feedback saying it would be helpful if there were a phone number or if their team could respond to inquiries more timely, to which the person replied, "I'll pass on the feedback". Wow. To have a company respond this way is completely unprofessional. I was and am still shocked. Needless to say, I will never set food at this establishment.

Pretty great spot. The food was great, atmosphere was friendly. I got the green eggs benny that were delicious. My friend got the Mediterranean omelette with sweet potato fries and it looked so good! We shared the crossiant french toast which satisfied my sweet tooth.  Glad we tried this place. Parking was available in the street. I highly recommend it!
Amazing coffee and snacks! Delicious peanut butter treats for our pup who pulls us there whenever we're in a walk!
Cute little coffee shop in the heart of Dumbo. Very chic and stylish. Staff is also very friendly.
Amazing Cafe! French Toast muffin is delish! Regular hot coffee was so smooth and yummy. My son ordered the Hot Chocolate and fast very content with it! Definitely coming back

We found this place after walking around for a while trying to find the right place to eat. After seeing the reviews we dEcided to try this place. Upon walking in we were immediately greeted with fresh dough being made into amazing things. The coffee was really good. The hot chocolate was fantastic. When my son Finished His hot chocolate there were actually pieces of chocolate on the bottom of the cup.  I got the oatmeal because hot oatmeal seemed perfect for a cold day and it was  without a doubt the best oatmeal I've ever had.  I wish there was a loCation back home because I know we would  definitely be regulars.

I recently just moved into the neighborhood and stumbled upon Butler. Let me just start with saying this place EXCEEDED all of my expectations. I work in hospitality and of course covid has been hard on everyone but particularly this industry has taken some crushing blows. You wouldn't have thought it with this staff, everyone was so friendly and in high spirits. I love walking into a place and you can tell everyone who works there really gets along and has a good vibe going. I especially love that when they're also really efficient and getting the work done quick. I wish I had caught the names of the three people behind the counter because I'd love to shout them out. But it was (4/1 around 10am). All of these guys deserve a raise, particularly because I saw behind me was a picky customer who had nothing but complaints and they handled it with nothing but a positive attitude. I will be back daily the iced coffee was great and the parfait I got was delicious. 11/10 experience because baby 5 stars just ain't enough!
new coffee shop in the 'hood! love the little take-away window. coffee was very smooth. the dog treat for the pooch was a nice touch. will def return for caffeine fix

We went here for coffee. We both got cold brew coffee which was delicious. They have a bakery so their pastries are fresh but we didn't try any. I love the view of the Brooklyn Bridge as we enjoyed our coffee.
The food is consistently flavorful, the lunch menu rotated seasonally, and the staff are aces!

Best coffee in NYC. Being a kiwi I want a flag white, strong. This place did not disappoint. Great coffee and the food was also really good. Had the avocado toast, really tasty. Do yourself a favour and check this place out.

Awesome cafe! We stopped by twice and loved everything about this place! Service, food and drinks were awesome. Loved the turmeric ginger tea! This morning we ordered the French toast pastry and it was warm, gooey and not overly sweet! They also have a window if you're walking by with pups that make it super easy to order!

This place is awesome.  I'm a big fan of Intelligentsia beans so I expected the coffee would be 5 stars.  The food though is what really surprised me.  I've been there a few times a week since it opened and everything from the Breakfast Empanadas, to the Berries on Toast, and all of their lunch sandwiches have obviously kept me coming back for more.  Super excited to have this place in the neighborhood now.

Great food and good portions for the price. I got the egg sandwich and definitely recommend! However, I will say they need new to-go coffee cups. I came with my boyfriend and both of our cups we're leaking everywhere and we had to throw our coffee out :/.

Lovely neighborhood cafe with interesting options-- I had a breakfast empanada and coffee, then the Tumeric latte which was subtle and perfect. Nice people, cool Euro-American vibe, not rushed, not a place to stay and work all day long (not a ton of seating) but a place for a relaxed hour-Long breakfast and coffee. Compared to the nearby Brooklyn Roasting Co, I would say the menu is more interesting here, but if you want to work all day, go there. Different niches.

Went for lunch this week with a friend. While the lunch menu would be considered "sparse", there are excellent choices for a varied palette. The service is attentive and friendly. The prices land where you'd expect them. There's a great view. What's not to like? I'd go back!
The best for everything. Breakfast. Brunch. Lunch. Coffee. The best oatmeal I've ever had.

If you are open until 6:00 and your menu, posted clearly on the wall states "Breakfast - All Day" and "Lunch - Starting at 11:00" maybe you shouldn't tell me at 5:31 that the kitchen is closed and "it usually closes by around 5:00 on weekends." Maybe change it to say "Breakfast and Lunch Until 5:00"
Stopped by for quick brunch. great service, calm atmosphere, and solid playlist! Great chicken wrap and empanadas. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a nice place to take a break.

Terrible, overpriced and unhelpful. Asked for a vegetarian version of the breakfast sandwich and had to pay extra for them to replace bacon with an egg (which I'm sure is much cheaper than the cost of bacon). Small portions, flat white luke warm and avocado on toast - the bread required a hack saw to get through.
Love this place. Great food and the staff is friendly. This is a welcome addition to the Dumbo neighborhood, and worth a visit.
Great addition to the neighborhood and one of the few places you can still feel like a local. The service is great, as is the food and coffee.
such a cute place! The coffee is delicious and the service is excellent. I will definitely be coming back!

I enjoyed the aesthetically pleasing atmosphere and the nice employees who took and completed my order. My drink was not exceptional, but it was on par with what I would expect. Then someone who I assume is an owner/management was very unpleasant to me so I will not be returning. There are plenty of beautiful coffee and tea shops in the area that I would rather give my business to.
Great variety, quality, and service. Highlights were avocado toast and the breakfast sandwich, but honestly everything was great
The rosemary ham sandwich here is divine. Not what I was expecting, but everything I wanted and more.
Really like the bathroom. Really chic. Food was good too, I guess. Like the coffee too.
Such a cute little coffee shop right near the Brooklyn Bridge. Gorgeous decor and delicious coffee.
Breakfast empanada is amazing! I went to the Williamsburg one for ages - this one is even better, love the space. Really good coffee too.
I love the pastries & lattes; the staff is friendly, too.  I stop in frequently when visiting Brooklyn.  I love this place!

This place is overpriced and the food is mediocre, greasy and generally lacks ingenuity or at least anything one might consider novel or interesting. As an example I paid $19 before tip for a breakfast sandwich and a cup of coffee. Everything costs extra. I had to pay $3.50 to substitute my brioche bun (lol) for a slice of sourdough. I will just buy an entire baguette next time (or 3) and bring them for all the sad customers.
Slick decor. Friendly service. Top quality coffee and food. This is my go-to cafe in Dumbo and it should be yours too.

Butler makes the most delicious pastries and coffee. I love going there for a quick bite to eat for breakfast and later in the day for one of their scrumptious sandwiches. They even have gluten free and healthy options. Everyone who works at Butler is super nice and I love the ambiance of the store. It is my new favorite spot for meeting up with friends and clients in the daytime.

Nice and welcome addition to the neighborhood but leaving off a star because when you pay by credit card, it automatically defaults to a 12% tip and you manually have to undo that.  I do not think that is right and have never seen that elsewhere at other cafes.  Perhaps its for the tourists but not cool!!  Also, please update your website with what you actually have on the menu!  The outside ordering window is pretty awesome.
Been a regular at Butler in Williamsburg since its opening, and I'm so psyched to have some DUMBO reciprocity. Can't wait to sign up for one of the pastry cooking classes!

Butler in Dumbo has amazing coffee and delicious muffins. The gluten free sticky date muffin, morning glory muffin and a chocolate gluten free are all gastronomic delights. Whether I cater coffee and breakfast for meetings or eat at Butler the service is flawless and always enjoyable. The decor is also great and everyone is super friendly.
Great vibe, excellent coffee and the best gluten free cakes I have every eaten. The crew are great and, as an Aussie in NY, its nice to be reminded of home.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I was too excited and hungry to take a picture of my food. This place is my favorite Lebanese bakery in NYC. they have all the classic Lebanese options, and you can never go wrong with a plain zaatar. I also have tried lahim bi ajin and it's super tasty. I also took my non-Lebanese friend to this cafe and she was a huge fan!
No comment

This is the best manaeesh in the city. I love the crispy bread. it tastes very flavorful. It gets hot inside but they have outdoor seating. Service is fast and they are always nice. I will say however the knafe is the worse knafe I've ever tasted in my life. I wish they would buy the frozen one from the Arabic store and sell it bc it would taste better than what they sold me lol it was like jelly knafe. But the zataar manaeesh it is so good, a little pricey, mine was $11 but overall I would go Everytime I'm shopping around soho or if I go to the NYU masjid.
Great cheese manoushe, definitely recommend. Authentic Lebanese experience. لبنان في نيو يورك
No comment

Delicious, no fuss Lebanese spot with fresh breads and fillings. As a vegetarian I ordered the cocktail Flatbread with cheese and zaatar. I also tried their sweet muhamara and tangy lebneh and thoum sauces. I liked the clotted cream dessert. It was reminiscent of a lightly sweet custard.

Excellent. I really appreciate spots that are quick casual but have healthy options with quality ingredients. Often hard to check off all of those boxes but this place does it. They even have a plain cheese pizza (called something else) if you have young kids in tow! I ordered the zaatar avocado salad and was very impressed. Tomatoes cucumbers diced green olives fresh mint and zaatar herbs made this a super refreshing salad. I ordered a side of chicken which was very flavorful. Wish the chicken marinade was a tad less sweet but other than that it was all spot on. Ill be returning.

This is such a nice little Lebanese restaurant! My Lebanese friend took us here and got us all the best stuff. Everything was uniquely spiced and filled with flavor, and I loved the banju and drinking from the fun little bottle. The staff were super friendly and efficient, and the restaurant was cozy, clean, and comfortable!
No comment

If you're looking for an authentic man'ousheh spot in the city (without having to trek to Brooklyn or Jersey), this is the spot for you. I love getting the "cocktail" (cheese and zaatar in one) and the dough is absolutely perfect. My only complaint is that the zaatar was a little too salty both times I was there otherwise I have made this place my go to quick lunch spot!
No comment

We use to come once a week at least but this is the last time, they now sell you the smallest portion ever at a higher price, basically a cheese Manoushe  without the cheese (so small) I will go find something else to eat if I were you l.
The falafel sandwich was like a falafel burrito and the mint was a welcome addition. Staff was friendly and helpful in explaining the options. Great picnic food for the park nearby also.

Great food and service. Great pricing for the quality of food. Staffing is great and friendly. Bathrooms are very clean and parking is in front of the building. Definitely I would recommend this place. Great for families with big groups.

I ordered a falafel sandwich. They serve it in a huge pita bread, then spread the falafel like a paste all over it and then add the rest of the ingredients. It was a new taste for me because I've never had falafel with mint leaves before. It's really good! They take cards which was a relief since I didn't have cash on me at the time. The place is cozy and they play good music. I'll be coming back soon!
The taste is great. True lebanese taste, but I was very disappointed to see that two of the items were seriously burned. I hope they will take this into account!

A must stop every time I come to NY! I get the cheese and Zaatar combo with veggies and the flavors are out of this world. Take it across the street with you to Washington square park for an added bonus.

There's only a few chairs inside and you must show your vax card and id. The bread is made to order so it can take up to 20 min to get your order so it's probably better to order ahead of time and pick up. The day i was here their card machine wasn't working but it was just a minor inconvenience. I've tried the zaatar, cocktail, egg with scallion, and chicken and all were delicious. I will definitely be back because it's super filling and super affordable. I also got a free coffee with my checkin on yelp :) The other location has few more menu items and is a little bigger i believe
Tries to be a unique Mediterranean place with unique taste etc, but doesn't do a good job of it at all.

Fire the three clowns working on 10/8/22 at 5pm. Useless bunch of clowns who will sure to bankrupt the owner and piss off the customers. Zero effort, zero discipline. Placed order and told will be ready in 10 minutes. Hung around for 20 minutes only to realize the oven is empty, the clowns are chitchatting and my food is not in the over or even prepared. Hire immigrants, they work hard and get the job done and make you money in the process. The guy and 2 girls gotta go. Useless and incompetent. Never ordering while they work there.
Excellent food.  The coddled milk desert is extraordinary.  Other food items were also authentic.  Couple of tables inside and outside.  Very good service.

The most ethnically delicious lunch Prepped by an amazing, warm in-house team. I had the Kofta and added labne and pickles. It was cooked perfectly and the yogurt and pickles complemented to a T. Don't miss this spot!

Unique flatbread that can be had in either rolls or pizza style. We ordered Ijjeh and Fatayer. The Ijjeh was a mix of parsley and scallion omelette mixed with labneh. I really liked the combination and the bite was nice with the chewy flatbread. The Fatayer was nice just too sour due to lemon for my taste bud.

I am a fan of the falafel.  Pretty large size and had a nice mint flavor. The falafel texture is mushy rather than what you may be use to.  When I'm in the area I try to go here - I plan to check out some other items next time.

I came to NYC, looking for a place that reminded me good times in Lebanon. And found it! This is the place! Oh my god! As soon as I got in, the smell transported me back. Their food let me tell you... is REAL and AUTHENTIC, fresh and flavorful. Great service and amazing food. Place to visit each time I am back to NY

The Za'atar manousheh was packed with flavor--generous servings of za'atar, zucchini, tomatoes, mint, and pickles all wrapped in a hot, chewy, fresh flatbread. There were a lot of green olives, though, so specify no olives if you're not 1000% into them. The chicken was also incredible. I could live off it the rest of my life (not joking), especially given how cheap it is: $4 for a large cup. You MUST try the chicken in some form, and from the sounds of it, all their other meat options are also phenomenal!

The fatayer is lemony, spinachy goodness in flaky dough. Small little shop with a few spots to grab a bite. Legit.
No comment

This place is delicious! It's so hot and fresh when it comes out, the cheese is like nothing I've had before and is complemented perfectly by the zaatar. The ashta is so light and fluffy and just the right amount of sweet. I love this place.
Stopped for a quick bite and was pleasantly surprised by the fresh baked pita and unique ingredients. Will have to come back and try some of the other wrap options.

I am obsessed with this place and order it pretty much every time I'm on campus. I would come back for this even after I graduate! It does take a while so try to order 30 mins ahead, especially during lunch or dinner time. The quality and portions are amazing for the price and I love the option to add veggies.

Formerly Champs, Ro's Diner is almost as good and cheaper, too! Same location, less decor, same black and white theme. Many options for brunch with kind servers. We miss Champs, but this is the next next Brooklyn vegan diner.

I liked Oxalis overall. I visited the place for brunch and it was easy to make a reservation. Seating was also seamless. The brunch menu is small, not many options but the food is good. I ordered the deluxe breakfast and it was great! I do wish that they add more options to the brunch menu. Otherwise, the vibe is great and it's nice inside.

Soooo cute. The back yard has a different menu compares to the inside, if I remember correctly

Small spot robust flavors! My second time here in five days. Came alone on 1/8 then again with the bf  on 1/14. We were welcomed, they remembered me, that was very special. On 1/14 Saturday late dinner (9:30pm reservation), we ordered the prix fixe from the bar, everything on the menu. We were not disappointed. Starter was salad w miso dressing and an injera type roti bread; it was light and delicious. Then we had a fresh baked sour dough with fresh soft in house made sea salt butter (Amazing). For dinner we had the tile fish and beef shoulder, both delectable and full of flavor. Tried the wizard's comb cocktail and loved it. At dessert we shared the passion biscuit and chocolate situation. Both were wonderful. So for $65 prix fixe it's a deal. High quality, bright flavors and 5star service! (We ended with hot espressos, also great)

Visited a friend in NY who raved about this restaurant and said we had to go while I was here to experience their 9 course meal. Ohhh and what an experience it wasThe ENTIRE staff is welcoming from the moment you enter the restaurant. Our server was amazing in helping me to choose my wine selections for the evening and the restaurant was able to accommodate my dietary restrictions within the menu for the evening. I love the collaborative approach of the staff in the serving each course. I loved everything with the exception of the desserts. I preferred one dessert more but neither were my favorites however that didn't take away from my overall experience. Each course built upon the next. Everything was exquisite. If you're in NY specifically Brooklyn and want a one of a kind dining experience, I highly recommend Oxalis.

Nice ambiance and service. The food was good but not enough to justify $165 price tag. We dine out every weekend and try to sample restaurants on "best" lists, so have a good reference point. If  you do pre-fix with no choice of substitute for this price, it has to be special. It was not. Scallop dish was good but I had a few gritty pieces. Meat had nice sauce and flavor, but a bit tough. We went to Nura last week and the dishes were more imaginative and tastier for more then 30 % less. I would give it solid 3.5 stars, because it doesn't meet expectations of what it should be.

This place was great! We did the bar prefixe menu and it was $65 per person. The service was great and I loved their cocktails and that they had seasonal cocktails as well. Everything was so fresh and flavorful!

First of all, we were welcome by warm hospitality. We ordered tasting menu for $125 ppl. Food is exceptionally creative, a beautiful combination of Eastern and Western elements. One of dish is tasted like fried Chinese turnip cake but with a twist of truffle that tickles your taste buds. Every course is definitely a surprise. Overall, the dining experience is enjoyable and worth every penny.
Sophisticated menu, service and venue worth Michelin's appreciation. Check for the fixed price menu in the veranda which offers nice fusion cuisine delicacies..

Went to get fine dining from this Michelin-Star-owned restaurant. We got the Carte Blanche platter, which was $70 each. The food was admittedly very delicious, many of the bites were amazing and the flavors burst in your mouth. The tuna with squid ink was good. However, I have one huge gripe with this restaurant, and it was that we were here from way too long, from evening to nighttime. This is because the dishes came out super slowly despite finishing our portions very fast. The ambiance of the restaurant was excellent though.
No comment

Oh boy this place is delicious!!! I'm so happy that I made the time to come here and try a lot of great food. Went to the back garden where they do their a la carte menu as opposed to the prix fixe within the main restaurant where you can see the kitchen. The service was impeccable as everyone was greeting me and all the staff was super friendly. We ended up eating with a chef of the restaurant as someone in our party knew her, so that was cool to get a glimpse into Oxalis' style and learn more about what we were eating. We ended up ordered... everything on the menu! My highlights were certainly the sourdough bread (which it seems like everyone and their mother is talking about); that butter was special!! But more than that, I loved the tomato spread with the rosemary lavender bread; I could have eaten that all up! I think the mushroom kebab (which just isn't a kebab at all) fell a bit flat, but still - all in all, this was a SPECIAL meal. The buttermilk dessert + the peach tart really rounded it all out. And my orange wine cocktail was delicious and served in the perfect glass. I know they have a more rotating menu here, so I'd love to come back sooner rather than later to try some great food. It came out to a bit less than $100/person, so considering it is a 1 Michelin-star place and we got everything on the menu, I think that's great; each dish isn't quite expensive so you can come in for a drink and some food and not break the budget. Enjoy!

Beautiful, delicate presentation. Food took our taste buds on a journey. Only offers tasting menu.

Very unassuming exterior. One of the best dining experiences we've had in a while. The service was amazing, the food was impeccable and unique but in the best way possible. We did their tasting menu on Saturday and left completely satisfied.

Delicious and able to accommodate vegetarian diets for the course meal. Always great to see Oxalis's take on the season's ingredients

They try hard and they succeed.  Most of the people there are very young, including the chef, and I very much am looking forward to seeing how they evolve and mature. They're really good right now and they're only going to get better, unless success and ambition makes them think there is something bigger and better than Prospect Heights waiting for them.

column3: South Kansas City, Kansas City, MO
column6: Had an outstanding meal at Oxalis. We opted for the carte blanche menu, which offered 9+ courses thoughtfully created by the chef.  Husband has the non alcoholic beverage pairing which he thoroughly enjoyed. I had the pineapple cocktail which was one of the tastiest cocktails I've had in awhile. Every course was delicious but we especially enjoyed the potato and seafood stew. I'm not sure how to describe it but to say it was savory and delicate and so rich in flavor. We also loved the flounder dish which was so fresh and both the cherry blossoms and green strawberry added so much to the dish. Staff was friendly and informative. Don't miss out on this excellent restaurant.

I visited Oxalis on a night when they had an event with Suntory Whiskey so there were some extra items on the menu. The food was delicious and drinks were amazing. My husband and I both had drinks from the special menu, and also tried the special dessert the cherry blossom roll. The rest was from their regular menu and we loved all of it, but the lamb collar was slightly underwhelming especially considering it's the most expensive item on the menu. Not as tender as one would expect for meet that has been cooked for 16h. I still give it a 5 star because, overall it was a 5 star experience!

No comment

The pre fixe menu here is well worth the $105 per person carte blanche.  There were 12 dishes.  Each one was beautiful to look at.  Some of the items could have been more tasty, such as the aged black bass..  Some dishes fell flat like the grape Ceylon cinnamon, buckwheat.  This might sound interesting and perhaps tasty, but it wasn't.  On the other hand some of the dishes were quite good like the bread and butter, the grilled chanterelles, grilled Berkshire pork, the fruits and caramels.  Service was quite good.  One receives a hardy welcome at the door and multiple goodbyes and hope you enjoyed everything upon the departure.  Also the sommelier was quite knowledgeable.  There is an bar and  outside area for their snack menu.

5-star experience from the food to the staff to the atmosphere. This just might be my new favorite restaurant in the city. We did the carte blanche with some cocktails. Every course was excellent and so were the drinks. Plus, the playlist had me vibing. I'll definitely be back here, total gem!

Great service and lovely atmosphere. The wine and food were delicious, but limited menu. I really enjoyed the salad and butter. This is a great date night spot and not far from the museum.
No comment

Oxalis was on point! Service, vibe, taste and drinks were excellent! Had the $65 menu and everything was very good, couple of items were outstanding. The food here tasted better than what I ate at Le Bernardin. I was totally full after 4 courses so I probably won't go back for the 11 course option but I'm confident everything is good there as well. Right across from the Brooklyn Museum and Prospect Park. Give this place a try!

The preset brunch was simple and elegant.  If you appreciate fine food and first class service it's easy to see the time and dedication that is spent on ensuring guest satisfaction, comfort, and quality put forth in each dish.  When our food arrived, I couldn't help but savor and marvel at the presentation, taste, and texture of each dish.  As a cook it really inspired me to rethink certain ingredients and preparations within my own style of cooking.  This is a place that has an experienced staff and a desire to give you a great dining experience that you will remember.

Garden room is gorgeous. Constantly shifting menu that's always interesting. Drinks complement the menu very well. Typically a little too fancy for me (you will be provided an ASMR description of your food upon being served), but everyone who works there is very chill. A tight ship whose baked goods, drinks, and entrees manage to all be top notch.

Mom took me and the fiancé here to welcome her new son-in-law to the family. This place didn't disappoint at all. The outside of the shop wasn't very impressive but once you walk in, it definitely felt very warm and inviting. My mom unfortunately made a mix up and didn't notice she put herself on the waitlist instead of getting the confirmed reservation. The staff did their best and offered their a la carte menu to us along with some free champagne (Obi Wine Keno Blue - cute play on Star Wars). Luckily as we were considering whether we should stay or not (not saying their a la carte wasn't appealing but mom wanted the big welcome for the new son-in-law), the general manager, Adrienne. stepped in and informed us someone cancelled. We were very lucky. (They usually have a set amount of ingredients and courses set for reservations so if you don't have reservations, from what I was told, they don't squeeze people in.) Everything was exceptional from presentation to taste. Service was wonderful and if I could come back more often for date night I would. Later, we found out their head chef (and owner) were originally from the West Coast (West Coast is the best coast - makes perfect sense why the food was so bomb) and moved out to New York to start his business here. Compliments to the chef and thank you to the wait staff for the wonderful service they provided.
No comment
No comment

During Covid, this restaurant does temperature checks when you enter, tables are very spread apart, and they change the paper covers on the tables after every guest. We started off with stone fruit on ice, which was topped with coriander seeds. This was a great refreshing start to our meal there. We also got the sourdough bread with the most amazing softened butter ever! We even used it as a dip at one point haha. I then got the tomato tart which had a delicious dressing on top. The shishito peppers came with a "teriyaki" flavored sauce, which added a variety of flavors to the peppers. The cocktails here came in cans, which I liked because the restaurant is taking Covid precautions seriously. The vegetarian main entree portions were a bit small, but I still felt very satisfied afterwards! Definitely worth the Michelin rating.
No comment
No comment

I went to Brooklyn with my partner to see an exhibit at the Museum and came across Oxalis. I have to echo the same sentiment that the service was poor / hosts were rude and incompetent. F+ at best. I called ahead of time (5:09 pm) to confirm if walk-ins were available for the tasting menu--which I was told yes. After stopping by in person, my partner and I were told we would wait 25-30 minutes at most and would receive a call. An hour and a half later I called again to see where I was in the queue and was told I'm next in line (7:30 pm). So my partner and I walked to a nearby bar to get a drink and chat. At this point (8:15 pm), we made a quick reservation for a 9:00pm slot (under the belief we would get an option for the tasting menu like promised) and walked over at 8:45 pm and spoke to the hosts. My partner and I were surprised by the passive aggressiveness and catty comments from the staff, and were told if we canceled we would be charged. Despite what we were promised verbally when we initially called 3.5 hours ago! We decided to take our business elsewhere. For how "upscale" this establishment is portraying itself to be I am surprised by the rudeness and lack of empathy my partner and I experienced interacting with this business / staff.
No comment

Amazing experience. Laid back atmosphere, which was wonderful after a long day - cocktails were inventive and excellent. Sat at the bar for dinner and bartender Sarah was engaging, attentive and made excellent drinks. The menu at the bar was simple, yet elegant and delicious. A gem of a find. Will be back to try the tasting menu.

I love this new neighborhood spot! It is now a Michelin starred restaurant which I am not surprised about at all! They have a prefix tasting menu but they are very flexible with food allergy accommodations. I came when I was pregnant and there were several items on the menu that I could not eat. Our waiter communicated efficiently with the chef and was able to accommodate every one of my wishes. It is a pretty big spacious space inside. It is great for an intimate date or a night out with girls. I had brunch there and it was delicious as well. They have a big outdoor space that I can't wait to try in the summer. It is very close to Brooklyn Museum and Brooklyn Botanic Gardens so it would make for a nice day to visit them and get a meal.
Amazing! Courteous, knowledgeable, attentive staff. Gorgeous plates. Interesting cocktails. Reminds me a lot of Olmsted.
No comment

Yummy prix fix with thoughtful wine pairings. Most of the pairings landed, some didn't, but all were creative and I felt like I had learned a little more about wine at the end of the meal. All of the courses were delicious! The trout with bergamot was incredible. This will be a place where I bring my visiting friends/family.
No comment
Lovely meal: Maitake kebab" on roti, yellow rice with cream and chard, asparagus with trout roe and smoked butter. Chamomile tart for dessert. Yum.
Brilliant, inventive, thoughtful, intentional restaurant.  Just absolutely fabulous.  We all had the tasting menu.  Can't recommend it more highly.
No comment

Oxalis was good, but for the price of the menu I didn't feel like anything I had really blew me away or was memorable. I tried the a la carte items and they were all pretty good, I think the bread with butter was the standout here. I would be open to trying the pre fixe if I go back, as I believe that's what they're really known and rated for. I do remember the service was wonderful though!

No comment

We've come here twice already (once for pre fixe menu and another for the a la carte menu.) Both times the food has been amazing! Lots of fermented + cultured dishes and creative use of ingredients. The service is also always impeccable. Definitely order the sour dough bread and the kebab, you will not regret it.

This dinner was one of the absolute best of our lives! The food was spectacular - every bite was mind-blowing and memorable. What was perhaps more surprising, however, was the impeccable service. Every single person we interacted with made us feel so special. An incredible experience all around.
Great food and discovered this restaurant has one Michelin Star  - would love to visit again around December for different dishes

Amazing food, staff, and service! Every dish from the tasting menu was unique and well executed. My only complaint, which is more of personal taste, was that I found the food to be a tad salty. The highlights for me was the dessert! The orange creamsicle was beyond anything I've ever tried.
No comment

Why didn't I find you earlier!!! Perfection! Just go to this place...but if you need to know why keep reading. Went for dinner and sat in the back courtyard. This is the more casual Al la crate setting. Still a lovely setting. But let me start with the greeting. You walk in the door and the kitchen is right there. Open and inviting. Smells of the amazing good greet you. A cook says hello and asked for our name. Even though there are hosts it was a nice way to be welcomed. We are led to our table. Every member of the friendly staff saying hello. Now let's get down to the main event. The drinks and meal! Every dish was heaven. The sourdough (fresh and warm with fresh butter.) Jambon! Totally different then plain old ham or prosciutto. The tuna carpaccio. Wow. Balanced and light. Sweet potatoes (lovely and light.) Next was the trout. This was the star of the show! I could eat this dish every minute of every day. And the beef was fantastic too. Drinks were fantastic and the wine selection is solid too. I will be back for the indoor set menu soon!

We made reservations for a party of 10. Our prefix dinner was $70pp. The service was amazing. This restaurant is more American rather than French based on the food we had. If you're looking for French food this is not the place. I felt the quality of the food was very fresh and dishes were unique and creative. I love the open kitchen as you walk in. I would've preferred to see the regular menu however our meal started promptly when our party arrived. I didn't realize we had an option to try other items on their menu until we were done with our meal. This was not necessarily the restaurants fault but rather me not asking as I was content with the meal that was previously arranged by my party. I was curious as we left the restaurant what else we could've tried while we were there but did not get a chance to try. If you have a big appetite this prefix dinner would not have been enough to fill you up. This is definitely a quality over quantity type of place.

Amazing food and even better service! The entire staff is so friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable. The food is always delicious and unique. I've been here a few times and have always been blown away. It has a very chic but urban vibe, perfect for date nights, GNOs, bdays/anniversaries or just a Tuesday dinner. My husband and I both love it here and will be back soon for brunch (which we've heard great things about)!!

Been tryin to post this review since last week cuz this place is def worth goin to cuz they do everything right. the food aint that expensive and they have most of the things people would eat. we sat outside and it was cool cuz you sit like in a space that has walls but its outside. the people was nice too.  To keep it real with u i thought the place was oxtails cuz i like jamaican food, but instead its like fancy regular food. My girl had a tasteing menu and I ordered the regular type of food. This place is also very careful with the covid.

My husband and I got the tasting menu. It was very good overall, but to be honest, it wasn't as amazing as I had expected. But I appreciate how well they made each dish, and the uniqueness of the ingredients. My favorites were the smoke trout and fall squash. The fish was cooked perfectly, but the sauce was a bit too salty. I also enjoyed my glass of pinot blanc. Service was wonderful.

No comment

Went to Oxalis for my wife and my first anniversary. Unfortunately the restaurant did not have room for us to take on the carte blanche menu, which we really wanted, but the food was nonetheless outstanding. In particular we loved the mushrooms, snails and coffee dish. I will absolutely be returning for that tasting menu!

Dined here back in December and was blown away by everything. Ordered the carte Blanche with the wine pairing so that I wouldn't have to decide a thing and dish after dish fascinated my palate and left me energized to try and run home to recreate what I had tasted. The space is comfortable and non-stuffy. Will be back soon.

I went here on Sunday night for a nice dinner with my girlfriend for our anniversary and it was fantastic! The food, service, atmosphere, drinks, everything was so so good. I also loved how not only was amazing but the servers were so warm and friendly that I didn't feel like I was in a stuffy fine dining environment. They truly made it a wonderful experience!

Amazing food, sophisticated and attentive. We went there 4 times , every time we left with fulfillment feeling. Testing menu with wine paring made my birthday complete.
No comment

Highly recommended for an adult evening out, special date night, or an occasion to celebrate. You'll enjoy an excellent meal, carefully crafted and conceptualized, from start to finish. I'd also suggest, if you're a duo, that you request the table with front row seats of the kitchen and the chef at work. I thoroughly enjoyed the added bonus of a show and it was really neat to see the composition and plating of each dish making its way to us. Oxalis offers a prix fixe dinner service (offerings change nightly) with optional wine pairing at an additional cost. My spouse and I elected to go all in and we loved the complete experience of everything being expertly selected for us - what a fun and delicious treat! We also relished in being surprised with the menu offerings for the evening when we sat at our places (hidden but neatly placed under our napkin and bread plate). Don't be afraid to ask questions - the staff, even the chef, are very friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes, the creative ingredients as well as the wine pairings. I was also shocked by my favorite course of the evening; glancing at the menu I knew I was looking forward to the soft shell crab and while everything was excellent, I was absolutely blown away by the potato, ramp, and kombu spring stew. It was so unexpected for me, I loved every bite. Both flavor and texture variety were perfect. That said, be open to being pleasantly surprised. Oxalis will come through in an amazing way and provide a very memorable dining experience. The hubby and I will absolutely return, we're already set to try the separate bar menu in the back of the establishment.
Not worth the time or $$$! Local wanna be, over salted food, super slow service, ton of bugs

If I could give this amazing restaurant 10 stars, I would. Chef Nico and his staff are top notch. We had a party of 4, expecting great things and they exceeded expectations in a very big way! The meal was truly the best I've ever had. Each of the 11 dishes were works of art, with flavors that were out of this world. The Kampachi, the first course was so savory, like nothing I've ever tasted. Literally, each bite, I closed my eyes to experience the incredible blend of flavors. We had two more appetizers that were equally fantastic. We also did the wine pairing which had perfect choices for all the courses. I added caviar to the fluke, which was outstanding. The beef with walnut miso, and black garlic melted in my mouth with the greatest flavors. Three different desserts put this evening over the top. Chef Nico and the phenomenal staff made us feel so welcome. Chef Nico, you truly love what you do and it shows in your creative food ideas, presentations and phenomenal food. This Michelin star restaurant is a real gem. Bravo, Nico and we will return! Thank you all!
No comment
This place is incredible--the food was outstanding and the service was the cherry on top. Definitely coming back. Vibes 10/10 and elite cocktails
No comment

Oxalis is one of the best places in town . Very good selection of cocktails and wines . Food is seasonal and delicious I would recommend the kebab but also the carte Blanche . Awesome  place love it !!!

Came after few days of their re-opening.  Obnoxious temp checking. Outside seating with zero ambience in some parking lot. No tasting menu and the a la carte one was extremely limited, not a single meat entree and  by 8 pm they ran out of the only non-carb non-veggie offering- fish. Then they right away ran out of bread and tarts... i am being kind giving them 3 stars. If you're not ready then don't hastily re-open. We had to go eat somewhere else afterwards. Hopefully they are able to get back to the previous standards.
