Had been wanting to try this place for dinner but had an opportunity to check it out as a brunch option while in the neighborhood as part of pre-museum plans. There are other places nearby that offer brunch but I had already been to them and wanted to try some place new. Reading other reviews highlighting the "elevated" brunch experience, i thought to try it out. So yes, it is pricey for brunch but the pre fix brunch menu is unique - not your run of the mill brunch dishes but still "brunch-like" enough...and definitely filling and delicious. If you love has browns or anything potato - Do yourself a favor and order the potatoes as an add on if they aren't part of your pre fix - even if you don't live has browns, this dish may convert you. The staff also is amazing. This restaurant is all about quality service and making the diner feel like all attention is on them (in a good way), so friendly, pleasant and cordial. It is all perfection. Will definitely be coming back for dinner.

This place is amazing! Best butter/bread combo I ever had. Every dish was made well. Considering I'm a picky eater, I gobbled down everything on the menu. I can't find one thing to complain about other than why isn't this place more popular!? Would totally come back to eat here :)
No comment
No comment

SO GRATEFUL not only to have the opportunity to eat this incredible food again but for this establishment's respect for the health and safety of their patrons and staff. My friend and I ordered four dishes and split them and were perfectly full. It was hot out and the food hit the spot- light, fresh and delicious!! The canned cocktails were fantastic, I had the Rose one and one with sparkling wine which were incredible and paired perfectly with the food we ordered. The staff was impressively diligent with following safety procedures as well as spacing the tables well beyond 6 ft which made me feel completely safe dining here, so much so that I would feel comfortable taking my high-risk parents here for dinner.
Great restaurant. Food was delicious and service was spectacular. Make sure to get both desserts in the bar area.
No comment

One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Creative, delicious, and consistently well executed. They pay attention to all the details, which elevates even simple things to be really memorable (for example, sounds silly, but the bread and butter is SO good). Service is friendly and attentive, and it is clear that the staff is proud of the food, but it never gets stuffy or pretentious. Plus it is a reasonable price for a tasting menu (and they have an a la carte option if that isn't your thing). If you haven't tried it yet, you're missing out. We are very lucky to have this place in Brooklyn.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Oxalis you are simply terrific, I had a wonderful experience here today. Gets a little too crowded, but has good ambience and service. The service was also excellent and everyone was kind. Every thing was fresh, flavorful, and very yummy. I can not praise Oxalis enough.
This place deserves much more than 1 Michelin star. The service, atmosphere, food, all beyond expectations. One of New York's best for sure, couldn't recommend more

Went here last night with my dad to celebrate my birthday and we couldn't have had a better time! We did the carte blanche menu and everything was incredible. Everyone was so friendly and helpful which made the experience even more enjoyable! We both felt like this is one of the best meals we've ever gotten. Very impressed. I loved all the detail they put into the restaurant - the back area has a bar and is decorated beautifully.  I've been obsessed with the oxalis plant for a while now so this was especially exciting. Can't wait to come back. Thank you!
No comment

Amazing restaurant!!  Warm welcoming staff, clean sophisticated space with unbelievably creative and delicious food.  Mother's Day menu- Fantastic and tasty from Quiche through bitter greens salad to dessert and it was ALL VEGETARIAN!!

They added in 2 other dishes in our printed tasting menu for truly one of the best dinners I've had.  HIGHLY recommend. The food was absolutely incredible, the wine pairings were diverse and spot-on and the service was stellar.  Added bonus, customized birthday menu and a bubbly toast start-off (we were stuck in traffic and arrived 30 min late). Favorite dish was either the skate wing or a rich vanilla bean ice cream with a frozen iced pea shoot topping, although all four of us agreed every dish was terrific.
Great brunch experience! Truffle omelette add-on is highly recommended! Friendly staff, professional service. I'd love to be back to try their dinner menu.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Update; their box this weekend was also delicious as hell. The sausage was to die for and the grits and waffle were good too. Great value for the cost
This French restaurant Going to blow your mind . Food and service over the top. Must try mushroom in broth dish , OMG . And now when they got  Liquor license Add  this place on Bucket list !#oxalis #

Really impressive meal and service. The very first bite blew us away and I thought to myself "they've set a really high bar here" and much to our delight, they sustained it throughout the meal. So much so that we are already planning when we can return

Seven of us ate at Oxalis last night. We shared the caulilini, little gem salad, asparagus, heirloom beans in fish broth, mushroom tart, wild rice fricassee, rainbow trout, cream puffs and gateau basque, plus an amazing potato pancake amuse bouche  with black caviar. It may have been the best meal I have ever eaten. Every dish was cooked to perfection and served with grace and finesse. Also impressive was the wine selection that included a delicious, inexpensive white. The only dish that was less than stellar was the gateau, which was a little cold and dense, albeit tasty. All of us were blown away by this outstanding dinner.

WOW - just wow.  It's been a long time since we have been blown away by a meal the way we were at Oxalis.  They somehow manage to present beautiful and DELICIOUS (next level) food without any level of pretension.  This is a very special meal and I would highly recommend it.  Incredible!
Oxalis is a TREASURE. The food has no business being this good at this price. I think about their tuna at least once a day. Service is exceptional. Also the most Covid-compliant set up out there.

Came here to celebrate my partners birthday, had a magical evening. Food, service, and ambience well all 10/10. Don't say that lightly, Having spent my share of time at Per Se, Blue Hill, French Laundry, Le Bernardin, Daniel... rivals all without feeling stuffy or forced. Every dish had something new, unique and special to it. Even the Swiss Chard course was mind blowing. The habanero sauce under our fluke might be the most delicate hot sauce I've ever tasted. Water glasses never hit the halfway mark. One of the owners checked in on us several times throughout the night, when he wasn't carrying dishes, pouring wine, or folding napkins. Beyond the compulsory candle on the dessert, a note was hand-written, a large dollop of caviar was added to a dish, owners and waiters alike poured extra glasses and checked in often to ensure we were having a good celebration. It had the air of a place where people love what they are doing, and are excited to share it with others. Can't more highly recommend.
No comment
Excellent. Great food, reasonably priced and the service is second to none. Wine was great, and the food was definitely top class. This place is a hidden gem. Hopefully it survives for a long time.

Absolutely exceptional meal.  Sat outside here this past weekend - although it was cold, we cozied up near the heat lamp and devoured a truly superlative meal.  We felt very lucky that they are staying open and willing to serve us in times like this.  Service was lovely too.  I will be a regular at this spot.  Highly recommend.

Doesn't look like much from the outside but once you're inside, this little Brooklyn fighter packs a punch. You are met by a charming brigade of cooks shouting "wi chef" with attentiveness to each order at the pass. The hostess, equally charming but with less ferocity welcomes you with care and ushers you to your seat with charm. The service is impeccable, with each dish and wine pairing coming at precisely the right moment. You feel the passion that earned this restaurant a Michelin Star right from when you walk through those doors up until you're out of them. The attention to detail was felt and my only complaint about the food was I wish there was more! Well done!

First couple of times we went when they did not have a liquor license. They also did not let you BYOB, which was super weird. The food and service were both good. We went again recently, and while the experience was much enhanced by a solid drink menu, the food quality has gone downhill. Some of the dishes were OK. A couple, like a rubbery seafood dish, were not.
Very interesting food! Very tasteful! Good crowd. ! Good atmosphere !something unique! Recommended to try!

Came here for a quick brunch before heading to the museum. The set brunch menu was balanced and good by itself but the merguez sausages that our waiter recommended we add on were definitely the highlight for me. The staff here were very attentive and professional. Our waiter was able to pick up on the fact that we were running late to our exhibition and put in an extra effort to get our dessert and check to us in a timely manner. I definitely want to come back here to try their dinner menu at some point.
Long due review. We went there in a group of 4 people. I didn't leave hungry but I was not impressed. The food qualities didn't justify the price tag. They over-seasoned almost all dishes.

I loved my experience at Oxalis. They are taking COVID seriously, taking temperatures, social distancing and not compromising on the food or experience. The best dining out experience I've had since March!

This is one of the most pretentious and childish menus I've ever seen.  Ridiculous food at exorbitant prices. Exactly the reason why the urban American food scene is so decadent, overpriced and deplorable. Experiments with food for ignorant rich kids. I would not eat at this place if you paid me, and I live in San Francisco

After reading rave reviews about the tasting menu, we booked a reservation through Resy, that explicitly said it was dining room seating. When we got there, we were seated in a back room and were told we couldn't order the tasting menu there. They weren't able to accommodate us in the dining room, so we left and went elsewhere. It was pretty disappointing, considering we had driven an hour for our reservation there.

Meh, not impressed. Had dinner here recently and while I understand tasting menus are not usually meant to fill, for the price we paid for what is billed as a "4-6 course meal", I left quite hungry and disappointed. While I wouldn't say anything necessarily tasted bad (besides the espresso we ordered at the end which was completely undrinkable), I'd say most every dish had at least something wrong i.e. duck not cooked well, entire dish being just one (wet) texture, etc. I do just want to point out that the "snack" course which, to be frank, was basically a singular tater tot sliced into 4 pieces with a dot of mayo on top (serves 2!) was totally unacceptable. Maybe I'm being a bit nitpick-y but in a tasting menu restaurant that additionally is only doing a handful of courses (also charging $100+ pp once you factor in tax+tip+drinks), they should all be perfect or close to it.
No comment
Its a new restaurant for the neighberhood and I've already gone twice.  The food was superb and the service even better.

We had a wonderful dining experience at Oxalis last night. We opted for the carte blanche ($70) and beverage pairing ($40). All of the dishes we had were good, with a few being outstanding. I was impressed with the attention to detail, thoughtfulness, and innovation with which the chef approached each dish. Service was very attentive, and the atmosphere was both warm and casually elegant. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great meal with impeccable service.

My husband and I ate here on February 15th, and we are still talking about the food four days later. We opted for the $60 six-course carte blanche menu and were blown away by the delicious and unique flavor combinations. We felt like we were getting all of the service and quality of a Michelin star restaurant without any of the stuffiness or pretension. This is an incredible addition to the neighborhood, and I know we will be coming back soon. Make your reservation now before it becomes impossible to get one.
No comment

One of the best meals I've had in Brooklyn in a while. The eclectic wine list was great, the service was gracious, the vibe is modern and understated, the music is fun and the food is beautiful, inventive and well executed. Thanks for a fun night.

We came in for some drinks and maybe an app or two in the back room. What a delight! The cocktails were interesting, maybe a bit quirky, but each one a delicious surprise. After a few different appetizers we were so intrigued by the food that we asked for a table and stayed for dinner. What a beautiful experience.  The food was subtle, balanced and well conceived. I'll say it again, what a delightful experience. My one caveat is that because the flavor profiles are so subtle you might miss out on the beauty of the dishes if you don't slow down a focus on the food, but if you do.... What a treat.

In the 5 years I've lived in New York, probably the best meal I've had. If you like surprises, not having to choose anything about the meal is fun, and the wine pairing was the perfect complement to each dish.
This is the best fine dining in the neighborhood. Bright, airy, not too expensive. It's just so great; fresh and seasonal food, creative plating. I'm so glad it's there for special occasions.
No comment

I would like to review the food at this restaurant but I have been unable thus far to actually eat there. Reservations are as of now not hard to get, but they've canceled me twice. They promised to accommodate me in the future, but it's getting frustrating. I will amend this review to include the food if I ever get to eat it.

I dined at Oxalis shortly after the NY Times review. My Gf was finishing up a sales meeting nearby and she suggested that we try Oxalis. We rarely make reservation's, but we arrived early enough to be seated. The space is very attractive, and it has a very nice vibe. The nabe is full of ues transplants, and on this particular evening it appeared that every one of them had invited their parents to dinner. I thought that I was in La Goulue for a minute. The food is good not great. The wines by the glass were terrible, but the staff were all polite, and very gracious. I guess that they need some time to age and I hope to try Oxalis again in the future.

A superb restaurant with wonderful service and a unique menu featuring inspired use of unusual herbs. It's the perfect place for a romantic dinner for two or a night of fine dining and drinking with old friends. Memorable things: the beautiful greenhouse-like dining area in the back of the restaurant, the herb-infused cocktails, the extraordinarily delicious food, the fact that we could get a table immediately, the prompt and friendly service. Frankly, I'm surprised this place isn't completely overrun by reservations weeks in advance; the food is on par with that of the ever-booked Olmsted around the corner, and in several ways more interesting.

We went for New Years and had an incredible experience. The food was amazing - especially the beef tartar and the poached oysters and the dessert - and the service was superb. The space was beautiful. A world class restaurant in Brooklyn!

First date night away from the baby for the husband's birthday and it was everything. We were treated like royalty just because I let them know we were celebrating- the service was tremendous and one of the owners is right there alongside the staff talking to all the guests. We reserved the dining area where it's tasting menu only- every course was so unique and delicious. As an added bonus, they throw in a couple things not listed. We can't wait to get back and check out the bar room which looked beautiful. Great addition to the neighborhood food scene!

Holiday spirit indeed.  I got food poisoning over thanksgiving and had to cancel my reservation, did so in advance but was told there was a $60 fee.  I explained the situation and this was not a last minute cancellation but no budging.  Would have been nice to get a heads up when I canceled.  Was really looking forward to dining here but a restaurant with no budging/heart is not one I want to support.
No comment

Absolutely best dining experience I have had in a long time. Every dish was amazing and my friends and I could not stop talking about it afterwards. For this price point, you have to go. I will definitely be back and bring many people with me. We talked to the chef afterwards and he was so kind and really cannot wait to see the growth of this fabulous restaurant.

My mother and I stumbled into this gem after visiting the Brooklyn Museum. The prix fixe menu is a bargain for $70. This restaurant would be at home in Manhattan for twice the price. The staff were wonderful and the service was among the best I've experienced in a long time. Every course was a small masterpiece. We loved it and would go back!

Such a great place. Whether you come for the amazing tasting menu which is truly delicious  or to just sit outside and enjoy a cocktail in the garden, Chef Nico, Steve and the amazing staff make this  an unbelievable experience! This place just flows from the moment you are seated to saying goodbye, everything just works beautifully!

Excellent, excellent restaurant. From the attentive and warm staff to the extremely delicious dishes.  We had the tasting menu and for desert we were surprised with candles for our anniversary.  Really loved the delicacy and unique flavors of all the different dishes. It's really rare to find an affordable tasting menu, especially in Brooklyn. I really hope this pop up becomes permanent!

This place is already packed but it's bound to completely blow up soon. The service, the food, the drinks, the presentation - and the reasonable price for all of these things - everything blew us away. It's truly a gem in the neighborhood. We sat in the bar room and ordered one of each dish, which was perfectly shareable between the 4 of us. The farro and beef in particular were our favorites and the citrus cocktail was so delicious. We will definitely be coming back to try more drinks and the tasting menu.
Really great food with delicious balanced flavours. The waiting staff were really attentive. Highly recommended.

So sorry not to be able to be positive- we were so looking forward to this place. We've been living in Brooklyn for 12 years now. We love good food. One of us grew up in Paris and we love to spend a good buck on dinner - when it's worth it. We got a tiny sized "flatbread " (bad pizza) for $17. The other dishes were fine but still not worth it. Made us feel like gentrification makes us all chumps - a little cabbage with a drizzle of vinegar can be $14 because hey, rent is high. Sadly would not return here again. (On a side note- very nice decor; Service was perfectly good; the wine was fine if overpriced.) Did not stay for dessert.
No comment

Definitely worth a second visit. Their menu prix fixe menu is very high end and worth the $60. They pay great attention to detail and the meal tantalizes your taste buds.The staff is very nice and accommodating. Awesome!!

So excited to have another food destination on the Crown/Prospect Heights border! As soon as we stepped inside, we started to understand why Eater had named Oxalis one of the top restaurants in Brooklyn 2019. Gabriel and his staff were charmingly polite and warm. We ordered a la carte: started with flatbread with duck offal (deliciously rich and appropriate for a wintry night) and chicory salad with carmelized anchovy (creamily addictive dressing, even if we were expecting pieces of anchovies); then enjoyed the cabbage with egg yolk (wish I could get the recipe) and grilled beef with horseradish (tender, fresh and filling).   The coffee chocolate cream cheese was heavenly. One of the best meals we've had in a long time. One of Brooklyn's finest in innovative cooking without any fussiness or pretentiousness.

Remarkable experience! Staff amazing.Food incredible! So much fun. HIGHLY recommend! Ok, so Yelp wants me to make my already highly complimentary review longer to actually post it. So I will because, while i hate to type on my phone, I like this restaurant so much. I hope this works.

If there was an extra star on yelp, I'd give it. First persons to great us, the Chefs! The food was so good I was texting my (industry sommelier friends) all night long. It's that good. I could have went face first into that mushroom pot-au-feu. Get there before the reviews as it surly will blow up. They don't have a liquor license yet, but send you a recc from their favorite bar. Reserve and go! $60 bucks for a 5 course tasting, in Manhattan $300 easy.

Creative menu with lots of unexpected flavors. The tasting menu is a gastronomic feast topped only by the quirky and delicious wines. Excellent staff who really love what they do and enhance the experience with their knowledge and story telling. Truly a gem of a restaurant.

Great vibe and great service. I went here post proposal and my soon to be wife loved it!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND 'NON-ALCOHOLIC' pairing with the meal! In-house sodas were actually better than wine pairing... sounds crazy but one must try to understand what i am saying! So worth it

Behind the frosted glass facade at 791 Washington Ave is Oxalis, where wonderful things are being made and served. This restaurant works perfectly for the part of Brooklyn it's in, which you kind of feel before you even open the door. The quality of the dishes the Oxalis team serve will astound you and are worth every dollar. They do rotating tasting menus, but also offer food and drink off an ala carte menu in the back half of the restaurant. You can tell that Nico and Co. know what they are doing, and also, most importantly, that they care. Being able to watch the chefs and cooks working so diligently in the open kitchen is quite humbling, but also inspiring. I think we could all learn a thing or two about delicious, fresh, new ways of approaching food and it'll be fun to see it happen here. Aspiring chefs, foodies, and regular people of all walks of life, in and out of Brooklyn, should give Oxalis a try. Maybe you'll learn something new, see something great, or just enjoy a nicely prepped and prepared meal, served to you by their nice staff. The last time I ate there, I tired the pig trotter and it was my favorite. I also had a dessert made with cream cheese ice cream, which brought out my inner fat kid, for sure. I'm going backwards now, but the brioche bread was amazeballs. I am really excited for Oxalis in 2019 and can't wait to see what is on the way!
Best restaurant in Brooklyn.  Not to be missed. Beautiful spot, delicious food, lovely and knowledgable staff.  Seriously, go.

I have been to some of the best restaurants in NYC (Eleven Madison Park, Per Se, Le Bernadin, Aska ...) but I was blown away by the inventiveness and quality of the food at Oxalis.  So delicious course after course it is hard to even pick the best.  The creamy farro with snails was unforgettably mouthwateringly creamy and verdant and unique.  The beef tongue was perfectly salty, crispy, crunchy and meaty all at the same time. And the goat cheese dessert was a wonderful end to a memorable meal that I will definitely want to repeat.

We just went to this place for a special anniversary, and we absolutely loved it. Upon making a reservation and noting my dietary restrictions, the manager wrote an email to confirm that they would be preparing a special menu. When we arrived, there was a beautiful table set with a personalized note wishing us a happy anniversary. They poured us delicious bubbles to celebrate (twice!), and the food was fabulous. It was an amazing meal and the warm and attentive service made us feel right at home. We're excited to go back with friends and family!

Oxalis' food, asthetic, and playlist are incredible!!! I've been here several times and most recently tried the set menu. There was a mushroom dish that was absolutely divine- the broth was incredible I could've had ten bowls of that alone. As of the last time I visited they didn't have s liquor license yet but their non-alcoholic drinks are all so amazing I didn't even care. My favorite drink was the sparking jasmine tea.

We came here on a friends rexommendatjon and w had a fantastic experience. Creative menu, friendly staff and an overall relaxing, but not too quiet, ambiance. The music was also top notch. At the end of the meal we couldn't decide which dish was our favorite and we each nominated two different ones as our personal favorites - which is always a good sign. We will definitely be coming back!

So delicious! We did the $60 tasting menu with the $15 non-alcoholic beverage pairing it was so unique and incredible. On top of amazing food there service was on point, so professional and enthusiastic!  Highly recommend!

I've been lucky enough to eat at many incredible restaurants in New York and while they're great, not many are standouts among the rest. Oxalis is without a doubt, the most pleasant, refreshing and jaw-droppingly delicious meal I've had in years. The food was otherworldly. We had the prix fixe and each dish was better than the last. The service was fantastic as was the atmosphere. I have a ton of food allergies to raw whole fruits and vegetables (I know, my life sucks) and they were so accommodating and created two entirely different dishes for me (though what my family ate for those courses was apparently also fantastic). To top it all off, the dessert (goat milk with honey and thyme - trust me, totally different than what you're probably imagining right now) was perhaps the best dessert I've had in my life and I've come to to the realization that was the peak of my dessert journey and I'm fine with that. Overall, a magical, warm, inviting, flavorful, surprising experience. Side note: try their Jasmine Tea Soda (WOW!).
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Such a fun little restaurant! This is where the Old Man Run Club meets on Saturday mornings, and they always have great snacks and vibes. I got the chicken katsu cutlet and shiso fries this morning after my run, and both were super crispy and flavorful! Just what I needed for a post-run recovery! Check this place out if you want a casual time with good drinks and eats!
No comment

We were a party of 4 and came here on a Wednesday!  We ordered 2 of each skewers on the menu.  They all have the same sauce and was pretty salty.  The skewers was warm/ kind of cold.  I think the skewers were pre-made and they just heated back up!  I would categorize as a bar more than a Izakaya place.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was good! Especially the karage fries and yakiniku!! We got 2 orders once the first was finished. A group of 9 surprising the birthday boy in the corner of the restaurant made it a good place to hide. As the tables were bar designed with high tops and slim space for free leg/arm room, we made the birthday boy limbo to his middle table seating arrangement. Great atmosphere with drinks / entree and apps. The japanese spaghetti about $22 was delicious, just wish it was a tad bit more creamier/saucier( add a protein, it's  only noodles). Chicken katsu with rice and curry was thick and filling. Ramen bowls looked great and not dense with oil. By the end of our meal, surprisingly they gave us matcha alcoholic shots, that's not on the menu. Not bad. Instead of the normal hot burn down your throat, it was brain freeze cold  lol
No comment
No comment

Came here for lunch and everything was so good! The katsu, fries, and the RAMEN!!!! It was surprisingly good. Also tried this melon beer that tasted like melona. They also make alcoholic slushies. At night the place gets pretty fun, will come back!
No comment

Came to this place to try. The appetizers were really good. The calamari a little different from most places. The batter was already seasoned and squeeze some lemons on it and you don't need marinara sauce. The takoyaki had the right amount of sauce on it. Some places usually drenched. The skewers were done well. But the sauce was too sweet. The chicken wings fried very well. But too much sauce overpowered the chicken. The don was okay. And the ramen unique flavor to it. Not a bad place to try. But I did not like the height of the food was at the appetizer and then went down from the entree. But my ramen unfortunately was too buttery and oily gave me a stomachache and had diarrhea. Flavors good. But maybe too buttery for the stomach. I would come back for the apps and maybe a different ramen that's not buttery or oily.
No comment

This is a great, low-key spot for Izakaya food and drinks. They have so many drinks, and even a bottled sake that comes in a cute keepsake glass with a doggo on it! My friends and I walked in without a reservation on a Friday night and were still able to get a table with no trouble. I like that the vibe is not pretentious at all, and there's no need to dress up to dine here. They have the usual Izakaya fare but we only ordered karage to share. The karage comes with a big portion. The chunks of chicken are meaty but tender and well battered. I also ordered the black garlic ramen, which was on par with what you would find at a ramen shop. Thick, smooth noodles, flavorful broth and the usual char sieu and soft boiled egg yolk made this an excellent bowl of ramen. My only complaint was that they only have one piece of char siew and half a  soft boiled egg while most places give 2 of each.
No comment

No comment
Love the food and great skewers
No comment
No comment
The service is amazing and the food is great! Karaage Loaded Fries are definitely recommended
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I returned yesterday to give this place a 2nd chance!! I'm happy to say that I was very very satisfied with the gyudon bowl I ordered. The fatty sliced beef and runny poached egg atop a bowl of steamy, saucy rice was such a dream in my mouth! The gyudon definitely out shines the ramen bowls here. I also ordered the chicken karrage as take-out for my boyfriend and he was a fan! This place will now be my go-to in the LES for japanese food! Can't wait to order that beef bowl again...and again...and again...
No comment
No comment

Absolute gem of a place.   We were lucky that one of the neighborhood locals recommended this place, or we may have missed the excellent experience.  The food is excellent.  Every from the edamame with dressing, to the meat skewers and the spicy ramen - everything was delicious. We were there at lunch time and the service was really fast. Its a lovely chill ambience and we will definitely be back!!
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: The meat in the ramen always feels a bit chewey/low grade. They have a nice beer selection from Japan and their chicken skewers are fantastic.

Food's amazing, especially their croquette and skewered pork belly 100% would recommend!

Definitely a gem. LARGE variety of international beers, sake, and wine. Affordable and delicious dishes that are well portioned and leave you wanting more. Staff is friendly and always able to recommend great selections. Great place for a quick late night bite!
No comment
No comment

Casual, a little funky, great choices for ramen, don, small plates. Busy Friday night but nicely handled a last minute reservation change. Everything we had was fantastic! Definitely a place we'll take friends

We live in the Lower East Side but somehow missed this place until now.  Not many lunch places open these days in LES, so we headed over to try it.  Boy, what a find!  To start with, they opened the outdoor seating just for us, and it has open/close windows.  The food was delicious, and we enjoyed what the owner said was the largest selection of Japanese beers in the US.  We started with the potato croquettes, which were delicious.   This was followed by (for me) the Yakiniku (absolutely awesome) and the house fries with cheese.  My (vegetarian) wife had the spicy vegetarian ramen, which she loved.  The service was awesome, the owner a super interesting guy to speak with.  We definitely will be back, again and again.

If you have HIGH expectations for ramen, I do not think that this is the place.   Juraku cannot compete with Ippudo Ramen and Menkoi Sato unfortunately.  It's just okay flavor.  For example, I ordered the shishito peppers, but it came with no salt but a cheap lemon.  At Ippudo Ramen, they serve their shishito peppers with yuzu salt, which is a game-changer.

No comment

There are many izakayas in NYC, many are also close to LES but  Juraku is the one I would most likely revisit. Unfortunately Japanese culture has fallen prey to the trap of conspicuous consumption in NYC and many places lose the charm of a casual bar that I associate with izakayas in Japan. The food is pretty solid, not the very best I've ever had but exactly the type  of thing I love to snack on while having a good time with friends in the evening. Much of their fare are small shareable bites, I recommend the skewers (particularly chicken), takoyaki, and croquettes. They also have some larger meal options like ramen and gyudon but I didn't try these and will not comment on them. They have a remarkably good beer selection, wide enough that I am more than willing to ignore their lackluster mixed drinks. You may be tempted as we were to try out the "get fucked" cocktail but it frankly just tastes of watered down Redbull, stick with beer and sake here. Overall though, I highly recommend this place if you are looking forward a fun, casual vibe where you can hang out with friends over a beer and some bites.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Giving 2.5 stars not just 2: We ordered the chicken cutlet bao buns and vegetable bao buns. I assumed chicken cutlet meant breast, but it was actually a slice of fat. I think that was my fault for not asking. The vegetable bao buns had two pieces of zucchini each. I think I expected something a bit different in terms of vegetables. We also ordered the oroshi karage, and it wasn't that crispy but otherwise good. The beef bento was just okay but the salad was very soggy so I skipped it. Service is really great though! I will give it another try and order something different
No comment
No comment

This restaurant was a hidden gem! We had dinner in China Town and were looking for a place where we can have a light food and a drink and then we found this place on Resy. Food was excellent and the sake & japanese craft beer selections that they've had were absolutely amazing. I'm planning to go back to this place tonight as well!

This is my first and only Yelp review: This is my favorite bar in nyc hands down. We get a free drink every time from the best bartenders. Please ask for the matcha beer- they hand make it in front of you! The food is also incredible. I can't say enough good things about this bar- just go!
Very casual (all disposal cutlery/plates) but tasty. Everything was delicious and service was fast.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Nothing to fill the gut and warm the heart like a whole lot of beer and skewer after skewer of grilled goodness. Chicken thigh and zucchini skewers are truly top notch.
No comment
This restaurant is a great asset to the neighborhood, offers great service and as a bonus, has the best dog treats in the city, according to the happy customer on the photo.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We sat inside for dinner. Great Japanese beer list. Many kinds to choose from and some drafts as well. Food was mediocre. Not that tasty - got premade food feeling. Service was okey. One thing I didn't fully enjoyed was their plates. All food and drinks come in disposable containers. Paper plates for sharing plates. It's still COVID time but I didn't vibe with that for dine-in experience. I'd come back here for a beer or two perhaps

Didn't expect it but, Izakaya Juraku was truly amazing. The atmosphere of this place is great and so inviting! I am very happy that we got Lotus Chips, this was one of their best dishes, extremely flavorful and delicious. The servers are pretty courteous and polite. Izakaya Juraku - Very impressive.
No comment

Great deal and yummy food! Wish I know this place sooner and will definitely be back soon and perhaps often. They have happy hour daily until 8pm! The happy hour includes drinks ($6 for wines and cocktails) and several dishes (edamame, chicken karaage, gyoza, agedashi tofu, yakiniku, etc) for $3 or $4 each and good portion. They also have great selection of sake if you love sake but don't think that's part of happy hour or maybe limited selection. It's a no frills place - people come here for food and drinks or before they head out to some party/club. So don't expect to have white gloves service or a place for a nice date as it can be loud (it can also be today coincide with Santa Con day). However, service is decent and prompt. Food was delicious. We had a lot of food (Not all food photos were take ) and two drinks per person and check is still less than $90.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is a Gem! The food is great, I had the Hamachi Kama, the agedashi tofu and the steamed clams, but the drinks were the highlight for me.   I had a great time sampling Japanese beers and sake. Most importantly the drinks were at a fair price compared to other places. The manager even took the time to talk to all the costumers. He even recommended us the best beers he had available and sake. The place was great. If you ever pass by just go in and try it.
No comment
No comment

Picked up a restaurant week special last night plus an order of spring rolls. I was hesitant to do takeout ramen but the noodles and toppings were separated and the black garlic broth was still hot when I got home! Didnt love the sauces that came with the spring rolls but that's just personal preference. The rolls themselves were delicious. They have really cute outdoor and indoor dining with dividers and the staff members were very nice. I'd come back!
No comment
No comment

We ordered a ton of small plates - raw octopus, happy hour tofu, shishito peppers, beef and chicken skewers, avocado salad, braised pork belly; and for drinks, we had sake from Tokyo. Everything was extremely yummy! The service was a bit weak, but the food and the atmosphere from the Japanese decorations outweigh. Would def go back again
No comment

Really enjoyed our visit today. Nice outdoor tent and booth tables. Excellent covid precautions. Tapas-like portions, all very reasonably priced and delicious! We had the takowasa, takoyaki, pork belly skewers, agedashi tofu (broth a little sweet), karate chicken with daikon, and yellowtail don (just a tad too salty). Well done to the owner. Thank you!
Incredible Izakaya experience! Great service and quality ingredients made simply and made well. Shout out to Kiyo - super nice guy. Would highly recommend the beef and chicken skewers!
No comment

My boyfriend and I were exploring the area and stumbled upon this place. The food is great and quick, customer service is on point and prices are reasonable!!! I would post a picture of the food but it was so good, it's all gone

Ambiance was awesome! Sat in the alcove area which I liked being that I am short I like to be less close to the ground! Food is amazing here! Small bites if you want to enjoy good company and their selection of cocktails and drinks but they also offer heavier food items like their boozy ramen! Staff is very friendly here shows good hospitality enough for you to want to return or become a regular if you're a local!
No comment
No comment
Food could be a little better but the drink selection is amazing. They offer outdoor seating.

Just had dinner here! It was delicious! We had seaweed salad, octopus balls, miso ramen and udon noodles. Everything was fresh and flavorful! The ramen broth is sooooo good! Definitely coming back soon!
Food and drinks are great. Will definitely go back to try other beers. Good to go during happy hour, some appetizers are discounted.

Tried this Japanese spot with a friend tonight for dinner. They have a daily HH until 8 pm so we indulged in a couple rounds of cocktails! The dishes are small plates and despite Izakaya being in their name, the menu is much more expansive than just grilled skewers. My faves were black truffle lotus root, agadeshi rofu, shishito peppers, and some pork belly in a tasty broth dish...super tender and flavorful. Would definitely return.
No comment

Matcha Hops! My first time trying this today. It's so great. I love this place. The anbai miso bacon is sooo yummy! So many craft beers and amazing Sake.Thumbs all the way up. A great chill place to bring friends and hang.
No comment
No comment
No comment

first off, I'm not exactly sure of the different names this place goes by, but I found this place under Grubhub under the name of Saru Japanese Cuisine. it wasn't until I called them directly that the caller ID said Izakaya Juraku so I'm mentioning it here so it gets the proper attention. as for my review, the overall price for our meal was good, but the food and service were tasty and REMARKABLE! ordered the vegetable korokke, Japanese chicken wings, 2 katsu don and 2 miso soups. the korokke was still crispy, as were the chicken wings - both rich with flavor. the katsu don was a good sized portion and tasty as well. everything was delivered promptly, however one of the miso soup containers had spilled soaking up everything at the bottom. after contacting the restaurant they promptly replaced the miso soup... would definitely order again!
No comment

Awesome sake and yum food! Nice environment for chatting, hangout and selfie. Nitro matcha definitely should be ordered, very special cold tea, the most umami and delicates feeling I never had before. Sashimi don was amazing, fresh and healthy

Oh man, I really wanted to like this place and couldn't figure out how my fellow Asians had let me down so badly. But let me down they did. The service here is so lovely but can't make up for lackluster food. A couple of the items (karaage, haru maki) were good but clearly the reason to come here is the beer, which I don't drink.
No comment

Came here on a weeknight and it wasn't that packed. I was craving some ramen and this spot was in the area so I decided to check it out. I ordered the Tonkotsu ramen and it was okay. The noodles were very soft and had no chew to them at all. Not sure if they just overcooked it or what. The broth wasn't as rich as I'm used to for higher priced ramens as well. The one redeeming factor was the pork. It was soft and almost melted in your mouth. They do give u a free appetizer if you check in on yelp so that's a plus.

Love their wine list! Lots of Japanese alcohol drinks! The food is mediocre, but their happy hours is good till 8pm. Their pork bun and scallop sashimi were bad in my opinion, so save your money on those two dishes. The ramen broth was really good, but their eggs weren't cooked right. Other ramen places did a much better authentic Japanese ramen style job.
Great atmosphere, vibes, and music. My family and I really enjoyed and everything was delicious. The service was excellent! Definitely will go back again.
Cold tomato ramen was super delicious! Also tried the lotus chips, niku jaga, and the eggplant which were all tasty, though I liked the eggplant best. Nice place to hang out!
Lucky this place is open! Had the buta no kakuni (braised pork belly), so yummy. Friendly neighborhood restaurant serving delicious dishes, will definitely be back.
Always a super comfy spot to visit. And the new black garlic ramen is SOOOO good. Especially when paired with a good bottle of beer.
No comment

The high number of stars is deceiving. The broth of the tonkatsu ramen had no flavor although we added the spicy powder. The katsudon was really soft and the chicken didn't have a crunchy outside. Also the rice was proportionally higher than the meat. Nice staff but not worth it.
No comment
Hosted a party of 15, hosts were super accommodating and very nice. The food was great and everyone loved the time there. Will definitely come again - especially for happy hour.
Small cozy place to have ramen and don. The food price is very reasonable. They have plenty of choices of beer and sake too. Family friendly and a very nice crew in the store.
This spicy ramen is fitting the spot. It's got a nice heat, not messing around. The egg was also exactly on point. Nice vibe, good drink selection. I'm happy.

I came here and only ordered off of the happy hour menu and the food is delicious. I pretty much ordered everything that was on the happy hour menu but the garlic sauteed edamame was one of my favorite snacks, but you should try everything on the happy hour menu. The cocktails are on point. I got a well detail description of how each cocktail was made so the bartender knew what he was talking about. The cocktails taste so good that I tried everything on the happy hour menu as well and my favorite was the one that had yuza in it. They have a large selection of Japanese beer and I was surprise about the beer selection on the happy hour as well. Although it is is a very small spot, it really had a personal touch to it. It was a very cozy spot and was a quite spot. The service was great to and they had clean bathrooms.

Wanted to eat here every day while we were in town from SF for a long weekend. Every place we went, from here to eat, was good, very good, but Izakaya Juraku was the ultimate! After traveling several times to Japan, I know quality Izakaya. We had several shared plates (the short-rib dish is to die for) and udon. The lighting is dark and cozy and the music was relaxing. High quality Izakaya style food and excellent friendly service. We met Kiyomizu (took his card, as I doubt I could spell on my own!) and he told us the story of the restaurant. I'm sad we didn't go back, but I urge you to try it out and go every day if you live in NYC LES area!
One of my fave happy hours in the city for beer/sake and light bites. Manager is super knowledgeable and helpful. Food is tasty and spacious good ambiance for the LES.
The staff members are nice, and drink selections are great.  The space can easily fit a large group- celebrations can be hosted here without trouble (restrooms were very nice as well )
Great pork buns and udon.  We ordered a bottle of motor sake and they gave us a variety of sake cups to use.  Great customer service too.
An amazing new spot...a gem that nobody seems to know about quite yet! Excellent food and service, and some amazing rare Japanese beers on draft.

Amazing bar to explore and learn what sake suits your unique sense of taste.  Friendly and amazing service, would highly recommend if you're looking to try something new, alcohol wise.  They pay heavy attention to insure you find the perfect sake that you'll fall in love with.
Great ramen and friendly service. I like the atmosphere and laid back scenery! I enjoyed the gyu don and kombucha they have.

I went here last week to binge on my favorite Japanese bites.  I had the hamachi kama, agedashi tofu and steamed clam in butter sauce.  I ate every last morsel of food that was served to me.  Everything was prepared in the true Japanese style.  The kama came with grated radish with a dash of ponzu.  The fish was grilled to perfection.  The clam was really delicious as well.  I was shamelessly using half a clam shell as a spoon to savour every last drop of the buttery clam sauce.  Just like my mom makes it!
No comment
Wow...what a beer menu! The food is solid Izakaya, but the beer selection made the "bar food" that much better! Can't wait to go back.
food was ok. seats were a little low for the table. service was satisfactory. great prices.
Japan vibes in a huge spot right in the heart of LES. Cheap beer and big sake selection, and all the food was great! will definitely come back !

Cute little place in the area. They got a big selection of Japanese sake. Staff are friendly and food is good. Very comfortable and chill, it is a good place if you just want to sit down and have few drinks to chat with friends.

This place is a gem! The food is great (I had Shoyu Ramen), but the drinks were the highlight for me. Had a great time sampling Japanese craft beers and some sake and chatting with the super-knowledgable manager who was tending the bar. Highest recommendation for the L.E.S.
No comment

Really great casual meal before a show in the neighborhood.  Our server was super nice and knowledgeable, turns out he invented the miso-apple-caramel drink which was terrific.  Recommend the chicken kara-age, as well as the fried Japanese eggplant.  Great beer selection as well!  Highly recommended, we will be back for sure.

Wowza! I've been to my fair share of izakaya's in Tokyo and the food here was FANTASTIC. Got that NY flair while the food stuck true to Japanese Izakaya. Highly recommend the yakiniku. By far the best thing on the menu. Drink selection is phenomenal, would recommend in a heartbeat!
This place is AWESOME! The ramen is always fresh, and tasty. The broth always has lots of pork flavors, they have great drinks and they are very casual.

I had no idea about this place but was blown away!! Great service (the staff is incredibly nice) and awesome Japanese food. Loved the tofu, the karage, the don and the curry. Highly recommend. Will definitely come back!
Incredible selection of very hard to find Japanese beers at incredible price points.
Great food , good service, and cheap.  Cant ask for more .  Highly recommend this place.   Shoyu ramen is great.

Had such high hopes and in actuality not all that bad. The service was a bit less than attentive but were warm and welcoming tableside. Still in the 'opening up' phase so looking forward to them ironing out the kinks. Has so much potential. Looking forward to returning and giving it another shot.
Great food and service. We had steamed butter clams, fried chicken and beef bowl with 2 Japanese craft beers. The atmosphere was very charming.
Fantastic food and great drinks menu. A little under-the-radar gem.

This place is great.  A terrific find. I will come back. I was looking for a Japanese place that specializes in classic grill and dumpling items. They do that here, and it was very good, but to my great surprise and delight, they also have the most extensive drinks program of any Japanese restaurant in the country. No exaggeration. Huge selection of Japanese craft beers, including awesome rare Japanese beer on tap. For instance, they offer a Hitochino yuzu lager that was incredibly delicious. I liked it so much that I tried the other Hitochino on draft, which was a sour, and it was just as good! Subtle, refined, delicious, not ridiculous overhopped and in-your-face like American craft beers. Izakaya Juraku also has superb sake selection, again at very reasonable prices.  I had a lot of fun talking to the manager who is a super chill dude with a lot of experience in the NY restaurant scene. He and the cook started the restaurant with the goal of providing something you can't find elsewhere in NYC: a relaxed easygoing Japanese place that you can relax in and where you can stay late and hang out for drinks.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We ate here after the Chinese New Year Parade and we didn't wait long to be sat. We had the salt and pepper squid and it was so yummy! Hot, crunchy, salty and peppery! The side of rice doesn't come with the entree but that's okay...the restaurant is nice and big and seats many tables. The servers were polite and I had a great time. Thank you Shanghai 21!

Waited to get to Chinatown to have some good lunch and so glad I waited. Wait was a little long for a late lunch (about 45 min for 3 people) but definitely well worth it. We started with some pork soup dumplings which had an amazing flavor just wish meat was a little more cooked. Place was clean. The service was ok servers gave you what you needed just were not friendly doing so. I asked for hot oil and server had no response and just walked away from me leaving me confused then walked back with the hot oil. Ordering and asking for more water and our tab went the same. You ask and they walk away without a word. Tip was included on our tab which explains the service.  Food was definitely a 5 stars for everyone in my group. We shared the Shanghai lo mein and sesame chicken which was divine. Thai tea was ok. I would definitely go back to that restaurant for takeout next time I'm in NY.
No comment
Always authentic and good food - there is always a wait so be prepared for that at least 30 minutes

The food was pretty good, especially for the price. Maybe we didn't get the right dishes. The dumplings were good. The scallion pancakes were the highlight. Fast service. I like that they served green tea for free.
No comment
No comment

This place satisfied my major craving for chinese food! It's a little hole in the wall place that we almost missed walking past it. I ordered the dry sauteed sheredded beef Szechuan style and it was delicious. I love how crispy it was, but it wasn't overly crispy where it's overcooked. It went well with a bowl of white rice. I also ordered the spicy wontons and shrimp dumplings. This will definitely be a place I recommend for anyone visiting in town.

Decided to try their chow mein, chicken fried rice and soup dumplings due to the high reviews. Was disgusted with everything I had.  The noodles for the chow mein were very thick and really gross. I honestly was disappointed with the food and felt sick right afterwards. None of the options I chose were good at all. Will not try this place and do not recommend at all.
No comment
No comment

I love this place! If you are looking for great dumplings and wonderful service, Shanghai 21 is the place. I personally loved the Black Truffle Soup Dumpling with Pork and the Chili Wontons. Black Truffle Soup Dumplings with Pork has a very unique flavor and the truffle gives it an amazing kick to the classic Pork Dumpling. It's a must when coming! The Chili Wontons are a classic as well and they are so deliciously done.
No comment

This place is popular and gets pretty crowded; you'll likely have to wait for a table but they also do take out. We tried the soup dumplings, they were pretty good and they come out piping hot. They're also a bigger size than what i'm used to.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We came here for Dim Sum Sunday and only had to wait for 30 minutes to be seated. They don't have the traditional dim sum cart so if that's what you want, you'll have to go somewhere else. We had the fried pork buns and old style traditional noodles with fried scallions, wonton soup, the spicy wontons and boar's head. EVERYTHING was delicious including the traditional noodles -which just came with plain noodles, soy sauce and fried scallions. The boar's head was absolutely amazing! It came in a whole platter of pork/boar hock of some sort with their awesome black sauce on a bed of baby bok choi. It was delicious. We had to order a couple of rice to help soak in the fat- it's very fatty but also had a lot of meat in the center. We also had some hot tea to help with digestion. I would absolutely recommend coming here!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Friday evening and the wait time for a table of 3 was quoted at 45 mins. Came back after 25 mins and a table opened up. We ordered scallion pancake, 2 orders of the pork soup dumplings, tiny fried pork buns and chicken pan fried noodles. Everything was delicious. They accept credit card, if you pay cash, they don't charge tax.
No comment
No comment

I really loved this place. I had to wait for a table but was sat by a friendly man and had a pot of tea  already waiting on my cold self. I only tried 2 apps but both were worthy. Hands  down you gotta go.
No comment

No comment

No comment
Best soup dumplings ever!!! We also loved the fried rice. About a 20-minute wait, but we were seated right on time and it was well worth the wait. Will absolutely go back next time!

This place is more expensive and not as great as I remember, but definitely a solid one in Chinatown. Wait times can get pretty rough so I would try to get there around 6 if you can. Not cash only they accept card.

Juicy pork soup dumplings and good hot tea. Quick and casual service. I didn't get anything else but in terms of soup dumpling, I definitely recommend and will be back.
The food is hands down amazing! The waiters are sooo nice!! The service is great! Everything we ordered was delicious! The wait time isnt that bad either!

Decided to check this place out on Sunday for lunch; the line was very long but we decided to wait ~45-50 minutes and finally got seated. Did I regret after trying their food? Not at all! I think I would have made the same choice. Highly recommend checking their D1, which was my favorite! I highly recommend checking this place out if you want delicious dim sum!
No comment
Brought my 85 year old mom to NYC for a Chinese food extravaganza. Came here as our "last meal" and it did not disappoint. Both the food and service were on point. Most importantly, my mom loved it.

No frills but best food. Truffle soup dumplings are to die for. Fried pork chop to die for. Any veg or mushroom dish is to die for. Highly recommend. But come about 30min to an hour before youre trying to eat because there is always a line!!

Food was absolutely amazing here! We got some xiao long bao, noodles, rice, and rice cakes and it was so good! The portions were large and we were able to share with left overs. The service is what makes me lower my review - my table was chatting, there were 4 of us, and a friend laughed, prompting a waiter to come over and tell her 'not so loud'. Didn't realize we were in a library :)
No comment

Love this place. We waited maybe about 20 minutes for a table on a busy Saturday night. We come for the crab soup dumplings and they do not disappoint. We got to try the pan fried pork chops this time and OMGGGG SO GOOD! They also make the most perfect scallion pancakes. Always recommend this place for good dim sum

No comment

We went on a Wednesday night without a reservation because we didn't expect it to be that busy. However, upon arrival the place was packed! Even so, we only waited around 5-10 minutes for a table. Everything looked amazing and judging by how packed it was I was excited to try the food. Everything that we ordered was delicious. The pork soup dumplings had been one of the best I have ever tried. The quality was very high with very reasonable prices. I would definitely recommend coming here!
No comment
No comment
My go to for takeout. They have great noodles and soup dumplings without some of their competitors pricing . They also redid the interior and it looks great!

Probably the best Chinese food I've had in NYC. Their General Tso chicken was good, but I highly recommend their beef Shanghai lo mein and shrimp dumpling! We waited about 30 mins for 2 people without reservations. Def a go-to spot if you're craving good Chinese food!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The truffle and crab soup dumplings are Delish! The are huge and the soup had so much flavor. Seriously one of my Favs. The Noodles were tasty as well, they had a really nice chew and flavor. MUST TRY
No comment
No comment

The best soup dumplings and Shanghai dishes in Chinatown are here!! I got the double sautéed pork and Szechuan style wontons (cause I tried the soup dumplings so I wanted something different) and they were both so good. The wontons have a lot of meat in them and the sauce is spicy but sweet! The double sautéed pork was savory and delicious.
No comment
Highly recommend Black Truffle Soup Dumpling and Szechuan Wontons. Also, the Pork Fried Buns. Long wait times but worth the food.
No comment

We went when they first opened and luckily there was no wait. We ordered 3 orders of the xiao long bao or soup dumplings and it hit the spot! There was a good ratio of soup to dumpling and the dumpling casing wasn't too thick. The ginger soy sauce was delicious as well with the fresh pieces of ginger. We also ordered the shrimp dumplings but the star of the show were the xiao long bao. Don't skip out on them here!

No comment
No comment
This sh*t bomb af fr y'all cucumber salad:slap egg drop soup:delicious Shanghai spring rolls: had shrimp in them and were so so good def my fav. SERVICE WAS QUICK, SIMPLE, EVERYONR SO NICE.

Ordered at the restaurant: the crab and pork soup dumplings to go and eat in their one outdoor seating area. Food came out in less than 10 min. The skin was thin, savory soup broth, temperature just right. Tasted great!
No comment
No comment

I have been coming here for 10+ years, and let me tell you, they are ALWAYS fantastic. I recommend this place to so many of my friends coming to visit the city as well as my local friends. The dried Szechuan beef is to die for as well as the fried vegetable rice cakes. You cannot leave here without having the pork Xia Long Bao, it is perfect for the fall/winter and an absolute must. I hope they stay in business for many more years. I'll be riddled with grief if they don't. Go by for a bite, and taste it for yourself!

So gooooooooood! Would def come back . Their shrimp dumping, xbl, spicy wontons etc were all good. My absolute favorite is the truffle dumping! They don't have that in California or i haven't found a place that serves that yet. But anyway , it was my first time and it was ssoooooo gooooood . Making my mouth wet rn just thinking about it.
Best Kung Pao Chicken I have ever had... clean and nice. The people are polite too. It was stressful picking a restaurant in Chinatown because there are so many choices.

Came here last Saturday. Ordered pork soup dumplings, pork & shrimp lomein, duck in scallion sauce and dry sautéed shredded beef. Everything was delicious. The lo mein wasn't as flavorful as expected.  Pricey but worth it. Would definitely recommend this place for anyone visiting Chinatown and in the mood for good Chinese cuisine.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We came here for the soup dumplings but unfortunately we came here too late! Would recommend coming here early in the day or the weekends when they have their dim sum menu out! We still thoroughly enjoyed our chicken Lo mein and the chicken fried rice! Plenty of food for two people and for a GREAT price too! Make sure you have enough cash on you as they do not have an atm in the building but there are ones nearby!
No comment
No comment
No comment

If you're craving soup dumplings, this place is a good option. Both the pork and crab/pork dumplings were tasty, although I personally slightly preferred the pork ones. However, I would say the other dishes we tried (beef lo mein and pork fried rice) were only average and definitely not the highlight.

Great dim sum and a prime location. Soup dumplings are a MUST for me and they have a great selection of other options on the menu to try! Service is always great and I've done takeout a few times and the food never misses. So good!
No comment

Brought a large group here last week and was very pleased with the service, food and quality. Everything was delicious though there are some dishes that I preferred more than others. Salt and pepper shrimp, soup dumplings, king pao were all great. The rice cakes were good but I forgot to ask for chili oil. Sesame chicken was sesame chicken - gloppy but fine. Fried rice was devoured before I could get to it. There was a wait, but ai was told it would be 45 mins and it was 45 - no complaints. I will order some other things next time, but I really enjoyed the food and will definitely go back
No comment

Just wanted to return to say that Shanghai 21 is still delicious, well priced, and overall a great time, one of my fav spots in Chinatown for sure. There does tend to be a wait so always be prepared for that, but once you're in service is quick and the food is delicious! People can get very territorial about where in Chinatown has the best soup dumplings etc. but Shanghai 21 is an overall really solid spot and I always recommended it to people!

Tried this place for dim sum based on a recommendation of a local resident.. the soup dumplings that everyone raves about was not a favorite for me but it was good. I did not really get any crab in there. The noodles were really good, basic but so tasty, it was my favorite! The wontons were pretty tasty, as was the fried pork but the presentation was so bland and uninviting. They are using all disposable for eating and serving, this may affect presentation of a dish. I think they need to use regular serving platters, it takes away from the food display entirely. The place was very busy and had a constant flow of customers. We waited rather long for the food over 30 mins. It is worth a try, but if I'm in town I would try another spot. They had a call button by the tables for when you were ready to order, that was kinda cool.
No comment

Ordered delivery to try this spot for the first time, and all my soup dumplings are broken. All of them. And the hot and sour soup is pretty gross. waste of money! upset because I had high expectations based on the other reviews

I tried coming here once before but it was super crowded and there was a long wait just to get a table so we didn't come that day. This past weekend we came back hoping it would be less crowded and it ended up being so much emptier, I guess due to the pandemic. I was a bit sad when I realized it wasn't specifically a dim sum place like I had hoped, but they had a small section for dim sum items on their menu so we ordered a few of those as well as Szechuan style bean curd. The food came out relatively quickly and I was a bit confused at first when it came out in disposable containers and all the cups and silverware were plastic as well, I guess also due to the pandemic. Luckily, the food was extremely tasty, so I won't worry too much about the other aspects. It was a bit pricey compared to other places I get dim sum in Chinatown but it had some of the best food out of them as well.
No comment
Clean place and well organized. Busy and popular for American customers than local Chinese Americans.
Got an assortment of things here and everything was delicious. Service was okay and same for the atmosphere. Can't really go wrong here.

Best Chinese food I've ever had! My fiancé and I split the soup dumplings with pork, the lo mein with shrimp and pork, and the kung po chicken.

Not as good as it used to be. Upsetting. Staff is still friendly and this place is always busy. Soup dumplings have thin skin and taste good. Dan Dan noodle was as good as it used to be. The rice wine with sesame balls was great as always but the alcohol was way too strong, couldn't drink all the wine.
really great staff and food was amazing. The duck was the highlight of the meal and the dishes are large, great for family style sharing at the table.

Happy to happen to be walking by this place right before the dinner rush hour. Loved the selection of dumplings and other dishes. I wished the staff would inspire you to try different dishes as you are left on your own to make your way through the menu. A must on your list. Really great soup dumplings!

We came here on a Saturday for lunch and it was a 30 minute wait. This place is always busy every time I walk by it and I can see why! The soup dumplings were yummy and had tons of soup inside  but they did break quite easily compared to some of the other soup dumplings I've tried before. We tried the originally pork as well as the crab meat+pork soup dumplings and I've got to say that the pork was my favorite. The noodle soup was also delicious and extremely flavorful. Service is a bit slow but it was packed in there. Prices are pretty fair and it's well worth the wait. They're using plastic containers right now for their food because of the pandemic so it was a little bit strange because I prefer eating out of real bowls but I assume it's just a temporary measure.
No comment
No comment

We came here for the first time thid past weekend and got their spicy stewed beef with noodles in soup, the pork soup dumplings, shrimp dumplings, and the Shanghai Style Lo Mein with shrimp/pork. Overall everything was very good. just a little on the saltier end but I think most places tend to gravitate towards that nowadays. I asked for the spicy stewed beef noodle soup to be less spicy and they were able to accommodate. It was very busy when we went but we were able to get all our food in a timely fashion. Would definitely recommend!
my new favorite Szechuan spot- extensive menu, friendly staff and prices that wont hurt the wallet. Highly recommend the crispy shredded beef w some fried rice- so good!

My family and I truly love this restaurant. The food is consistently good. Dumplings are delicious and ambience is chill. Of all their dumplings our faves are the soup dumplings, the pork leek dumplings and the pork pan fried dumplings. The wonton soup is light and delicious. And their scallion pancakes are also a family fave. Also recommend their scallion shrimp.

I loved Shanghai 21! It was my first time trying dumplings, let alone soup dumplings. We ordered the pork soup dumplings to start and wow! They were an incredible burst (literally- my soup dumpling burst open the first time I tried to eat it) of flavor and goodness! The lo mein with beef was awesome. I saw some reviews said they only take cash or AmEx; we asked several people before we ordered if they took other credit cards and they did.

Located in the heart of NYC Chinatown. Small place so you'll likely have to wait for a table. Crab & Pork XLB is probably the best in the area. Side dishes are delish.

For soup dumpling it is very good.  We always get the pork and the wrap was not too thick and the broth was light and not too fatty.  But for small to average size dumpling 6 of them for $9.95 is a bit pricey.  I compared all soup dumplings to Joe's Shanghi which now thinking about it was actually very fatty.  However the other two dishes we ordered we weren't completely happy with it was just average.  And note a bowl of rice does not come with a dish it has to be ordered separately ... unreal

e really loved the food. Great portion size and great flavor. Staff were friendly! Go before you are hungry as we has to wait an hour for a table. I'd love to see some more chicken appetizers on the menu.

Best soup dumplings and red bean pancake! We also loved the cashew chicken and veggie dumplings. It was all delicious!

I was here on a weekday at past 3pm, and I decided to treat myself with fried noodles, mixed vegetables, dumplings--- everything almost spicy (at least to me). It was excellent and had me deciding I should walk back to where I am staying before working. Service was friendly and as expected, the place is smallish, which is what comes as regular in Chinatown. I only had hot tea, by the way.

Its not what it used to be. Pan fried buns were soggy and the ja jiang mein was just weird. I loved this place with the previous owners but its definitely not the same anymore. Sadly won't be returning again.
Order delivery from here very often! Love everything I ate so far, especially the soup dumplings and tiny buns.

My husband always says you can tell how good a place is by the line at the door. This place is worth the wait. We waited 30 minutes to be seated at 2:30 in the afternoon. The food  was absolutely delicious. We ordered the Kung pao chicken, cashew chicken  beef and broccoli  pork fried rice, pork wonton soup and spring rolls.  The three of us ate family style and it was perfect!  We will definitely be back on one of our future NYC trips

I've been wanting to have a food excursion in Chinatown for a while, and now I finally got the chance. I went to Shanghai 21, and the food was great. They have a combination of traditional Chinese cuisine and the American Chinese food variety that is more widely available in the city. They have a reputation for having the best soup dumplings in the city, and I can't deny. These soup dumplings are A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!! The Black Truffle Soup Dumplings are the best. They are so flavorful. The Fried Tiny Buns with Pork are also great. I, generally, like Pork Buns, but these tiny buns at Shanghai 21 are such an improvement over the traditional. The proportion of bun to pork is perfect! I noticed many diners ordering the Dry Sautéed Shredded Beef Szechuan style, and it did not disappoint! The flavors in all these dishes are just so complex with traditional Chinese cuisine flavors, sweet, salty, and umami. The only knock that I have for this restaurant is the wait time and how they keep track of their waitlist. My friend and I arrived and were told the wait would be a half hour. After about a 15 minute wait, a group of about 6 people arrived, and they were seated well before my group of two. Otherwise, this is a great place to try in Chinatown.
No comment
Really enjoyed the buns, shredded beef, and bok choy. A nice spot for a quick tasty meal in Chinatown

When i eat here or order take out, i always get their soup dumplings.  Its so yummy.  I especially love the crab one.   I occasionally would get the truffle one because it's so pricy compare to the other dumplings.

very let down after researching multiple Chinese restaurants to visit in NYC. Came here for the Salt and Pepper squid. It was more fluffy than crispy but had  zero flavor. The limited Dim Sum they had was decent but nothing to brag about. Our wait was about an hour which seemed normal based on all the lines out the door at nearly every restaurant in this area.

We got the deep fried pork chop as takeout and ate it reheated upon returning to our Airbnb. The flavor and seasoning of the meat was great, but could've been more tender. Also, paid $9.25 and got 2 slabs of not so big meat.

Food and prices good, very big portions. The free green tea is also delicious, definitely recommend.

Good food, but nothing different from what you'd get in Levittown or suburban Iowa from the local Chinese takeout in a strip mall.  Not sure why anyone goes to Chinatown for places like this, other than tourists who gravitate towards a place they perceive as safe because it vaguely resembles a suburban place they're familiar with.  Get the chicken with eggplant and garlic sauce in the event you do go.  It's labelled hot and spicy, but that's by a Western palate's standards.  It's mainly sweet but hits the spot without having to schlep to Levittown.
Very delicious soup dumplings! Like I could just eat 2 plates of them! The other dishes we had were good but not near as good as the soup dumplings.
My first ever dim sum experience and it was delicious! Prices were very reasonable. Wish I could have enjoyed more before I was full!

So glad to see our favorite dim sum place open for outdoor dining. There are only a few tables so get here early!!! The food is every bit as good though I am missing the ability to get chili sauce at my whim. All the dishes are served in single serve containers except the steamed stuff and you are safely cordoned off by plexi glass barriers. I must've missed the ownership change but they take cards other than discover and Amex now. Mm can't wait to come back. Our go tos are crab xlb, spicy Szechuan wontons, shrimp dumplings, bamboo shoots and pan fried pork buns. I wish they would serve or let us bring beers :)

Shanghai is now one of my favorite Chinese food restaurants! Walked in around dinner time and our party of 5 was seated quickly. The service was fast, not overly friendly staff, but not rude either. I enjoyed some steamed vegetables dumplings which were amazing! I also ordered pan fried vegetable noodles. I love the pan fried noodles here because they are a mixture of crispy and soft, so you can mix then up. My entire family loved their dishes as well. By the time we were leaving around 6:30/7 the place was getting busy and people were having to wait for a table so just plan accordingly! Definitely recommend!

It's a beautiful place to spend with your loved ones, the food is also tradition compared to ones in China.  I highly recommend it and want everyone to try it! Thank you kai!

We ate at Shanghai 21 twice while staying in the area. We loved everything we ordered. Everything we ordered came out hot, fresh & delicious.

Always 10/10! My go to spot in china town! I go with the tiny fired buns and szechuan dumplings!!

I highly suggest this restaurant next time you're in Chinatown. My group ordered the pork tiny buns, vegetable spring rolls, general Tsos chicken, and cashew chicken to share. We had 3 people and this was more than enough food. Our group was impressed with each dish we tried- the tiny buns and cashew chicken being our favorites. The wait staff was attentive, but in a quiet and gentle way- not overly assertive. Our group will definitely be back and I hope you give it a try!

I was pleasantly surprised at this gem of authentic Chinese deliciousness! I requested to have my vegetable dumplings fried instead of steamed, they were delicious! Had the Black truffle and Crab XLB and it was pretty good and authentic (not life-changing though). The sliced chicken noodle with sesame sauce was pretty refreshing though with a peanut butter taste.

The waiters were so disrespectful and gave me and my group a hard time. They had the worst attitude, worst service and terrible inauthentic Chinese food . Definitely will not be returning.
