No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

A small place that fills up pretty quick even on a weekday (for lunch). Looks like they have a lunch set menu but we opted for the regular menu to try out their yakitori. Favorites were: pork neck, agedashi tofu, chicken skin, wagyu, and enoki wrapped bacon. Staff was kind, checked up on us several times, service was not too slow but not quick either, and the food was delicious! A casual spot to grab some skewers and sake/beer.
No comment

Solid spot with table and counter seating for your yakitori fix. Skewers: the highlights were definitely unagi and chicken. Wagyu was disappointingly tough! Quick service but make sure to make a reservation prior as this spot seemed quite busy and full for dinners!
No comment
No comment
Need reservations. Good food, but in detail: Beef is great and chicken is just good. Might be a bit of noisy.
No comment

The waitress was nice, but the food was definitely not good. Was the chef off today? The chicken wing was bland and left my mouth nothing but char. The other dishes were nothing to rave about. I did enjoy the yawaraka annin tofu dessert; which was the highlight of the meal. And sorry Anthony Bourdain, I did not like the Skin.
Really good yakitory restaurant. Tried almost everything and also the house hot sake.
Great Sake selection and delicious Yakitori! Gets really busy at night. Will be back!
Every thing tastes good, but a bit pricy for a work lunch. Will try lunch specials next time.

Classic spot and infamously where Bourdain introduced us to the beauty of flash grilled chicken skin. My favorites were the lamb, grilled on the bone, chicken thigh momo, and tofu with miso was a surprise sleeper hit. Spot is very cozy so be sure to get comfortable with close seating
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was one of the most delicious rice bowls I've ever had. No lie! Plus the yakitori was to die for - I got the grilled rice ball with yakitori sauce and it was delicious. The place is reasonably priced as well. For two people (no drinks) it was $32 with tip.

I really like the concept of this restaurant with small plates, nice variety, and yummy food.  The kimchee was very flavorful, not too spicy.  The zuke or tuna sashimi was fresh and good quality.  The gyoza, wontons, and braised pork belly are all very delicious.  The yakitori is the reason to come here though.  The variety is great and you get a few skewers to really enjoy.  The chicken alone has about fifteen different ways it's prepared, different cuts and different compliments.  The harami and kalbi were two of my favorite beef dishes.  I like how they grill the meats and serve on small plate.
I ususally love yakitori totto bentos but this time it was so burnt I couldn't eat it.
No comment
Hidden gem in Hell's Kitchen! Small yakitori bar on second floor was packed on Monday night. Great cuts and quality of yakitori with good local vibe. Definitely coming back!
Great food. Their yakitori is perfect. Great pair with Asahi beer. Only minor thing I wish they can improve is the highball. Other than that strongly recommend specials. Chicken oyster was the best.

Solid yakitori, although I haven't been to other places before so hard to compare. I feel it's hard to mess up skewers tho. The kalbi was the best. Chicken skin and pork were both good/fine. I liked the pork better than chicken skin. Small place but I dig how it's on the second floor. Best seating is near the window.
No comment

Great service and delicious yakitori spot. Stopped by for lunch with a friend after we realized that Momofuku Noodle Bar was closed and we're lucky we did because the food was great. Most notable of the skewers we got were the pork neck, chicken thigh, chicken skin, stuffed shishito peppers. We only got skewers and still left stuffed.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was excellent. Portions are a bit small, especially for the price. Service was slow as they seemed understaffed - our 3 min wait for the table to be set up was more like 15 mins after the waitress assured us twice.
No comment

My favourite every time I visit NYC. Chicken skin is a must, and their cold udon is amazing. They only take reservations till 7 pm, and you have to call. Call during the opening of their dinner hours to get a hold on someone. It's upstairs, which can be difficult to find sometimes, but amazing!! Love love love yakitori totto
No comment
No comment
This place has AMAZING skewers and I'm glad we tried this place. They have a good selection of skewers and it wasn't salty I definitely recommend this place.

1 year ago I would have given 5 stars. my husband and I stopped in for dinner in Oct 2021 and everything was top notch! wonderful service, delicious food, and great beer. We talked it up so much that our kids wanted to try, so we made reservations for lunch. Our son was most excited to try the prawn, which is still on the menu but what you actually get is shrimp, although you're not informed of this when you order. We were also excited for Wagyu since we loved it so much last time, however, it is now "premium beef" but you're not told this upon ordering, either. I would call what we had today skirt steak at best. Even the famed chicken skin is fatty and tough to chew and service is lacking. Anthony Bourdain is rolling over in his grave at what this place has become. I truly hope they're able to overcome these setbacks and get back to what they used to be.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Welcome to Tokyo. Stunning place to take a date, spouse or coworkers you'll be a hero..
Small restaurant but the food is absolutely delish!!!! The drinks are on point and the dessert is amazing. Green tea affogato!!
No comment

I had been wanting to try this restaurant for ten years but for one reason or another failed to get here.  Finally made it and happy to report it was worth the wait!  Utterly transportive and totally delicious!  Everything we ordered was divine, including the seaweed salad (which might have been my favorite dish) avocado with tuna, myriad chicken skewers, okra, mushroom, eel and rice stick.  I want to come back and try everything I missed!  Service was warm and efficient.  Corkage is reasonable.  Will definitely be back...and won't wait ten years this time!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had a great time for my fiancé's birthday last night. Ate 350+ dollars worth of food for four people and it was worth every cent!! They sang her happy birthday with a lighted candle dessert and food was amazing.
No comment
No comment
Amazing food! And great service. Will be going back for sure. Need to try more menu options next time. The mushroom appetizer is delicious.
really good yakitori and it's very delicious. i was supposed to take a photo but i just kept eating and ordering the Peppers try it out !
No comment
No comment

Overall the experience was good. Made reservations & was seated right away upon arrival. We had the corner bar seats, which I really for the semi privacy. Service was quick. The waitress took our ready and the skewers came out one by one about 10 minutes after. All were cooked & seasoned perfectly.  My ONLY complaint is they charged for hot tea ($3/ea) which is unheard of at any traditional Japanese restaurant.
No comment

Very friendly staff. Quaint place. Chicken was undercooked. Ordered three plates and appetizer. Appetizer arrived with two of the three plates. Two of us nearly finished before third plate was brought out. Third plate wasn't even touched but paid for all. Wouldn't go back.  Health rating was only a B
No comment
No comment
Busy and authentically good. Good variety but cost can add up if you don't do Don (rice bowl). Excellent taste and worth a visit.
Superb Japanese grill restaurant on a second floor. The atmosphere is lively, and the food delicious. In the tradition of classic Japanese Yakitori.
No comment
You must get the lunch special. It is definitely worth it.  It comes with salad and miso soup. The chicken wing and chicken skin is very good. Easier to find parking on a Sunday.
No comment
No comment
I'm sorry this place is going down the hill. Make sure don't order "saikoro steak" it taste like vomit!

Nice place to get Yakkitori and drinks with a slight upscale ambiance. Some of the skewers we had were, the chicken skin, scallop, chicken heart, chicken thigh, and beef short ribs. My favorite though was definitely the lamb chop. One costs $8 and its not that big, but the flavors were on point. Once you bite, it melts right in your mouth like butter. Really delicious. Service was good and food came put quickly. The place isn't that big and I'm not sure if they take reservations, so you might have to wait for a table. Overall I enjoyed my experience here.
No comment
No comment

Good Japanese BBQ place. It was full on a Friday evening so we came back on a rainy week day evening instead. Food meets our expectations but not exceptionally impressive. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was good.
It's very authentic yakitori japanese food. Must try their soft bones and gizzard. It's so good.

column3: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: No comment

Probably better for meat-eaters. I'm a pescetarian and didn't love the seafood and vegetarian options. For yakitori, I got the scallop, eggplant, shishito peppers, and shiitake mushrooms. The scallop and shiitake were probably my favorites, whereas the eggplant was barely cooked and the sauce was overwhelming.
Clouded Yakut or I Izajaya on the second floor giving me some Japan nostalgia. Tsukune and eggplant are the must items to try.
No comment
No comment

Great yakitori options! Expensive relative to yakitori places. My boyfriend loved the eel rice so much! It was such a big portion as well, and the eel rice had a subtle flavor with the eel delicately cooked. Liked the wide variety of options for grilled vegetables and meats, ranging from normal chicken to chicken heart and vegetables from tomatoes to artichokes to shishito peppers. Staff was super attentive and nice, wait was a bit long was about 40minutes. Was able to order drinks while waiting. Really homey atmosphere, comforting spot in bustling city.
No comment

This place has gone downhill over the years. Food is OK, they don't have the special items very often anymore, but last time I went, I found a cockroach in my drink, it was a clear drink with ice in a glass, hard to miss it I would think. Very gross!!!
No comment
My go to for yakitori I love this place the stsff are so nice and the food is fabulous  highly recommend  the unagi
No comment
Just okay, nothing memorable. Had the meat lovers yakitori set and only ate 3/5 yakitori. Didn't have that much flavor but the meat tenderness was pretty good.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Solid, very authentic Yakitori - bless them for staying open til 1 a.m.  It's a madhouse at midnight, but the food is so worth it.  Chicken neck and shisito Tsukune were excellent.  They run out of nankotsu/some of the more limited chicken parts as the night progresses - not to worry, though, because the "leftovers" are tasty.  Seating is tight, but that just adds to the authenticity of the experience (for anyone who has dined in Japan).

I'm shocked that this "Japanese " restaurant gets more than 3 stars. We arrived around 2:30pm and we were the only table occupied. We had various yakitori skewers including the "premium" Japanese beef ( premium it was not!), meatballs and chicken breast. All were bland and poor quality. My wife thought maybe it was bad. Ramen was not too bad. My Oyako don was ok. Miso soup was too salty and their salad included very salty dressing. Their fried chicken appetizer poor quality. Overall will not ever be returning although the young lady server was very good and polite. Very disappointed since we expected much better especially a Manhattan restaurant.
No comment

Arrived before the rush. Apparently you can make a reservation but I didn't know that. I love coming here for the skewers. Chicken hearts, skirt steak, anything that is a skewer is great. Small location. Good prices.
Grabbed a quick meal at the counter and each dish came off the grill at a perfect temperature and texture with a deep richness to the flavor
No comment

Overall the meal was pretty pleasant. I tried to get seats at the bar but they kind of brushed me off and if there are no reservations i don't really understand why they didnt seat me there. In any case, service was pretty quick except i wish they gave me my rice dish towards the beginning of the meal instead of the end. I tried the chicken oyster, chicken thigh, karage, chicken wing, chicken skin, bacon wrapped asparagus and kalbi. The chicken oyster and karage were by far the best bites with others just being mediocre. The bacon wrapped asparagus was actually pretty decent with the bacon being crispy. I'd come again but i'd probably be more pointed with my choices.
No comment

Second floor Yakitori restaurant that'll make you feel like you're in Japan. Came here on a Thursday night after seeing Betrayal on Broadway (which side note, was excellent) and sat at the bar area where you could see the chefs grilling the meats. I had the chicken bun, the chicken bowl, and the chicken dango (allot 15 min for cook time). The bun was a good appetizer - the chicken was a tad dry but the bun was very soft. The bowl was filling and I liked mixing the egg with the rice. The rice was super soft and it was a good proportion to the chicken. The service was really nice and I liked how it's a good spot for solo eating. There were tables in the back of the restaurant too however for bigger groups. They do take credit cards. Note that you need to take the stairs up to the second floor and the restaurant is a bit narrow. Overall a nice place to enjoy a solo meal and eat some grilled meats.
The quality of lunch served here has improved a lot from the deteriorated time when I submitted this review, and my recent experiences were quite good.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is my second time order their food through yelp ; unfortunately when I called the restaurant the lady who picked up the phone keep saying that we don't work with yelp you cannot order from there ; I explained to her I ordered in the past and this is my second order  .. anyway after back and force she finally found my order ; then I tried to remind her friendly that you should know which apps your restaurant works with she got really irritated , the whole time the way she talks on the phone is unprofessional and rude , like is  my fault  .. how funny is that ?!  I'm not ordering again.
My fav yakitori in NYC, solid service, food arrives quick, and my fav is the grilled chicken skin.

Met up with a friend here Friday night at 5:30pm sharp right when they opened. Ordered a variety of food and all taste delicious and very IG worthy! Definitely a great place to hang out. Apparently there were people lining up before it opened already. Since it was just the two of us we were seated right at the bar immediately after arrival. As the night progress there were many people waiting in line behind us. If you are planning to come definitely come early!

The yakitori is great. Here's some favorites: liver, heart, premium beef, harami, beef tongue. The apricot kernel tofu dessert is also amazing. Will be back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Best Yakitori I have had in New York. The lunch deal is fantastic - quick, healthy and delicious. Very cute Japanese style restaurant, so don't expect much room but the food more than compensated for it!!

My BF and I waited around 20 minutes on a weeknight, so not too bad. The dishes were kind of hit or miss but most were very tasty. I especially loved the short rib and the lamb chop was great. Didn't care for the cold octopus - the wasabi flavor was way too strong and I felt like it took away from the fish. Tempura zucchini was good, as were the chicken thigh skewers and gyoza, but overall we weren't too wowed. The short rib was definitely the standout. Decent service. 3.5 stars.

Came back again for lunch and the food is still pretty good. Seats are limited so you do have to get here early to get seats, or else there's a longer wait time. I got different rice bowls to share with my friend and they're both good.
No comment
No comment

Pretty good yakitori place with a lot of selections. The chicken gizzard and soft knees are really good. A few other exotic items are great too. The steamed chicken ball with rice on the outside is great, it's worth the 15 minutes wait. The prawn is great too, a bit salty. We also liked the ice cream.
No comment
No comment

First time back after 16 months. It was ok and not as great as it used to be. Shishito peppers were markedly smaller than before and the smelt seemed a bit off. Some of the other yakitori just lacked taste. The eggplant though was ousting, as was the service. So a mixed bag, and maybe it was just an off day (Monday after a holiday). I will wait a couple of months and try it again in hope that things will improve and I can come back with a 5*
Solid yakitori selection here.  Start with beers then let the several rounds of ordering begin.  Ending with a don would be a smart move.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My favorite yakitori spot in town by far.  I love how each piece of the skewers are grilled meticulously and examined before serving.  The grill master definitely display a lot of pride in their work.  We are frequent patrons of this restaurant. The only pointer I have is that either come early because a lot of the specialty pieces are sold out early.

Food is okay but waiter stopped you from walking out because the waiter said the restaurant has minimum double-tax tips??? I gave around 15% but they demanded at least 20%. Bedsides that, the waiter's attitude is terrible in terms of giving recommendations, confirming what you ordered and no refilling water until the bill was given.
No comment

The pork neck is amazing! Think I got 4 of those. Everything else was also good, but quite pricey. I spent about $50 but wasn't full. It also took some time for the yakitori to come out so I felt like I got hungrier during the process. Good place for a snack and drinks, I wouldn't come here if I was hungry.
No comment
No comment

Delicious!! It was a blessing to have found this place that closed at 1am after landing in EWR. Even better, 1 min away from our hotel! We've been in Japan and this place is close to be called 100% legit. I never call something 100% outside of the cuisine's home country as original ingredients may differ a bit but this place delivers and delivers in a great way (4.5 stars if I could). Staff is super helpful and friendly, fast service and totally delish. Not at all cheap but this was the best way to spend $100 for 2 people on a late-night snack

Gem of a spot. Our server recommended a balanced sake to share. Ordered the totto bun and a bunch of different yakitori - harami (skirt steak w onion), pork karashi, chicken skin, unagi, the rice one, shitake mushrooms, and shishito pepper - all were cooked perfectly and delicious. Unfortunately they did not have the limited selection during our visit, but we'll be back again. Did not leave smelling like smoke which is a plus. And they were playing tech house.. 5/5 definitely worth a visit.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Tasty. Expensive. Super small portions. Tiny place! Maybe I am not used to NY and having everything be miniature sized (out of towner). I think the sake was the best part of the meal.
No comment

No comment
No comment
Best place to get Yakitori! Every piece is cooked to perfection and every part of the meat tastes different and delicious.
No comment
No comment

This small little place located near Times Square is packing alittle punch with the yakatori sticks and Don bowls . They were very busy during lunch so I recommend getting there alittle earlier. Services was good and farely quick. The Don bowls are just enough the fill you up. The taste brought me back home to the days when I lived in Okinawa growing up. This place is definitely a must try if you are in the area it's worth the wait. If you have kids the Ramen dish they have along with the Yakatori sticks.

Had dinner here with a few friends on a Saturday night. We had a bit of a wait but it was totally worth it. We ordered lots and would recommend the agedashi tofu, eggplant dish with dashi, premium Japanese beef yakitori, spicy cucumber, prawn, and fried chicken! Order a bunch and share!

Service was good, but a little too helpful. I couldn't  go 30 seconds without being asked if everything was okay. Momo chicken, Negima chicken, Wontons and Udon Noodles were very good and all came out fast. Place is a little small and up a set a of stairs.

Always a line so try to get reservations! Don't recommend coming here with the party larger than two people because it will be a long wait. I tried to make reservations but I don't think that they let you do so unless your party is large. also be prepared to sit at the bar where it is very crowded because the restaurant is a very small space. however my boyfriend and I had a great time!! Mainly because there the food was delicious and the service is fast I really recommend the chicken skin the skirt steak the pork mustard and the Galbi !
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite restaurants in NYC. I have described the food here in ways I can not, would not, should not do in a public forum. Think about chicken. Now forget about everything you know about chicken. This is chicken nirvana. It is that good. Get there early. The special cuts/parts of chicken, such as chicken butt, run out in the first hour.

Delicious restaurant. Efficient and friendly staff. Reasonable prices, especially considering the quality of the food. Excellent location as well. If you feel like Japanese food in the vicinity, this is the place!
No comment

Yakitori Totto is a decent yakitori joint in the Hell's Kitchen area. The skewers aren't too creative, but they hit the spot. Some of the meats are juicy and delicious, while others are nothing to write home. The space itself is small, and during weekends it can be crowded with waits.

My boyfriend was dying to try the place and we came in around 7 or 8 for dinner. The place wasn't super over crowded but it was definitely busy. The staff was friendly and the food was cooked well. The menu style is a la carte so plan and ordering at least 4 to 5 plates if your hungry. We had the bacon asparagus which was fire, Negima, Prawns, & the Totto Bun's. Next time I would prob skip on the prawn, but I'll definitely be back for more. If your in midtown this place is a must try!
No comment
No comment

All of the chicken and pork skewers are excellent, including and especially the shishito pepper with chicken stuffing.  I actually liked the beef skewers a little less than the chicken and the pork here.  Sometimes it can feel like they are rushing you a bit, but the food is really delicious.
No comment

One of the best Yakitori meals I've ever had in my life, probably the best in all of NYC. Be ambitious and try the chicken hearts. The Tofu is really good and the Kalbi. Sit by the counter and see then grilling in front of you.
No comment
No comment

They have a wide selection of skewers available and the ones I tried were very tasty. The lunch menu was also very decently priced. However, they put a lot of MSG and salt in their food so it was not the healthiest option around.

Ordered their negi tori don and dori dango and some yakitoris (skewers). The warm egg came with the don was surprisingly the best. Skewers are fair I personally think they were overpriced. We came without reservation so was limited to one hour eating time which wasn't too bad except for the waiting time to get food was quite long. I do love how they have the very cute tiny place on the second floor though.

Fantastic find.  A tiny, 2nd floor, cramped shrine to Japanese grilled foods on a stick.  They have a fairly diverse menu with various hot and cold appitizers - we really liked the Tuna Avacado salad and Chicken Bun.  Them the star is clearly the yakitori and everything we tried was fantastic - Chicken Meatball (amazing), Chicken with Scallion, Kalbi, Shishito, Garlic... mmmmmmmmm.  I can't wait to return.

Made a reservation for Sunday night and glad we did because the place is very small and fills up quickly. Ordered the croquettes, fried soft knee bone for appetizers and the following skewers: beef tongue, premium Japanese beef, chicken skin, chicken oyster, smelt, gizzard, pork neck, chicken meatball with sauce, and soft knee bone. We also got a sardines with preserved veggies over rice to share and the tofu dessert. For skewers the standouts were the Japanese premium beef, pork neck (amazingly delicious!!!), and soft knee bone. The appetizers we got were all delicious and would definitely get them again. I would skip the beef tongue, it was very tough and tasted very weird. The smelt, gizzard and meatballs were nothing special so would skip those as well. The rice was delicious and was very filling with some pickles and miso soup served on the side. Would highly recommend the dessert which was very refreshing and not overly sweet. Service was standard but they were very quick. Overall the food was decent with some standouts but they dont season their dishes enough and I kept having to add salt to everything I ate.
The amount of food is quite expensive but reasonable. Yakitori's are cooked and always observed by one cook. Waiting is quite long during weekends but the food and service is outstanding.
No comment
No comment

I have been to this place many times. This is like a authentic Japanese restaurant. I really like the una-jyuu, which is the best eel rice Ive ever had in nyc, the eel is soft and tasty and box is so cute. The Yakitori are good as well, I recommend chicken liver, gizzard and thign.
No comment
No comment

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: this is one of my favourite yakitori place. I usually go there once a month. The unagi bowl is the best in NYC！

Maybe they were having an off night or maybe I should not have gone to Tori-Shin before, but I just didn't find the food or service to be that great here. It was definitely missing the trademark smoke/taste from cooking on the binchotan/robata grill.
No comment
No comment

Waiting for the pick up for more than half an hour, asked them many times and they just told me to wait, at the end they just told me the order wasn't went through. I understand that the app might have some technical issue, but the restaurant pick up service is the worst I have ever seen. Very disappointed.
No comment

I discovered this place by accident about 4 years ago and was amazed. I just came back with my gf last night and we enjoyed one of the best meals of our lives. The Yakitori is seared to perfection. Their service could not be better and the ambience makes you feel like you are somewhere exotic. Beyond the Yakitori they also have great sakes and neat/tasty appetizers. We hope to come back soon!
No comment
No comment

Service was good but the skewers were bland,which was overpriced too. The eel over rice was soooo delicious,and their desserts were good too. Even though the yakitori wasn't very tasty,we still enjoyed our meal.

Trying to find some place open till late we stumbled upon this izakaya type of yakitoriya. Portions were really small for the most part but tasty, exception to the unaju which I'll talk about more later. Skewers were around U$3,00 to U$3,50 and tiny. I have worked for several Japanese restaurants as a chef and I had not seen skewers as small as Totto's. But the worst part was when I ordered some Unaju (fresh water eel over rice). My wife likes it more saucy as it was very dry and I asked the server if it was possible to BUY some more sauce. He just said NO in a very rude and unapologetic way without giving any excuse for that: just a blunt NO! Japanese culture is all about politeness by expressing and living out OMOTENASHI. Unfortunately that didn't happen to us and we ended up having a real bad experience. I would definitely NEVER come back.
No comment

Good skewer except some of their special ones were sold out. The place was a bit small, I almost hit the guests at the other table when I try to pass. You have to be so careful moving around(when you have to).

I waited in line for 1.5 hours. The eel bowl is my favorite!! All the BBQs are general tasty. The shumai is good, the bacon wrap is creative, the beef tongue are little overcooked....the lamp chop is tender! Recommend!
No comment

Got there early which was a good idea. Place got packed after 10 mins with people waiting up to half an hour. I tried the Yakitori like the Kawa, Harami, Sasami and Shitaake. I was actually surprised with the taste. Everything had its unique flavor that made me order more. Beer was great and not stale. I am hoping to go to this place again in the future.

We loved the food here!  The food came out fast, was delicious, and was reasonably priced for the quality.  We went for lunch right when they opened, and we were glad we did because shortly after that the place was full.  Yakitori isn't something you can find anywhere (unlike ramen and sushi) so it was a cool thing to try.  The service was also really good...I dropped a chopstick on the floor and before I could even pick it up our server had a fresh pair of chopsticks for me!
No comment

Absolutely UNACCEPTABLE. Found a long piece of METAL/mesh sponge inside my "salted duck ramen." When I tried to take a picture of it, the Waitress immediately took it away and showed it to the kitchen staff and only offered to replace the dish/remove it from the check. Of course I did not want to eat anything else so I checked out immediately. Never coming back here again!!
No comment
No comment

Arigato! Something different, and delicious. (*By the way the restaurant is up a long flight of narrow stairs, NOT the ground floor*) My husband and I love to come here and order several skewers to share. My favorites in order of preference are: the shishito peppers, the smoked lambchop, the grilled garlic, Harami skirt steak, and the shiitake mushroom. But whatever you order, you can't go wrong! I wanted to explore the sake menu but many of the selections lack a description in English and I was too embarrassed to ask the waitress to go through the list with me. Seem like an impressive list tho!

So good. A bit of a wait. Food was delicious. The donburi was very good, along with the agadeshi tofu and other appetizers. Worth going, especially for the cozy izakaya ambience.
No comment

column3: Fosterstown North, Dublin, Republic of Ireland
column6: Good food but menu is very detailed and takes a lot of reading and while I like the authenticity of staff they were not very good at describing what each dish entailed or what was gluten free for a guest that was with us... sake was nice but pricey for what u get will return again to see if I'd sawy to a two or a four.
No comment

I don't know what an authentic Yakitori restaurant is technically but this sure feels like it to me. The whole restaurant smells of grilled meat that's been barbecued in their open kitchen behind the seats at the bar. I thoroughly enjoyed two different beef skewers and a bowl of the spicy Negi Tori Don. This rice bowl came with a soft cooked egg on the side that when poured in over the rice adds flavor and texture to the rice that I haven't experienced before. Drinks are a bit overpriced here. Including tea. They charge for each cup, no refills. So if you have two cups of tea that's $6. Just a heads up. Small restaurant but the wait ended up being shorter than we were originally told.

Can't go wrong with Yakitori and this was a nice spot for an overdue dinner date with an old friend. Food is good, portions are decent, prices are fairly reasonable, sake options are great, and ambiance is nice. It gets crowded so be ready to get to know your neighbors.

I love their Tsukube yakitori and the lamb also good. Overall they have a good food and the service also good. Always have a good experience there. Im not really crazy about their rice bowl one. Get their yakitori, they have a good yakitori.

I would give 4.5. Kyona & Jyako, onsen tamago salad-good. Fresh kyona. Salty but tasty fried silver fish. Super fresh onsen tamago that adds a creamy texture. Cream cheese goes very well with the salad. Asparagus bacon-good. Juicy asparagus wrapped in a slice of bacon. A little fatty and salty. Gyutan-very good. Good quality of beef tongue. Very chewy and tender. Well marinated. Japanese premium beef-very good. Some pieces melt in your mouth. Very tender and juicy. Excellent with wasabi. Chicken oyster-delicious. So tender, juicy and flavorful. Both meat and skin melt in your mouth. Hotate-very good. Fresh scallops. A little over-done but still good.

Good yakitori and other skewers. Arrived 11pm after a show on Friday eve and seated right away. Everything tasted good, nothing bad. Chill vibe. If you enjoy organ parts of the animal, the chicken skin and heart source was excellent.

Japanese Yakitori. Excellent authentic little place with the bbq grill out in the open. Each of the skewers is about 3-5$. Loads of options and meat, veg, rice balls, dumplings, salads etc. All of the skewers I had were fantastic including chicken hearts. Hot sake is good fun also. Will definitely return again. Great fun place, reasonably priced and all the food is very tasty.
No comment

I've been coming here for years on and off, and it's always been really good, something to look forward to. This last time the food was pretty bad, I mean everything. Not sure if they changed the cooks but it was really disappointing.

This place was amazing, and easily one of the best Japanese Yakitori's in New York I have ever been to. It is located on the second floor after the main entrance. The overall restaurant size was pretty small. We went at around 6PM on a weekday before the dinner rush and there was no wait, however, when left around 7PM there was a line, so come early! The skewers were fairly priced and they have a ton of other entrees to choose from. Would recommend the green tea affogato too. Definitely come here.

I love love love this place! This is def a must when you are in NYC. It's very small, cozy seating arrangement. The food and place just gives you that very authentic feel as if you are in Japan! Everything in their menu is great! We usually go get dinner then come here for a second dinner. The pacing on how often they serve your order is timed perfectly-I am sure they  have some algorithm how that works.

It was a last second decision to take my daughter and neice here and we were not disappointed at all. It was the first time for my neice trying Yakitori  and she was amazed. The Eel over rice seemed pricy but was absolutely worth every penny. I would come here everytime I visit New York.

Small cozy environment! with amazing meat quality! FRESH!

I ended up in the hospital by ambulance several days after eating here and have been sick for over a week. The worst I have ever been in my life. If I had not gone to the doctor I could have died. This is because of the campylobacter bacteria which comes from poorly handled poultry. So, most likely the chicken skewers here. How do I know? One of my other dining companions also ended up in the hospital and another had a 102 degree fever. Be very very careful when dining here.

Now I've never had an authentic Yakitori experience (meaning I've never had Yakitori in Japan) but this place is exactly how I would imagine the experience would be. The interior is small and almost cramped feeling but that's what it looks like at most Yakitori joints I've seen photos and video of in Japan. If you get to sit in front of the kitchen like I did you get the tortuous pleasure of smelling the aromas of the food items cooking on the grill. And you are also treated to a good show! But the fact that I was seated right in arms reach of where the waitresses pick up the food was just so terrible, I felt like grabbing every freshly made skewer that was set on that raised counter every time they placed an item there. Speaking if waitresses, the waitress was very courteous and polite, I give this place top marks for their service! I got a refreshing glass of Sapporo beer which I liked a lot, my first time trying Sapporo. My food order consisted of 4 skewers  which were the Pork and Green Onion, Chicken Breast and Green Onion, Bacon wrapped asparagus, and Chicken thigh. The Pork and Green Onion was alright, nothing really jumped out at me there. The Chicken Breast and Green Onion was a good pairing. Bacon wrapped Asparagus, well do I need to say more lol. And my personal favorite was the Chicken thigh, just so tender and juicy and lightly charred exterior was just all so perfect! I had a great meal experience here and would love to visit again on my next trip to NYC!
No comment
This is a strong yakitori shop.  Meats are high quality and uniformly very tasty.  The apps/side dishes are also pretty good.  This is really a strong 4-star review, I'm a big fan.

Worse customer service ever - terrible and completely out shadows the food. The hostess was rude at the start and the end and eventually they ended up kicking us put. I am making no comment about the food as I feel the service was so terrible, rude and frankly so unlike Japan that having the word yakitori associated to it a disappointment to Japan
This place is probably my favorite place to hangout with my friend on a late night in NYC, it's really close to Time Square and the food is DELICIOUS!!
Only one ramen on the menu - pork broth with beef is one of the best I have tasted in the city.  The ramen noodles taste buttery and fresh.  Grilled yakitori skewers are a must.
No comment

Super super expensive! So I asked the waiter if the price was per stick of meat and he said yes. I know different places are different, but come on! This is yakitori..... And $3 per stick is pretty expensive. Back home in LA, yakitori would be the same price but they give u 2-3 sticks of meat. So comparing, I would say eating this place isn't that worth it. The chicken soup was yummy though. Very light but had enough flavor to give it that tasty factor. Service was ok in my book. I think they had some big reservation at 7 and was kind of rushing all the guest. So I didn't kirk that. But overall, it's a fun experience in NYC to try yakitori.

Stopped by just for the yakitori, place was packed after 6pm on a Thursday. Fresh ingredients that were cooked and seasoned perfectly. Chicken gizzard and chicken liver were surprisingly good(no strange gamey taste at all). However, portion was rather small for an average of $4 per yakitori, had ten pieces and walked out still feeling a bit hungry. Their lunch set might provide better value. Service was okay though the waitress never smiled.

If you're looking for Yakitori in NYC, this is the place you want to be. The place is quite small so expect a wait if you're going with a large group or even on a date. The service is amazing and the food ... listen, the food is amazing. The Yakitori, the rice bowl, the beers, and even the whiskies. It's all delicious. Come prepared to eat, drink, and spend some money.

This place is the bomb! We went here for a late night snack and discovered this amazingly authentic Japanese yakitori restaurant. We had the most delicious Inaniwa Udon noodles served cold that reminded us exactly of our favorite restaurant in Tokyo. I can't wait to go back and explore more of the menu!

But they really need to update your system so people maybe can put their names down and get called or something other than what they have now which is very archaic.

At 10pm we were told it be 40 min wait.  I was like there is no way.   Wait time less than 15 min most of the people were done eating.   We order a variety of food and I almost die when my daughter order the chicken skin.    she said that in error but hello it's chicken skin what did you expect it to taste like.  Lol the miso soup was tastey but it was not white miso like my daughter liked it traditionally and it was a bit salty.   I told her next time ask what kind of miso is it before you order never assume.  Read.   The best was 3 skirt steak yakitory and the 1 kalbi beef. Yum!!   Dumplings were homemade but suck together and stuffing was falling apart.  The chicken was very good and the wings.  Love the tuna appetizer  the presentation was beautiful. The prawn was good but lack flavor.  The 1 age dashi tofu was delicious and 1 cheese fried was good as well as the baby salmon roe and mayo as dipping sauce for the cheese roll.  Edamame was good you can't screw that up and if you do you need to close.  I would come back again and try different items.  Last page of menu $20 min per person per order.  Really?!   But we ordered plenty. Service overall was very good this place is on the second floor but it is small and comfortable.

It is good. The food arrives fast. They do expect you to leave after you are done eating though because it gets busy. The portions are small. I guess it is expected for yakitori. A bit to the pricey side in my opionion for what you get. I guess the value isn't there. However, if you are in the neighborhood and craving yakitori... this is a good option. The food is tasty.
It's delightfully delicious. Feels like Japan. It's sooooo good. Staff was nice. Scallops were outta this world!! I love this spot!!!!!

This is the best restaurant that I've been to in this part of the city. We only had a 20 minute wait or so, and they text you, so you're able to stroll around during the wait. The restaurant itself is on the second floor, and is quite a small intimate space. The food here is so, so good. The actual yakitori themselves aren't that expensive, but they do have a price minimum for each person that you need to spend. But this place is a treasure and I've never been anywhere else like it. The service is great, and you can just keep ordering and ordering skewers of meat and veggies throughout your meal. So if you're in the area, and you want a relatively cheap place to stay away from all the big chain restaurants, this is the place to go. It's fantastically delicious, and eating here is definitely an experience.

No comment

Food was incredible. Love the sharing style and pace. Mostly yakitori (skewers and small plates) each one better than the last. I recommend the chicken skin, chicken breast wasabi, croquettes, oyako don, and eggplant miso.

Yakitori Totto is a great option for lunch or dinner in midtown. We went before a play in the area. We were able to snag two seats at the bar before it got too busy. The salmon salad was one of my favorites surprisingly. The chicken buns were a bit boring, probably would have been better as the fried chicken option. The yakitori is quite good. Tons of options. And the menu is large so there's usually something for everyone.
Love this place! Great food with nice service and a weird but cool atmosphere. The rib and chicken meatball skewers were my favorite. You MUST leave room for dessert they have really nice ones.

Every dish we had here was simply divine! My partner had been wanting me to try Yakitori for a while, but there aren't really any good options for us in Raleigh. Luckily, this place was right near our hotel in NY, and it was out of this world! We will definitely be visiting this spot again on our next trip!

Diff experience to try out lot of meat options. But most of the popular dish was not available despite being there at 7pm.
First time at Yakitori Totto with friends from out of town. Its pretty amazing! Very tender and tasty choice of meat and a simple setting to catch up with friends.
One of the best Yakitori I ever had. Not too pricy and the food is really good. You may need to wait for 20 min but the food there is definitely worthy.
Yelp led me here and I loved it. Highly recommend this if you are in NY.  All yakitori dishes I tried were good. I had a soup too. It was also good. Service was good but it gets crowded.

As good as last time! Tryied different dishes and still great! Got takoyakibin the seasonal specials, so good! They sadly deleted the bacon-mochi yakitori from their menu which was my favourite.., please bring it back!!

My husband and I had dinner and everything was going well. Food tasted great and we received all of our dishes except one. We kept asking for it and they kept telling us it was being cooked. Being that it was a hot appetizer we thought it would have been one of the first things to come out. People to the left and right of us reordered food and we're seated after us and got all of their dishes. I don't know what the deal was but we left very upset. We won't be going back or recommending this place.

We went for lunch.  Unfortunately their lunch menu is different than their dinner menu.   Also, they were out of the bacon skewers.  Ugh.  The skewers we had were all good but I wouldn't say they were must haves.  If I could give it 3.5, I would.  That fits better than 3 or 4

I like the chicken heart, liver, gizzard! The takowasa is juicy but a little bit salty. Tofu is very soft!

3.5 stats. Whether you're looking for a place to snack or a place to have a meal, this is the place. It can be pretty cramped but it's adequate enough for a squeeze. The service is quick an apt when refilling water or asking if you need any more food. The big downfall for me is that it can get pricey. But the food is decent to great. I loved the eel with rice and the different choices of skewers. Things can seem a little bland but there is a side of salt, pepper, red pepper, and soy sauce if you need more flavor.

A small little place with amazing food! Highly recommend the scallop, eel rice and bacon mushroom. Def will be coming back!

I'm from California and we have plenty of yakitori restaurants but this place is probably going to be my favorite! They used quality meats, cooked and seasoned it to perfection. Their service is top notch! Just an excellent place for dining with friends! Will definitely come back again when I'm in town.

I can never seem to get a reservation for dinner but I have gone there for lunch two times. The prices are very reasonable for midtown. I highly recommend the Chicken Nanban and get it every time.

Food is good but the service is horrible. The waitress didn't get us the right number of orders. I went here for my brother's birthday and we had 5 people and they cramped us into a very small table for 4. Definitely not worth the hour wait.

Saw cockroach run around the bar table and climb into the cute salt container. and they dont say sorry, just move me to another table despite my nice attitude not to shout it out and scare the entire restaurant

I had not been back here for some time but am so glad that I came back.  Great yakitori! I love the chicken hearts ... and most items to be truthful.  It is a real NY yakitori place  (not a Japan yakitori place) so it is full, crowded, fast ... but oh so very good.

Came here with a coworker. Dinner was good, dessert menu could slightly be improved. Wish I had some pics to post, but I guess I ate too fast.  Most memorable dishes....all were equally good. Had the enoki bacon, Kalbi was a little chewy, scallops were slightly over cooked, chicken skin was good as well as Yaki onigiri. I actually really enjoyed the arugula salad. Agedashi tofu was delish even if there was only two.

I can't tell you how happy I was to find a bonafide yakitori place in this neighborhood. Yakitori Totto has a great atmosphere and serves very good food. The only thing I was missing was happy hour drink prices and chicken cartilage.

Tiny and busy place!  Very cute, but with it was a bit more flavorful.  Loved it's smokiness.  The braised pork belly is heavenly - and very very filling.  Chicken skin could go a lot more crispy for my like.

We tried an assortment of yakitori including wagyu, scallops, pork belly, chicken skin, grilled shrimp, and assorted mushrooms - everything we had was flavourful and delicious! The only downside was that we had to wait for over an hour for a table for two despite the hostess saying the wait would be 30 minutes.
Love this place! It's a small and cozy place but the food always seem to be spot on!  No matter the newest dish we add to our repertoire of our usual dishes, the new items are great as well!

We tried a variety of grilled meets with beef tongue and premium beef as our favorites. The fried tofu was another dish that stood out, and we concluded our meal with their green tea affogato, which was amazing. The meats are well seasoned and tender, but portions are rather small. Quality over quantity though amirite? The service was great, and everything is quite pricey here, but the experience was definitely worth it.

I think this place was overrated. Food was actually average, except for the special chicken oyster! Services was outstandingly below standard. My best advice is try to "keep calm and carry on" when you are here ;P Even though you receive a text saying that the table is ready, you might need to wait for another 10-15 minutes. Personally, i do not think this place is worthwhile for waiting time of an hour at all.

Walked in on a week day after 7:30pm and there was a wait. In my opinion, this is always a good sign for a restaurant.  After about 20 mins, we were seated by the bar.  The atmosphere of the place is modern, clean and higher end of izakaya.  We ordered several skewers of this and that..  prawns,  lamb, chicken skin etc, etc.  Ah, perfection!  Watching the yakitori chef carefully turn the skewer of food on the grill was kinda amazing too.  It explained why the food was cooked so perfectly!  They also have a good variety of sake, which is also a plus.

Good place for the happy hour drink!  It is a small place with very crowded tables and noisy.  Their yakitori is excellent!  Wish they can have more varieties or have a combo that has everything together!  You can order the skewers then order a rice.  The rice dishes are little too much if you order the appetizers.  It is about $20 per person.

Good yakitori, and food came very quickly. I love the soft knee bone. The salmon roe rice is just OK. I would like to come back and try something else if we don't have to wait an hour for food

Love the octopus ball, eggrolls, and tuna salad. The appetizers are really small and if you go as a group of 3 or more you definitely will have one of your friend starving. Staffs are pretty friendly. I personally think the reason why this has 3 dollar signs is because the portion of the food is ridiculously small. But I WILL NOT come back even though I feel great privacy in my table because I found slim metal from the dish washer sponge in my sautéed duck noodles. Greatly disappointed

The service is TERRIBLE!!! Don't go there if you wanna turn your good mood upside down. That waitress is dropping down the seaweed dishes, cups and bowls on the table with zero attention and NO apologies. No smiles at all but offering smiles for other tables (Racist?!) I guess that waitress thinks she's the boss since she even asked us to make room for her so that she can easily get the dishes from the kitchen counter. RUDE. My friend and I feel we are not even welcome to order the food!!! Whaaat?! We sit, eat, and leave with ANGER. Sincerely, Yelp lovers, please don't go there.

I was hangout w my friends eat dinner here by Mar 25，and i'll never ever come back！There is what happen，we order something and we don't like it，but it's ok，it just no my cup of tea.We order soba and something like duck，we take a bite then we don't want eat anymore，we ask for check，we have 3 people and spent $40+.Then the waiter came said next time u guys need order more，the menium for one person is $20.Excause me！？The waiter even no asking why we don't want the food anymore！I still give him 20% tip because I'm a waitress，but i totally not appreciate what he did！

I absolutely love this place. I work close by and we come here from time to time for lunch. We try to arrive a little before 12 because the place gets packed fast and once you try it you will know why. The food is amazing and I have tried all the beef, pork and chicken dishes. The asparagus wrapped in bacon is to die for. The service is usually very good although not the friendliest which is fine with me. It's a very small place so expect to be on top of the next person. It really is a great place though.

Pretty tasty food, as otters mentioned prices are a little high for portion size. I'd like to give 3.5 stars but can't, hence the rating. I ate the scallop skewer and it was good, also ate the hot udon noodle soup (without chicken) ...it was very good but I had asked for a spicy sauce and was told they didn't have it ...wish they did. BF ate the skirt steak skewer and it was cooked very well and tasted great (but the gripe, again, is the size/price) he also ate the dish that comes with rice and chicken and an egg on top...he liked it well enough but felt it's nothing spectacular. We shared the tuna avocado salad to start and it was tasty but very difficult to pick up with chop sticks and should come with at least one or two big flat crackers...again for the price that seems it'd be reasonable.

I am long time customer of this restaurant but I will not go this restaurant anymore or until back to original. Every good things has been change. The service, food quality and all staffs were not good anymore. I believe the owner has been changed. Be aware.

Sooooo good! Great service, atmosphere was fun, decor was classy and beautiful, food was outstanding! Definitely recommend the pork belly, tuna sashimi, chicken thigh and sirloin steak! Also the floral display in the bathroom!

However, you can't find many places charge yakitori like this. We spent 90 bucks plus tips on few skewers. It's just the amount is really not much and taste was just okay.

I took off a star because of the service. My friend and I went there on a Saturday night without reservation. We were lucky to get seated immediately but were asked to leave by 7, which is understandable. However, the waitress started to remind and push us to leave at 6:20. Definitely annoying and rude.  Without doubts, food they offer is fantastic. I  am obsessed with Mochi lately. I had mochi bacon, mochi ice cream and green tea ice cream with two small mochi. We also had lots of other dishes, all of them are amazing!

Based on the reviews I thought I would be blown away. Instead I was thoroughly unimpressed. I lived in Japan for some time and while the food was adequate, it wasn't amazing and the service was marginally acceptable. In retrospect I'd rather have eaten at the crappy karaoke bar next door for far less money.

ZERO STAR! Stay away from this place!! Be aware of OLD JAPANESE FAKE DIRTY BLOND HOSTESS! Just like other reviews, disgusting customer service!!! She's so crazy and feisty! The service is warm and food is carefully prepared. Very authentic delicacy!! Although the price is moderate, I will definitely come again.

Fantastic! Wide variety of delicious food, good for lunch and groups. Fast service all around. A small space, so book ahead for dinner. The raw egg that comes with many of the rice meals is strange and I don't recommend mixing it into the dish. My favorites are the beef skewers, salmon + salmon roe bowl, and the eel dish.

Friendly staff and service! Lunch was a great deal considering ~$12 for a salad, miso soup and rice dish. We had the Yakitori totto and the seafood don. Both were decent and of good portion. Yakitori is famous there. must try !
This place is super tiny but super delicious. Everything we ate was super delicious. The Tamago was super memorable. We will go back next time we are in NY.
Expansive, but not delicious. Service was not good as well. They miscalculated our bill without saying sorry. Bad experience overall.

Before this place, I was a yakitori virgin.  We ordered a ton of food, from meatballs, to bowls of things, to chicken skewers.  Everything was good, but I wouldn't say that they blew my mind.  We made a reservation, and walked over from the Rockefeller Tree.  Good spot if you're near the area.

A little pricey but overall, the food was good. Definitely come earlier if you can because the place fills up very quickly during lunch/dinner hours!

This place is great and most likely you won't be disappointed. Service is always great food quality is great.  Must try items here are pretty much all the specials, but they are gone fast and its first come first serve, so be there early if you want to try them. The seaweed salad is good but I like the kyona salad better. The deep fried silver fish appetizer is awesome with beer.  I also like the jidori rice dish they have, this you have to order I think 30 minutes ahead because does take some time to make it, but definitely worth a try.  Also if you like noodles, try the cold noodle dish, it's really refreshing and good.

Loved this place - truly authentic japanese grill! we sat at the counter (40 min wait, had a glass of wine while we waited). The food was all meticulously prepared. The cucumber was great, all of the grilled items -- and we had the most amazing dessert: coconut milk, tapioca and frozen banana. I can't wait to go back.
Not worth trip at ALL. New York has the finest cuisine in the world, however this place is mediocre at best, def not worth the trip

This was a hidden gem! Hadn't been to New York in a fee years...ended up here in search of a great sushi place on the same block (which closed). I'm glad it did, otherwise we wouldn't have found Totto. The food is authentic...staff if brilliant and the place is cozy. But the 5 stars is really truly for the food...don't be afraid to venture out & order the many different organ meats they have. Delicioussssss!

I really enjoyed the various dishes I tried. They have a good mix of the bbq items as well as other items. The hot udon soup was really nice on a cold day and I enjoyed how fishy it tasted with all the seaweed floating in it.  The bbq items were very nice, the chicken wings, short ribs in sauce were delcious. The chicken meatballs wrapped in rice were okay, seemed to lack a little bit of flavor.  We also tried the premium japanese meat which was a nice cut of meat but not too much flavor.  Lastly, we enjoyed the dumplings because they were steamed and then had a hard sear on the side. Overall, it was a nice meal. We came at a random time so no wait, and they have a minimum of $20/ person which is really easy to do.  Food is somewhat expensive given how small the portions are.

Skewers of chicken, beef, and pork cooked to perfection. Served with Himalayan salt or yakitori sauce. Goes wonderfully well with house shouchu cocktails or a glass of beer. This place is very authentic well priced.

Cozy, tasty, spicy exotic, name it this place gets all my rating! After eating at hundreds of Japanese food this is my favourite place. If you want to splurge into food exotic Asian food don't miss this out. I went with group of 7 and totally enjoyed it..

I'm a fan of all of their BBQ. However I don't think it's a good place for a group of guys who wants to really have some meat. Actually it's not a good place for group. It's small and cute and neat place for 2 people (couple, dating, friends, etc) to have a chit chat and have something on a stick but don't want to be too full.

Chicken oyster is great. I love their eel rice bowl! We ordered green tea affogato as desert. It tastes amazing. Highly recommend!

This place is phenomenal. Undoubtedly my favorite place to pig out. It can get expensive but totally worth it. The staff is pleasant and helpful although their English isn't the best lol. The menu is extensive and there is something for everyone. Most of the menu is served on tiny skewers. A few things you must try; Tori dango (rice covered chicken meatballs), braised pork belly app, premium Japanese beef, short ribs, asparagus bacon... The list goes on.... The sake selection is also immense but it will cost you. Two hungry pigs, like my friend and I, run up a $200 bill no problem. Definitely a place worth trying.

Their food is just ok. Most skewers are good, but the Kalbi short rib and Bacon mash room skewers are not that good. The Ikura rice bowl and Udon noodle are just ok. And expensive for small portion of food.
This place is incredible! If you love yakitori, this is the place to go in NYC. This place is my go to place in the city whenever I feel like dining out. Highly recommend to anyone!

Love, love, love this place! Asparagus Bacon and the Harami are amazing. I eat here for lunch at least once a week and have never had a bad experience. Service is always excellent.

Authentic Japanese Yakitori. All the Yakitori on the menu was cooked to perfection. Excellent texture. My personal favorite is the beef tongue, lamb, and short rib. Amazing selection of sakes. Expect a line during peak hours. Cool spot for grubs with friends and a fun experience for a date.
Love the atmosphere. I had the ramen, which was excellent. I'm looking forward to trying other items on the menu next time.

One of my favorite restaurants in NY.  I eat here every trip.  They have an awesome selection of skewered meats in a very cool place.

Perfect late night bite after seeing an amazing broadway show. The soft bone, pork neck, steak skirt and mushroom skewers are really good. Yakitori at its best. Bit on the pricey end, but makes up for it by phenomenal quality of tsukune, ebi and other yakitoris. Yakitori Totto!  Been meaning to try this place for so LONG!  Every since I got back from Japan and had the BEST yakitori every in my life in Tokyo, I had to get my fix again in NYC.  Every time I came to Yakitori Totto, the line was always long and the wait was unbearable for my group.  However, last week, after a random week day, I went with my friend.  The yakitori did not remind me of the food that I had back in Japan.  We got the braised pork, sweet & spicy fried chicken, chicken thigh, scallops, and pork with scallions.  My friend ordered the lamb for herself while I drank their $6 shot of plum wine.  Starting off with the braised pork belly - the mini potatoes that were beautifully peeled and shaped, were too salty.  The braised pork was delicious and some of the best pork I have ever had, but it too was too salty for me.  The dish was marinated in soy sauce and as I'm writing this review, all I can think about is the saltiness of the dish.  The sweet & spicy fried chicken was missing the sweetness and spiciness.  It was fried to perfection, with a nice crunchy bite to the chicken wing, but again, sadly, too salty for me.  What I can recall is just salt, and can't really remember the sweetness or spice.  The chicken thigh skewer was under-seasoned, and so one bite of the fried chicken and one bite of the chicken thigh would have been perfect!  Unfortunately, each yakitori dish came out separately, so couldn't do that combo.  The best dish of the night would have had to be the pork belly and scallion yakitori skewer!  It vaguely brought me back to that rainy night in Tokyo, where I had shared with my cousin while visiting the peaceful and beautiful country.  Onto the next place to search for yakitori!

Had the single worst experience at Yakitorri Totto. I used to come here a lot. Loved their high-value lunch menu. Tonight, however, the nightmare started with seating. Me and my friend were seated after a few minutes' wait, which was good. After we were pointed to our seats, we took a second to take off our heavy coats, while another party of 2 were taken in and seated next to us at the counter. The waitress, completely ignoring the fact that we came first, went straight to the other party of 2 to take orders. After a prolonged ordering process and serving a bottle of sake, she finally came to us and asked "are you guys ready?" "Just so you know, we were here earlier than those guys, so it would be nice to ask to take our order first," I complained. She started rolling her eyes, clearly not understanding one of the most basic principals of waiting tables. After finally taking our order in a pretty rude manner, she began unleashing her dissatisfaction about my complaint by banging bowls, glasses and dishes on to our table. It was one of the worst experience I've ever had in a Japanese restaurant in New York, the likes you d usually expect a higher standard of service. I'm not sure if I would come again. The food isn't great, especially at the price I'm paying. My friend was also once refused to order food here when she came late to join us for lunch, because clearly "me and my party have drained my time at the table (30 minutes), and we should clear it out for the next party". I am utterly disgusted by the attitude I've been receiving here, and I sure hope it has nothing to do with racism. With such high level of competition in midtown New York, I'd suggest them to upgrade their service as soon as possible to match their reputation.

I had an excellent meal here, and agree with other reviewers that the yakitori and skewered meats are probably the best in the city. You can certainly put together a memorable and delicious meal, and the salmon siokara is unique and wonderful, if you're up for something different. Four stars instead of five for a few reasons: first, that they did not have most of the more interesting meats on the day I visited, which was disappointing, and service/ambiance were so-so. Second, the tuna and avocado salad was a disappointment. I expect Japanese food, especially salads, to be thoughtfully put together and served in small quantities. This was the opposite of that: a very large serving, and for lack of a better word, sloppy. The avocado was of guacamole softness and tasted mashed... with tuna. Because that was an appetizer, it was a negative, off-putting note at the beginning of an otherwise good meal. Go for the skewers, and hope they have some interesting ones when you're there!

Restaurants are definitely pretty good if giving a 4 star is pulling down the average... That said, I think this place is good, but not so much better than the stuff in St Marks or Hagi to warrant the prices. They have lots of stuff you can't find elsewhere, with excellent presentation and good service. But at the same time the atmosphere is a little stuffy and almost too quiet considering we're eating what the Japanese consider drinking food. Again, everything was very good, just not worth the 50-100% mark-up over everywhere else considering that in the end it's just chicken on a stick...
Everything was great. Be sure you order the mochi ice cream. That'll be the perfect ending for your dinner.

I thought my friend's oyako don was ok/meh. Selection offerings are creative but a bit limited. Also, service was friendly but not attentive at least for our table. I'm looking forward to trying Yakitori Taisho at St Marks which looks like it has better offerings including okonomiyaki and takoyaki and $2/skewers ;)

This place is authentic! Everything is great! Better come early for the chicken oysters - they sell out fast!

What a great experience.  Sat at bar to enjoy the grilling experience. Glass between us so no smoke. Everything was excellent especial the spicy nori don. The chicken skin grilled always Amazing.  Will be back again.

Probably the best yakitori outside Japan.

If you can, I recommend you making a reservation or waiting in line 30 min before opening. It gets really crowded but worth it. It adds up because you keep ordering skewers. I started off with the abalone appetizer and zuke--both were really good. As for skewers I tried: shiitake mushrooms--super juicy and good, washu beef--the meat was cooked really well, buta negi, yakioni which is a grilled mochi. I also had the spicy negitori don which is a chicken rice bowl with a semi-cooked egg and the udon. Ended with the custard which was fantastic. Everything was really good and the service was great!

One of my favorite things to do in NYC is trying out new restaurants. My friends took me here during my last trip and I'm glad they did. Hands down the best yakitorri restaurant I have ever been to. Every item we tried was delicious and we must have ordered over 20 things.  Some of the items I remember as standing out were the totto soup, meatball skewer, bacon wrapped mochi, lamb chop, some steak skewer that tasted like wagyu (melted in my mouth), kimchi, and stuffed shishitto pepper. For a party of 4 we each paid about $80 total. For the amount of food we had and beer and a carafe of sake, that is not a bad price for NYC. I will definitely be back.

Food is outstanding although prices could be a tad more reasonable.  I wish they still had the shiso flavored chicken meatball, but hey can't have everything.  Love this place and their food.

Easy to find in a sea of franchise lunch spots nearby. Ambiance was complete intimate and it wasn't too crowded at lunch time. The ramen broth was tasty. I wish there were more ramen options (spicy, miso, etc.) but good overall. Pretty inexpensive combo with salad and soup.

Service fast and pleasant, highly recommend

There's a wide selection of items from chicken neck to chicken tail and everything in between, as well as some yummy non-yakitori options such as smelt and grilled eggplant. Definitely come when you're hungry.

the yakitori here is so delicious, specially with some sake and beer to cleanse your palate with. Probably one of the best yakitori places I've been to in nyc. Start off with a cold dish by ordering the salmon siokara and then work your way onto the grilled meats, try as many different ones as you can. I liked all the chicken and beef ones. Their amakara chicken is delicious too.

I gave it 4 stars but we didn't eat there. It was Monday night at 8p & we couldn't get a seat & was told it was an hour wait! The place is small, REAL small, so make a reservation.

The waiter did not show simulated enthusiasm but he is definitely nice and makes people comfortable. The food is as good as expected but not surprisingly delicious. It is a great place to have a dinner gathering with friends.

Disappointing. Came for dinner and had the worst service ever. Would ask a waitress a question and she wouldn't directly answer it and wander off and disappear for the next 30 minutes not even following up.

We went here because of the reviews amd they did not disappoint. The food was delicious and a great price. We enjoyed everything we ordered and it was nice getting so much variety. The hostess and wait staff were excellent. This was a real treat and am so glad we found this place. Will be back next time in NYC.
This place definitely has the best Japanese skewers in the city. Been there 50+ times with fei and keep going back till now.

If you're up on the Upper West side, this is the place to go to for Yaketori. Make a reservation during peak hours.

I've been here several times and I think the food is good. They always have long lines and that's fine because their food is good. But their service is really bad. When I step into the door they said do you think you can finish before 7? We said yes. When we get seated, the waitress said did not ask for any drinks and just said you last order should be at 6:30. We didn't get it first so asked again. She repeated with her cold face. We then ask so what's the time now. She showed her watch right in front of our face with an impatient look and looked the other way. That's enough for me. If you don't mind awful service, you can go. But to be honest, manhattan has a lot of comparable good Japanese places. They are not the only one. So be smart, make your choices.

It was late and we wanted something good to eat, a quick yelp search led us to this spot, only a couple blocks from our hotel. We waited like 15 mins to sit at the bar, ordered a bunch of stuff, but the most memorable was the wings, meatball, and beef galbi, and the negi tori don was very good.

Bad service, try explaining things to them and you'll wanna pull your hair out too. they speak english but cant comprehend?  my co worker and i wanted separate receipts not split the bill. Not accommodating at all, i hope they hire a manager soon.

This place is really good.Its a small restaurant and is always packed. It reminded my husband and I of our favorite place to eat in Japan. The portions are small and you need to order a lot in order to get full. One order of chicken wings is one chicken wing. Everything we ordered was good with the exception of the udon I  ordered which was just ok. I probably shouldn't have ordered udon at a yakitori restaurant. The bacon wrapped asparagus stood out as being excellent as well pork belly and kobe beef tongue. The mushrooms were good as well as the chicken wings. The mochi ice cream was also really good. My husband really like everything he ordered. The staff is nice. If you don't have a reservation be prepared for a long wait. The food is slow bc I think there is just one or two guys cooking everything.

Horrible service. Rude people. They literally rush you out before you even finish your food/drinks. Never coming here again.

We had 6 of us who came here late night after we watched Wicked. It looked like a neat spot and different.  So we waited for a table.  When we finally got seated, the waitress took our order and we were excited and even more hungry. Then she came back telling us about their policy.  We did not know there was a mandatory $20 per customer order policy per person.  we had 6 of us and we wanted to share everything, but some didnt want to order 20 dollars worth of food each.  I think this is BS for not telling us before we ordered or sat down, like how are we suppose to know and they didnt even want to make an exception for a large group like us.  I don't recall if there was a sign, but we were like EF this and we walked out.

If there is one thing you need to do before you hit this place, is that you really need make a reservation, like two days ahead. We got there like 5:50, just 20mins after it's opening, and we had to wait for almost an hour. The food just higher then our expectation. The chicken meatball/skins,rice ball with soya souce, tails, soft knee bones are all very juicy and crispy. We also ordered the monk fish liver and it turned out quite tasty.
Reasonable price and not bad taste. But just wonder why I didn't see many dishes on Yelp on the menu? Are there different menus for lunch and dinner?

Probably this is a bit biased but as this is my first meal of the day, this is the most tasty grilled Japanese food I have ever had in my life. We tried chicken wings, skins, heart, Oyster, lamp chop, beef, and finised all within minutes. The almond tofu was remarkable as well, not too sweet, though the raspberry was freezing lol. In a sense, everything was 100% good, so please give a try by any chance:)
Called to ask about reservations. The hostess seemed so rude on the phone. If that's the first service impression this restaurant creates, then they must not need more patrons.

The food here is excellent but definitely on the pricer-end since each yakitori comes with one skewer of food. The restaurant itself is a little cramped and we sat at the bar area (after giving our phone number to wait approx 30 mins). All of the food was brought out as it was finished being cooked so it was fresh and hot. I was still a little hungry after the meal but didn't want to spend more on the food. Overall a good experience, but wish the portions were larger.

To be honest the decor is lovely, just a bit off the main street of boardway and Columbus Circle, on a small spot on the second floor.  It's a small gem one would or could miss .  Their food is decent however there is a minimum of $20. Easily their meals can equal that price but I dislike how it's mandatory.  Their service was nice and I was very please at the presentation of food.  Their corquette was one of the better ones I've had,  and their silver fish Don is very well done.  I personally loved the dessert choice of green tea argumon (spelled that wrong ) but it is very pleasant mix of red beans, mochi, and ice cream and then you would drizzle hot matcha green tea onto it.  Very well done. It does get pricy because each sweker is 2 to 3 bucks and their aren't many entrées to pick from.  So know that,  But overall I can say the food is great,  the service was excellent but I would not go there unless I had extra money and going with someone.
Great food, great service and great overall experience!  Sit at the Yakitori bar to watch them prepare and cook.  Gyoza were the best I've ever had...beat Japan by far!

What really impressed me was the broth for their ramen. It was extremely rich, complex and full of flavors. The pork belly was also very well cooked, as both of the texture and flavors grabbed my attention. Their ramen was outstanding.
