Best yakitori-ya in Manhattan (but also depending on who the chef is).  Most of the time, the yakitori is perfectly cooked, but on rare occasions, you get a new or young chef who over-cooks and serves burnt sticks.  Other than that, pretty consistently good.  The annoying thing is the wait.  Thank goodness I live close by I can put my name down and wait at home.

went here based on yelp reviews. i'm from Boston, so i'm use to pretty expensive places, but the amount of money i paid here i got so little food. quality is good, portion is lacking, be prepared to spend $30+/person to get full

It's like Japanese tapas.  Very unique Japanese food eating experience for me...not having gone to Japan before, that is.  We ordered a whole bunch of random things and there wasn't one that failed to surprise and please the palate.

The food is simply amazing! The wait is usually quite long, but at least they will give you a call when your table is ready so you can walk around the area while waiting. I LOVED every 'kabob' they made. But my favorite are the chicken tails and scallops. So sad that they only allow one chicken tail per customer because it's so limited. Otherwise I would have ordered five more! Yes, the price is on the more expensive side, but I thought it was worth it. This place would've received a five stars from me if they allowed me to order as many chicken tails as I want :)
Very delicious, have a chance to taste many different dishes. Reservation should be made in advance.

Arrived when they opened for dinner and seated in front of the open kitchen which is fun to watch the cooking.  Tried quite a few items.  Favorites were avocado with salmon/roe, the lamb chop and the asparagus/bacon.  Least favorites were skirt steak (tough) and duck (gamey).  Wife had the seasonal sake (very good) and I had beer.  Since we were just ordering skewers the tab easily goes past the $20 minimum.  We didn't experience anything negative with any of the staff.  Service was pleasant and prompt and had no issues.
Pretty authentic Janapese, Recommend the organic chicken screwer, anchovy salad, and tuna sashimi.

Great for a kind of Japanese food you don't eat often in US. Long wait, get there when they open, or late in the evening. Great to sit at the counter and watch your meal grill. Tight quarters. Friendly.

I came here on 8/18/15.  The food was very good, the Saki was very nice also.  I like unfiltered Saki and they had several available.  We sat at the bar so watch them cook everything.  It's much easier to see what looks the best and what I could see myself skipping.  I started with Shirauo Kara-age, it was so light and delicious.  I then had Agedashi Tofu, it was subtle and flavorful at the same time, with the lightest texture.  I then moved on to Tori Dango (chicken meatballs with rice on the outside), they were simply delicious with the best sauce on the side.  I finally finished with Kuruma Ebi (prawn) and finally with Ikura Don (salmon roe over rice) with just a touch of soy it was the perfect ending.  It's not the quietest place, the employees yell across the restaurant often, but the food is very good overall.  You will sit and eat for a long time here.  I'd coming back again for more.
most items were grilled well.  big fan of their grilled pork belly, which made it to my blog.  relatively cheap.

Why you must unzip files on their site to see the menu (there ain't much else on the site, either) is beyond me, but that's besides the point once you ascend into the perennially jam-packed space. I was about to call to confirm our rez the night of when they called to do so (a bit late IMO); you also can't make a reservation via message/e-submission/before 5pm (15 minutes late & you lose your spot, no exceptions). Reading that David Chang is a regular AFTER going made me feel a tad proud of myself, jussayin'. The sake was solid, coming from a non-enthusiast, and the plum wine was damn good. The wait service is mediocre at best, but the chefs do the damn THANG right in front of you. Push aside all the earthenware, plates, utensils, and sauces (not forgetting to use them all at one point of another) and dig the hell in. We lingered right until they kick you out (which they do, don'tchu ever forget), enjoying a nice spread of their treats -- in a new-age twist, veggies & fish for me & meat for the lady. It adds up. You won't care. It's that good.

food was good but way overpriced. it is okay to be expensive if the portion is at least decent. a stick with three less than 2cm x 2cm cubes of beef costs $7. really only one stick! unheard-of!  it is just way too expensive. Additionally, the waitress was mean and lack of patient. Plus, the place is extremely small. it does not have an atmosphere of an izakaya at all. not fun plus unpleasant service. not going back.

Dim-lit room, smoke rising in the air, grill guys sitting around rotating sticks.   Reminds me of getting my yakitori in Japan.  I can sit here all day, load up that little jar with empty skewers, and drink sake.  Can definitely get busy so early is better.  Wish we had a place like this in Chitown.
This place serves little skewers of grilled meat with teriyaki sauce. If that's your thing then go here.

Really great place for yakitori. The interiors are serene and refined. Sit at the bar and watch the master chefs at work. The specials are written in Japanese on wooden plaques hanging on the kitchen wall, which are turned when the item is sold out. All of this make the place so authentic. The yakitori is superlative, and remember to choose whether you want the skewers grilled with salt or sauce (I recommend sauce). If you are feeling adventurous, try the chicken cartilage or other innards. If not, get the beef, chicken, or other vegetables. The wait can be insane, so plan accordingly.

It's a bit pricey here, but it was really good! Tasty food, good service. Our waitress was very nice, and we were greeted at the door. The food took a little bit to come out, but it was worth the wait.

Second time we've been here.  The first time experience was great, leaving us with a longing to come back.  Second time was just alright.  The experience seem very rushed the second time and as the result, some of the meats were not cooked very properly.  2 dishes that come to mind that were big disappointments are: cream cheese wontons/egg rolls and Japanese fried chicken.  The yakitori dishes didn't have seasonings/flavor to them.  In addition, it was pretty costly.  I kept thinking about the late night pizza we were going to eat throughout the entire meal.  Pretty disappointing. Probably will not be back.

I'm salivating just thinking about this place. The long wait is WELL worth it! Sitting at the bar won't cut your waiting time all that much but go take a walk around the neighborhood and work up your appetite coz there are plenty goodies on the menu to fill up your belly. No-brainer orders at Totto include the chicken soft knee bone (which is limited so make sure you request it as soon as you sit down), beef tongue (which is grilled to perfection!), chicken meat ball with brown sauce, and the tofu with miso sauce. If you're carb-a-holic, then order the hot udon. Its very plain. Just a simple broth with seaweed, a few slices of shitake and slippery udon noodles but I think its elegant and delicious. To end this dinner experience perfectly, order their green tea pudding!

This restaurant is da bomb!! No, I'm not exaggerating! I've brought friends over there and they all loved the place. This is the second time I've been there and the quality of the food is still excellent. Besides the bbq skewers, I also recommend the salad(sorry, I forgot the name). Make sure to call for reservation ahead of time. If I'm going back to N.Y.(hopefully sometime next yr), I'll definitely make a reservation at Yakitori Totto.
Less than an hour wait on Friday night and 20 minutes on weekdays. Awesome Japanese grill. Love it.
No comment

DELICIOUS!  Particularly loved the chicken thigh & onion and the lamb chop.  Their vegetables were delicious too - really well seasoned and everything was very flavorful and perfectly cooked.  Awesome experience.

This restaurant opens at 5:30 and there were 3 of us that tried to walk in at 6. We were told an hour wait when the restaurant wasn't at all full. I'd tried to call all day for a reservation and no one answered the phone. As another reviewer wrote they obviously have a following and are not concerned with gaining new customers. I don't care how good the food is, I won't be back.

Excellent Yakitori.  Juicy, fresh chicken, short ribs, beef.   Smallish restaurant, but if you get there early for lunch it will be open for seating.  Tried the rice, chicken, egg bowl, but I would pass on that next time.  Just ordinary.  The Yakitori is what matters and it is fantastic.  Try 6-8 for a nice lunch size....
Awesome sushi and sashimi! So fresh and delicious. Very decadent and the place had a great atmosphere. I most enjoyed it here.

The best Japanese yakitori restaurant in New York!  And my Japanese friends agree.  The restaurant is small, and they do not take reservations from 7-9pm, but they can put your name on the waiting list and call you when your table is ready.
Definietly want to make a reservation, this place is super crowded but the BBQ is really good!

The food here is good but pricey. This wouldn't be a bad thing if you could dine at your own pace and enjoy the meal. I've been here several times and every time I go here I feel like I'm being rushed out. I will not go back here.
fun place and near midtown theatres; i always make it a point to go here and it never fails...but make a reservation

I would give this place 5 stars just for the food but because the wait is so long and the staff not too friendly, I took off 2 stars. We go to the one on the east side because the wait is much shorter there (I think it's called Tory's).

I actually FINALLY signed up for yelp because of this place.  A lot of my friends have never been here but I always recommend! soooo cute and sooo much character, SIT AT THE BAR SO YOU CAN WATCH THEM COOK! Amazing!

The portion is so small whatever you order.  Almost everything is overpriced and the quality of the food is just ok.  You might wanna feel like trying this place if you've never been here, but you are most likely gonna be disappointed.  Also there is minimum order of $20/person.
hands down! chicken lovers must go!!!!!!! nothing but amazing food!  you wont make a poor choice with anything!
No comment

I hesitated to do this review only because writing about it leaves me drooling and craving for more.   If there's one great culinary lesson I have learned from NYC, it is that there is so much more to Japanese food than sushi, udon, and tempura.   I first learned this lesson at awesome O-Taisho which I'm devoted to but a friend convinced me tonight to check out Y. Toto.  It's on the second floor up a long flight of stairs but well worth the walk.  Juicy kobee beef tongue, a skewer of cow hearts, skin ... that's right skin on a skewer (I don't know if it was chicken skin or the skin of their competition), awesome skirt steak ...mmm...  Everything was deserving of the term "delicacy." Damn I want more! Even their soup and rice porridge with chicken and egg left me ecstatic.  Off the hook, high quality, authentic Japanese food (and very cute waittresses) makes this Y. toto worth the price.  My only complaint was that the portions are pretty small but I have the appetite of a race horse on steroids.

I just came back from eating here.  I also agree with the rest of the reviewers that the service here is bad.  My friend and I went after it opened 15 mins and the place with not full at all.  We were sitted near the door at the bar. I ask the hostress if it ok if we sit at the table. She said it was reserved.  I was ok with that and ask if we could sit futher down the bar where it wasn't that cramp.  She said those were reserved as well. I know that was a lie, she was just too lazy to move our menu.  During all that time when we were there, no body came in to sit at the tables. I think I read somewhere that they don't even take reservations. To top it all off they forgot one of the dish we order and ask if we still want it. We both said, "no".  I felt we were rushed out of the restaurant and never ask  if we want dessert.  This will be the last time we come back here. The food wasn't the greatest and not worth it for rude service.  My friend was still hungry afterwards so the portions are small for a grand total of $65 dollars. We didn't even order drinks.  Bad service+ small expensive portions= unhappy customers.   Not worth it at all.

Haven't been here since their first year open, but I am thrilled to see that they are still as amazing. Must try dishes are the tsukune (chicken meatball) with sweet sauce, the sticky rice balls filled with chicken meatball, Harumi (skirt steak) yakitori, seaweed salad and the house made mochi ice cream. Everything is seasoned perfectly when it arrives, so it calls for effortless enjoyment. I wanted to order more tsukune skewers for myself because one was barely enough (since it's my favorite yakitori). So good esp. when a bit charred. The mochi is so soft yet holds up well and isn't your supermarket freezer mochi. Yum. Their fried chicken (Jidori karaage) is great, but they serve it with the bone-in. A little hard to eat but worth the effort if you like Japanese fried chicken. Also, the fried shrimp balls are greasy but crunchy (from the shrimp, not from the actual frying) and go great with the ground ginger condiment they serve. Fun social environment with good attentive service.

i came here on a Friday night after unsuccessfully trying for several weeks to get a reservation. they only take reservations from 5 to 7pm after 7 its first come first served. i recommend if you want to have dinner here aether making a reservation a few weeks in advance or getting there a few hours before you want to have dinner because the wait can be very long. my boyfriend and i had a 7pm reservation but arrived about 15 minutes late, the hostess was very nice and kept the table for us. We sat by the bar area which is great because you get to see the cooks preparing your Yakitori. The food was delicious with lots of flavor, we ordered about 5 different Yakitori dishes my favorites were the chicken skin and the asparagus bacon. we also ordered a rice dish and the dumplings, everything was excellent and our waiter was very friendly and gave us great recommendations. my only complaint is that their desserts suck! but the food made up for it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Service, food and drinks were amazing!! I went for my birthday for a quick drink and from the moment i walked in, the staff was welcoming and attentive. The guacamole was delicious, the spicy pineapple was on point (I had 2!!) and when I left they showed up with a birthday card with such kinds words. I will definitely be returning!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

For a vegan restaurant, it's pretty good. The whole fake meat thing isn't really my jam, but I thought the chicken tacos were decent. The carnitas didn't really taste like carnitas, but the chorizo on the nachos was great. The guacamole & rice were fantastic, and the drinks were great as well. Service was super friendly and the restaurant itself is really cute. Probably wouldn't go back, as I didn't think many of the dishes were a hit, but worth a try!
No comment

Vegan food that taste real?! Wow. I'm a fan! Service is fine. Ambiance isn't anything special, but these dishes?! Obsessed!!! Love the quesadilla & tacos burritos are also on point; honestly everything on this menu is delish & with a try!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is one of my favorite restaurants in all of NYC. Specifically the Williamsburg location because it's big and beautiful and near the water. I'm not vegan, but this vegan restaurant recurs in my dreams. The cocktails are excellent as well. Try one of the burritos if you've got a bigger appetite. If you're feeling lighter, the verde enchiladas are very refreshing. Vegan or not, come for good vibes and peak deliciousness.
No comment
No comment
No comment

stopped in here a couple nights ago & haven't stopped thinking about the cafe de olla cocktail. It's the most perfect take on an espresso martini I've had. Perfectly balanced (I got mine with tequila) and not too overpowering. The nachos were also fantastic. Our server was lovely. And the inside of the restaurant is so cute. Perfect place for a date or somewhere to catch up with a friend. I'll be dreaming about the espresso martini until I return again. Thank you!

just want to say that the place is well located in Williamsburg brooklyn. Corner location. I got tricked by my friend to this restaurant. She is vegan. The food is amazing and very tasty. Loved the nachos. I did not see a difference to meat tacos. they were great. The street corn was also so tasty. like wow tasty. The empanada was very tasty but a bit overpriced. I usually go to restaurants for their food and drinks.  this place food was amazing, drinks were just ok , very tasty but very weak on alcohol. Also the drink portion was very small compared to other places I have visited. Glasses are not full of the cocktail and they also out a huge square  ice cube. This  is pretty much half of the drink  . If u go for the food  its amazing. drinks are weak

I was so excited to find that this vegan restaurant was so close to where I was staying in Williamsburg! My family and I ordered the nachos, enchiladas mole, enchiladas Verdes, quesadilla, kale pancakes, sangria, and spicy margarita. Of all the dishes, my favorites were the appetizer nachos and my nephew's kale pancakes! The nachos had so many sauces and toppings-- they was sooo flavorful and delicious. Everyone working here was so nice and accommodating as well. I highly highly recommend checking this place out if you have the opportunity!
No comment
No comment

Check this place out! The nachos alone are a reason to go. Loved the non-alcoholic beer options and I was impressed by all of the entrees I saw. The inside, including bathroom, was super clean and the patio was incredible. Their signage was also really cute. I would definitely go back if I was in the area!
No comment

Painful review to be writing :( One time I had ordered the burrito for takeaway, and it was quite good! I was so impressed with the mock chorizo inside, and the sauce on top was so flavorful. However, this time, my experience through Ubereats was pretty disappointing. I ordered the Coconut Queso Enchilada - it looked like it was going to be delicious, however the cheese is just not perfected (too gooey + retains way too much of the coconut flavoring, that overpowers the whole thing). The mushroom filling also felt a bit undercooked. I also ordered their birria tacos (and was so excited to try it!) - it was a creative dish and I was impressed with how much they stuffed in. While the broth was quite good, the tacos itself were too floppy + just not that impressive. I'm really rooting for Jajaja (i really am!), but I don't think I'll head back in a bit (especially not for delivery).

My family really enjoyed this place, there was literally something for everyone. I'm gluten free and they had lots of options to pick from. I had the watermelon gazpacho and the Gordita- yum! Others in our party had the Chorizo burrito and the enchiladas verde. Atmosphere was nice and the bathrooms were good. Highly recommend next time you're in Williamsburg.
No comment
Really cute lunch or date night spot. The sweet potato tacos, coconut quesadillas, and churros are all outstanding. I was impressed. Service is great I have no complaints. Definitely revisiting.
The menu didn't disclose it was only VEGAN, food wasn't the best and the drinks were subpar.
Loaded nachos are amazing and can be made gluten free! Tacos are also really good. Didn't get pics I ate them too fast lol. They come in pairs. Not super filling so I recommend sides.
No comment

Ordered delivery and had a good experience. Sadly they didn't have my favorite item, the guac burger, available for delivery, so I tried the taco tazon bowl instead. Chorizo burrito was also great as always. Hope they add the guac burger to the delivery platform!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: The nachos are out of this world! I couldn't stop smiling while eating them! I don't know what they put in this dish but it is some of the best nachos I've ever had! And they're VEGAN! Im not vegan but this place gets me in the door! So good and tasty! Cute and welcoming inside as well!

Great drinks and food. Mushroom quesadilla was the unexpected fav. Heart of palm ceviche w/ plantain chips (fresh, hot!) and birra tacos also super delicious. Frozen marg sangria swirl is a must! Caring staff.
No comment

Lovely evening eating outside with city views, Antony was super helpful with making selections while we enjoyed our excellent cocktails! (Spicy Sandía is amazing!) The Sikil Pak makes a great start and the pollo fresco burrito was bangin'.
No comment
No comment

This place was very cozy and perfect for a birthday! The service was excellent and they accommodated all food/drink requests and allergies really well. I was surprised to enjoy their all-vegan selection!

This place is great. Even as a meat eater, but this place is still different if your looking for exact replica. I had the soup of the day which was really good forgot what was it but it was like a spicy potato leek like soup to me. The Mexican street corn was amazing roasted and flavored without the regular mayo and cheese. The palm heart ceviche is refreshing. The jackfruit tamale was ok but I prefer old school tamales. Now the tacos, Spicy Birria has spice flavoring but missing fat and umami, but comparing with reg birria is apples and oranges. The Buffalo blossom tacos was a hit for me tasty with the little crunchy cauliflower nuggets and salsa yum. Didn't try the Rainbow chard bowl. Dessert- I would come back just even for the dessert, since it doesn't leave me with a heavy food coma.
i LOVE this place! such delicious food - the nachos and barbacoa tacos are to die for! not too pricey and the ambience is great. also loved the almond horchata - i'll definitely be back!

For my sister's birthday (who is dairy-free) we ordered the following dishes for the group to share: nachos, gorditas, verde enchilada, chorizo burrito, coconut quesadilla, chipotle sweet potato tacos, buffalo flower tacos, and the BEST churros I've ever had! Everyone was really happy with all of the food and the multitude of vegan options made ordering very easy. We wish we had asked that they include plasticware (we were staying in a hotel) but other than that it was great! (visited 1/9/22)
Delicious and flavorful food especially the pancakes and quesadilla. Juan was a great server!

The food here was amazing. As a fellow vegetarian, this place did not disappoint. The flavor and texture of everything were amazing!! Our server Juancho was the nicest server ever!! Super attentive and gave so many amazing recommendations. Will definitely come back again!!
No comment

I have been to Jajaja 3 times and have normally really enjoyed my meals! Most recently I went to the Williamsburg location and decided to try their kale bowl. It is described as having quinoa, avocado, mango, coconut strips, and massages kale. When getting the bowl I was disappointed to hardly have any toppings, the mango was rock hard and the kale was not even cut or properly massager. Disappointed to say the least, especially when I compared it to my friend who tried a different bowl from their menu with a wonderful presentation.
No comment
WOW! Absolutely amazing service and food. The nachos were so good, with so many toppings and layered ugh so delicious! Our server, Mitchell, was an dream! So kind and attentive. Will 100000% be back!
Great food I love the buffalo tacos and churros. Everything is flavorful and packed nicely for delivery.
Excellent food, great vibes! Loved the varieties of hot sauce. The tacos were creative and fresh tasting.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Great food. You cant even tell its not meat. I am always happy eating here. I like to bring my meat eating friends they are always initially disappointed then they eat and are always surprised at how tasty the food is.
No comment

I ordered a to go order and once I arrived I decided I wanted to dine in after a long drive /walk to get there. They acted as though it was a completely impossible request. Not to mention the  vibe that I picked up from several of the employees. The host was very nice , however the waiter was not , and seemed completely confused as to how to accommodate someone who would like to dine in. It's not exactly an impossible task to accomplish. Sad that we still deal with seemingly racist interactions in 2022, in such a "progressive" neighborhood. Customer service is a lost art.
I've been getting Jajaja for 2 years now and it never disappoints. Such good vegan Mexican food!!
$15 house margarita??  Bad hip hop blasting. Customers watching soccer games on their phones at full volume. Appropriately named Jajaja (hahaha).

I've been coming to Jajaja for years now, first at their lower east side location which was cute dark and cozy. The food is always great (you can't go wrong with the nachos, ever). Staff is always kind and service quick. Will continue to keep this place in rotation and HOPE for an LA location soon!
Amazing food and cute ambiance. Totally worth any wait time and food comes really quickly.
Amazing vegan food! Our server was Juan and he was so friendly! Constantly checked on us and made sure we were good.
Fantastic place. Wouldn't even guess it's vegan; the food is so delicious. The drinks and vibes are also on point. Would highly recommend for any evening.
The food, drinks and the overall atmosphere was amazing!! Pedro was amazing and very attentive. If you're in the area definitely check it out! :)
The drinks and food were delicious and the view of the city from the outdoor patio was amazing!!

Had my birthday dinner here with a large group and had the absolute best experience ever. We were so well taken care of, the food was fantastic and so were the drinks. The staff absolutely wined and dined us I wish I caught my waitresses name but she was a star! Thank you jajaja's for making my birthday special!

Stumbled on this place, went in to use the restroom and the decor was so inviting we stayed for a drink and a bite to eat.  I didn't even realize the menu was plant based until I was 1/2 way through my meal and someone pointed it out. Everything on the menu was enticing. Friendly and efficient service, great food, fantastic drinks. I'll go back.
Very delicious. Got the chorizo burrito, so glad I did. Got the margarita, pretty strong. Nachos soo good as well. Fast service & nice workers. Overall great.

Stopped by with my vegan daughter (I'm not vegan) for pick up. The food was DELICIOUS! Seriously didn't even taste vegan! Everything was perfect... took about an hour to prepare but it was worth the wait. Tacos were spicy but not too much, guacamole had pumpkin seeds, different from what I've ever had, a welcomed, savory flavor. My daughter had the verde enchiladas. Made with jackfruit... but they were so delicious she actually stopped eating to ask me "is this really vegan?"  We will definitely go back!

Fabulous vegan Mexican spot near Domino Park. It was a little weird to get to since the food hall was closed due to COVID but the workers were friendly and the tacos were amazing. We walked to the water to eat and it was really enjoyable. I would order from them again and would love to see the food hall in full force.

I've been to the LES restaurant location before and was excited to see that there was a spot in Williamsburg.  This is located in the N 3rd Marketplace with other food vendors.  I'm not vegan but am always down to try new things.  At the LES location all I tried were the nachos...ordered those, the chorizo and the mushroom tacos (2 tacos for $8).  Nachos were huge, good for 2-3 people to share ($13 + $3 for guac).  Tacos were a lot bigger than she said - she said they were small.  When they came out they were big and we had ordered too much food!  They were also pretty messy to eat.  Love the two sauces, minus the weird runny charcoal sauce.  Overall great if you're a vegan, but on the pricier side for tacos - I know a better and cheaper spot around the corner.  I think I would only come back here for the nachos..

Delicious restaurants all three locations! Customer service was beyond amazing today. Uber eats cancelled my order and they were closing, the staff was kind enough to wait a few extra minutes for a delivery partner. So small but so kind! Will be in to eat all week now. Thanks!

Very tasty buffalo flower tacos!! Plus they are priced quite well for the market. Be prepared with lots of napkins. The gauc is amazing, but just a bit on the pricey site for quantity. So many options here plus you've got couches and a great hanging out area where you can dine and stay a little longer for a few drinks.

This place was great when they initially opened in Williamsburg, but has gone down a lot recently. The portions are half the size as before and the quality is on par with my terrible cooking. Not ordering from here again.
No comment

I'm a nurse in New York City. I just worked a 12 hour shift, and was very excited to come home and order JaJaJa. I ordered via seamless at 750 Pm. I could see, via Seamless, that my deliver guy arrived at 815 pm to the restaurant. Then, all of a sudden, JaJaJa canceled the order on me. It was not late. It was not a big order. And it was 20 minutes past the time I originally ordered. I would understand if you canceled right away because you weren't taking anymore orders, but you canceled 20 minutes after the fact. I'm very disappointed.
Jajaja chipotle fish tacos are to die for!! Cooked to perfection and topped with the most juiciest red onion.

Yum!! I ordered the "fish" tacos and elotes for dinner. Because it was Cinco de Mayo, they threw in a complimentary Topo Chico and chips and salsa! The tacos were delicious, and the delivery was fast. I can't wait to order again!
Some of the best vegan tacos I've ever had. Had the buffalo cauliflower and fish tacos. Wow

Great place for takeout vegan food. Was great to have it in the neighborhood! I have the nachos and burrito really good. I visited the their restaurant a few weeks ago had an amazing time. Cant recommend it to enough people.

Best Mexican food we have ever had - by far. We ordered delivery one night and loved it so much we went and ate their the next day. The fact that it is vegan is even better. We have had amazing burritos, nachos and even their kale salad is awesome. Try it - so super awesome.

BLAND BLAND BLAND BLAND BLAND! OVER PRICED BLAND FOOD! Don't waste your time or money here. The burritos have zero flavor and they are over priced.. don't disrespect your tastebuds. Not to mention nobody here knows how to wrap a burrito.. it just falls apart.. and WHY is everything cooked in CANOLA OIL!? who cooks with that poision anymore? It's 2019.. stop being cheap.

My god this place is great. I don't even eat vegan, and I've come here three days in a row with my wife. The food is prepared quickly, and it has tasted excellent each time. I had the burrito with carnitas, burrito with chorizo, and both times they rocked. Their nachos are delicious, their pupusas are also delish. Their habanera sauce made me sweat, and my wife says she could drink their mild charcoal sauce. Fantastic place, will continue to come here over and over.

Most of the food we ordered was good.  We ordered deviled eggs after being told that you received 6 eggs.  When the plate came there were only 4 eggs which was not worth $9 as you are really only getting 2 full eggs.  That got sent back and was taken off our bill.  My friend didn't care for the baked beans as they were flavorless.  The pulled pork, mac and cheese, and cornbread were all good.  Yes the cornbread was small but they were like mini corn muffins and we got 7 of them.  I'm still not sure what the difference between the pork sandwich and the pork platter is and what more you get for the platter.  The sandwich was $18 and platter was $24.  We were told they both come with coleslaw and pickles.  Not sure why you'd pay the extra $6 for the same items.  The menu did not mention that we would receive fries with the sandwich and I wouldn't have ordered the mac and cheese had I known that.  They do add a surcharge when paying with credit card so we paid cash.  The waitress took the check and was gone for a bit before coming back to ask if we wanted our change.  They should never assume that the difference is their tip.  Then when we received our change what we got back was based on credit card amount so that had to be corrected.  I don't think I'll be back.  There are other BBQ places that are just as good and cost about half the price, and I end up with leftovers.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Hands down best barbecue beef ribs I've ever had. My server was also amazing me and my wife will be back. Thank you boots and bones for coming to JC.

Exactly what you would expect from the new BBQ place in town.... Extremely dry and tasteless brisket on top of a piece of white bread. Do not recommend. Please leave the neighborhood to make room for an actual good restaurant.

The food was good. My boyfriend and I got the deviled eggs, the Carolina caviar, and the Buffalo wings to start and i got the dirty cowgirl cocktail and my bf got The Boot. They were good but not mind blowing. Then came our entrees which were the pork spare ribs and the beef ribs. Both were tasty but lacking in sauce. Overall, food was good but not outstanding. Service was also okay, when they came to attend us they were kind and polite but they rarely came and they took ages to get us the check. It seemed that the servers were spread pretty thin so maybe it could be chalked up to the fact that we are here before the grand opening. Lastly, the ambiance was fun and lively and I enjoyed the restaurant vibes themselves. I feel that this place is good if you're looking to spend some money on some okay barbecue but it's definitely not top tier when it comes to the food which is the most important aspect in my opinion. There is definitely room to improve and I hope they do so that maybe I can add a start or two if I come back.

OK, for a spot that JUST opened, and knowing the investment in time that BBQ takes, we were super impressed with this SOFT opening at Boots n Bones. First of all it smelled great when we walked in & we were hungry. So...after speaking with the owner & finding that their 'official' opening is early April with the full menu...there's a lot to look forward to. We preferred the St Louis ribs but our pal who got smoked beef ribs like his better. Deviled eggs were delish, mac & cheese was the bomb. Good drinks and super nice staff *also* considering they are new. Wings were also very good. Might have given 4 stars but went for 5, just for effort and the quality of the food so far. Getting excited for a return visit next month to check out the full menu & that mysterious bar downstairs. (Note - we used to go to Blue Smoke all of the time, ate it everytime we were at Jazz Standard -- this chef is no slouch, he is kind of a big deal to be in JC.) We will be back!
Really over-priced for almost no food on each plate. Almost no meat on their flavorless, overcooked ribs. Poor meat quality. Far better options in the area.

I was really excited about going here but to be honest, I was quite disappointed. I paid $16 for a drink but it seemed really weak and I felt like I paid $16 for a sweet fruit drink. I honestly question whether there was any alcohol in it. We ordered cornbread which was good but nothing special. Same with the mac n cheese - it was good but nothing special. I was also irritated that they added a credit card surcharge. I understand why certain businesses do that but there are other restaurants in the neighborhood that are owned by a families (not restaurant groups) and they don't add a surcharge. If they're going to do that, they should let customers know by printing a message on the menu and on their website. For me, the only plus was the location and the music. However, I feel like you can walk less than 1 minute down Newark Avenue and get better food and get your money's worth and not have to pay a credit card surcharge.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This new market location opened up recently and has some really delicious looking food spots. there is a lot of seating areas and public restrooms if needed. they have a pizza spot, a bar, a taco spot, a burrito spot, some sushi and other delicious looking food spots. It is a nice spot to come rest after work if needed.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Ddobar was my favorite place here! It has really unique flavors and it felt like an elevated version of things I've had before. The bathrooms at Olly Olly market are really nice and clean as well. I think Olly Olly market has the potential to be a better and more popping dining destination than Chelsea Marker

I've only been to Forsyth fire escape here but I'm obsessed with that place and I'm glad they have a residency. There's definitely other restaurants here that I'd also like to check out! I wish it was open later or on the weekend because it's hard to make work with my work schedule.
No comment
Great new market in the starret building I. Chelsea. They have a bunch of good food options my favorite is the taco place but can't go wrong with any of the options

Obsessed with this hidden gem! Great location with so many food options inside. Plenty of seating in a very clean building and cute vibes all around. Looking forward to returning to try new stalls and see what other restaurants they add inside!

Shamckwich// best chopped cheese in town. Great service because it was friendly and quick. I will recommend to my friends. P.S they use mikes hot honey which is a home run! The vibe is IT. They are catering to the people who are nostalgic but want an elevated touch. It's Waygu for goodness sake *chefs kiss* . Enjoy the big boy for two .

Went here with a party of six. As soon as we entered, we were immediately offered a table. Our server was good- He is an expert at the menu and selling us--no kidding. We had no idea what dishes would be appropriate for the occasion, but he simply went to buy some samples and explained which ones were which, as well as which ones he loved and recommended. Although it's not our first time doing Korean barbecue, it is our first time here, and when we informed him of this, he helped us incredibly by making food suggestions and by keeping a close check on us so we could report on the cuisine. I appreciate the opportunity!

No comment
This restaurant is definitely 5 star worthy and one of the best bbq houses I've been to. The service is friendly and the food is as good as it gets. You won't be disappointed

Atti is a really great Korean bbq restaurant that just hit the scene. We had a group of 7 and ordered various meats and side dishes. We allowed the server who is also part of management to take over for us. He didn't disappoint. Superb cuts that melt in your mouth. Side dishes were awesome. Very good stews.

My friend brought us here on the recommendation of one of her other friends. The barbeque was quite good, and the ambiance is nice, but the ordering minimums are kind of odd, and it was a little expensive. For a group of five, it was explained to us that the minimum was 2 x the pre fixe menu, plus 3 a la carte meats. We chose the three cheaper ones. We each spent $75 after tax and tip. The waiter was also really weird about giving us a few more leaves of lettuce. They did comp us some shrimp cocktail (which wasn't too tasty or fresh, but a nice touch), though!

Great addition of Korean BBQ in Downtown Brooklyn and I would definitely recommend the meal seat that requires 2 people at least with 4 great cuts of meat by the chef. Everything was tasty and high end. Even the tableware was high quality I must say. One thing that isn't great is how pricey everything is. I ordered some extra lettuce to wrap the meat and other stuff without realizing it was 8 dollars for a few slices of lettuce which is a bit ridiculous. But besides that, service was great and the quality of food was excellent. I would definitely come back again but will not be ordering extra side dishes that would normally be feee in any Korean restaurant.
No comment

If you've ever been to the Michelin-starred Korean Steakhouse COTE , ATTI gives a similar vibe. I loved the décor, and of course, the food! To start, my career is in facilities management, so I immediately notice how spaces look and make me feel. You should know I'm a slut for good millwork and lighting, and the wooden slat wall panels and lighting caught my eye immediately. My table ordered the oysters to start and the Chef's 4 selected cuts as our entrée. In Korean BBQ fashion, the meats came with several small sides called banchan, which included kimchi, egg souffle, bean sprouts, lettuce, and a variety of sauces (to name a few). The meats were grilled table-side and all tasted high-quality, and were well seasoned. We ended off with their bingsoo- shaved ice with red bean. The entrée was $64 a person and I think this was a great value for all it came with. My paloma cocktail was pretty but did not taste that great... but it was also the only drink I ordered. I'd still give ATTI a 5/5 as all the meats and sides were perfect, along with the vibe.

We got Han Sang Set A, which came with 4 selected cuts. The meats were good, just not a lot. Two soups, egg, and shaved ice were also part of the set. As for banchans, you can get free refills, just ask. The plum mojito was refreshing.
Delicious food! Better than cote without the wait. Service is great and ambiance is perf for date night or girls night! They're drinks are strong as well
Food and services are both amazing.  I came in a group, but I see lots of couples dining here too - ambiance is definitely nice for a date.
No comment
No comment
Very the best traditional Korean BBQ full of side dishes. Great quality meat and an excellent combination with vegetables! the genre of healthy bbq! Solid spot & thoughtful mood and service.
No comment
No comment
A beautiful experience. Beautiful restaurant. Great Service, Everything on menu was fully explained. All the sides were amazing on top of Chae cooking all of our beef selections perfectly.

Yay for a fine dining KBBQ place in downtown Brooklyn!! Went with a group of 4. The meats were mostly really good - we got the premium menu as well as the other two cuts that didn't come with the menu so that we could try all the different cuts. I would recommend all of them aside from the filet mignon which was too lean. They have someone grilling it for you so you don't need to do it yourself but make sure you tell them how you like the meats cus the person who did ours kinda overcooked some of the meats until we told him. It was kinda expensive - they don't give you free vegetables (ssam and scallion salad) like all other kbbq places I know. Each was 8 dollars for a few leaves which is pretty crazy. Can we just bring our own vegetables?
No comment

There's not a lot of Korean bbq in Brooklyn - generally speaking, this place tastes good. A bit pricier and doesn't offer as much variety as the typical joints in Manhattan's koreatown BUT I'll definitely come back with friends. I hope their menu expand or rotates!
No comment
Phenomenal service and quality of food. The absolute best that Brooklyn has to offer in terms of Korean food and BBQ. Very premium quality. Very worth the visit.

This spot is pretty decent. Its a good KBBQ spot for downtown bk. It's a bit more on the pricer end but the cuts of meat are good. I did the Han Sang and it was lovely. I was full after but if you're comparing it to Ktown BBQ spots then I can see how it might feel like it's not a lot of food for the price but again the preparation of meats are different. In addition the service is different too, there's more attentive service here. I will come back!
No comment
Finally KTown level food in Brooklyn. Go here, get the chef's set menu (while it's still affordable!), and try to get seated with KO! He's great
No comment
Positives - the meats are high quality and well prepared. But the service is slow, and the cost is exorbitant- not worth it.
The best Korean BBQ in Brooklyn! The Ambiance is nice and their service is very friendly!!

5 stars is not enough to give this restaurant. The restaurant has a beautiful ambience and our waiter KO made this a wonderful experience for us. Everything on the menu was amazing - the marinated short ribs is a must try! I would definitely recommend this restaurant for date night or groups. Looking forward to my next visit!
Sooooooooooooo goooooooooooooooooooooooood. A lil pricey but worth it!! Much needed addition to the neighborhood
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here as a group of 8 to celebrate a birthday dinner and was really impressed by both the service and the food! To start, we shared the garlic milk bread which was so warm and buttery (but kind of difficult to split, if you come here with a group of people get the bread rolls instead). Then we had the steak, crispy pork belly, fried rice, rose udon, and a spicy garlic shrimp dish that I didn't photograph because it was eaten up too quickly. I'm often wary of Asian-fusion places, but this restaurant far exceeded my expectations. For dessert, we shared the ube lava cake and agreed it is one of the best desserts we have had in NYC. Would 100% come back here in the future!

Disappointing. Taste of the peanut noodles with chicken was okay, but overall it was a plain dish with fat noodles dominating. No vegetables except for three minuscule cucumber slices. Apart from not being too healthy, everything came in plastic containers, with only the fork being biodegradable- according to the listing. Regretted my choice, though the people and service really got my sympathy.
The food was overall very bland.  Tried the sesame noodles, cheese bread, cucumbers, steak, pork belly
No comment
No comment
AMAZING GEM! Great fusion spot. Lovely ambiance and impeccable service. The owners are so friendly
No comment

No comment

Absolutely DELICIOUS. I had the Kaya French Toast and my fiancé had the Brunch Burger. Both dishes were soooo GOOD. Definitely coming back again in the future! Service and the ambiance was awesome as well!
No comment
Booked a two-too for brunch as the menu looked so fun and unique...Asian fusion.  The sliced biscuits were truly amazing as was the burned butter wow.  I would go back and just get that for brunch.

Solid food and kind service. Went this past weekend for brunch and got the kaya french toast and yuzu eggs benedict. Would recommend both in a heartbeat. The french toast was soft and flavorful and surprisingly the yuzu works well with the eggs benedict. The flavors are nicely balanced. Also got the milk bread to start and only complaint is that it only had 4 pcs. Looking forward to trying more dishes here.

Saw the reviews for this place and had to stop by. Interior has a great aesthetic. Enjoyed the thai iced tea and bread rolls. Got the bulgogi burger which was good but seemed like just a regular burger not bulgogi? Nevertheless this place is awesome and I highly recommend

The food was great. We got their Milk Bread App, Bamboo Salad, Shrimp, Steak, and Pork Belly. It was more than enough for 3 people to split. Every dish was great. I don't get the $$$ rating for this place. I thought everything was well priced and the portion sizes were generous.

I came here on Saturday around 12 pm. The place had people but there were a decent amount of tables for 2 available. Upon entering, I was not greeted by anyone. The workers just kept walking past me. I waited a good ten minutes because that is how long it took my friend to meet me at the restaurant. When my friend arrived, someone FINALLY came to asked how many people. To me personally, this is just unacceptable. FYI, other people they came in got greeted and sat within 1 minute. A lady came over to take our order but she didn't bother to take the menu away after we order. I got the French toast which cost $21. Personally, I have a sweet tooth but this French toast was way too sweet. I had to removed some of the cream on it because I just couldn't handle it. My friend got the chicken waffles and she said the chicken was too oily ($21). Overall, I would not recommend this place. Nothing was special for the brunch menu. Also, not in the mood to feeling cold throughout my meal.
Nice location. Nice ambiance. Food was mediocre at best. The bread needed more seasonings. The noodles were really good, but the pork belly was bland. Nice try only.
No comment

Great fusion place for brunch. Must get the rolls with the butter- the butter was so good. We also got yuzu eggs Benedict and the kaya French toast. The Benedict was so good esp with the pork belly. The kaya French toast was mid- personally I thought there wasn't enough kaya. We also got a Thai iced tea to share- beware they put cinnamon in their drink so it kinda tasted like chai- wasn't bad but just was not expecting that. I would like to come back to try their dinner menu.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: Their brunch menu is a can't miss! The Yuzu Eggs Benedict is so good, with pork belly, salted egg yolk, and yuzu brilliant additions to the classic! My friend got the BEC (bacon, egg, and cheese) and it looked great. Then we topped it off with their unique macarons, which had just the right texture and fillings that were sweet but not overpowering. Highly recommend the Vietnamese iced coffee flavor! The dining room is lovely, the bar has the most comfortable stools (if you know you know), the staff friendly and attentive, and the chef is truly talented with genius Filipino-inspired and Asian fusion dishes!
No comment

Had dinner here with a group of about ~15 people and the staff did an amazing job feeding everyone! We ordered about 9 dishes and loved how diverse and delicious they all were. My personal favorite dish was the soy caramel wings which reminds me of Korean fried chicken, super crispy and flavorful outer and juicy inner meat. We also had the seaweed chips, rosé soba, salt and pepper cauliflower poppers, bulgogi ribeye, spicy garlic shrimp, grilled lemongrass chicken, crispy pork belly in coconut milk, and ube lava cake. All were amazing but just wish the portions were bigger as the price of each dish was over $20. Felt more like tapa-style dining bc the entrees were smaller than expected. Not to say the food wasn't good though! Additionally, the restaurant indoor space was very nice, clean, and organized including the decor which was simple and pleasant to look at. Our waiter and waitress was super attentive and helpful in getting what we needed. Overall, highly recommend coming here for an Asian fusion experience!

Fantastic food, atmosphere, and people! We loved everything we tried - we started with the garlic milk bread and soy caramel wings, would definitely order both again. The bulgogi ribeye was cooked perfectly and the gochusam butter really brings it over the top. The crispy pork in coconut milk was incredible - the sauce was so good, we could've eaten just that with rice. The superstar though, is the ube lava cake dessert - this is an absolute must order every time! We'll be back soon to try more entrees...

I've already been to Red Feather couple times since its opening as I am becoming obsessed. We started off with the bomb garlic milk bread and bamboo salad. I have never tasted anything like it!! Tofu in the salad is just crispy enough but so soft inside. This time, I tried the lemongrass chicken and the sauce that comes with it just elevates the chicken to the next level. And gochusam butter!!! I've never tasted anything like it!! It goes SO WELL with the bulgogi steak. And I always finish with their infamous Ube lava cake. Please do yourself a favor and try it. You will not regret it!! I can't wait to go back again soon!! Oh also, service there is great!!

My friend and I stopped by for dinner and had such an amazing time! Such a nice atmosphere with the friendliest staff and owner! The menu has a ton of great options; it was so hard to decide on what to order because everything sounded delicious. We ended up ordering the garlic milk bread, watermelon salad, pork belly, and branzino: I'm no food expert, but I enjoyed it everything we ordered. Flavors were great. We ended our meal with the ube lava cake, which was very yummy! Highly recommend, and would definitely come back again!

I was strolling down the street with a few friends and struck upon this gem in the neighborhood. The food is delicious and the ambience is very cozy with their newly added cocktail menu. Bamboo salad is probably the best veggie dish I've had in a long time. Rose udon and branzino is also a must try. Also, don't ever never forget to try their ube lava cake.
No comment

Everything we ordered was excellent (the milk bread, my lord), really solid ribeye steak that we split for the main entree, for dessert chef brought out a carrot cake that was being tested out that was one of the best I've ever had. Atmosphere was fun. Highly recommend.
No comment
Incredible service - very unique and authentically delicious Asian food! The steak and cauliflower dishes are amazing!
Very clean restaurant with great service. The foot is delicious. Will come back again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great service and delicious food! The Spicy Shrimp was very spicy so beware, but very good! The crispy pork belly was very good, and chocolate lava cake amazing!

Saw this new place pop up on yelp so I decided to try it out. Highly recommend it. I had the mushroom and tofu satay as well as the pork belly. I liked that the mushroom and tofu had enough kick but wasn't too spicy. The pork belly was cooked perfectly to have a nice crisp to the edge. Ambiance and set up of the restaurant is great as well. Will definitely come back!
No comment
Seriously SO delicious. The garlic shrimp and garlic milk bread were unreal. Beautiful space and wonderful staff. Can't wait to come back!!
food here is to die for!!! the garlic milk bread is so good i could've eaten about 14. also the lemongrass mulled wine is the perfect winter drink.
No comment
This place orders by checking on a paper. No dim sum pushing carts in this place. Lots of variety, very similar to Golden Unicorn on East Broadway. Very clean.
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

It's very rare to find a dim sum place that offers dim sum in the evening. My friends and I (a large party) came here to celebrate a birthday and we had a great time. The dim sum is very good, especially the bean curd roll and we were hooked onto the coconut pudding. The waiters are very nice and the service was fantastic. The atmosphere was very welcoming and the lighting was a plus. One thing I always check is the cleanliness of the plates and utensils and I was extremely pleased. Overall 11/10 would come again!

Latest outpost of dim sum palace, that's open late. Been to the 2nd ave location and the concept is the same. You order of pictionary menu of dim sum and some more hearty options, like chow fun with beef.  Tried a bunch of meat and veg options, including XLB. The wrapper was thick and chewy but broth and filling was otherwise tasty. Steamed ribs were mostly bone and cut unevenly.   Service was fine, place wasn't busy around 6. Would I want to come back? Probably if I was around late at night otherwise plenty other dim sum options.

Newly relocated Dim Sum Palace is one of the few places that open early for breakfast and closes late for after hour's karaoke. We were given a private party room in the basement due to the amount of people in hour party. The staff was friendly, the food came out quickly and without missing a single order. Overall the food was excellent. However, the only thing I would change is the texture and thickness of the rice rolls. Definitely returning here the next time I'm in Chinatown and the mood for Dim Sum.

Went here recently for some late night Dim Sum with some of my bros. We ordered what felt like was practically everything on the menu from turnip cake to beef chow fun. Everything came out fairly quickly and was fairly tasty. I would say how newly renovated the place would make one distrust the quality and authenticity of the place but it was all in all a good experience breaking bread. Would definitely go back again considering that they're open until 3am according to their sign, which is getting rare these days to find an establishment not trying to close earlier especially in Chinatown.

We were craving Sticky Rice Wrap so we ordered them from Dim Sum Palace. The order came super quick! The Sticky rice was enjoyably chewy with a slightly sweet taste. Our wrap was filled with savory chicken. It also game with a ginger sauce that brought out a burst of flavor. Overall, delicious and well fulfilled craving.

Awesome spot! Spacious and so many menu options. Speedy service too. Delicious variety of soup dumplings. Even the sautéed veggies were so simple but garlicky and tasty. And beef and fried rice were great. Also loved the duck for the buns. So tasty. Great spot for large groups

This place was surprising. I figured a new dim sum place in Chinatown with locations all over the city would be questionable. But they really delivered, love the shrimp quality - doesn't skimp like other places you may go to nowadays. The location is super convenient, but just know it's not a cart place. You order off a menu, and if you're trying to grab a quick bite, it may take a little longer than you may be planning. But the food quality is more than worth it. Great service with the pro level dim sum waiters you know and love. Bustling and loud location full of people from the moment they open the perfect environment for yum cha.

Had both dinner family style for Chinese new year and family dim sum. For dim sum the food was hot and picked from a menu - like that it wasn't cold food rolled on carts as usual. Variety of food was good too. And really enjoyed the dinner option too esp the lobster sashimi!

On their website, they said there's half price dim sum happy hour between 3-5pm on weekdays. When I walked in at 4pm, the hostess had no idea what I was talking about. So I only grabbed a menu and took some pictures.  But I still plan on eating there with my family this weekend. Seems like a nice addition to division st
The food is good quality and taste better than other dim sum restaurants in my opinion.
Excellent dim sum from pork buns, scallion pancakes and beef chow fun.  Everything fresh and tasty. New restaurant addition to this chain is well worth the visit!!

Went for New Year dinner.  Food was delicious!!  The duck was so juicy and the skin very crunchy.  The staff made into pancakes that were so tasty.  Shrimp with caramelized walnuts, so plump and sweet.  Steak was amazing tender.  All our hosts and staff very friendly.  Will definitely come back again!!!

The dim sum did not need to go this hard... but it did. I've had good dim sum in my lifetime but this was extremely consistent and had the best sauces I've ever had? Their chili and sweet soy sauce hiiiiiit. Their turnip cake was perfect. Hope they have a great opening!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Got a new design, the waiter or waitress. horrible the green tea matcha wasn't even green, it was gray or black because they used a random ingredient to replace the green tea matcha. But they didn't mention anything about changing ingredients, the service was great food was below average. They need better cooks in order to get a five star. Also, where warm clothing it is really cold no matter where you are.

Was eager to try this new place; had enjoyed dim sum at the previous tenant, Sunshine. We thought the dim sum was delicious. Everything comes out hot and fresh, and they have items on their menu that are different than the usual array. And your tea, served in a beautiful glass teapot that filters the leaves, is regularly replenished and stays hot. Only reason they are not getting five stars from me is the service. Everyone was nice and we got the right things, but they were obviously shorthanded. No sauces, no spoons to eat the Xiao long bao with. And the two doors, when both open, bring a blast of freezing air into the dining room, so some tables were literally in a stiff breeze, and pretty much everyone in the dining room had their coats on. We'll definitely come back, but would probably come back at opening time so they aren't backed up yet, and would make sure to be sitting a long way from the door if it's a cold day!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Pretty solid Georgian food, but value might be better at Ubani. We tried Chefs Megruli with the smoked cheese and preferred the parts without the smoked cheese. I think the smoked cheese detracted from the dish, the original is better (and I am a lover of smoked cheese). We also had the lamb kebab mtsvadi which was well seasoned but also well done. I prefer my lamb more medium but maybe this is just the style? They didn't ask how we like the meat cooked. The honey cake was dry, not my favorite. I'm between a 3 and 4 on this review, I'd give them a weak 4. The host was very friendly and the wait staff was slow at refilling our waters but friendly as well. We came for an early dinner around 6ish, the restaurant really filled up by the time we left

Wow, have never tried cuisine from Georgia (country not state) but not did I leave impressed! Try the dumplings, the Georgian pizza, the Georgian salad, the skewers... left very pleased and pleasantly surprised. Atmosphere was nice and so was the service. No complaints. Would come back
Food was great, portions were well sized and all delicious. Service very warm & friendly. Can't wait to come back! Don't sleep on the mini mushroom dumplings!
I'm so glad we took a chance and went to this new Georgian restaurant. Not only was the service great, the food was spectacular.

Delicious food and excellent atmosphere, as well as exceptional service. We thoroughly enjoyed sampling Georgian cuisine and discovered we had to come in a few times to try different things in the menu. A definite NYC must.

The food is so delicious. Each dish was better than the last.  If you're looking for a brilliant and authentic Georgian meal in midtown Manhattan this is the place to go. You cannot go wrong with Aragvi     Enjoy :)

WOW! I visited for the first time today and the food was stunning, just delicious! I haven't been this excited about a new restaurant is ages, and the prices and portions are good for midtown and the service impeccable. I can't wait to try more of the menu!

They just opened in January 2023. Everything is brand new. Service is fantastic. Food is awesome. Ordered Khinkali with pork, a kind of Georgian dumplings, and Adjaruli, like a pizza but with considerably more cheese inside.

I really liked the restaurant decor - tastefully done. I had the chef's dumplings (thinkhali) which  I found a bit salty for my taste. For the price it should have come with a side or something. I will go back there again to try something else different.
Delicious freshly made food, excellent service, reasonable prices, nice spacious dining room
Aragvi is a great new spot to get dinner, every dish was delicious and we tried many that were new to us and loved them. We will be back to try more!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is amazing!! Thank you Diego and Gustavo! Recommendations were not only on point but they were excellent! I went before With my brother for the morcilla (blood sausage) and yucca purée but this time, Diego suggested the potato salad. It was good excellent and a great pair. Highly recommend!!!!! pS, they will be activating their space for entertainment in the spring and summer, so please follow!!
No comment
And yet again another amazing delicious visit to El Mate. It never fails us at all, the meat was medium rare, exactly how we wanted it!! Love this place!!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cozy place . Great friendly service. You must order the empanadas they were delicious. My husband had the lemon chicken with vegetables which he enjoyed. My son had the salmon with the yummy mashed yuca and kale. I had the gnocchi bolognese so flavorful. Can't wait to return.
No comment

Stopped by for takeout and got the parrillada for two. The steaks were cooked well and not dry and the sausage was excellent. I wish they gave more rice and beans with this meal as that seemed to be enough for one.

What a great spot to visit! We made it just in time to grab a couple of drinks while on happy hour special. Happy hour ends at 7. The gentlemen who waited on us was super sweet. He was attentive to our table and even repeated the specials twice (hearing through the masks is tough) Margaritas were great. However, the sangria was a bit.... different. Not horrible but definitely not something I wanted to order again. Now if you've been to other Brazilian spots you know the meats tend to be a bit on the saltier side. However, the flavor is like no other. Meat was cooked perfectly and the yucca purée was delicious. The rice and beans also tasted great nothing out of the ordinary. The star of this meal however was the BRAZILIAN FLAN! Perfect way to finish the meal off.
No comment

The restaurant has a wonderful ambiance the drinks and our appetizers were great. When it came to our meals the steak wasn't seasoned at all. The Salmon dish was great! Our sides also lacked seasoning. I guess we had higher expectations for an Argentinian restaurant we've been to other similar places and the food is seasoned amazing. The Flan was delicious. If I was to go again I would do drinks and apps.

I've been to El Mate twice now and I will be back again! I'm Uruguayan and love a good asado. The steak was delicious and the ensalada rusa was also great. The only thing I didn't like was that the server asked the person I was dining with "Oh you finished everything! You liked it, huh?" after they ate everything on their plate. ¡¡Super fuera de lugar, eso no se pregunta!! However, the food was very good.

Overall a really good experience, go support local small businesses and restaurants! It was our first time at El Mate and we celebrated an anniversary.   The highlights were the rib eye, mashed yuca, and drinks that were strong. Our waitress Marie was awesome. We sat at the outdoor patio which shielded us from the light rain. The main gripe would be that this restaurant is sandwiched between two others and all three were playing different music outside.  It made dinner quite loud and hard to have conversation at times.

.Ate here for Father's Day with a party of 3 . The restaurant has indoor and out door seating.The staff was very friendly and inviting ,had Louis( hope I spelt it correctly) as our waiter. He was very attentive and our food did not take long to be served.The Sangrias and margaritas are a must.Will definitely return in the near future.

First off the staff was incredible. They were attentive, humorous, and offered great suggestions for us first timers. Our group ordered a round of drinks and each one was better than the last. Flavorful and strong. The food was filling and tasteful. But the chicken empanadas were they highlight of the night, and the meats had a great flavor and cooked as asked. Would definitely come back.

This was such a nice restaurant. The staff are very friendly and helpful with explaining the menus. Food, is amazing. I always start with the empanadas. It's food porn. That's all I'm going to say about that. We had the Parrillada which was perfect for us.  It's nice and local with a lot of personality. Can't wait to visit again.
Love this restaurant. The staff are top notch. Always ask for a recommendation, you will not be disappointed.

Brazil Brooklyn-style. Lovely cocktails. Good servers ! Music Sunday night. Chicken wings, salads and fine Brazilian stews. Small street side room and a large covered back yard.  Fun place. Staff nice.

Great service, excellent food across the board. The empanadas were especially good (chorizo was our favorite, and the dessert empanada was killer.) The parrillada was exactly as I remembered it from our last trip to Argentina (which is to say, varied and delicious, though perhaps not the best choice for the squeemish since it includes things like blood sausage. I would gladly eat here again

We came here on a Sunday evening. The place is cozy and it wasn't packed. We both ordered the steak and sides (yucca, sautéed spinach and mash potato)and dessert. I would definitely come back for more delish food! 9/10

Great steak! And a nice embience for a chill night out. We left without getting dessert and ended up coming right back for their dessert empanadas. Would definitely recommend going there!

Thank you guys for a great night out.  They were able to accommodate my party of 14 and we had plenty of room in the back of the diningroom. Also had a great looking backyard as well.  Drink orders were taken shortly after we sat down.  Waitress was very patient with everyone deciding what they wanted and the recommendations of shared empanada appetizers were great.  The crust was light and flaky and all the different fillings we got were moist and flavorful.  Large amounts of meat and steak for all the entrees, especially the mixed grill (must have).  Constant came by to refill drinks and clear the table.  We didn't stay for dessert but they sent over 3 plates of flan for the table to share and everyone agreed it was awesome.  The perfect balance of creamy and dense and the caramel was spot on.  Rave reviews from the whole party.  Looking forward to going back.

The steak was absolutely delicious. Had the skirt steak and the pichana and they were cooked perfectly. Their chimichurri sauce is honestly the best ive ever had, i even bought a container of it to go. Out door seating was great as well and service was impeccable!
Yucca mashed, entraña , chimichurri, empanadas , so dam good. Our new favorite for steak and delicious Malbec wine.

Originally my friends and I wanted to have brunch at Buttermilk Channel, but unfortunately the wait was over and hour, and thanks to that, we stumbled across this amazing Argentina spot. Definitely an underrated gem in The area. They have a super cute outdoor garden seating, and since we went during the fall we were able to enjoy the outdoors, which was lovely. The food was divine. Starting from the Passion fruit mimosas to the Argentina coffee to the empanadas we ordered as an app to the entrees of steak and eggs breakfast wrap and huevos rancheros! No one had any complaints! The food was perfection! Authentic Argentina food and great service as well! Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the area. Highly recommend trying out this gem.

This lovely hidden gem in Carroll Gardens (Brooklyn), offers an amazing selection of Gaucho style meats, wines, and delicious specialty cocktails (try their sangria). I recently celebrated my birthday with close friends at  El Mate, my first dinner outing in months (all while following CDC Covid-19 guidelines), the staff definitely took the steps necessary to secure our safety and theirs. My friends and I were accommodated in their patio, which was such a great treat. The patio is beautiful and spacious, it's easy to forget that you're in Brooklyn. The food, service and atmosphere were stellar. I can't recommend it enough. I'm looking forward to my next visit and so are my friends. Thanks Luis and rest of staff, you guys made us feel very comfortable and allowed us to have a great time.

This place is my new favorite Spanish restaurant! Hands down. Food is so delicious and the staff are super friendly. My fiancé and I wanted a new place and found this one. Such a great find! We had the Red Sangria, Fried Calamari, Parrillada for 2, and Rice and Beans. Thres Leches and their Brazilian Flan.  if you're in Brooklyn and craving Spanish, I highly recommend this place!

I have missed amazing steak...this spot did not fail in any way. Perfect food, timing, service, ambiance..allll of it!! I got the skirt steak, my boyfriend got the ribeye, we are more than happy to recommend this spot and hope to return soon.

Bf and I had a meat platter and a bottle of wine.  We were so full - strongly recommend the meat platter - we ordered the meat platter for two people and we found it too much food  but overall delicious meal

Had the beef, chicken, cheese, and chorizo empanadas to share, which seems made to order since they were flaky and hot.  The sauce it came with tasted tomato based and was good but preferred using the chimichurri sauce which came in a sizable mason jar.  Two of us each got the skirt steak which was very tender and juicy.  The parrillada for 1 was a generous serving of a variety of grilled meats and sausages with plenty for leftover.  Tilapia had a lemon caper sauce with two sides, spinach and sweet potato mash.  All other entrees came with an order of a side, we ordered the potato and sweet potato fries which were both crisp and hearty as well as the yucca mash which was rich and cheesy.  Also had shared plates of gnocchi and mushroom polenta (must get).
The best in brooklyn, I no longer need to go to queens to get some entraña steak this place has it and then some. So good was all I ordered the yuca mash on point highly recommended

No comment

This was the best authentic Argentine food I could have asked for - the morcilla and sweetbreads were fantastic, as was the eggplant empanada I had as an appetizer. My date loved her salmon.  Excellent!
No comment

Our party of 12 ate at El Mate after attending a concert at Barclay's Center.  Walter did a great job in accomodating our group.  We mostly ordered parilladas and drank their sangria.   The food was delicious.  The meat was tender and prepared exactly as ordered.  Although the portions were smaller compared to other Argentinian steak houses the tradeoff of quantity for quality was worth it.  The prices were reasonable taking into account this is New York City.  Not one member of the our party of 12 had any complaints about the food, the service or the price.  I was actually commended for selecting this nice cozy place with simply terrific food.

Was in Brooklyn to watch formula e and figured I'd grab a bite to eat while down there. Found this place on yelp and I must say that the food was very good. It lived up to the reviews. I had the Entraña (skirt steak) which was cooked perfectly. The chimichurri was the best I've ever tasted. Worth a try for sure.

My friend and I stumbled into El Mate and loved it! It has a nice atmosphere, especially during nice weather. You can sit outside in their backyard which is nicely decorated. Service was quick and food was delicious. We shared a few empanadas, the spinach and cheese one was the best! We then shared Milanesa alla Napolitana which was a huge piece of chicken covered with cheese. It was definitely enough food to share. We also had sangria which was delicious. I would definitely go back and try the other yummy food!

I had Valentine's Day here,  the food was awesome! We enjoyed the meat platter for 2!

Best Argentine restaurant I've ever been to! The service, atmosphere and food are phenomenal. You won't find a better skirt steak, even in manhattan - I've tried! The empanadas are also incredible. I could go there just for them. Love this place!

Awesome place. Came here with a group of 13. The sangria and margaritas were great. I had the soup with carmelized onions, wow. So good my friend ordered as well for herself after a taste of my soup. Than we shared the meat mix for two. It was great. Everyone love there dishes. The staff was super great and interactive with us. First time here and we felt as if we were at a regular place where your friends with the staff.

What a great evening! the food was delicious, the drinks outstanding, our waiter delightful, and we felt very comfortable eating in their distanced outside space. There were 5 of us and all agreed it hit the mark on every level. Highly recommend.

Came here with boyfriend. The service is great and the food was good. The drinks are on point and love the atmosphere there. Good for date nights. For the people who love mash potatoes I would definitely recommend the mash yucca ! Would come back again.

I was so happy to stumble upon this little gem in Brooklyn. After touring the Navy ship for Fleet Week in the Navy yard, my mom, brother, and I were starving. The service was excellent and the food was amazing. We couldn't sit outside because it was pouring but their patio is cute. Would def go back and enjoy everything they have to offer.

Happened to find this place when another restaurant closer by was closed. How lucky! This place is delicious, the staff is nice, and prices decent. I suggest the empanadas (we tried the eggplant and beef ones), mushroom polenta and vegetable risotto.

By far one of the best restaurants I've been to in Brooklyn. Pretty much had a 3 course meal and it was delicious. Steak was done perfect. Empanadas were insanely good. Desserts were all fresh and delicious
The food wasn't super authentic. The provoleta was nothing at all like an argentine provoleta. Pretty good all around, very friendly service. Good steak, great chimichurri.

Super yummy Brazilian/Argentinean spot tucked away in Brooklyn. Got the Entraña skirt steak. It was cooked perfectly to my liking and the yucca mashed potatoes that accompanied it, did not disappoint! They had accidentally forgot a drink we had asked for. It was no big deal to us, really. Fernando was so kind to offer us both a free specialty shot to correct the mistake. We said it wasn't necessary, but he insisted! Definitely made our night and we enjoyed the experience.
I went here for the very first time and I really loved  it.. really good environment the food it's delicious and the dessert was the best!!.. las mejores empanadas ever!!

Amazing!! The short rib was perfectly cooked, the chimichurri was the best I've tried, and even though I don't normally love blood sausage, the sweetness of the caramelized onions in this one was delicious. The owners are so nice and really know their food, go early to talk to them. Plus, the bathroom has a listerine dispenser to counteract the garlic, so it's a perfect date spot!! We are still raving about the dulce de leche crepe.
Pretty much everything they serve is great. I usually get a skirt steak. Casual Argentinian steak house!
