I came here with my husband for his birthday. We had a favorite Argentinian restaurant in Queens but it closed down and we hadn't found a replacement. We went today at 4pm for dinner. It was empty but the bartender did tell us Saturday's are busy so if we want to come we should make a reservation. Place is like most places in the area kind of small.  We ordered the beef and chicken empanadas. Guys the empanadas were amazing seasoned and so tasty. Then we had the entraña with rice and beans with side of yuca mash. The entraña was perfect. They give you the chimichurri in a small jar. It was perfect. Tasty and great texture. The yuca mash was ah-may-zing!!!! You must order it. The reason I gave it four instead of 5 was because the rice and beans was bland. Rice tasted like It's I don't like steamed. And beans eh. When I go again I would just get the yuca mash. The pisco sours were good. Flan was tasty but a lil dry compared to what I'm used to.  The staff was friendly and attentive. We will definitely be returning.
No comment

Amazing dinner on Friday night. We had a bottle of a syrah malbec blend which went great with our meal. For appetizers, we did 2 of the empanadas: 1 spinach and 1 eggplant. They were fresh and delicious and didn't taste like they have been made in old oil. For mains we shared the churrasco and the sausage/sweetbreads plate which came with blood sausage, chorizo and potato salad. The sweetbreads were amazing and the chorizo. I wasn't a fan of the blood sausage and the potato salad lacked flavor. We also shared a side of the sweet potato mash which was great as well. It was definitely a great amount of food for 2 people. The service was excellent and I definitely want to go back and have room for dessert this time.

Me and my girlfriend have been to this place twice now for Valentine's Day of this year and Valentine's Day of last year. Both times we have enjoyed the food here especially the empanadas. The staff is very nice and the interior decorations are very cool. This is a definite must visit if you're around the area and even if you're not make the trip out here.
No comment

We absolutely loved this place! My friend is from Argentina and I will definitely bring her soon! The skirt steak melted in your mouth. The chimichurri is one of the best that I have had at a restaurant, tasted home made. The pastas are made fresh at the restaurant. Everyone from our group absolutely loved what they ordered. You need to finish the night with the empanada de mate. A must if you are in the area.
Liked the red sangria, crepe w dulce de leche was too sweet, rib eye was decent, sauteed kale could've been better

Cool place, nice atmosphere. Bartender is really cool. Offers a pre fixe menu as well as a regular menu. Empanadas are great. Can't go wrong with any one of them. This is my second time there and I must say the first time was a better food experience. I'm a definite carnivore  and I love my meat (steak,sausage,ribs) the first time I went my steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned well. Second time hmm......definitely different. Food was missing that wow factor. It was still good but not as great as my first experience. I would still recommend you try them out. I want to check out their weekend brunch soon.

No comment

What a wonderful meal and warm welcome at El Mate.   The food was delicious with perfect wines to match.  My boyfriend and I shared our first Valentine's Day together here and I can't wait to come back, particularly in the summer with live music outdoors.  I highly recommend the polenta con Hongos to start!!
No comment

On a cold Friday evening my boyfriend and I were greeted by a warm staff in a warm and cozy room. We were informed on the specials of the day and given bread with a DELICIOUS chimichurri sauce, as well as an eggplant spread, which was also good. We started off with 2 red sangria's and 2 empanadas (one beef and one ham & cheese). The 2 empanadas were perfect for sharing as an appetizer and they were VERY good! The dough was perfectly cooked, flaky, and delightful. I didn't care for the red sangria at all, neither did my boyfriend, but he decided he'd take one for the team and drink both of them. I asked for the cocktail menu and the staff noticed that my sangria glass was still full. I did express that I did not care for it when they asked me and they kindly did not charge us for it at the end of the meal. After my bf finished off both sangria's, he had a wonderful glass of Malbec. For my main meal I had the skirt steak and yucca mash. BOTH were out of this world!!!!!! Especially after I smeared several spoon fulls of their chimichurri sauce all over my perfectly cooked, melt in my mouth, steak. BELIEVE the hype on their yucca mash people!!!! BELIEVE...... My sweetie had their steak "special" with merlot mushrooms, asparagus, and mashed potatoes. He was VERY jealous of my yucca mash after tasting his potato mash. Not that they were bad...., the yucca just has that extra special something going on...I detect cheese, has to be the cheese.... Mmmmmm..... For dessert I had the panna cotta (with a cafe con leche) and it was creamy and delectable (coffee was great too!). My NUMBER ONE suggestion to them though is that they ADD a chocolate dessert to their menu. 9 out of 10 people LOVE chocolate and it is ALWAYS the perfect way to end any meal. My boyfriend didn't have any dessert at all because of the lack of chocolate options. All in all El Mate is a KEEPER for us and a romantic place for any couple to reconnect over great cocktails, wine, and amazing food!

Phenomenal place!! My partner and I had a taste for steak, we decided to give this place a shot. And boy did we make a great decision. The atmosphere was lovely, as well as the servers. EVEN MORE SO THE FOOD!! We had a taste of something from every topic on the menu down to dessert. Their skirt steak had my mouth drooling, can't go wrong.  The chimichurri was amazing, sweet potato mash!!! The drinks!! I've said enough, the food was great and is worth your money.

Wonderful restaurant! We have been there several times every time was excellent! The food the service the wine it's all good. Gustavo and the rest of the staff welcome you with grace and enthusiasm! I am sure I will return many times!
Very good job with Brazilian steak and the beef Ribs , still hot and juicy. Most memorable were the soup, salad, from the appetizers, and rice with beans.  Much better than Outback on each item.
Nice ambiance.  Romantic.  Excellent food.  Nice variety of drinks.  Friendly staff.  Will definitely return.

I'm so impressed with this beautiful idea of a business in this amazing neighborhood. It is difficult to find a complete great customer experience in New York but El Mate exceeds everything that we look for in a restaurant.  I just tried their amazing sangria, maracuya mimosa, Bloody Mary and the amazing Backyard Chef Burger - it all makes me want to come back every weekend w\o excuse.

The evening was amazing from start to finish. Fernando and Ariel were exceptional! They were so attentive, informative and had amazing energy. Food was delicious! The empanadas were beyond our expectations. Loved the beef and the spinach and cheese. Had the sausages and breaded chicken for main course. Deliciouuuuusness! Enough about food let's talk ambiance. The music was so fine and relaxing. Can't wait for summer to spend time at the patio!!! Oh I almost forgot to mention one of the best part, dessert!! Oh my god!! Sooooo perfect!!! Try the flan  I'm in love

I went here with my husband for the first time, and i dont see why this place is rated so well.  The prices were outrages, the drinks were so disgusting,   the child like proportions actually were about 35 a plate,  and all you can taste was  salt ! Me and my husband decided to not come back. We left very unsatisfied with our $120 bill and an unpleasant meal  experience.

My girlfriend and I were looking for a place to have some steak with Latin flavor lol so came across el Mate and I must say I'm happy we did ! We went for early dinner so it wasn't as packed and were able to sit the backyard. Customer service was excellent! Everybody was very friendly and attentive... we started with empanadas as any Person should lol and they were delicious, we had the chicken, chorizo and eggplant goat cheese. As an entree my gf had the picanha which was amazing but I went for the more fatty one lol I had the tira de asado and like I said this is more in the fatty side... as sides we both had purée de yuca ! And honestly it was the best thing of the dinner ! If you like mac and cheese then you will love this side ! Highly recommended! So overall excellent place we will be coming back here
Delicious food! I had the black linguini with crab meat and it was so yummy. Hubby had their short rib with pasta and it looked very good. Will return!
No comment

My wife Alicia and I just revisited for the 3rd time this great Argentina restaurant in Park Slope  our great servers Walter, Debra,  and Luis were Fantastic they helped us  with the menu and explained to us all the specials. Everything on the menu is Great You will Not be disappointed  Enjoy

My family and I tried this place when it first opened and it was amazing! We went back tonight to celebrate my father's bday and once again it was perfection! The staff is friendly and very attentive. The meal was delicious from the steak to one of the best hamburgers I've had in a long time! Their chocolate flan was the perfect ending to a great meal! Can't wait to come back!

This place is incredible, friendly welcoming staff and amazing food. This is a must do in the area (and certainly worth going out of the way for). We look forward to coming here whenever we can

I can't stress enough how amazing their food is. This is my fourth or fifth time here, and they remembered me and husband in the past two years (we live in Sheepshead Bay and we come here whenever we're in the area). But the most important thing about any restaurant is their food and service. Service is great, but their food is mind blowing. Everything that I've tried here hasn't disappointed me (*knock on wood*). From appetizers to entree to their desserts, you will be impressed. My favorite dessert is the dulce de leche empanada with bananas and vanilla ice cream. Their yucca mashed is to die for. I didn't care to order it but my husband did, and after trying it, ugh I must say that it was so freakin good.

Really bad service and food! We went 3 people and order 2 steaks, one of them was really bad like a gum. After we told that to the manger he didn't agree to replace the steaks, so we left the steak as  is, pay the bill and left. Really disappointed...

I ate short ribs with malbec wine, along side with yucca mash and for dessert I had a Romeo and Juliet, which was really delicious, they deserve 5 stars because of the great music, vibes and the great service, I really loved this place, I'll be coming back soon!

They started us off with bread with an eggplant dip and chimichurri sauce. We ordered beef empanadas and the mixed platter for 2 with sautéed kale & yucca. Food was great - there was sooo much meat! - a bit salty though. Yucca had milk & cheese, which I don't eat, but my friend loved it. Steak & short rib were the best on the platter. For dessert, we got the empanada with banana, dulce de leche, and strawberries - delicious! Excellent service as well
The food was amazing! Their mashed yuca is from another world and the guys that worked there provided an excellent customer service

No comment

Ordered the Parillada (mixed grill) for 2 medium rare. Received a plate full of overcooked well done meat. When I told the waiter, no accommodations were made and all I received was a blank look. Another diner at my table ordered the short ribs and received another overcooked piece of meat. The service was pleasant but inattentive. Maybe the restaurant let their head chef  have Easter Sunday off, but it sucks that I was served a below average meal.  This will be another restaurant at the end of court street that will be out of business in the blink of an eye.
Love this place! Everything is so delicious. Great mochitos! Out waitress was so sweet and her recommendations were right on point. Love it! Thank you

Fantastic South American food in a cool spot.  The skirt steak with chimichurri and empanadas and caipiroska's are off the hook here.  Finish with some authentic mate and Brazilian flan... ridiculously good food at a reasonable price... don't miss this spot!

You must try the house made empanadas - the chicken and beef were the best choices - and the house made chorizo. Quelmas beer from Argentina was a pleasant change. Owner is on premises and cares about the customer's experience. We'll be back to try their chimichuri sauce with grilled beef soon.
No comment

No Bullshit Review: Party of 3, I had the beef and chicken empanadas they were great. Wheat is also FABULOUS is the eggplant spread or dip they give you. I also had the Hamburger which had caramelized onions and bacon what can you say about a burger except it was excellent. Then I had the brizalian flan which was great just the way I like it. I would have to say they make there deserts. Ok the others had stake which they say were excellent. The Answer to this review, Would we come back Yes in a heartbeat, the service was extremely attentive and we had the Argentinian waitress which was wonderful. So come can give them a try you will not be disappointed.

Do yourself a favor and stop by El Mate for authentic, tasty South American food. The menu leans more Argentine, which is totally fine because the drinks are universally good. Milanesa is perfection, so are the empanadas. To top things off, service is fantastic. Finish your meal with panqueques de dulce de luche, and you will 100% leave happy

For the food- 5 stars. Excellent empanadas. Some of the best I've ever had. We had the kale salad with hard boiled eggs which had a nice flavorful vinaigrette dressing.  For our mains we had the skirt steak and the tilapia. All very delicious and very flavorful. We had a nice seat outside. -1 star because the service was ok. We rarely saw our waiter and one table literally hijacked him for 5 minutes each of the times he did show up.  -1 star also because we called before and the person on the phone was rude when we asked if there was any wait time. Would hesitate to go back unless I was in a very leisurely and patient mood.

Great place, awesome service! Food was exceptionally delicious, granted, not cheap but for a good steak it's well worth it.  A very nice romantic atmosphere, came to celebrate my cousins birthday and all of us had to try out the steaks, none were disappointed!  Had the polenta in a creamy mushroom sauce, that sauce was amazing, and the melted cheese with ham appetizer, absolutely delicious! That are. Sry accommodating to requests as well. Drinks were all good. Try the Pisco, it's a great cocktail, don't get intimidated by the egg whites, it yummy!

This place is great. It's got a great atmosphere. The food is always amazing. I always order the provoleta (It's basically melted cheese with ham and capers) for an appetizer and the skirt steak and mashed yucca for my entree. Their mashed yucca as well as their chimichurri sauce are the best, definitely a must try!

Servers were friendly & attentive. I really liked their empanadas and drinks. I recommend el Carioca, it was refreshing. Im not sure why I didn't order the steak since that's what most of the reviews are on. I got the Milanesa Clasica but didn't like it very much as it lacked flavor. Everything else (appetizer and sides) were good. There's a large variety on their menu so I'll definitely be coming back to try something different.
I ordered matambre with rusa as an appetizer, milanesa napolitana with yuca pure and panqueques con dulce de leche as a desert which I really liked with some mates. Everything I had was delicious!

I came here for the first time last weekend and I can't wait to come back. It's a very small restaurant, which I like because that usually means the food is great. And it is. The entire atmosphere is awesome. Their empanadas are insane- my mouth waters thinking about them! We had the beef and chorizo ones. The fried calamari was delicious and the steak was soooo good! We also ordered two tiramisus for dessert and they gave us another dessert on the house. I will definitely be coming back- it's too good not to

My husband and I decided to visit El Mate for dinner because it has great reviews and it did not disappoint. We ordered 2 morcillas and they were very good. We ordered the entraña medium rare and it came out just perfect. We also had the sangria and it was pretty good. Overall pretty good food, service was good too. Good local spot. Prices are also very reasonable. Menu is big enough to try something Brazilian or argentine but small enough to not get overwhelmed.

Great customer service and lovely outdoor seating. Unfortunately the food and drink were disappointing given so many good reviews. Cocktail was teeny tiny ($14) and the ribeye steaks came out over cooked and tough, even though we ordered it MR. The area has some really nice restaurants but we opted for this one after seeing the five star rating...our mistake.

Omg the steak!  Get the skirt steak which is super flavorful and was served cooked to a perfect medium rare as requested. Very generous portion. The chimichurri is some of the best I've had. Lots of flavor!  To offset the meat, get the house salad, which has lots of ingredients and is big enough for probably 2-3 people. The service was also on point!  Our server recommended a malbec to go with our steak and it was perfect. The backyard area is really nice and has some cover if the sun is strong. Met the owner on the way out and seemed like a really good guy who is interested in the clientele. If you're feening for a good steak, go here... Now.
Excellent food and service! Great prices! The entraña is delicious as well as the morcilla. Definitely try it!

I'm very happy with you El Mate. Parrillada for two had some fantastic meats. Empanadas were off the charts. Sides were pretty damn good. Polenta tasty. All paired with a nice malbec. It's a meal for champions. Cheers. Please stay authentic, it's much needed in the neighborhood.

Was pleasantly surprised by this great South American eatery. I stopped by without any real expectations and left impressed. There's no doubt the chef knows what they're doing. The food was flavorful and filling without being overpoweringly seasoned or greasy. The service was attentive and friendly without being suffocating, and the ambiance was casual and cozy. I'm definitely a fan, and will return without hesitation.
We had a great meal here.  Friendly staff, good empanadas, and good food. Chicken cutlet was well done.  We'll definitely go back again.

Went to El Mate for the first time last night to celebrate my husband's birthday.  Everything was delicious. We had the empanadas, sirloin steak, Brazilian Rump steak and my daughter and her boyfriend had the Parrillada for 2.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  Drinks and dessert were also great.  Great night out!  Will definitely be going back!

As an Argentinian I guess I feel like some kind of authority on this topic. There aren't many Argentinian places in New York period, let alone authentic ones. Well, this one is. Genuine home cooking 100%. The empanadas were ridiculously delicious and Fernando the owner is a f**king gem of a man. I would recommend this place to anyone who misses Argentina and likes delicious food.
One of the best parrilladas I've eaten in a long time. We were 5 so we tried many things, all of them to die for! Also, I will strongly recommend you get a banana empanada for dessert!

The food is just mediocre.  We had salmon and short ribs- both were just ok. The salmon and kale were both too oily in my opinion and frankly the whole dish felt as if it had been microwaved.  However, the empanadas - beef Piccadillo and eggplant and goat cheese were very good.  The service was friendly and attentive.  I really don't understand the rave reviews of the food here.

I took A and another couple here for dinner and it was delicious! We all agreed the food was great and were one of the only diners there since we ate quite early. The empanadas and steak were good as many say. I'd recommend it to friends who are looking for Brazilian.

My new favorite restaurant in NYC! You walk in and pause in awe at how beautiful and unique it is and then the staff is amazingly personable and the drinks out of this world. This is THE spot to relax and be pampered.  I'll be bringing friends here from now on!

The food is awesome. I hade the platter for two with another. It was very filling. At the bottom of the platter we were greeted with two amazing steaks. We had a side of mashed yuca which was delicious. I had a pisco sour to drink which was also very good. The only thing I did not like about this place is the table size.
Great food, great service, genuine fusion of Argentine and Brazilian food! I hope they get big so they can put all the salgadinhos they want on the menu.
Amazing service!!!! The waiter made our night. Great food! Great drinks! Such a wonderful atmosphere and so much fun to try new things. All out extraordinary experience!
No comment
No comment
Delicious! I haven't eaten this well since I was in Argentina. I had the bife de chorizo, which was tender and succulent. I loved the attention to detail, and I felt welcomed by the warm hospitality.

If I could give this place 10 stars I think I would. Firstly. Fernando one of the owners took care of us with the most wonderful service and hospitality. I ask for a spicy drink when I thought I ask for mild and and he changed it complimentary even though it was my mistake. We order skirt steak and ribeye. Both were amazing I loved my skirt steak! Brilliant food, Excellent service, lovely outside terrace to sit and eat. The perfect restaurant. We will be going there again very soon.
Excellent food. Kind and prompt service. My wife had the breaded chicken and I had the skirt steak and both were cooked to perfection. Would definitely eat here again.
I took a friend here from out of town. The sangrias were delicious and the food amazing. The service was also kind, patient, and very attentive.

Went to El Mate with a few of my friends for some nice meat! Our waiter Walter greeted us with a warm welcome. Professional service! The empanadas were amazing! Argentinian skirt Steak was delicious and cooked appropriately. I ordered the sausages, chicken and steak plate deal for two. Can't wait to go back!

This was one of the best food experiences of my life. My family and I went here for a birthday dinner, and we were astonished at how delicious the food was. From empanadas to the grilled salmon to the dulce de leche crepes, the entire meal was simply outstanding. In addition, the service was excellent, and our server, Fernando, was extremely kind and courteous. I will certainly be back in the near future.
Amazing food.. Friendly service. A MUST GO if you are in Brooklyn. We came when it was a bit chilly out but the patio looked amazing.

Came here for my birthday, and was treated super well! The food is delicious, and vegetarian options are pretty solid (especially the spinach empanadas). They sang happy birthday to me and it was very sweet. I definitely recommend the Yerba mate infused cocktails! Reasonable prices all around! Can't wait to get back so I can sip on some sangria in the back patio, it looks lovely.

Best Argentinian restaurant in New York in my opinion! I've been to many others in the city and this one really impressed me! Everything from the chimichurri sauce, the skirt steak, the Milanese chicken to their empanadas are extraordinary in quality, taste and authenticity. You have to try the skirt steak, and if you have room for dessert go ahead and order the panqueque with dulce de leche- it's a classic! Drinks are very well crafted too, and service is very attentive and friendly! I will most definitely return and I will recommend to my friends!
No comment
The best empanada from NYC. As an Argentinean Im entitled to make this review a legit one! My Brazilian friends love the caipirinhas!

We really wanted to love this place as we live in the hood.  Unfortunately, it was an epic fail.  The outdoor space was cool and the kale caesar salad and mashed yucca was pretty good. However, I ordered the skirt steak (medium) and about 45 minutes later, I was presented with a rib eye steak very well done (super chewy and dry).  The waiter only told me as he placed the rib eye in front of me that they were out of the skirt steak! I would have liked to have had a choice especially since the rib eye totally sucked. The waiter "tried to make good" by offering to charge us the skirt steak price (a mere $3 less) and then proceeded to let us know how good the skirt steak tasted when he had it the night before. Thanks dude. We won't be back.

Our family came for brunch and dinner a couple of times and every time the food was delicious and the service super friendly. The empanadas are addictive (in a good way). We'll be back to sit in their backyard!

Had dinner at El Mate based on the positive reviews. I agree with all of them. We had dinner in the back courtyard which was very festive. Fernando was a fabulous waiter and made excellent recommendations. The mixed drinks were delicious and the empanadas with the chimichurri sauce were amazing. I had beef and my husband had chorizo and I would recommend them both. Our entrees and desserts were equally good and I would most definitely come back if I find myself in Carroll Gardens again any time soon. You won't be disappointed by the friendly service and excellent food.
Family environment and absolute best food I have ever had in Brooklyn! Brazilian/ Argentinian fusion; the skirt steak was amazing! Great staff! Thanks guys

Soooooo good !!!! We had a big party of 15 and was seated outside in the back yard. We were all being fed to the mosquitos and there were no repellent available. However that didn't stop us from eating. Everything was so delicious! I recommend the yucca mash over the mash potato. The steak was good. And the empanadas were amazing. definitely would want to come back!
No comment

Awesome food, great place to go with a couple. Small and nice. Prices are good for the location and size of plate. Recommend it to anyone who likes argentine food, and for those who are looking to try something new you won't regret it.
No comment
Beautifully  restorant. The food delicious. The attention so perfect  .we recommend for everybody   go to  try.  Definitely  amazing  restorant  Argentinean

The best empanadas! Cocktails and sangria are fantastic. Wait staff top notch. Apps and main dishes are fantastic. What more can I say? Well there's more than I can say. Hopping on a Friday night! Come in get an empanada have a beverage enjoy an entrée. You will not go wrong!
No comment

I never give 6 stars & today is my first..1 for small clean inviting atmosphere, 2 for Hospitality, 3 for fresh moist & authentic Argentine BBQ, 4 Yucca mash mmmMm, 5 Blood sausage/Morcilla, and 6 STAR Empanadas!!! I am coming back to try to Milanesa brunch and cocktails!

A bit more expensive than you might think, but great quality. I went and tried the beef empanada, the melted provolone cheese with green olives, ham and diced tomato, and the rib eye---they were all great and my mouth is watering thinking about the provolone. The place isn't fancy but the service is friendly and there's a spacious backyard. Pro tip: If you're not into huge portions, the steaks are more than enough to share between two with an appetizer or two.
We had a great meal, very friendly staff and authentic Argentinian cuisine.  Will definitely return.

Great food.  Great people.  Awesome experience.  The outdoor patio was great on a warm late summer night. The service was excellent. We had the mixed plate of assorted meats which was really tasty (minus the blood sausage), but the sweet potato puree was off the meters good. The pesto gnocchi with shrimp was also awesome. Definitely two thumbs up.

We were a party of 16, and the service and food were fantastic!!!  The ribeye, and meat platter were both homeruns!!  Unfortunately they ran out of pisco sour after the first round, it was a disappointment but the other drinks on the menu were just as good.  I would definitely recommend this place and we will be going back.
No comment
No comment

I absolutely love coming to this restaurant. Fernando, the owner, always provides excellent service; attentive and friendly to his customers. I came here for my birthday and It was such a great decision because everything was excellent. Each time I come here with my family we have to have the parrillada, which is finger-licking good. The drinks are also great. I can't wait to be back!

Food is delicious, atmosphere is great and the staff are amazing, Courteous, handsome and friendly.  Love the sangria! And the deserts are heavenly.   I will definitely come back to visit again and will bring my family and friends!
I come here for brunch. Steak and eggs was just perfect - skirt steak was quite tasty. Today, I took the tuna sandwich and the beef empanedas: great ingredients make good food! Will come back.

Great place!!!  Stopped by for brunch (excellent!) and will be back for dinner (probably very soon).  I want to drink the homemade Chimichurri!  Also-save room for desert.  The Brazilian Flan is one of the top 5 desserts I've ever had.  Hoping this place is open for years and years to come!

Came in with a friend last night for a drink and quick meal, and ended up having a whole dinner with drinks, dessert...and more dessert : ) the service was great, food was delicious, and drinks were fantastic! Oh, and, probably the best flan I've ever had! Highly recommend this restaurant.

My family is from Argentina so finding an authentic empanada and Milanesa that I absolutely love outside of Argentina isn't easy...until we discovered El Mate. Amazing! So so so good. Fernando is the best host ever, super nice guy! We loved the cozy neighborhood vibe of the restaurant too a lot. We left stuffed after eating crepes with dulce de Leche as well. We will definitely be back. We loved it

This wonderful restaurant and Fernando are welcomed additions to Carroll Garden's restaurant row. El Mate's selections are reasonably priced and the authentic flavors will transport you directly to South America.  Try ALL the empanadas!  The back patio is perfect for lazy afternoons drinking pitchers of sangria with 20 of your closest friends!

Just left this restaurant. We had a table of 14 people and everything was superb. This is the second time I've been here and the food is always sooo good and the staff are so nice ! They accommodate you and don't rush you. I had the skirt steak and it was perfect. In addition to the delicious food and friendly staff, the place is so cozy and clean ! Will definitely be back for a third, forth, fifth time. Thanks guys !
Great service, cute place,and ambience is perfect for a date or dinner with friends. Empanadas are delicious along with their rib-eye!

It's great place for small parties or a date, the empanada De caprese it's to die for, the enrollado De pollo is beautiful not dry very balance sauce topped with boiled egg so surprising. The Tbone I loved with sauté garlic kale loved. The lobster bisque i loved it was not to heavy very light. The best was the Brazilian flan my favorite and the Passion fruit Mousses is second you must go it a new best place.
Awesome steaks and wine. Best black beans and rice in the neighborhood. The empanadas and desserts are also delicious. The owners are very friendly and this makes for a great experience.

This is my first time at El Mate and it was a very good experience. I ordered Gnocchi de la Nona a la Pomarola and it was delicious. It is usually hard for me to finish my plate, but this time I finished my entire entree. For dessert I tried the Mousse of Maracuya (Passion Fruit) and it was super tasty. Also, the service was amazing! Our server - Fernando-  was super nice and friendly. I will definitely come back!
Excellent food and drinks! I simply marveled at the Listerine dispenser!  Check it out! Superb chinmichurri!
I love this place. Great steaks, tasty empanadas, interesting side dishes and wonderfully hospitable service. Cocktails are good too -- can't go wrong with the sangria!

Hot steak, hotter waiter. The food was fabulous. So simple but so amazing. Took my friend who was considering becoming a vegetarian here and she realized what she'd be missing out on. Will definitely be returning soon especially for Fernando! Waiter was really interactive with us, knew the specials well, was there when needed. He definitely made the visit more memorable! Service was fabulous and the food was definitely worth it.
Pricey. Empanadas were amazing. Eggplant dip they gave you with the bread. Everything else, not so much. I'm not a huge meat eater though.
Love it the steak here! And the margaritas also!  and the personal is very polite and funny!
No comment

Impeccable service, delicious food, and fabulous atmosphere. You have the option to dine inside or out back, both areas are pleasant. The staff is genuinely warm, friendly, and attentive. Its obvious there priority is your enjoyment.  I would call the atmosphere upscale casual. This is my new favorite spot, you won't be disappointed.
No comment
Food was amazing and there dessert was simply the best I've tried, definitely will be coming back here

My experience at El Mate couldn't be better. The food was delicious,drinks perfectly mixed and the ambiance was great. I recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an intimate  setting with friends or a date.  I will definitely come back again!
Come and and eat here it is amazing!  I am coming back next week.  They have an amazing Valentine's day special.

this has been by far one of the best an upmost amazing experiences for me. i will tell you this , the ambiance and energy is amazing. the staff is great, and the food is as fresh as it can be !!!! trust me, i know what fresh food made with love tastes like!!!!
The place is hidden all the way down Court St. but the food is delicious.  We has the short ribs with a side of spinach and tilapia. Both were cooked perfectly.  Will definitely go again.
One of the best steaks I've had in NYC, and for about half the price you'd expect to pay for such quality.

This restaurant is a great little/big spot with a lot of room and backyard seating. The service and attention was excellent, and is what stood out the most. I went with a big group and had the opportunity to taste various dishes, from appetizers to desserts, and they were all delicious.

I have been there for dinner at least 3 times for the past 4 months and they have not disappoint each time. The food is excellent with very reasonable price and the drinks are great as well. The meat are juicy and made just right. The specials for the nights has been something different each time and they are just as good as their regular menu. Definitely worth it!

Delicious foods and even better service! Came here after a coworker recommended it for dinner and boy were we impressed. The cozy space is warmly decorated and the waiters are kind and friendly! We spent hours here drinking wine we ordered various dishes all amazing and tasty but the best was saved for last, we topped off our experience with the fried banana empanada infused with dolce de leche! We will definitely be coming back here!
No comment

Food was great I got the ribeye and my boyfriend got a sausage platter, both were amazing.  Other things we enjoyed were empanadas and mashed yucca.  Everyone there was helpful and friendly too.   Service can't be beat here.

Quaint ambiance with excellent food. My wife and I came here for brunch while in Brooklyn and were very pleasantly surprised. My wife said these were the best Huevos Rancheros she'd ever had and my omelette with chorizo sausage and kale was fantastic!

I was at El Mate again last week. My wife and I are regulars. I love staying at the bar for a glass (or 2) of wine or a cocktail. It's just perfect with a few empanadas and kale salad. We also tried the brunch a few times: simple and delicious. Service is detailed and warm. We have to go back for the meat and the sausage which I have been craving for.
Excellent food and service! Can't recommend it enough. Fernando was kind and warm and made us feel at home.

Sunday brunch with the girls. We had such an amazing time.  Food and the company was great!!!!  Fernando was such a great host, I recommend all to try this place, thank you fernando you rock!!!! xoxxo

Came here for a last minute Mother's Day dinner when many places in surrounding areas were full and no longer taking customers. I am so happy that we came here, it really saved the day. Firstly, I value customer service. The service was top notch, every person working came over to our table to make sure that we were having a good experience. We started our dinner with drinks and appetizers. Sangria, the Brazilian house cocktail, sweetbreads, empanadas... All wonderful. We ordered the meat sampler for two which could easily feed 3, the meats were all tender and seasoned perfectly so you could really enjoy the taste of the meat. It came with two sides, the yucca mash was awesome. For dessert, we had the flan and a dulce de leche crepe that was sent over on the house. I honestly can't say enough good things about this place. I would recommend anyone reading this review to check it out. Five stars, hands down.

Never order here for delivery unless you're paying in cash. We live on the first floor next to the foyer where the mail is dropped off and doorbell is rung. Tonight our order was placed more than an hour before I contacted eat24 and then the restaurant told them 10-15 minutes... 30 minutes passed again and they are now confirming delivery. We live next to the door and the window is wide open! Whoever is confirming this! You should either card your delivery or stop lying! Eat24 will be canceling this order and lying and delivering to wrong people and having other people is bad business practice.  It's tough to not be harsh when the charge is $20 and no food shows up, but thanks to Eat24, no harm was done. Also, thank you Ariel for your response and explanation. I'm hesitant to order delivery, but your food ratings are good, and if I do try your food for the first time since the last time was unsuccessful, then I'll make sure to order delivery with cash only or to dine in.

I was looking for a place to get my empanada fix since my favorite place on the UES closed...happy to report I found it!  Everything was super moist, crust perfectly flaky, nicely done.  Nice ambience--will be back for dinner and the backyard.  Waitstaff very friendly and nice--good date place, has a little bar too.
If you want delicious food and spectacular drinks, come here. Not only is it a gorgeous restaurant, but the people that work here are the welcoming and down to earth people you'll ever meet.
Love this place.  When I'm craving Brazilian - it's the ONLY place I go.  Steaks are out of this world and service is the best - just wish I could get here more often.

This is my favorite restaurant I have ever been to. I ordered the empanadas as an appetizer. Picadillo and chicken. They were both amazing but the Picadillo was my favorite. So flavorful and the outside crust was so perfect! I ordered the strip steak after asking my waitress which she preferred: the strip or the rib eye. I am SO glad I did. It was one of the best steaks I've ever had. It was cooked to medium rare perfection. It had a nice outside crust but the middle was still red. It was so tender and the juice that's formed on the sizzling skillet is TO DIE FOR. I got a side of black beans and rice which were an awesome contrast to the steak and cleansed my pallet. When I first sat down, The Girl from Impenama came on and they continued to play all of my favorite Brazilian jazz all night. When I asked the waitress about the music she said she would go ask the owner. The owner then came out and shook my hand and we talked all about the music and where I was from and it was all just so amazing. It's an absolutely beautiful restaurant. Oh! And I forget to mention I came in at 10:45 and they close at 11! Everyone was so nice and welcoming and didn't seem too terribly upset that I came that late.

El Mate is a great restaurant. I celebrated my birthday here with my wife. The restaurant was quiet and the service was great! We were given 2 free appetizers which were delicious... the best empanada's around! Both of our steaks were cooked perfectly and our sides accompanied very well. We washed the meal down with Malbec's to finish the Argentine evening. They even delivered a free dessert (and sang) for my birthday!

My husband is from Buenos Aires and has by missing Argentine food terribly. Luckily, we found El Mate, which is across the corner from our home. My husband ordered a Milanesa Napolitana, one of his favorite dishes. I felt like there was a lot riding on it.. lest it be a disappointment and leave him even more homesick. Fernando brought the delivery over immediately - honestly, I think in 10 minutes or less. And it was absolutely Delicious!! Really, really good. My husband said (jokingly, I hope) that now that he found this place he can stay here in New York. We are looking forward to dining in the restaurant soon and trying more of their dishes.

This place is so good! The food is superb-- some Argentinian, some Brazilian, ALL GOOD. I have tried the classic Argentine skirt steak and it was one of the best that I have had in the city. I would probably say the same about the empanadas-- I never knew that they could be so good. If you are interested in something besides meat, they have salads that are very fresh and also great. I have never written a review on Yelp before, but their food is so good and the owners are super nice so this place deserves it!

First choice for happy hour in the neighborhood. The food is exceptional - both the Argentine and Brazilian specialties, but the steaks and risotto special in particular. The owners are incredibly friendly and will make you feel at home.
What a fantastic dining experience! Our server offered wonderful recommendations. We couldn't have been happier with the food, service, and cocktails. Will definitely go back, and soon!

Place was absolutely awesome! Went for dinner with three of my girlfriends on a Friday night & from the moment we walked in, we were treated wonderfully. Fernando made us feel like home the second we walked in, showed us to our table, and took our order immediately. The customer service was outstanding, drinks were great, & the food was to die for. We were there from 7:30pm till the time they closed ... & they didn't rush us out!! I will definitely be back. Thank you guys, thank you Fernando, & thank you Santos.

Been coming to this place for awhile and like it.  I live in the neighborhood. The empanadas are great and the Brazilian salad was really tasty.  For dinner I had the chicken dish which bursts with flavor and the accompanying vegetables were spot on.  My husband had the braised short rib special that I tasted and wished I had gotten it.  We each had a Cabernet wine that went well with the meal.  The greeter/bartender, who identified himself as Fernando, was quite pleasant.  He came over after each course to ask if we liked the meal.  I thought that was good. In addition to what I ate tonight, I recommend the beef empanada, the hamburger, and their Pisco sour.

Busy night at El Mate. Nightmare of a crowd. Many men hogging the tables getting ready for a fun night out (if you know what I mean). As the rain was pouring and there was no way out I sat with two beautiful women in this tranquil environment filled with steak, chimichuri and red wine. None of this would be possible, of course, without the amazing host. We felt like we were in a restaurant by ourselves thanks to them. And just as we were biting to down on the flesh of this delicious piece of meat (just as the men sitting next to us were about to do at some local gentleman's club) I realized that this was one of the friendliest restaurants I've been at in years. Excellent food and even better service. And great hugs. Thanks.
Walking by and stopped in for dinner. What good luck. Great drinks and excellent food...especially dessert. Friendly, attentive staff. Worth making the trip in Brooklyn.

My boyfriend and I came here after the place we had originally wanted to go to was closed. We were not disappointed. We both had steak that was cooked perfectly. The service was great and even replaced my boyfriends drink when he was not fond of the type he ordered. Will be coming back!
Was away on vacation and was craving the empanadas and spicy margaritas!!!  The only problem is that even when you know you're full, you don't want to stop.  so happy my friend found this place.
My family and I really enjoyed this Argentine/Brazilian restaurant.  Excellent steaks, truly pleasant service.  Not a light meal, but a good one.

Never had Brazilian food before, would definitely go back. Waiter was attentive, we were a party of 6 and had a variety of appetizers, salads and main coarse plates, we all sampled each others plates and everything was delicious. 2 bottles of wine 6 main coarse, 4 appetizers, 2 salads,  20% gratuity included $296.94. I was so pleased with service & food I gave the waiter an additional $20 tip. We were so full & didn't want desert but the waiter came back with a complementary Tiara misuse which had a delightful mango whipped cream on the side. Lots of garlic, expect dragon breath next day.

Just discovered this place. Finally Brazilian food in Brooklyn! Very authentic and delicious. The owners came to greet us personally and welcome us. Also, there was terrific live music which was a mix of Brazilian bossa nova and American songs. Don't miss the empanadas, the Brazilian Flan desert and the Carioca cocktail. Highly recommended!!
SOOOO good! Super flavorful food and great customer service. I will definitely be back, great neighborhood gem!
Delicious steak, kale, empanadas, burgers, milano cutlets. We all loved it.

Amazing food and ambience. Went with my wife, we had the parrillada for two, it was incredible. We will definitely come again (and again), make sure to try the desserts too, we had the Brazilian flan.

My fiancé and I went to El Mate for dinner after traveling from Staten Island. I've never been there before so I read the reviews and decided to go. We had the calamari which was bland very bland and extremely small pieces. As we were sitting in the backyard dining area preparing to eat our main course, there is a rat running around. I should have just left but instead we finished our dinner inside. I called the restaurant the next day to voice my concern and horrible experience. I asked to speak with the manager and the man said that he is the manager and remembered my fiancé and I. I asked if he was there the night prior and his reply was yes. So I asked why did you not come and personally apologize, the manager said it was out of his control and the rat could have come from anywhere and had it been inside the restaurant then he would have addressed it. Now he did apologize but I WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE despite what the other reviews say. EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK!

I stopped by this place with my wife plus friends and was totally surprised by the quality of food and wine they offer. We enjoyed empanadas freshly prepared by Eduardo and a pork chop as the special of the day! What an experience of south american cooking. What we really treasured is the passion Fernando runs this place. Don't miss the desserts. At the end of our dinner we had 5 bottles of Argentinian sauvignon blanc worth every zip! Malbec will follow next time. We will come back only for the reason to enjoy the lovely backyard of this place!

So, I am a big fan of meat. I love my meat and I respect anyone who knows cook it and bring out all of its essence. I went to this Brazilian/Argentinean place. The costumer experience was incredibly nice, the staff was caring, the environment of the place was super smooth and the food, man that meat was on point! Absolutely coming back.

The interior was beautiful and the food was good, but the real star was Fernando, our waiter, who was very attentive and made our visit very special. He even asked his boss to extend happy hour so we could get two drinks for the price of one. Very kind! We had the steak, the tilapia, and the passionfruit mouse--we avoided the many mate-spiced dishes because we didn't want caffeine as part of our dinner. We do plan to return at lunch to sample the mate dishes!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Most affordable option for outdoor bubble dining we've ever seen! You can reserve a dome without any extra charge and it's a beautiful view. Went in freezing weather and was kept toasty. Food was good and server was polite.
No comment
No comment

Great summer activity with a group or even for a date. Located at Pier 26 in Hudson River Park, overlooking the Hudson River, providing an amazing ambiance to enjoy wine on tap. Variety of wines to choose from. They also serve food, however they do not serve on the rooftop itself. Spacious and a great place to get an instagram photo.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The service was fast and friendly. The fries were delicious and the view was absolutely beautiful however the burger was a bit dry. I order a cooked medium burger and I was not able to finish my burger due to how dry it was.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
We loved it! 5 of us. Great bites and a private dome in the sun. Was great with a child as she was able to walk  around and we weren't disturbing others.

Decided to take myself for a relaxing lunch at City Vineyard. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich with a lovely slaw on it. I also had to try the Brussel sprouts. The food did not disappoint! The chicken was fried to perfection! The Vineyard spritz was delicious too and I have been trying to recreate the drink since returning home. It was light and not too sweet.   I would definitely recommend. Next time I want to try the rooftop seating but I was there too early.
No comment

Good ol City vineyard. This place I have longed to go to for a long time but never had a chance to until yesterday. My guy and I were looking to go somewhere after having oysters at the Grand Banks and we ended up here. We had the duck tacos which were not that great, but the crab Mac and cheese? Wow! It was ridiculously delicious. However, what was most mind blowing about this place aside from my date was Andrew. He literally made an aperol spritz moment that was not so aggressively sweet. I think the best I've ever had. Go here and say hello to Andrew. I suggest going here at night for a more romantic feel.
My Favorite Rooftop Bar in NYC; vast Rose selection overlooking the Hudson (note NOT an NYC view) with standing space conducive of small group conversations. $10 a drink. 5/5 stars as a rooftop.

Giving City a 4 star because of its location. Great space to sit outside and look out into the Hudson River. There is some green space around City also. However, service was slow and not that I'm hung up on drink garnishes, but when you run out of limes for a gin and tonic, don't try to make up for it by putting an orange slice.
No comment
Raw chicken, Chuck E. Cheese pizza, this place is a stomach virus waiting to happen. I do not recommend for anyone trying to have a nice meal

Skip this place at all costs. Wine list is sadly small and virtually no selection of int'l wines (French, italian, etc). Walked in last weekend and front area was empty and waited over 15 mins before someone came to give water. Place was well staffed and staff was chatting at the bar amongst one another but not paying attention to our party. Slow service, bad wine list, why bother?
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Came here yesterday evening to grab a meal with a friend. It was packed, due to it being a gorgeous day in NYC and a Friday evening. That said, we were seated very quickly on the back patio and the ambience was perfect. We only ordered food which was pretty average, but service was good and waiters were courteous and helpful. The drink menu looked pretty good so I'd come back to try it out! I'd say this place is great for meeting up with friends for an evening drink, especially on a nice day, but if looking for amazing food this may not be the spot. But for the other things it offers, definitely worth checking out!
No comment

I had walked past this place a couple times and written the name down in my notes app as a "to try" simply because of how beautiful the location was. When I finally got around to trying it, the experience did not disappoint. I went with a couple friends up to the rooftop, where we enjoyed some really good and reasonably priced wine. I love that City Vineyard has wine on tap that they put into custom reusable wine bottles! I had a poké bowl that was more like poké salad but was absolutely delicious nonetheless. We got to enjoy our wine and food while admiring a beautiful sunset view. 10/10, will be returning.

Hice una reservación 1 semana anticipada para 7:30 pm, llegamos a las 7pm preguntamos si podíamos tener la mesa para esa hora ya que vimos muchas mesas vacías. Nos dijeron que debíamos esperar 7:30, pues volvimos a nuestra hora y nos dijeron que debíamos esperar entre15 o 20 minutos porque no había mesas. Cuando en realidad habían más de 7 mesas vacías. Las mismas mesas que estaban vacías cuando llegamos.Obvio empezamos a reclamar por el tiempo a esperar pues no tenía sentido. Nos hablaron en forma despectiva... En fin después alguien habló con el administrador y al momento nos sentaron. Mal servicio, no hay gran variedad en el menú... soy vegetariana, ordené un Veggie Burger y me lo trajeron regular de carne... fue horrible. en fin no recomiendo el restaurante. Personalmente yo tuve muy mala experiencia.
No comment

Honestly, this place is super overpriced for what you get. We spent a lot of money on a corporate dinner that was mediocre. The food choices were extremely limiting, the portion sizes were very small for what you pay for especially the apps and desert.   The staff was very nice, but the food was average, nothing special about the food at all. There was nothing amazing about this place, it really was all about the view and that is what you are really paying for. The thing that annoyed me the most was the 22% service fee that they add on top of the gratitude. Save your money and do a little research, you can find better because you will not get your moneys worth here.
No comment
No comment

Soo maybe we made the mistake, we went later in the evening and sat outside on the row of tables. We had to switch tables because little mice kept coming to our table. I don't think they have this problem during the day. I ordered the burger it was good, I would definitely recommend getting it. We also got their ceviche it was ok, not too crazy about it. My friend ordered the steak he was really excited about it especially the first few bites, after the 3rd one he wasn't really happy with it. It was just another steak.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Good for a casual outing with friends or co-workers. There is a wine sampler for $20 and cheese/cracker plates available with a view of New Jersey. The rooftop patio can get a bit chilly so definitely bring a jacket in the colder months.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place was a little oasis in the city! We sat on the rooftop bar during sunset and it was lovely. The wine was also good and the food looked delicious (we were just there for a drink). It does get crowded on the rooftop like everywhere else in NYC but we showed up at 5pm and were able to get a table. This was a fun way to feel like you were out of the city for a moment while still getting a waterfront view. The freedom tower is directly behind you as well! I hope to be back.
Great food, great prices, great atmosphere. My only complaint is that I find this place overpriced. But the ambience is gorgeous!
No comment
No comment

I went there with my girlfriend for brunch. We sat on the rooftop under the dome and it was pretty warm. The service was great, food was decent. Overall great experience. I might try them once for dinner.
No comment
No comment

Slow service. Only order a pizza and 2 beers. And bees flying everywhere outside; I'm allergic to them.  Told them to respond to this and it took like 20 minutes to move the plate the bees were hovering around. Never mind it's overpriced as hell. The vibe is uptight. Would not recommend this place.

I really wanted to like this place, but the food was mediocre and with the exception of the young lady who seated us, the customer service was non existent. Most of the staff was on their cellphones and didn't check in while we waited (over 20minutes) for an order of Mac and cheese. We also ordered the wine flight (the Riesling was the best out of the 4). This led me and my husband to make reservations some where else and leave. The fact that the restaurant was almost empty at 6pm on a Friday, should have been a indicator that this place had issues. Management should train their staff on etiquette and customer service.
No comment

A woman was assaulted and robbed at this restaurant and management refused to hand over surveillance footage. Will never give this place my business if they treat their customers like this and allow this to be swept under the rug.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing place!! Loved the ambience, really cool that you can stand in line for a few minutes (15 to be exact) and get a wonderful table right next to the river and have your drinks while the sun goes down. Ok, I digress. Cool ambience, quick service, great choice of wines. Flight was good. Food was okay, nothing exciting. I think it was the ambience that did it for me.
No comment

Attended a private event there on Monday and it was wonderful. Great, friendly staff, a beautiful atmosphere on the water and the food was delicious. I definitely plan to go there again the next time I am in NYC.
My favorite place.    Just need more tables and chairs in upper deck.       Great staff
No comment

This place was awful, despite the views. We waited over an hour for the food to get to the table for a party of 3. The pasta was inedible and the burgers had a lot to be said for them as they had no flavor. We will not be coming again and would not recommend it to anyone.
No comment
Great place for brunch, be ready of your proof of vaccination. Nice water view and the service is quick.
No comment
No comment

I booked the winter dome but they seated me in the one that was on the bottom floor which had no views of the city whatsoever. The dome didn't feel comfortable, the chairs inside was huge and it felt tight inside because each dome had about 7/8 chairs I was only a party of 2. I asked if I can get changed to the winter dome upstairs where you can see the view of Manhattan and they said no since it was full already, so I just decided to have a table inside. The drinks and food was extremely pricey and not worth it. Do yourself a favor if you're a wine lover like me get the flight which is about $20 and you can taste 4 different kinds of wines vs 1 glass for $16. The staff is friendly but the vibes of this place can be better.
No comment
No comment
No comment

So worth the wait and truly exceptional service. Food was really good and very pleased all around. You will be told there is a table time limit due to their outdoor seating and we honestly didn't feel rushed at all. Very impressed and will be back without a doubt. Also purchased 3 bottles of house rose to go. Really delish!!

This place is a perfect place on the water and truly feels a little removed from the big city life. I loved looking out at the water whilst enjoying wine and dinner. The wine flight is a great way to go to save a little money and enjoy all the flavors. Pictured are the burger and the lobster roll, both great. The burger was average, the fries delicious, and the lobster roll perfect.

Not worth a single cent. While this place boasts good views of the Hudson, you are much better off going somewhere else or having a glass of Cab at home. We got the wine flight and could tell immediately that they water down all their bottles, some of the worst wine I've had. The fries were great and were paired with a nice dipping sauce, but that was literally the only silver lining of the entire experience. Other than the fries, they decided to pair the Cabernet with a side of awful service, disgruntled employees, and wobbly tables. I wouldn't give my worst enemy a City Winery gift card.
No comment
No comment

After dining here on Friday April 1st, I accidentally forgot my credit card here. I left a voicemail with my name, explaining I'd like to pick up my credit card, and asked for them to return my call.  Shortly after, I received 3 alerts that someone attempted to use my my credit card at a smoke shop and for public transportation. I had already locked my credit card, so the charges were denied. But it's immoral that someone from this establishment tried to illegally use my credit card after I had forgotten it there, instead of retuning my call and allowing me to come back and pick it up.
No comment
No comment
Only reason we came here was rooftop drinks took two trains and walked a good bit. Roof top wasn't open and servers were rude as can be.
No comment

We were texted 10 min before our birthday brunch plans for a large 10+ party saying the restaurant was bought out, and we now had an outdoor table. That would totally be fine but it was freezing cold outside and they were incredibly rude to us. The woman at the front made it seem like it was our fault bc they texted us 10 min before (while we were in transit there), and we didn't see it. We used to come here all the time bc we love the space but would no longer recommend this place due to some of the staff being rude to customers and the uncertainty of a reservation made weeks prior. The manager and other staff were lovely and did help after 20 min. Make sure to confirm your reservation especially when it's a large party
No comment
No comment

We had a great time on a date night. It's a casual place but really well done with outdoor dining, great selection of drinks and of course wines and a great cheese plate to accompany it. I'm pretty much happy right there. Nice to have different sections and another terrace on the roof, views on the Hudson are of course amazing :) will definitely be back before the summer is out. Tip: nice place to visit when you are going to little island it's very close by.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful views, great wine, friendly and helpful servers, and tasty food made with fresh ingredients.  I got the wine flight and glad thar I did  because the wine I was going to order, while still good. Was my least favorite.  The server helped me choose the tuna sandwich and it was delicious.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Stunning views! The chicken sandwich is amazing and cocktails are pretty strong! This place is a fav of mine.

So I had stopped here with my date to get some drinks and look over the Hudson River.  It has indoor, outdoor, and roof seating The drinks were alright, as we had the Blue Angel and Frozen Mojito. Theyvhad a really expansive wine menu and great decor throughout the restaurant. The brunch menu left a little to be desired as it had very basic American-fare food. However if you are on the lower west side looking for somewhere to grab after work drinks, or doing a wine date night -- I would recommend checking out City Vineyard.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has an amazing view and is right by the water! My friends and I had been looking forward to trying this place. We got there and they said they weren't seating any more people because the kitchen was about to close, but we knew exactly what we wanted to eat and promised not to loiter after finishing our food (they didn't close for another hour and a half) and the host so kindly let us have a table. It was a wonderful experience and the whole staff was so kind.
No comment

We arrived and ordered drinks with truffle fries. Finished drinks and it was over 30 mins before I approached the staff asking about it. I understand it wasn't his fault but the organization at this place is not up to my expectations. I was very disappointed at this place In comparison to the reviews that I read.
No comment

Was really excited to come here and was disappointed in all aspects. It's an overpriced tourist trap. The pictures make it look beautiful but it was nothing like this when we went there. You are seated right next to the free kayak school and there are whistles blowing the entire time. The drinks are very overpriced and not great. The wine flight was difficult to drink. Our waiter was nowhere to be found most of the time. Worse than the atmosphere, the drinks, and our service, was the charcuterie board. I am APPALLED. It was more than $30 and took over 30 minutes to arrive and I can't even begin to describe how not fresh everything on it was. Part of me thinks the waiter took so long to bring it out after he brought us the wine because he wanted us to be tipsy when eating it, so that we didn't notice how old everything was. The meats we're not even edible... they had clearly been sitting opened in the refrigerator for weeks. The ends of it we're hard and beginning to peel. The cheeses tasted off, it came with a few mixed nuts (mostly peanuts) from a CVS tin. It came with stale rye bread, maybe toast it or something? The grapes were nasty. Ugh overall very disappointed.
No one answers the phone...no way to make a reservation... bunch-a slugs what a joke
Ridiculous to pay 15$ for this small glass of sangria ,  half of which is ice. Server was irritated by my question, which made the situation even more unpleasant
No comment

We arrived on a beautiful Saturday afternoon and there was quite a long line (but it moved quickly), only to be told that there are high tops on the other side that are first come / first serve -- you just have to send one person to the bar to order drinks (aka no table service). While my friends said the bar ordering situation was rather chaotic, we did enjoy sitting outside and sipping on some aperol spritz and wine. Might need to return to sample some of their food.

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COST UNLESS YOU WANNA BE SCAMMED. I've lived in NYC for years and this is literally my worst dining experience in the city. Our party had to ask to get our bill THREE times from two different people, and after waiting for 30 minutes just to get the bill, our bill was OVERCHARGED by $12. The item we ordered on the menu was $21 and they charged us $24. Our waiter Brian changed the amount after we asked to check the price. But this is not over... next day when I checked my card transaction at the restaurant I found out I was overcharged by $24. This is simply fraud. I emailed the General Manager Ty Smith of the restaurant. It's been 3 days and I haven't gotten any responses. Now I have to contact the bank to fix it. So for the sake of your sanity, please avoid this place.

My husband and I went for brunch on a Sunday, it was busy but we were seated quickly after waiting in line and checking in. We did the bottomless mimosas and it was worth the price. The food was ok, I didn't even photograph it. Our server was great but I feel like he was the only one waiting on all the tables, poor guy was running back and forth. Overall, we enjoyed our time there, the views from our table was unbeatable
No comment
No comment

Cam here on a Tuesday afternoon around 1pm hoping to get a table for 2 and it was relatively empty, with only 1 person eating inside, and 2 small groups outside. We sat outside and the views of the pier were lovely, I am glad that it is covered just in case there's inclement weather. I forgot our waiter's name, but he was very friendly and helpful, making jokes and even bringing out a small dessert after I told him that it was my bf's birthday. My one gripe with city vineyard is how limited their Lunch menu is. It only has a small fraction of what you see for dinner and the only entrees are a burger, a chicken sandwich, and 1 other item. We both opted for the fried chicken sandwich and it was very delicious. One of the crispiest chicken sandwiches I've had in a while. The fries were done to perfection as well. I didn't love my cocktail (forgot the name), so maybe next time I will just stick to wine. Overall, enjoyable lunch , I just wish they would expand their lunch menu. It's a very pricey meal, so more options would've made me feel better about what I paid in the end.
No comment
No comment
This place had decent food with good drinks and atmosphere. However, they were severely understaffed and very slow. We ordered two pizzas which never came and we're still charged for them.

This is one of my favorite places in the city! I came with friends from Vermont. We had the gazpacho soup and the Charcuterie with cheese. It's so hot today, Brian the server, recommended the frozen mojito. It was amazing! We love this place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This venue does not deserve its location.  We got the worst margaritas I've ever tasted - no tequila, just simple syrup with some vague spice.  In fact, when we asked for an extra shot of the tequila that was in the drink's description, they didn't have it behind the bar.  The kale salad was a scant layer of wilted greens.  The flatbread with burrata and prociutto tasted like it came from Trader Joes.  Somebody new needs to take over this gorgeous space!
No comment
No comment
No comment

City Vineyard was absolutely wonderful! The individual igloos for dining were heated and the views of the Hudson on the rooftop were beautiful! COVID-19 procedures were thorough. Our service was quick and easy and the food was delish. When I say that our server knew what she was doing... she KNEW. We were there for a bottomless brunch and she kept the mimosas coming! None of us really fancied the rosé sangria, but our server said it was a hit or miss with customers. Everything was well worth the price and I had a great time. Definitely recommending and coming back.
Great views, good wine, ok chicken sandwich, fries and bun were cold.
Service leaves much to be desired and not enough bathrooms. Expect to wait at least 40 minutes for bathroom.

The location and vibes of this place are great but I honestly wasn't in love with any of the wines. I tried the wine flight (which I always respect a wine flight on a menu) but didn't overly like any of the choices I received. With that being said, dogs are allowed and it's right on the water with beautiful views so I can't complain.
No comment

This place was amazing. From the view, to the staff, to the food and wine, I am beyond impressed. It's such a wonderful ambiance. Chris is the best and I will be coming back non stop. All I can say is thank you for such an incredible experience and amazing staff. If you're looking for a unique and beautiful experience in the city this is your spot!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Sooooo happy we got to try this spot! They take COVID very seriously and didn't feel uncomfortable for a second. The food was so amazing, in particular, the lobster rolls (impeccable) and the oysters. We did bottomless brunch and although they were out of mimosas the day we were there, it was a blessing in disguise because the (bottomless) sangria is so refreshing and not bitter like typical champagne. Also, somehow our bill wasn't outrageous. Definitely the perfect place to spend a Sunday!

We came here for a birthday dinner and it was ok. I loved the view and the ambiance but for me, there wasn't enough items on the menu for pescatarians or vegetarians. I ordered the kale Caesar salad with shrimp and for 30 I thought it would be better than it was. My friends had the honey pizza and the ratatouille. The pizza was a hit and the ratatouille was just ok. If I came back, I would probably come for the wine flights and the view.
No comment
No comment

Went to City Vineyard for the first time today and it was fabulous!  Location is perfect with views of New York and the Hudson.  What they have done during Covid with 'bubbles' for guests to sit in is extremely clever.  City Vineyard is 'up' on all the protocols so you feel very safe.  Host and wait staff were all wonderful, especially our waiter, Chris, who couldn't have been better!  Very professional and great personality.  All in all a terrific experience!
No comment
We were here to have soMe drinks for ours friends birthday - incredible service on a slow Monday. Highly recommend.

I had the opportunity to return back to City Vineyard with my girlfriend on a Saturday afternoon. We had been biking down the West Side Highway and wanted to stop at a spot for lunch where we could enjoy some river views. I had been to city vineyard once before and recommended we check it out to see if it wouldn't be too crowded. When we arrived we saw a small line formed for temperature checks, however they were still seating people pretty quickly. Once we got to the hostess we were shown to a table in the back with a river view. The majority of the tables were filled and it looked like we had come during a rush. Regardless we were given menus and water and allowed time to look over the menu. I ordered the city vineyard burger ($16) while my girlfriend got the crispy chicken sandwich (15). Both were HEARTY to say the least. Really well made but make sure you have lots of napkins on hand cause these sandwiches get messy. Overall this was a great dining experience, food was on point, and the restaurant took the necessary precautions to make patrons feel safe during the times of COVID.
No comment

Nice margarita flatbread, nice beer. Perfect location, especially the outdoor seating. Worth a visit. Would I keep returning though? Probably not. The food menu is not that exciting and doesn't have enough options.
No comment

Really loved coming to City Vineyard! They have a great waiting system, and take COVID precautions seriously by doing a screening survey and taking down your information for tracing. We were seated within 10 minutes from the time that we got there, so they have the process down. We had the Strawberry Fields cocktail carafe, which was extremely refreshing on a Summer day. Although I liked that drinks were served in biodegradable cups, I would have liked to see glassware. Cocktails were very good, despite it being a winery. We ordered the vineyard elote, which was seasoned and charred very nicely, and shared both the city vineyard burger and the crispy chicken sandwich. Both were very good, and came with a big portion of fries. Overall, everything was incredibly fresh, and the service was top notch. The outdoor atmosphere was very nice, and was really relaxing to sit by the water by sunset. Great date spot!
No comment
No comment

Decided to check this place out. Saw they had a great view of the Hudson and downtown. So came to try it out. First they take your temperature, ask you if you've had symptoms or have been In contact with anyone with COVID -19. And they take down everyone in your parties name and phone number for contact tracing purpose. They have QR code's for the menu. When I decided on food I got the chicken sandwich which was awesome. Highly recommend and their Belgian fries were season really well. Great beers. Nice spot to try if you're around the area. Only downside is that you have to find street parking because this is on a pier.
No comment
Great service during COVID times! Felt really safe and service was amazing. Nothing can beat this amazing view!! Matt Pete and Steve were amazing!! 100% recommended!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Would love to give this place more stars because of the beautiful view and our wonderful server, but our experience was soured right after sitting down by the manager, Jamell. We were seated at an outdoor dome that we were perfectly content with, when our server asked if we would like to move over to a dome with a heater. Of course we accepted and moved, but within minutes Jamell stormed up to us and demanded we move back, dishing out some serious attitude while we were confused and dumbfounded. We tried to explain that our server told us to move, but she insisted on being rude and unprofessional. Our server had to apologize on her behalf, pretty sad.
This place is amazing - amazing views, fantastic service! Stephen and Matthew took great care of us. Felt like an oasis with everything going on in the world
The best place in the city! Crowd is super chill, beautiful view, great staff. Open for outdoor seating especially now very important. Plenty of room. Highly recommend.

Terrible service!!! Gorgeous Saturday afternoon. Walked to the Pier and this place is pretty crowded. Lots of bros and Instagram crowd looking people. But whatever - you find that everywhere and I just wanted a drink on a beautiful summer day. Got a table right away with my dog (kudos for being dog friendly). A server (not my server) also brought a water bowl for dog right away (again kudos). For this - 1 star. Things started to go downhill from there. We ordered a couple of drinks and informed the server that we would probably only do a few drinks and not food. She abruptly told us that downstairs was "full service" only (a laughable concept as you'll see), and drinks only were upstairs so she could close our tab and we could move upstairs. This is a stupid rule IMO because this place isn't fine dining. I'm not stealing a table from people that are gonna spend $$$$$ on food. Everyone knows drinks are the money maker so if we have 4-6 drinks total, guarantee we're spending more than lots of people here getting food and maybe non alcoholic drinks or cheap drinks. But regardless, we're pretty laid back people - no problem, I said. We'll get some drinks and an app. Everything went downhill from there. We got our palomas. Even ordered a bottle of sparkling water to make sure we were spending enough to justify our existence there. Ordered tuna tartare. After that, our server literally walked by us maybe 20 times and never checked in on us or asked us if we needed anything. I mean, we didn't even get silverware or plates for the tuna tartare!!! And yes, I did try to make eye contact and raise my hand as she walked by but I wasn't going to tackle her to get some acknowledgement. It was completely absurd. Full service???? You have to eat if you sit on the ground level - but don't expect full service! At least not from our server. I would have ordered more drinks too. The drink and food (that I had to eat with my hands) were actually fine - 1 more star for that. But the service was so absurd, I can't imagine why you'd come here unless you are a desperate bro or desperately need material for your Instagram account.
