NYC still alive! Amazing and delicious food, beautiful view, full bar, and hot runner around. Lol. But who made this experience wonderful was Steven our server. He helped us to make great choices and the service was outstanding. If you want to feel the NYC fire, this is the spot. Say hi to Steven.
No comment
No comment

After a playdate, in which the baby was mostly asleep, a friend and I took our kiddos here for lunch. A beautiful outdoor sitting area, rooftop bar, great views of the Hudson and JC across the way. Complimentary bread w/ butter and olive oil, a decent kids menu. Prices seemed reasonable. I went with a starter margherita flatbread and was not disappointed. The sauce was light and sweet, flatbread (flat bread sp?) was thin and crispy topped with roasted tomatoes and baby basil. It was so so yummy and for an appetizer portion, made a perfect lunch portion. Will need to come back and try a few other things next time. Service was phenomenal.
This place is beautiful in the summer. Really nice location overlooking the river. The price is good for nyc and the bartenders are very nice.

Unfortunately this place gets away with a lot because it's got a buzzing atmosphere and is a great place to watch the sunset. Drinks service is always pretty slow and am yet to go with anyone who has really enjoyed their food there. But definitely worth a stop if you want a good pic of sunset over Jersey.
Update: they said to contact for a refund of the overcharged money and they never responded. So they are also not trustworthy.
Terrible, slow service and mediocre over priced food.  Don't bother.  Also they are often closed for events, so check before you make your way all the way out there.
To summon- nothin more then a cheap diner food and watered down so called "no ID in a plastic cup cocktail" but with a Hudson view.... Not even mediocre..which is really sad since the view is great!
No comment
Amazing service, amazing scenery, amazing server Will. The hospitality was great. Come during sunset, great views! Many drink options that are all delicious. Great food as well!
Amazing service, waiter (Will) and festive cocktails!  Perfect for the season & the vibes are exactly what we were looking for.

I live near this place so was hoping to like this place. Came by with a family Friday afternoon. Service was not good, had to call for a waiter multiple times. Ordered tuna tartare which was ok but the steak was almost unedible as it was too hard to chew. Was evident that the meat was of low quality and was probably the worst steak I've had a chance to eat at restaurants.  Great ambiance though.

Beautiful location, but the service was insane. I think we just got stuck with a server having a rough day. Everything we asked for was either unavailable or never given to us. He forgot our drinks, our silverware, and our food was incorrect. Mind you we just ordered the burger, nothing complicated. When we received the bill it still had a charge for the pellegrino we never received. It was crazy. But again, could be a really nice spot if you have a good server. Sending a prayer to that guy, he was struggling.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I went to City Vineyard for the first time today and will definitely return. The location couldn't be better, the food was excellent, the host and wait staff top notch! Chris has been mentioned a few times by others and I can see why--he is very professional, friendly and handles his job with great enthusiasm! I will definitely return!

Loved this place! Unfortunately the rooftop is closed until June but the food was great I had the cheeseburger & my boyfriend had the steak fries! The outside seating area was beautiful, you have a great view of  the water. Customer service was great so overall I give 5/5 stars!! Will be coming back

The food at this spot is okay, but the view is amazing. If your visiting nyc, I would recommend coming here for dinner just for the great view. It's right on the pier, and you can see the skyline perfectly. The pier is also very pretty and clean.
We love this place and Stephen and Matt P are the best bartenders!! So fun and always get you what you want!
Great place for groups, beers & wine. Not the best place for kids, the rooftop opens April 1st
No comment
Flor was amazing! Reminded me of back home and feeling welcome. Thank you for the hospitality
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I can't wait for summer and to get back to City Vineyard! Thus restaurant is so gorgeous and right on a pier along the Hudson, with a beautiful view of Nee Jersey. You can see some incredible sunsets that I highly recommend! I've had a bite to eat and the food is good, but what always brings me back are the drinks and the views! There's a great post work drinks crowd here in the summers.
No comment
No comment
Nice outdoor ambiance. The drinks and food are both good. Nothing exceptional but doesn't pretend to be. Respectable spot for after work drinks and light food.

We got caught in the middle of a terrible rain storm.  At 7pm, they let adults in but would not let children in out of the rain.  It was inconsistent and unkind.  The hostess actually stood in front of the children and declined them, but let others in . They said they were at capacity, but were not. They watched small children get soaked to the skin.
No comment

City Vineyard is a nice place to come and enjoy a nice glass of wine with a beautiful view. Sunset is the best time to be there. The service was excellent, and so was the food. I had the salmon, and it was cooked to perfection give it a try for any occasion.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We are more than ecstatic to recommend this restaurant with a very relaxed/ sophisticated outdoor environment and very friendly service. Stephen from City Vineyard took care of us and his hospitality and persona completed the atmosphere we were looking for during our dining experience today. Our Kale/ Mediterranean salads were very well made and we couldn't be happier with our dining experiences today. 10/10, we'll be here again for our next visit! As a street photographer I really enjoyed the visual aesthetic of the outdoor dining area as well!

Just finished dinner here! We got an igloo in the upper deck. Really nice place with fantastic views of the hudson and liberty one tower. U feel ny here. Their domes or igloo like tables outside have heating and the waitress was super diligent to close it to avoid cold but also she tried very hard to not step inside.. very careful w covid. I was very happy  w that. Also the host didnt even get in the elevator w us so we wld ride alone. We were only the 4 of us family celebrating my daughters bday in some pandemic possible safe manner.  Heater was not like indoors but kept it ok to be outside. Food was ok (dinner) .. no coffee tho. They shld offer some hot bevs given the weather.. my kids wanted hot chocolate!  All in all really good experience!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Things that are great about this place: The views. God, the views are glorious. They just started showing movies on their roof during warmer months. Or I just found out they do this. I came in recently to see Clueless and it was an alright experience. People were communal and willing to share tables for our party of three. There isn't a lot of beer (2 light beers) on draft, which is your cheapest option - $10, a few bottled beers and ciders. The wine is what gets me at being marked up to $14. I believe all of their wine on the roof is even on tap. My pinot noir was cold and just unremarkable. It also wasn't worth $14 to me in my opinion as I had just come from Morton's and the happy hour pinot noir there was even light years better for half the price. I'm unsure if they have a happy hour. It's listed as a menu online but other reviewers say there is none. It may be a bit crowded but more worth your value to try more wines earlier in the evening at a reasonable price if that's the case.
No comment

Went here for the first time my GF's birthday. We sat in one of the plastic bubbles on the roof which was festively decorated. Our server Aaron was attentive and kind. Service was great and the food was pretty good too. Great oysters and shrimp cocktail. Split a flatbread and burger with the GF and both were tasty.
No comment

First time here not in the summer and I was blown away! Came in right before sunset. Two friends and I sat in the back on the couches and was greeted by bartender Erin. She took great care of us! We love the rose on tap and ended up getting two bottles. Will continued to take care of us through the night and ended up staying later than planned. Will be back soon! Highly recommend.

To start off the hostess asked for our vaccination card which I find invasive of my family and I'd privacy and even asked for proof. The drinks are water down, the food looks like your typical frozen section, and the staff only cares about you when they feel like it. The only decent thing to eat were the brussel sprouts and the cheese board but even with the board they barely have any bread. Highly wouldn't recommend unless you want to pay for the view.

Do not recommend this place! They don't take reservations. Waited 90 minutes just to get a table and did not even get a table with a view. Saw RATS running around inside the restaurant. Ordered Lobster Rolls and never received them, even though everyone else got their food. Couldn't complain to anyone because the waiter only came to the twice - to take our order and to give us our bill. Horrible horrible experience!

Our experience at City Vineyard was awesome! Especially Aaron!! He was funny. Food was excellent and drinks were even better. Recommend the oysters and the lobster Aaron-cini ;) We sat in the domed tables outside and they were very warm.

Just went to this location for the tuna tartar and oysters and got food poisoning. Tuna did not taste fresh at all and had a fishy taste. Would not recommend any of the raw bar items since they clearly have a sanitation issue.

Cool place to grab a drink after work when the weather is nice. Came here during the summer when it was warm out. The bar upstairs didn't have cocktails, only wine, beer, and they had a canned hard kombucha. Prices are what you'd expect for New York. Enjoy the sunset lighting up the sky and surrounding buildings. Also enjoy the view of the water, just remember when you are taking your Instagram photos that across the river is just boring New Jersey, so it's nothing special to photograph.

Came here pre-COVID and it was amazing!! Definitely a bit pricey but the food was so good, and the frosé's were absolutely amazing. The staff was so nice and accommodating. You also can't beat the views. Afterwards we were so full and decided to walk along the river and enjoy the warm weather. We're definitely going to have to take a trip back.
Def a nice vibe, beautiful scenery. The drinks are great as well. A bit pricy but it's def worth it. Especially for like a date night.
No comment
Matt p was very kind, very nice greeting when took our order. From Cali felt very welcomed  how to come here again

I came here on a Sunday afternoon with my friends and it was lovely! A bit difficult to get to because it is so far west but it is worth it. The roof deck was not very crowded which was nice and has a great view of the Hudson. One con is that it gets VERY hot on the roof, they have lots of umbrellas but fans/misters would have been even better! You cannot get food on the roof but can go inside to eat.

Put our name down for a 40 min wait - no one picks up the phone when you call so couldn't make reservations before hand. There was not really a menu except for snacks and drinks, nothing for vegetarians. Brussel sprouts had run out, the fries were equivalent to a McDonalds small size and the corn was on a cob - so pretty hard to eat. Not really impressed with the menu at all. Pelligrino had run out also. Except for the location, people watching, and views it's not worth visiting again. Left hungry.

Was pleasantly surprised about how thorough they were at the front door with health screening -- definitely made me feel safe. Right now they have "indoor" dining in secluded plastic bubble igloos with space heaters. It's still a little chilly so bring a sweater but definitely bearable considering it was 30 degrees outside. Food is decent. Fish and chips didn't come with a ton of fish (two pieces) but each piece was perfectly cooked. Highly recommend the oysters. Great service from Aaron and the rest of the staff!
No comment
We had such a great time. Not only was the food amazing, be sure to try the the short rib tacos,  but our waiter Matty P was fantastic! We will be back for sure.
No comment

Our waiter was very kind, but honestly the food was disgusting. Much better options nearby. Took 45 minutes to get a Caesar salad that looked like it was tossed together in seconds. 14 dollars?? ehhhh... awful experience
City Vineyard is a great spot for drinks, good food, and an amazing view. Came in today and had Matt P as a server. He took great care of us. Will definitely be back. Short rib tacos were so yummy!
No comment
No comment

Great venue and very spacious. The view is amazing and picture worthy. Great place to have engagement parties or even farewell parties. There is space upstairs where they can make it private for those who have private parties. There's a bar upstairs and downstairs. You can sit and drink on both levels as well as stand and look at the view with your drinks!
No comment

City Vineyard has done an amazing job during COVID. I felt super comfortable, safe, and enjoyed that the space was clean and spaced out without ruining the ambiance, which was beautiful. Our server Macon was so helpful and fun. Definitely recommend!

Amazing location and fantastic service. The restaurant is on the Hudson river overlooking the ground zero and Jersey side. Definitely one of the best views that only NYC can offer and they do a nice job presenting it. I went for the concert/dinner and had an amazing time. Having amazing dinner and drinks with great crowd listening to a funny talk show was just perfect. It's a vineyard but actually in my opinion, food was better than the wines I tried. Menu price isn't too bad for its location/popularity. Portions are huge too. Paella is a must. I've never seen paella with so much seafood like City Vineyard. It had like 10 scallops and 10 jumbo shrimps and lots of calamari and mussels. It was amazing. The staff here are so nice and attentive as well. I'd love to be back for the rooftop next year.
No comment
Great for brunch or dinner with groups. Food is always spectacular and views make it special. Also great for private events. Particularly love their salads, burger and pastas.
This place has such a beautiful view, we watched the sunset over the water. The service is excellent with such friendly, warm staff. The oysters were excellent! Will definitely be back!

They were insistent on not extending our 90-min stay even though it was empty and we were the only patrons at the time. I thought that was odd. Other than that, the place is great and very Covid-friendly. Wine was good. Kung Pao Cauliflower was delicious. I'd come back during the Summer to check it out again.

Went here on my way back to my hotel and I was blown away by how great this place was. Everyone was so nice from the host to especially my waiter Chris. The drinks were amazing thanks to the bartender Carlos. I definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting NYC or anyone who wants delicious drinks and food with a great view. Chris truly made my experience in nyc one to not forget! 10/10 would recommend!
Such a beautiful view. Food and service was great. My only pet peeve was the drinks were wayyyyy too small and overpriced and not many food options. Other than that I would definitely go back.
No comment

Firstly, the view is amazing, and the fact that the rooftop igloos don't cost extra is truly a gift. The food is pretty good - it's on the pricey side, but the portions are fairly big. The service was great as well, and i would definitely recommend going!

Stopped in to have lunch but there wasn't really anything that was gluten free that sounded good to me so I just had a glass of the rosé on tap. Very nice wine list and nice to see upstate (Fingerlakes) NY wines on the menu.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The ambiance and the view were very very nice. Me and 3 friends came here for brunch and it took 20 minutes for a waiter to come and even bring us water (brunch opens at 12pm and it was only 12:35 so it was busy but not ridiculously busy). Then, as we were ordering we were told they didn't have any flatbread pizzas which is one of the main foods on the menu. When our food came out it was cold, my friend ordered the chicken and waffles and the waffles were uncooked in the centers and had to be sent back after he took one bite. I personally won't be returning but hopefully others have a better experience!

Amazing spot!!! The best views ever. So beautiful! The food is also great - we started with a drink upstairs while we were waiting for our table. The frose is delicious! For dinner we started with the shrimp cocktail which was perfect. I then had the fish tacos! Great overall - service was quick and one of my favorite spots in city
Very good bottomless brunch on the water!! We had great service. Justin was our server and very accommodating. Will be back!

Great view, scenery, location and food. We stopped here on a Saturday afternoon and were pleasantly surprised to be seated right away. It definitely sounds like you would need a reservation for a larger group (There were only 3 of us). We sat inside because it was pretty hot and sunny that day and we had just walked quite a bit. Extremely fast and efficient service and the staff were all very nice and accommodating. Our server even brought me a glass of ice for my water bottle before we left. Several very clean, individual restrooms here too and a lovely bar and decor inside. I cannot remember the name of my drink but it was delicious. I had a lobster roll and it was very tasty and fresh. I would love to return for brunch next time I am in town.

We stumbled upon this place while looking for a place to grab lunch during our bike ride. They had takeout only as we are currently in the COVID pandemic. The menus were in multiple areas and we ordered and paid for our food all online. Food took about 10-15 minutes. We ordered 2 burgers (came with fries) and a pitcher of margaritas. First off the container they put the margaritas in was so cool and travel friendly (again we were on bikes) and the burgers were packaged perfectly. We took our food and found a nice spot in battery park on the grass. Cracked open the food and the burger was large and juicy, fries were delicious as well! The margaritas were outstanding, we wound up a little buzzed after that pitcher so we just hung out on the grass till we were good enough to get back safely on our bikes. What a great place, we will definitely be back!
No comment

City Vineyard was absolutely delightful! They have a rooftop but it's chilly outside so we sat inside and had a lovely view of the harbor. Flor was out server, she was fantastic! We got a vegetarian spread of flatbread and a French omelette which she helped us pick out.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Im only giving this place 2 stars because out first waitress was really nice. Other than that they really could use more than 4 types of food on their menu on a Sunday afternoon.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The best way to end a run along the west side is by popping over for a touch less beer order. New York summer sun, a light sweat and the sense of accomplishment that comes from completing an aerobic activity is worthy of a celebratory beverage at City Vineyard. And the staff, shaded seating, and good music are all to boot.

My friends and I came here and I can't say enough good things about Matt P! He was so attentive to our needs! I had the short rib tacos which were amazing! We sat outside and enjoyed the weather and amazing view! They took our temp upon arrival which put us at ease. We will definitely be back!

The view is incredible and the service is even more incredible. They make you feel so safe with the wellness check as you enter, and give you the space you need. I went here with a close friend and our server, Matt P, made us feel special and attended to is with kindness recommended some amazing food. Highly recommend coming here.

column3: Palm Valley Sunrise Wigwam, Goodyear, AZ
column6: This place has the absolute best service & food!! ask for will, he's the best! the winter domes are a necessity if you are going to dine here!
No comment
No comment

Wonderful lunch on the patio following a visit to Little Island, a short walk away. Our group had burgers, pizza and a poke bowl all excellent. Wines of course (rose). Although we sat outdoors, the inside dining rooms were very inviting as well.
These guys are doing an amazing job with socially distanced tables and the best frosé. Stephan and Matt P provided the best experience! Big thanks to them.
City Vineyard had great views and a great brunch menu. Really enjoyed my time with Flor!

Love the setting! Food is good. Hard to beat wine and food on the Hudson. There are dairy free and gluten free options but not many. Vegan options are a pretty limited here. Service could use some work. Also they had a bit of a gnat problem. All that said, this is definitely a place you want to find yourself for happy hour over the summer.
No comment
No comment

I reached out to City Vineyard after securing a reservation in one of their Winter Domes for my parents' 30th anniversary. My parents are strictly kosher and love red wine. They were able to get a kosher bottle from their partner City Winery and prepare a fully raw, vegan charcuterie board (both off the menu) for my parents' celebration. Jamell and the team there were super patient with me and all of my questions and went so above and beyond to make this such a special occasion for my parents -- a memory they will cherish for a lifetime. The customer service and the COVID experience (private, heated dome) were both exceptional, and I would highly recommend the Winter Dome to anyone looking for a special experience. Thank you again for everything! 10/10!
No comment

This is a great spot for happy hour, late nights, or live music. It's waterfront and has good happy hour deals. This is a fun area and it's very pretty. Flor helped us out and she provided great service! This will be excellent during the summer months and there's a rooftop view of all the buildings.
I'm so glad this place is open during covid. Stephen was very professional, strict rules were followed for everyone's safety, service was great and perfect summer ambiance!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great spot for after work drinks or dinner! Been a go-to during Covid for to-go cocktails and a stroll on the west side highway.
Great vibe and good food. Loved it here! Service was friendly and the menu had some nice options for brunch. Not expensive either.
No comment
No comment
I'm so glad city vineyard is open! I had a fantastic experience, thanks to Matt P and Macon! We had the BEST time and can't wait to come back :)
Come for the bottomless mimosas, stay for Justin! Great experience thanks to that guy
No comment

The service was wonderful and catered to everyone accordingly. However the prices were unreasonably high, 10$ for an angry orchard?? It's basically juice. Also I ordered the shrimp special that supposedly came with couscous and it was just a handful of baby greens with a soon full of lentils and shrimp. Not a sufficient or correct meal. Will not be returning.
No comment
No comment

Had a very lovely time here, the area by the water is very nice and our waiter Luca was lovely and very attentive. A little on the expensive side, but you're paying for the atmosphere. One side of the menu is drinks and the other side is food and there's a good selection of everything to perfectly enjoy your summer day. It's also dog friendly, which is great.

Colossal shrimp cocktail decent rosé by the bottle and relax views of the Hudson.  GO THERE ! Awesome date night spot .. I know because i was watching all the couples make out while my friend and I downed 3 bottles of rose !

Our first time at City Vineyards was a smashing success! Matt P was our waiter and gave us 5 star service! He recommended the chicken sandwich and the short rib tacos as well as the frosé. We immediately ordered all of his recommendations and we loved them all! The tacos were flavorful and tender and the chicken sandwich was packed full of flavor too! We really enjoyed our time here and will be back often! Thanks City Vineyards!
Shoutout to our awesome server Adam at City Vineyard! We had the best time after mini golf. The food, drinks and service were amazing. Such a great atmosphere! Thank you!
No comment
No comment
Good drinks but the $20 cheese plate felt like the kind of thing you'd expect wrapped in cellophane at a grocery store
No comment
No comment

Great view and great service. We sat in the patio and our waiter, Brian couldn't have been more attentive. We all had a whiskey apple drink that was fantastic. The fish tacos were really fresh and the fries were amazing!

Terrible chicken sandwich and they didn't listen to a single one of my comments. I asked for no honey sauce because I'm allergic and they put it all over my sandwich. I also asked for ice water and they didn't give me that either. Fries were cold and undercooked. Also Way too overpriced

Top notch service!! Our waitress Flor was simply amazing!!!! This place is also outstanding, the food and the music was on point!!!! We are going back next week with friends! Thank you for an amazing night with great Paella, wine and live jazz!
Beautiful scenery, friendly staff and delicious food. We ordered the margarita flatbread, organic free range chicken, the vineyard burger and plenty of other food all was delicious!
Great and safe atmosphere with delicious food. Beautiful views of the water, felt great sitting outside. Took extreme measures to ensure safety during COVID Macon was an awesome server!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Fantastic service, food, drinks, and views! The entire staff was attentive and more than following all recommended Covid guidelines. We felt extremely safe and relaxed the entire time. Matt P was an exceptional waiter and took care great care of us the entire afternoon. Will definitely be back! Thank you!
This is a little gem right on the water and would definitely go for a casual day outing. Although the service was slow and the menu limited the food was delicious and the drinks were okay.
No comment

I can't say enough about the staff at city Vineyard they are just fabulous. The manager came over probably three times she actually was a waitress acting as a manager that evening and totally deserves the job. Our waiter was super friendly helpful and understood and went with our humor we greatly appreciate it as we were drinking and drinking and drinking. The snacks that we got were excellent definitely go for a cheeseboard definitely try one of their drinks you don't have to get wine here the views are amazing inside and out
In the age of eating and drinking outside, there's no better place to be than City Vineyard. Incredible views and amazing service. If you're lucky you'll get Matt P. or Stephan.
Looking for a great wine bar on the water? Look no further! City Vineyard has gorgeous interiors and an even better patio. David was our waiter - such a a gem! Well definitely be back.
As always... beautiful views and great service. Thank you Matt and Stephen. A great day with a great friend! (social distancing and masks the entire time)

The concept is great. The views alone make it a nice place to hang out on the water and have some drinks. They have draft wine which always appeals to me. I did like their rosè, but the petit verdot was just okay. As for the food, I only had two flatbreads, so I can't comment about rest of it, but I wouldn't recommend them. Honestly, they were pretty bad, which is the reason I am giving 3 stars. The service was very good though. Overall, I would go back, but not get the flat breads.
No comment
No comment

Our waitress was Flor and she really made my birthday so special. She went out of her way to make sure we were taken care of and even brought out a cake and two rounds of Prosecco on the house. The scenery on the patio was unmatched. Will definitely come back again. Thanks!!
No comment

Came here for drinks recently. It was a Saturday night and was a bit crowded so the service at the bar was a bit slow. Overall it's a nice location with pretty views of the river. The outdoor bar didn't have any specialty cocktails which was unfortunate.

She floored us all!! LololFlor is the best. Its my birthday let alone Womens international day and i had the best service and she kept the mimosa cominggg ~ :) thank you so much for the fast and responsive service on cue!

Wine was reasonably priced for the area. The gimmick is the wine on tap from their own winery. We chose 750ml of Sauvignon Blanc this time and it was a good balance of dry and floral notes. We sat at the bar, which gets crowded very quickly. The views are great and I loved that they retracted the roof when the sun was setting. The staff can be a hit or miss. Some are really friendly and others are dismissive. They just recently opened so perhaps these are just early day hiccups. They also probably didn't realize how popular it would become with the surrounding companies around. The food menu is very limited and pretty pricey so we would only return for the drinks.
Really good drinks (preferred the Quarantiki)!! Did a temperature check on the way in and felt very safe. Will definitely be back - new favorite weekend spot!!

Perfect for a glass of wine after work in the summertime.  Gorgeous environment to hang out with friends on the roof.  The spectacular view of the World Trade Center and the jersey skyline definitely set the tone for the rest of the night.  Didn't try the food, but would definitely come back for dinner sometime on a romantic date.  Wine was very good and it was awesome to see them use wine taps straight from the barrel instead of bottles of wine.

I absolutely LOVE city vineyard - Lucas was such a sweet waiter!  We adored the oysters and charcuterie board.  We highly suggest pairing the apps with a rose spritzer.  We also enjoyed the fries and risotto balls.  If you're looking for a gorgeous view, delicious food, and quality drinks - this is the place to be! Cheers!!

Such a great spot on a warm sunny day overlooking the Hudson. But also near impossible to get a table on a gorgeous day! Always packed. Highly recommend sitting outside with a bottle of Rosé, oysters, and a salad. My friend had the crispy chicken sandwich which was amazing. Can't go wrong with most of the menu. Hope to get a seat again one day
Amazing spot on the water - a guaranteed good time. Fantastic wine selection and bites! 10/10 recommend.
Stephen and Matt P made our experience amazing here. Great views and their house made rosé was delicious!

What's not to like about this place to grab a drink outside (i didn't have the food so can't comment on that). Good selection of beers on tap and obviously a great selection wines by the glass.  Service was fine. And the view is great.  On a Friday night it was packed but not too crowded where I was annoyed.  Def would go back

Stumbled on this place while walking down the west side on a Saturday afternoon and it was bumping! The place was packed. We went to the second floor and grabbed a drink from the makeshift bar in the back but then there wasn't really a place for us to sit.Its definitely a place to come with a large group early enough to claim a space. Water views are great. It's obvious a 20 something's place where lots of selfies are taken. Would be back with more friends because it's apparently the trendy place to be!
No comment
Great bar! Will Kenderson and Carlos Kennedy Lopez are great bartenders. Get the tiki chance on me.
No comment

I love this place. It was a gorgeous day in New York and perfect to sit outside. The food was delicious and they also offer free kayaking. We started out with some margaritas and the Rose and tequila cocktail. Followed by some soppressata flat bread. I order the croque Madame and my friend had the shrimp cocktail and french fries. We devoured everything.
Paella is unbelievable! The best I've ever had! Trust me! The seafood are the freshest you can get in there!!! Absolutely surprised!

First time at City Vineyard and it was a treat! If you're looking for a place to soak in the nice weather while sipping amazing wine, this is the spot for you. Also, the food is delicious so it's a place where you can relax for hours. 5 stars for City Vineyard!!!!!
No comment
Our drinks were great and Macon and Matt were even greater. The views were awesome and we had a wonderful evening overlooking the water. Be sure to get the frozen drinks!

I was excited to come here to try the wines on tap as well as enjoy the water views. While the views did live up to my expectations, I can't say the wines were anything special. We came on a Friday night, so I shouldn't be surprised that the rooftop was absolutely packed. If you come during prime happy hour, it's highly unlikely you'll get a table/seat upstairs. It might be nicer on a calmer night when you can get a seat and really enjoy the views and sunset.
Crowded on a friday but the upstairs terrace has enough space to move around..enjoying one of the city's best sunset views!  def coming back

Came here for brunch as a party of four ladies a few days after Christmas. We sat in the enclosed outside space and it was perfectly warm and not too crowded. Good wine, good food and good service - the mulled wine especially. Thanks Brian!
No comment
No comment
No comment

City Vineyard is a really beautiful restaurant with great views including a rooftop patio. The food we fine, nothing too special and unfortunately the service wasn't very good. We had to ask multiple times and various waiters to bring us water and allow us to order to which they would all just pass off to someone else. They have a very wide range of wines to select from so it's a great place to go during the warmer months and enjoy the patio and wine so hopefully they step up their service!
No comment
No comment

My first visit to City Vineyard. My friend recommended this spot. A nice chill vibe by the waterfront, great views, drinks and service. Brian recommended items from the menu and drinks, also mentioned this is the place to be when it warms up in NY. #rooftop! I will be back!!

Not a fan. Came here on a rainy Saturday and it was pretty empty. There was people in the outside area but they told us that because it was raining they didn't want us outside. Come up with a better excuse. They seemed hesitant to sit us even though the inside was pretty empty except for a few groups. Claimed it was because many of the tables were reserved yet by the time we left, many of the tables around us were still not taken. We were told we have to order food if we sat after we sat, why not before when we were waiting? This might have been a good thing since we ended up getting mussels, which was actually really good. We split a bottle of their vineyard's sauvignon blanc and it tasted pretty watery. Won't be returning.

My friend brought me here for my birthday dinner and I totally understand why. Food is amazing at a very affordable price.. Special shoutout to Flor who has made us feel very comfortable  We would definitely come back often.
Came here with my mom one afternoon and enjoyed some wine on the patio. She loved it so much she asked me to "find it for [her] on Yelp" a week later. ;)

My wife and I have been wanting to stop in for some time now and got the chance to do so for our 5th Anniversary brunch. I have to say, we were blown away by the food! We enjoyed the omelette and lobster Mac n' Cheese. Both were amazing, light and fresh, but the lobster Mac n' Cheese was one of the best we have ever had! Add in the fresh and bright sparkling wine by City Winery; wonderful Hudson views and exceptional service by Flor, it made for a must do NYC experience, one we will do again very soon!
Great service, wine and ambience! Best way to watch the sunset in the city. Got the Rose and Cab Sav, both were great.
No comment

Certainly a great spot by the Hudson River to check out the sunset....they didn't have dining outside unfortunately (true, it was freezing outside so I don't blame them) but we were sat on the "indoor" patio. It was cozy and a pleasant spot to grab a drink while soaking in the view. Worth checking out!
Outstanding location, food, and service. Right on the water. We had Stefana as our waitress and she was very helpful with suggestions. Highly recommend stopping here for a drink, lunch, or dinner.
Nice river front dining with a healthy menu and excellent cocktails.  Rooftop bar with a great happy hour vibe.  Perfect start to our weekend in NY.
Burgers were amazing. Tried and loved the chicken sandwich too. Waiter was Matt P.  And service was phenomenal. Seriously go for him. Also covid policies which I like.
Went there with my co-workers for a happy hour and had a blast.  Andy is the man!!  Super friendly and helpful! Great customer service!  Will be back next week for sure!  Beautiful views, tasty food.
Took 20 to have a server come over, everything came out at once(apps+main), server was friendly, but not a very good experience. And expensive for the quality. Great view though!
Uninspired food. OK drinks that took awhile to get there. Better places with good views.

Incredible! The service, Steve was perfect, the food, shrimp cocktail and lobster Mac and cheese- amazing and cheesy and just the right amount of sweat and decadent lobster. Steve recommended the Mourvèdre which was delicious and flavorful and truly complimented the entire meal. This was the best service we've had on the east coast and though we shared both dishes as a snack it was the best meal of the trip.
Let me start off first by saying our waiter Adam provided impeccable service. The food was great and everything was socially distant. Would 10/10 recommend going here!
No comment
No comment

The ambiance, the wine and the hot cider, all right on the water with a beautiful outdoor patio (with heaters)!!!   Food is great and the people who work here are delightful.  This may be my favorite place in NYC !!

Popped in here during a city trip for my sister-in-law's birthday. We were expecting a bit more in terms of what we've seen through random IG posts. However, delicious drinks and fun atmosphere. We didn't make it too far past the main entrance's bar - so I'm sure we will return to make the most out of it. They were also very accommodating to making a virgin drink for her as she was expecting. Hot day - AC and a drink were all we needed before hitting up the next few food spots :)

Can you say boozy brunch?? If you and your girl friends are looking for a perfect Saturday or Sunday afternoon activity eating and drinking with a view at City Vineyard should be on your list. Fun people, good vibes and great pictures.
Amazing place to get some nice wine. Had a great service by Flor, as she made sure we had a great experience here. Nice wine, nice food, nice service and great views! Definitely coming back!

This place is what you would expect it to be - beautiful views right on the water and exactly where you want to be on a beautiful day in NYC. The wine is good but unfortunately the food quality and service are severely lacking. We ordered a few apps for the table and weren't impressed by any of them. The charcuterie board literally had one slice of each type of cheese - super disappointing. Service was tough also - we couldn't get our waiter's attention once and some of our items we ordered were never submitted to the kitchen. Overall I'd recommend skipping this place and finding another spot for the good views.

Jesus this place is freaking amazing. If you don't get Roy as your waiter you're doing it wrong. He's so so amazing I got multiple bottles of wine and multiple desserts just because I love him so much. On my BIRTHDAY!!
No comment
No comment
The new venue is amazing and the wine is great. The food however is terrible. I hope management reads this because I want them to succeed
We had the best time at City Vineyard! They have awesome views of the waterfront, delicious food, and a great selection of wine. The couches are super comfortable if you can snag one!
Such a great ambience. Our waitress Flor was great and very accommodating. Definitely will be back in the future!

It was a very comfortable setup given the ongoing pandemic. We were seated in the middle of the room and felt very comfortable. Chris was a fantastic waiter who gave us samples of mold wine before we order. Highly recommended
Great pandemic place to meet outdoors for a socially-distanced drink or dinner.  Good food, good service and excellent atmosphere.
No comment

Probably the most amazing views of WTC and N.J. I have ever seen. The ambiance is relaxing and the music was great. Our waiter was Ryan and he was an absolute delight and made us feel very welcomed. It was just an overall perfect way to end my hectic work day. The reason I give it 4 stars is because the food was ehhh I got a salad and it was very uneventful and had 2 random pieces of sardines lol.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has SO much potential given that it's right on the water, but man is the [brunch] food bleak. I got the risotto balls which actually made my stomach sick because they were so clearly frozen and warmed up. Weren't even hot when they arrived at our table. The potatoes were not cooked right and I don't think I saw one person working here smile the entire time. I can't speak for the dinner menu but I hope it's better than brunch.
No comment

Love this spot for happy hour after work when the weather's nice, but I guess so does everyone else because it can get packed!! The space is pretty large with a good sized roof deck, and the ground floor has a shaded outdoor area and an indoor area for dining. You can't reserve space on the roof deck (they take reservations only for dining) so it does get really busy and you have to go pretty early on a weekday to get a table. But if you can snag one, it's great. It can get HOT though, so just be warned. Yes it's NJ views but it's still nice to overlook the water, and you have a good view of downtown and the WTC as well. And if you're there around sunset it's pretty nice. They have a variety of wines, including wines on tap which they can still pour into a bottle, but they also have a full bar with some cocktails and beers. Crowd can be finance-y after work since it's across from the Citi building and a 10 min walk from Brookfield Place. But, I love the ambiance for a great outdoor spot that isn't a stuffy rooftop. Tip: If it's too crowded or too hot on the roof deck, the area on the ground level facing the street has outdoor seating that's still nice, is usually not crowded and is shaded from the afternoon sun! You don't get the views but you also don't get sunburn and you get a seat instead :)

Where do I start to thank you for making Maria's bridal brunch yesterday a huge success and memory! The igloo on the roof top comfortably sat all 6 of us ( including a chair for gifts) and was warm with the added heater. The food and bottomless beverages were plentiful. Thank you Janel for your energy and hard work during the time we were there! Highly recommend !!

Amazing open space for drinks! Great service and food. Flor was amazing and moved us into the shade when we had had enough of the sun despite the crowds lining outside. Fun for chilled afternoon drinks.
Met some friends to celebrate a birthday. We had the bottomless mimosa lunch which was fantastic. They have really yummy food with a beautiful view, and Flor was absolutely amazing!

We visited City Vineyard on Memorial Day weekend. The best place for summer. Beautiful city view plus Hudson  river view from one spot. We seated in a patio. The wine and food were good. It was pretty busy there but our server Enrique was on top. Thank you for your suggestions! We will definitely come back.
Overpriced, rude staff, overrated. Menu is limited and not a variety of choices. Not worth the trek down this way. Grand Banks is a better option.
No comment
Had a fantastic experience with Flor, great food, great drinks, great vibes. Best place to wait out a monsoon!ill be coming soonn!

HIGHLY recommend the oysters and lobster roll. All of the food is really good and affordable but those are definitely a crowd favorite! The venue and igloo bubbles are also very cool and adds to the amazing overall ambiance and experience. Definitely a must! Not to mention our waiter Justin brought our food out extremely quickly and was so helpful and attentive!!
No comment

They didn't seat us and said that it would be over an hour wait but we could sit in the main area and order at the bar. We did that and then watched as the hostess sat other people around us with service. We ordered at the bar and it wasn't till halfway through till we got silverware. Not to mention only that only one table got silverware and the other had to borrow silverware/ napkins for the other table. Food came out at different times, even waited an extra 15 minutes for one plate to come out that was on the same bill (by that time we practically finished our meal) Not a welcoming environment. Overpaid for food that should have been provided service with. Didn't get water or option to refill on drinks. Missed opportunity.

City Vineyard had been on my list for a while now, but I always thought it was a bit pricey. A group of friends and I went the other night for a rooftop movie, but didn't realize that you can eat on the roof. We ended up grabbing dinner downstairs and skipping the movie - but the gorgeous sunset was nice enough. The margarita  flatbread I got was the best I've ever had! The wine was obviously delicious. The staff was all super friendly! The manager (?) even gave us champagne as we were celebrating a friend's engagement. I'll be back for sure!
No comment

Everything we had at dinner was absolutely delicious and love the views. Food came out pretty quickly. Our waiter forgot to place one of our appetizer orders and he made up for it by giving it to us later for free. Definitely coming back when it's warmer to enjoy the outdoor space.
No comment
No comment
The BEST! Frozé on point and the views are not to be missed. Super safe during covid (we love) and dog friendly. What more do you need in a place?!

We came to this place the staff was so nice and accommodating. We got greed by our Rock star of a waiter Adam . He was nice and got everything right he made our experience great and is one of the reasons we will be back !!!
Adam was our server and he was a rock start. Super nice and super friendly 10/10 would recommend!
We love having Adam as our server! He was extremely prompt and energetic. Knew the menu well!

The new set up during covid is great - the bubble tents are awesome. Definitely would dress warmly because you can feel the temperature. Food was excellent - we had the cauliflower soup and the tuna tartare. Would definitely go back!

Was a little worried about going out during COVID times but everyone is wearing a mask, they take your temperature, and info when you check in. The drinks and food are great, view magnificent, and Cemil friendly and knowledgeable. I hadn't seen my bestie in 6 months due to quarantine and happy this is the place we reunited. Will be back for sure if possible this summer!

The views did not disappoint but found the food to be a little bland. Skip the truffle risotto balls but do get their flat breads. The upstairs bar was packed with young people but I'd recommend sitting inside if you can grab a seat. Wine is priced imon the high side considering the size of the pour
No comment
We visited City Vineyard on a beautiful sunny day and the view was phenomenal. The food was great and our server, Flor, was very nice and attentive! Will visit again.
No comment
No comment

Amazing food and amazing service! Roy is very attentive, polite, and had great suggestions. Highly recommend this place to anyone that's in the city.   The City Cava sparkling wine is amazing and the Brussel sprouts are even better.

Great experience and great service! Roy served us and was very accommodating and attentive. I feel reassured that they are very serious about following covid protocols. Definitely will return in the future.
No comment
No comment

First time at City Vineyards.  The live music is great!, The food was exceptional! The flat breads are fresh and delicious.  The seafood paella is absolutely off the charts.  Cannot wait to come back and check out the outside dining and rooftop bar in n the warmer weather.  Our Server  Lucas B. Was fantastic. He recommended the paella and was great the entire time.  He made our experience so wonderful.  We will be back.
Great views and amazing service. Would definitely come back, one of the best outdoor dining experiences I've had during the pandemic. Macon served us and he was the best
No comment
Our servers Chris and Janelle were so awesome!! Felt very covid safe both in the domes and out. Will be back soon!!
No comment

Had Easter Brunch. Mushroom Risotto balls were delicious. Hummus was fresh & tasty. Had 3 crafted cocktails: Que Syrah Syrah, followed by Strawberry Feels Forever then Roselita. All equally good & refreshing. Great location on the water. Good for kids.

I went to City Vineyard on the summer solstice and had the perfect Friday evening here. My friend and I immediately put our name down for a dinner table downstairs when we arrived and then went up to the rooftop to have a glass of rosé. Our table was ready in 30 minutes which was faster than either of us expected, and we completely lucked out and landed a table outside with a perfect view of the water and skyline! There are additional tables outside with a partial view and tables indoors without much of a view - we thought we would definitely be getting one of those. We ordered another bottle of the Syrah Rose and had a wonderful dinner with the Caesar salad, brussel sprouts, salmon, and crab cakes. The brussel sprouts were so yummy with the feta cheese, and the crab cakes were delicious. The salmon was cooked well and came with asparagus. We were not rushed at our table and watched the sunset, finishing the meal with chocolate mousse dessert with cinnamon whipped cream (yum). The service was a tiny bit inattentive (we had to ask for dessert menus 3 times) and a little slow, but we had a lovely leisurely dinner here and I will be back for other summer nights
No comment
No comment
Great food, awesome views, fun music and amazing service (thanks Lucas). Perfect for date night or drinks with friends. We'll be back!
Could not have had more fun at this bar, milos was a great server! It was beautiful weather and great setting to catch up with friends.

Me and my friend had an amazing time sitting at the bar sipping cocktails and eating our flatbread. Our bartender, Matt was attentive and made the best flowery gin cocktail I have ever had. Also shoutout to Elena and Devin. Will be back
Great experience here! We had the salmon tartare, shrimp salad, and mussels. Our waitress, Flor, was helpful and efficient.
No comment

Food is decent / predictable. Nothing in the menu will "surprise" you. You pay for aesthetic and the aesthetic and scene is phenomenal. At the very least, a good bar scene upstairs and again, great views so I'll leave it at 4 stars.

This place is amazing. great for a date spot, the rooftop igloos are special and also safe for these times. It was our own private table with a skyline view. Our waiter Will made the whole experience above and beyond. His wine suggestion made our night. Definitely will be back. Btw been a few times, Aaron is a great server, but Will 10x better.
Our waiter Will was amazing! Five stars hands down! The best festive cocktails and the view is amazing! I can't wait to come back here! The food was amazing and we stayed nice and warm all night!

Amazing,...just amazing views! Lively music and vibe although not busy , but it was also a Monday night ! Great personable service from our bartender Leonel ! Just opted for drinks tonight but definitely plan to return and try their menu although it seems very limited . The staff here were all very friendly and view is simply breathtaking!

An amazing experience for dinner and drinks. We ordered the margarita flatbread, the mushroom risotto balls, and the Belgian fries to share among three. Flor was amazing with the service! Highly recommend, will be back for brunch.

This was the best experience I have had since the beginning of covid. Our waiter Stephen was AMAZING he made our experience here 1000X better he helped us choose the best drinks and apps and he was so personable; every suggestion was on point! What a breath of fresh air in such a crazy world that we are living in right now.

I love this place!  The food is amazing!   Brunch all day!  The igloos are cute and warm for this holiday season!  Our waiter Holly was amazing!  Will definitely come back for my holiday gatherings and views!
No comment

I've lived across the street from City Vineyard for 3 years and it's still a treat every time I stop in. The food and wine are so delicious and the staff are more than happy to accommodate other requests. The view is amazing and the atmosphere reminds you of how amazing it is to be a New Yorker, even during tough times.  Also, Chris is the BEST - if you're lucky enough to have him as your server, you're lucky enough !
No comment

Fantastic lunch spot. We were in the city, winging it and stumbled across City Vineyard. Fantastic spicy Bloody Mary and locally-made Pinot Noir from Willamette Valley grapes. We had the Croque Madame and Crispy Chicken Sandwich, sat at the bar. Awesome service, great food and drinks. Amazing view!!!

Love the setup and it's on a perfect location for this kind of venue . The food is great and I must say they have one of the best French toast in the city . We came for brunch a few times on a Sunday and they are quite consistent . I love the views and the decor is perfect except for the giant fake cheap looking grapes above the bar area . I wish they were made out of glass or something that looked more modern and expensive to play off well with the rustic-modern/industrial decor .
No comment

We had a great experience in one of the pod bubbles at city vineyard. The bubble was warm, socially distant and perfect for our group of 6 (3 couples). Our waiter, Roy, made the experience excellent. He was attentive, fast, very nice and accommodating. We were very impressed by Roy and would recommend returning to be served by him!

we had the best experience here. the food, staff, and wine were incredible. if you're looking for a unique and wonderful dinning experience i would recommend City Vineyard. we were blessed with chris as our server, he was incredible and we couldn't have had a better time. thank you for wonderful memories amazing wine and the best service!
Andy is the best waiter. He was extremely attentive and very nice throughout the night. His customer service was superb.

I don't really get the hype of this place. Came on a Saturday afternoon, was told that a table requires ordering food or we could head to the rooftop. We decided to check out the rooftop, I felt as though I had stumbled onto a college sorority party, plastic cups everywhere, all the tables were dirty and it was crazy crowded. So we decided to head back down and got a table, the prices were ridiculous. I rather go to a rooftop then spend money here.

Flor was exquisite in customer service as well as general manners. She had great recommendations and hospitality as well as very timely service. I would recommend the food, atmosphere and flor personally to anyone visiting NYC as a first timer or native.
Great food, awesome bottomless mimosas. Flor was great! Definitely coming back again! (:
We had a great time! The dome was very cute and our waiter (I believe his name was Salvatore) was amazing. He had a great energy and was super accommodating.
Brunch here was amazing! Our server, Flor was incredible and helped us pick the best vegetarian meal to share for the table. Great vibes all around!
Great spot on the water for drinks and some food :) thank you Brian for an awesome experience!
What an awesome way to spend the evening! City Vineyard has such an amazing view, the food is fantastic and drinks are delish! Thank you Flor for being so welcoming.

I came across this place by accident. I must say that the views are great. Flor , our waitress, gave us true recommendations on the dishes they have and on their select wine. My favorite part was going on happy hour during sunset. Nothing but a beautiful site.
Matt P was a phenomenal server and gave us everything we needed. Overall great and safe dining experience. Will be back!!
Great daydrinking spot. Affordable drinks and food. Stellar views. Good raw bar - montauk oysters.

This is SUCH an incredible spot with impeccable staff.  Justin, our server was speedy and quick, fun and kind and made the experience so enjoyable.  This spot is right on the water with incredible views, not to mention fun igloos with tables inside to make your fall/winter dining experience that much more special.  10/10 hands down YOU MUST COME!!!!
Great rosé & even better server, Flor! Ambience, views & service are all a perfect 10!
No comment
I am impressed with this venue. Great location right on the Hudson. Pretty big spot too. Multiple bars. The service is great. I would recommend coming here for a subset one night.

Update: Came here AGAIN to celebrate a friend's birthday!! It was a chilly afternoon but if you used your imagination it kinda felt like you were in Florida and it was just a very breezy morning on the beach. Anyways - we had a rather large group and the service was super decent! Our group ordered everything from carafes of brunch cocktails to prosecco and beer. We had a grand time. Will definitely be back again to celebrate literally anything.
Great food and ambiance! The staff was so accommodating for my bday brunch. Everyone was so nice especially Lucas!! He was super nice! Will def come back!! Love this place
View and the location is great. But the food is average at best. Get drinks and enjoy the view but don't get dinner.

Good location but terrible service and layout. The bathroom line is ridiculous and blocks the entrance way. Tried to order food for the self seating area and was told I can't order food. Won't be back here anytime soon.
Flor was our waitress and she was great. Very attentive and friendly, and the view is fabulous!

went for drinks on a friday to kick off the weekend and had steven as our bartender and he was incredible!! so very friendly and lively and he really brought the energy and made a mean cocktail. would love to have him again when i come back!!

Incredible service and experience! Our server Tre was amazing and  provided knowledgeable, kind, and diligent service. The wine and ceviche were phenomenal not to mention the dreamy views. Will definitely be back again.

Waited 45 on line to get seated, they gave us a seat right under direct sun light! We asked to give us a seat in shade and the waitresses said oh no other seats are not available out of laziness so she doesn't need to move us to another seat. We tried to move the seat under shade and after we partially made it, another waitress came said you can't move the table! And we left this shitty restaurant with its horrible service.
Andy, our waiter, was extremely attentive and this whole experience was perfect

Used to love coming here in the summers pre-covid for happy hours... these days, it's dead compared to what it used to be. Friend and I came by recently for dinner and in the middle of eating, we saw two mice running around inside at the tables next to us. They ran inside for a while to the point where one of us had to inform the hostess and all she said was, "okay" before turning around. Nothing was done to solve the situation and no apology offered. Disappointing but unsurprising after reading some of the other reviews.
Traveling from California area! We enjoyed our ladies night out with the best server David! Awesome place with great happy hour deals and amazing views! Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

We arrived on a beautiful day with no reservations after volunteering with Hudson River Park and City Vineyard was very accommodating! Stefana is a lovely and attentive server - ask for her! Pro tip: order the Taste of the Vineyard.

Amazing place to come eat and have a nice time , Lucas our waiter was very nice and helpful with our menu . Nice atmosphere, awesome view , will definitely come again , everyone is very nice and great attitudes .

The address is strange, the one I went to is at Pier 26 in Tribeca. I love this place. There's wine on tab and the building is great. Plus you have a fantastic view of sunset over Jersey City skyline. The wines are tasty, and my friend tried the cocktails and she thought they were pretty good.

I came here at the end of September for my birthday. It was a group of three and I thought it would be a nice ambiance for dinner before a night out in the city. The ambiance was nice, the food was not. It reminded me of those restaurants where they only truly cook the meat to order and the sides are pre-made. The food wasn't even hot! I ordered steak and mashed potatoes and when I went to try the potatoes, the entire serving came up with my fork! Like a brick. Picture below. I was immediately turned off. I didn't finish my meal. I was disappointed. The views are nice and the scenery is great but I wouldn't come here for anything other than drinks. Don't waste your time with the food.
No comment
Rooftop bar on the pier in the summer? Yes, please! Amazing food, great drinks and service-- ask for Cathy the bartender for the absolute best service.
I love this place!!! Feels so safe during corona. The views are great, the drinks are yummy and the service is great! Special shout out to Matt P and Jimmy - they are so lovely and awesome!!! :)
Awesome view in the city, a nice spot for a group of six gals. Good vino -- Rosé and Sauvignon Blanc on tap. Flor was great to us.
BEST. PLACE. EVER. Ask for Macon and Matt, they're seriously the best. We've never had better service in our life.
I had a great time at City Vineyard on a beautiful day!! The staff was amazing, especially Matt P and Macon!
Amazing ambiance and great drinks/food.... Chris was an amazing waiter and Will crushed the drinks!
Matt P was our server and he was great, recommended "the antibody" cocktail and it was so delicious!! The views, sea breeze, and food were also a nice addition, especially on a hot summer day.
Great views with better wine! Went for after work drinks here and had a great time. Good service and everything was great! Highly encourage a trip on a beautiful nyc day.

This was a beautiful spot for outdoor wine drinking. The space was large, airy and inviting with floor to ceiling windows. Service was a bit of a miss, and the charcuterie board was skimpy - I've definitely had better especially considering the price point. I'd love to come back during the summer for rooftop dining
City vineyard is my favorite spot! Amazing views, amazing food and amazing service. They have wine on tap and it's delicious. Michelle and Flor are the best waitresses ! Highly recommend!

Stephen is an incredible bartender. The whole ambiance is incredible and Stephen made sure our party was taken care of. This is a great spot for happy hours with beautiful views. When you come, please ask for Stephen. He will take care of your party.

Stephen is lit, best server I've had in the city. He's incredible and some of the best customer service we've ever seen. This was a great time and def coming back.  Also his purple booties are amazing.

column3: Rainey Street Historic District, Austin, TX
column6: If you come to City vineyard, you have to ask for Flor and Justin they are the best. The food is great the service is amazing.

I loved this place and they were very friendly (specially Flor who was really nice with us)! The view is so amazing and peaceful! I really recommend this place  I enjoyed all my afternoon with my best friend here! Pd. The cocktail was delicious
Great views, food, wine and service! Flor was the best. Highly recommend for a beautiful day in the city. Order the rose spritz!
No comment
No comment

Good for outdoor seating. Nice menu. Pre Covid I came here and waited 30+ mins to use the bathroom. Same thing during Covid. If you have to go to the bathroom, go beforehand. Or be prepared to wait in a very long line.
Great venue! Beautiful scenery and great food. Flor was an excellent waitress and helped with great brunch recommendations.
They have the best house rosé here, this place knows what they're doing! You can't beat the view either. I'd definitely come back here.
I love this place! The food is amazing and so is the Rose! Our waitress Flor was the sweetest most welcoming lady and made our experience just that much more special! Will definitely be going back!!
Fantastic wine deal and friendly staff that takes safety guidelines seriously to ensure a great experience for all.

Great vibe! Amazing music and the food wasn't to shabby!! This Cali girl/ Louisiana transplant hit New York!! Stopped by the pier and stumbled upon this amazing place. Our table tried the French Toast, a bacon and shrimp bloody merry as well as the chicken sandwich. All were very savory and fed my foodie spirit! I enjoyed the food as much as the great service . From the host to the server, everyone was pleasant and prompt! Great vibe, I'll definitely be back!!

Really enjoyed dinner here. Had mushroom risotto balls, charcuterie and cheese, really good olives, paella, and 2 bottles of the house wine on tap. Food and drink were amazing and our server Lucas took good care of us. Would highly recommend.

Amazing. Everything amazing. The waitress, Alex, was so great and attentive. It felt like we were the only people there by the way she kept up with us. And the food was great. The brussel sprouts were the best I've ever had. Even someone who didn't like them would enjoy these!! The wine on tap was delicious too!! And the sorbet and gelato they have is highly recommended also. Definitely coming back here! Not to mention the view of the jersey skyline was beautiful!
Flor was amazing. Took great care of us and made sure we had a wonderful experience. Beautiful setting as well.
No comment

cool place, domes great place to isolate and still get that desperate fleeting taste of living real life again. aaron the server v nice, served us our food around an inconveniently placed tree with not only elegance but humor. would com back 2 hang but also isolate again!!!!!! wear a mask!!
No comment
Great spot after months of quarantine. Great place to sit outside and enjoy some drinks and food. Thanks Justin and team for providing a great and safe spot for nice days in the city

If you're looking for a great rooftop bar with affordable prices this is probably one of the few in walking distance of TriBeCa. I went to the rooftop and was surprised to see it was very large with a lot of seats and tables. There was also a really nice bar up there. Menu had a lot of great drinks, wines, and beer to choose from. The light menu looked great too. This is definitely on my list of summer time bars to hit because the price and rooftop combination is hard to beat in NYC!
Beautiful spot with strong COVID compliancy. The cava was great and the service by Matt P was spectacular.
No comment
One of my favorite places! It's so beautiful and the ambiance is beautiful as well. I also loved the drinks. Definitely a must visit!
Flor is the best person I've ever met. She is so nice and always gives me wine and pizza whenever i want it. SO accommodating
Amazing waterfront bar! Flor was our waitress! She was so helpful and so quick! Great rosé. We love her! Highly recommend this place! Views are unreal! Flatbread is delicious.

I went with a couple of friends to the rooftop bar after work on a Thursday. It was packed since it was one of the first nice evenings of spring. All the tables were taken, and it's first come first serve, so we ended up finding a few empty chairs and pulling them together to make a makeshift seating area. It took a while to order drinks from the bar, but definitely worth it for the breathtaking views of the Hudson River. I look forward to making this a staple in my happy hour routine over the summer.
AMAZING views! Matt P. Was my waiter, made us feel very comfortable and happy, def coming here again. Great food, great times, great service! Brussel sprouts is a plus!
No comment
Had a great experience. Food was great, drinks were better! And Andy was an excellent server!

No need to lament as Spring 2018 has arrived and it's time to imbibe on wine with a waterfront view. Offering a 270 degree of the Hudson River and the Manhattan skyline, City Vineyard is finally in full swing. The glass enclosed restaurant comes with a patio and a rooftop deck offering an unparalleled view. As for the wines, City Vineyard offers wines on tap straight from the barrel. I would however recommend skipping the wines on tap and instead ordering a glass or a bottle of Oh La La Rosè for whites and a glass or bottle of Castello Di Verduno if you favor red as to be quite honest, their tap wines left my palate a lot to be desired. Beyond the grapes, they offer beers in both cans and draft, as well as cocktails such as "Hudson Skyline" and "Spring Street". Prepare to wait at least an hour to dine here on Saturdays as this place gets packed unless you're only coming in for drinks. Here's the breakdown of my review: 5 stars for ambience, 3 stars for service, 4 stars for wine and food. Overall, I still give it a solid 4 stars because here, I get to sip my wine of choice while taking in the unimpeded view of the Manhattan skyline from the rooftop. Salute!
Matt, Devon, & Elena know how to make a cocktail! Beautiful view of the Hudson - can't wait to come back!

This place had a pretty good selection of beers and wines. Yes, beers! You'd enjoy scenic views and waterfront seating area overlooking jersey city views. We had wine and cheese platter and how beautiful was it. Aged cheese and Merlots.

I wish I could talk about the food, but it never got that far. Not for lack of time. Got seated quickly near the window.  Waiter came over with some water and was immediately told us they were short staffed, but had a full restaurant of staff running around. After waiting for 20 minutes, waiter sat 2 other tables and then came to take our order without receiving a menu. 10 minutes later, got 1 menu to share. Waiter took our order about 10 minutes more. The other 2 tables got there food after 10 more minutes, still none for us. Waiter apologized for the slow kitchen staff. He asked if we would wait. After 15 more minutes, we decided to leave. As we were leaving, we explained the long wait time. Waiter told us he forgot to put the order in. So much for the kitchen staff being slow. Can't cook what you do't know. Instead went to China Blue and got some great food there instead.

We are obsessed with this place. Flor is the absolute best! We were celebrating a birthday and she brought us out two desserts to celebrate. Such amazing customer service here. We came here for the last day of their unlimited bottomless brunch and they were constantly filling up our mimosas. We will be back here for dinner throughout the summer for sure!

Stopped by City Vineyard on Sunday evening. They are still ramping up and working out the kinks, so I am limiting the stars. Only outdoor was seating available. Fair enough, but there was a thunderstorm coming and while they let us move inside, we couldn't order anything. I did enjoy our bottle of rose and shrimp ceviche, on special that day, before the storm.
Perfect on a beautiful Summer day, the Sauvignon Blanc on tap was delicious and the views are lovely
View was amazing, Pinot noir was our fave, along with the calamari and the risotto balls.  Thanks Flor for the amazing service!

My best friend and I always come here during the summer months as this place is always a solid choice. The wine is fantastic and the food is always consistent. This time; however, our server Brian took it up a notch. Originally we were seated in the shade and he took the liberty of moving us to a sunny table. It was so generous of him! We really appreciate him taking care of us
Amazing service! Great happy hour. Had a delicious flatbread and sat with an incredible sunset view. Had an extremely friendly and attentive server named Milos. Highly recommend and will be back!!!!

This is a nice brunch stop. We have been here before for dinner and it was a great pick as well(although it's more crowded at night). The burger was delicious and well priced for what you get. Another great item to try is the cheese board- we paired that with some wine. They have a great heated back patio that faces the Hudson. My friend ordered the French Toast during brunch and it looked amazing as well- so good that i wasn't able to catch a picture of it before it was all gone! This is a great location if you're in the world trade area and want to walk to the water and get a good view of Jersey City.
Great sunset spot and great wines.  Hidden (or not so hidden) gem in TriBeCa. Worth the wait!
Great view and vibe. Ask for Matt Pete and Steve, they are fantastic and super helpful!

Wow. Honestly ive walked by here a hundred times and never went inside. Disregarding the amazing view for a moment, from the second we walked it the experience was outstanding. Matt p and Steven were our waiters. They immediately made us feel at home with genuine small talk and recommended some great apps and cocktails. The food came out amazing and the cocktails were equally as good. Anytime im in the area ill be back here even if its just for a quick drink. Love this place!
No comment
The view is wonderful, the waiter , Cemil , was very professional and also friendly and the service was perfect. Just waiting time was a little long regarding covid is understandable and acceptable.

Hi, I came here for the first time and Flor was my waitress. She was the most friendliest, sweetest and kindest waitress. She took care of us and had such a big heart. She made sure everyone was always satisfied and even accommodated 5 people when the table only holds 4 people! I wish I can give 10000+ stars! If you come here, only ask for Flor! She is Peruvian!!!!!!! The best! The sweetest!!!!! Go Flor

Great spot for day drinking on a blue sky day. City vineyard is a wine bar on the water, and packed because it's one of its kind in nyc. The rooftop is definitely a scene - great for birthdays or a fun day with friends, but I wouldn't recommend for dates since it's crowded with large groups. Downstairs there is a more formal wine tasting area and restaurant. Unfortunately the roof only has raw bar items so if you want a flatbread or something more hearty than oysters you need to hang out downstairs for a bit to eat. Would definitely recommend for locals and tourists as a cool was to see nyc

Awesome view and decent food. We came for an early dinner on a weekday night. You get a terrific view along the river. Service was nice and fast, and food was really pretty good. We ordered a burger and shrimp roll (instead of lobster), which were $21 each. Both were fresh and flavorful. I was also happy with the rose on tap ($12). I'd definitely recommend this place for a casual dinner, nice glass of wine, and terrific view!
No comment
No comment

Found this place while driving on the west side highway. Decided to give it a shot for my anniversary we got seated right away. The waiter Brian was very attentive. My husband got the chicken dinner and I got muscles with a side of Belgian fries. The muscles were delicious, the chicken was tasty as well. They have an extensive wine menu, my husband and I chose a Lebonese one which was delicious. Afterward we went upstairs to the bar area which is first come first serve basis. It was nice view and we were able to find chairs even though it was crowded. I would definitely go back again.
No comment

Came in on a Friday night with a large group and from the start I could tell it was going to be a good experience. Our section was already set up and the staff was very friendly and patient as we waited for the rest of our group. More people ended up showing up to our party than anticipated and the staff was so quick to set up extra seating arrangements and made sure to accommodate our larger group. The space has beautiful indoor and outdoor seating and we all really enjoyed the ambiance and view. Our waitress, Flor, was amazing. She was so attentive and made great drink and food recommendations for our table and we ended up loving everything. The wine list is so extensive and the cocktails are delicious, so there is something for everyone. Everything from the food to the staff to the ambience was incredible and we will definitely be returning.

The restaurant is a very nice and inviting location, but the food wasn't really good for the price of $100 per person. After hours of sitting, we've had struggles paying. Our really nice waiter couldn't help us out anymore since he had so much to do on new years eve, we got to talk to the manager/a colleague. After running around with my credit card, putting it into a purse in the meantime without me seeing what he's doing, he put the transaction in multiple times. I had to accept the payment, so it took some time and instead of being patient and friendly, he just accused me of having not enough money, he couldn't take my money otherwise and that it's not his problem. I really can't suggest this place to anyone.
Beautiful spot, unreal food, and great Prosecco! Such great service will definitely be heading back
Great spot to go for drink. There's a beautiful view when you sit outside. I'd love to come back for movie night and see what it's like

Came here for a close friend's 30th Birthday. Flor was our server and took amazing care of us for such a large party, especially for a brunch group.  She always made sure everyone's drink was topped off and our food was delicious (which it absolutely was).  This is the perfect place not only for group gatherings, but also for a date night with scenic views of the Hudson River.  I'm excited to come back to such a friendly and attentive establishment.
