The one hostess left and when she returned changed her story. Apparently, in the five minutes she walked away the kitchen had become too busy to make food. "The kitchen is backed up 45minutes," she says. Okay, so we won't order food can we still sit out back? No bc those were food. We just sat somewhere else. It was so much confusion and unwillingness to accommodate. There were several families and couples that commented to us the same experience. I think they need to work on the up front staff. The bartenders were very nice. Most people were not as tolerant and left before even making it to the bar. It's a shame because it wasn't that busy.

Great views and wonderful wine. We came after work with colleagues and it was such a delightful experience. Evan, the general manager was so lovely. And our server Brian was so attentive. We never waited for food or drinks and they kept coming around asking if there was anything else they could do. Great experience!

Currently sitting outside on the patio as I write this. It's a beautiful day and therefore insanely crowded. The GM saw us waiting a while and asked if we needed help. He checked in with the hostess and quickly accommodated us with a beautiful table outside. Our waiter Brian was hilarious and had great drink suggestions for us. Overall, so happy with the service, food, and drinks - it's the first of many more visits this summer!!
What a beautiful patio! Brian is super helpful and honestly I was so relaxed in a city of so much craziness. I loved it!
Great location! Lucas was a great waiter and had a great time. Awesome food and drinks!
Amazing location ! Amazing views service from our waiter Lukas experience was great from the moment we walked In ! Definitely recommend this place !

Love this place so much! Perfect for a super cute date place especially if you go when the sun sets. Our waiter Brian was really nice and recommended great dishes. We got the charcuterie, grilled asparagus, and risotto balls. 10/10 will return!!
Awesome place with our server Lucas!! Definitely coming back to this amazing place with a beautiful view!!

Had a great experience on a Thursday afternoon for lunch. Our waiter Lucas' service was top-notch, and the food tasted great. We had calamari, salmon tartare, and caesar salads, and they were all great. Will for sure be coming back.
Great service and food. Had brunch here with my boyfriend. He loved the chicken sandwich. And we had their house wine tasting. I definitely recommend. Flor was our server.
LOVED City Vineyard! Milos took care of us from start to finish - super helpful with suggestions and very attentive. The shrimp pesto flatbread was delicious.
Beautiful view, delicious food and amazing service. Milos was very attentive and sociable. He made our experience even more fun and memorable. Highly recommended! Try the drink specials!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: Had the best experience at city vineyard! Went with a group of girlfriends and our waiter, Milos, was the BEST! He was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the drinks/menu. Would totally come back, but only if Milos could be our waiter again!
So gorgeous! Came with 6 girlfriends for a girls night, wasn't a long wait for a table on the patio. Food was good, so were drinks. Our server Milos went above and beyond to accommodate us.

City vineyard was great! The service was awesome, thanks to our great wait staff, Milos, and the views from the restaurant are impeccable. I would definitely recommend coming here for a casual night out or a big celebration.
Antonio served us this beautiful day.  The chicken salad was awesome. Ask for Antonio, he was very helpful!
Flor was amazing!! Get the burger. Very good view. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting or from here.

Great service! Alethea was fantastic!  Food was very good. Seafood was fresh and very tasty.  We had the Rose which we both really enjoyed. It was not too sweet and perfect for a summer day. We'll definitely come back

I went here for brunch, and they have great drink and food options. It's unlimited mimosas or bloodies for only $25! Beautiful views and a lot of outdoor seating options, highly recommended! Flor is the best waitress!
Love this place! Service and food are 10/10 and the view of the Hudson is just the cherry on top!
WE LOVE CITY VINEYARD. So attentive and the food was great. Glasses were always filled and the serve was 10/10! Such a great time.
They accommodated our large group and were super nice. Shout out to Flor our server who was so attentive and made sure we were always taken care of!

Had the best experience at city vineyard! Had a large birthday reservation for 10, and the party arrived at scattered times. Our server Flor was so patient while attentive. And the food was delicious. Would definitely come back!

This was an amazing experience. The food was outstanding and the wine was special, chilled to the perfect temperature. We had an awesome view of Jersey City, and our waiter, Brian, was really warm and helpful throughout the meal. It made for a perfect date night!
Great food, amazing service, and awesome view.   Came here to see Robyn Hitchcock, whom we love, but weren't expecting such a wonderful place   Will definitely be back!

This place is atrocious. I had dinner here with 7 friends last night. They brought out all 7 peoples food out at the same time and brought my food out 15 MINUTES later!!! That was after we reminded them 3 times that I was the only person at the table that had not gotten their food. When my food finally came it was freezing cold and not edible. We asked for the manager and when the manager came over and I asked her to take my food back to the kitchen she took it and said not to worry because she would take it off the bill. REALLY??!? Thank you so much for taking my inedible food off of our bill. Needless to say I didn't eat dinner last night and the manager could care less. Don't waste your time with this place. It's probably the worst service I have ever had in NYC and I have lived here for 30 years. Go somewhere else, you will thank me!

I came here with two girlfriends for dinner on a Friday night at 9:30 pm. We were promptly seated and our waiter - Milos - took care of us right away. We had a bottle of wine, a flatbread, calamari, and asparagus. Everything was great, and Milos was even better. Thank you Milos!
My go to place for the best wine, food and music, special occasion or not.  Service is phenomenal!  Don't miss the spectacular views from the cozy patio.
Best dining experience . Food excellent . Service amazing . Manager and staff , professional friendly can't wait to come back to have the mussels. Best ever. Restaurant is first class all the way
Brian was a great server, we enjoyed incredible views on an amazing New York, warm evening. I'm from LA but felt right at home here! Will definitely come back again.
This place is AWESOME. Came here from Cali to visit for Ny Market Week and Brian was our waiter. Best waiter, best recommendations, best view, best food!!!

The only reason why I'm giving this place even one star is because of the view. The food is terrible and beverage selection is mediocre. The biggest reason not to go here is the service. I visited on a Saturday night after sunset and stood at the bar for 20 mins watching two female bartenders chatting and one male bartender flirting with a girl at the bar. When I finally got the attention of one of the female bartenders she looked at me and said with an attitude, "What do you want?" I made my order which was only two drinks and waited 10 more minutes before leaving after she forgot my order. I asked a woman standing next to me how long she had been waiting and she said 30 mins before someone asked her if she needed anything and she also never got what she ordered. Management has a ton of work to do and really need to find better, more reliable staff. I was with 7 people and we all left because we didn't want to support the poor service.

Gorgeous place for sunset and a delicious dinner. Ask for PJ to wait on you. He is delightful! Friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the menu. He even brought me a glass of rosé on the house while waiting for my dinner!

Terrible experience. From beginning to end. I kept hoping something redeeming would come from what seems to be a charming locale on the water. Our initial greeting with the bartender left us with her shouting across the bar to find out what the vineyard name was for wines in question (??bartender at a "vineyard") after a ridiculous large tasting pour ,.. actually not complaining about that... we were met with disinterest and ignorance about the menu, after having to call the waitress numerous times to place a food order.   She didn't know any of the daily specials or any details about the regular items. After an hour we called her over again to place an entree order, long after our wine and apps were finished, and again had to listen to her hollering across the bar about what items were. Another 30 min pass  and she had time to text in her phone..( also it's not even half full) our entrees come and we ask to have some other wines. They never come and our $26+ entrees included a "rack of lamb" that could barely fill a slider with one fingerling potato and undercooked veggies with 0 seasoning and a steak that was "black and blue"  it was so underdone..And trust me I do steak tartare all the time I don't mind rare , with soggy WAY over salted fries and more raw steamed veggies: even in the end when the bartender was deliberately asked to clear plates she gave a giggle and said " just push them out of your way I can't reach them anyway". I've never left such a minimal tip; and regret giving her the $10 even then. I'll go out of my way to tell people not to go here
We had an excellent time here! Such a cute and welcoming atmosphere. Flor provided incredible service to us. We will be coming back!
Such and great spot for a glass of wine and lunch. perfect on a beautiful day. ask for antonio, excellent service!
Oh ... and my wife just reminded me that PJ was the name of the excellent waiter who looked after us so well. Thank you, PJ!
My friends love this restaurant, great wines, food and view!!! We always have a good time, thanks Marco for the best service, you are very pleasant and efficient. We will come back for sure!
Rodrigo is the BEST waiter I have had in nyc.... great food, great drinks, and the best service. If Rodrigo is working, I'll be back!

Milos was an amazing waiter! We came with a group of four adults and two small children and it was perfect for us all! The place is awesome. We went for a walk on a sunny afternoon and came across this beauty. Drinks outside and lovely food. The food came fast and the drinks even faster! He was attentive and considerate and we will definitely come back

I don't usually write reviews, but I felt compelled to do so after my amazing experience with City Vineyard. I'll get the obvious out of the way first-- the location is amazing, the views can't be beat, wine selection is great and the food was delicious. However, what really stands out to me about City Vineyard is the amazing staff. I just hosted a surprise party here and they were amazingly helpful and SO sweet. Gracia at the hostess stand was so accommodating and kind. Our server Flor was prompt, attentive and truly wonderful. Alexandria came over to check on us throughout the meal. Everyone else who helped really went above and beyond. I will absolutely be back here soon!
Brian was awesome! He even started our meal off with a sample of some delicious sparkling rosé. I got the oysters and they were so fresh and delicious. Definitely will come back!

This was by far the worst restaurant we've been to during our visit to NYC. The service was dismal the quality of the food was terrible. We waited for approximately 30 mintes for our lobster rolls, and a bread pudding that was a big dry brick that crumbled when you put a fork in it. The only redeeming quality for this restaurant is the view and location but eat somewhere else its not worth it at all.
Athelea rocked - great day at city vineyard! Little warm but breeze was nice. Flat bread was good - chicken was tad overdone.

I never know when the kitchen is closed for dinner. The sign outside reads "Serving Lunch and Dinner 7 Days A Week - 11:30am To Midnight". But tonight I stopped in for dinner at the bar at 10:10pm and was told the kitchen is closed. Last week on a Thursday night kitchen closed and last call at 11pm. So you can't depend on a dinner time here.

This place is amazing! Ordered the croque madame and it was one of the best I've had in the city. Brunch prices are pretty reasonable for the area and the views are great. Our server Brian was awesome. Would highly recommend.
Great place right on the water. Waiter Brian is excellent, he was so attentive! Brunch was on point.

Great restaurant! Milos was awesome! He was patient and very attentive. He waited for me to finish telling my story before I tried my glass of wine until he poured it for everyone! Lol. He really was the sweetest and we will come back! Thanks for great service Milos!
Went for a birthday brunch and everything was amazing. The food was great and the service was top notch! Our waiter, Milos, made it a great experience !

This was my first visit here and I cannot wait to come back. There was a wait at first but my table was ready immediately. The view was incredible and the service was excellent. Pedro was attentive and our food was brought out right away! Some of our entrees included shrimp pesto flatbread, calamari, and shrimp cocktail. All of which I would recommend. Thank u Pedro for a memorable visit!! We will be back again.

Thank you so much City vineyard you have a very wonderful staff the food was excellent I'm deathly coming back You did wonderful training your staff to be friendly I never expected them to be friendly from a New York restaurant
Great spot for drinks with gorgeous views! Brian was our server and he was terrific! Would definitely recommend.
Great ambiance, Brian was a great server, delicious food, will take any out of towner here any night of the week

DECEIT & DISCRIMINATION: This past weekend we were shocked to find the hostess and manager telling our group of 3 couples, each with our own well-behaved 4 y/o, that they couldn't seat us together--despite virtually the entire dining room being empty on a sunny Sunday afternoon (the patio was moderately full due to the warm weather). Puzzled, we asked why they couldn't simply pull a few of the many empty tables together. The vapid hostess stammered a few words then said, "Let me talk to my manager". She came back and said they could not pull tables together "because of reservations" (again, the dining room was all but empty). Thinking there must be some mistake, I asked to speak to this manager--to which the hostess pointed to the harried-looking tattooed woman behind the bar who barked out--"Yeah, we can't pull them together unless you agree to our per patron minimum of $100 each--INCLUDING THE CHILDREN." Everyone at the bar--and much of the staff--looked at her in disbelief. So, clearly, there were never any reservations or legitimate reasons to not serve us...we were being outright lied to and discriminated against. The $100 per customer minimum, the "reservations" etc. were just deceitful business practices simply because City Vineyard doesn't want to serve families with children (despite being directly next door to Pier 25, one of the biggest family destinations in Lower Manhattan). To think that a business in this day and age--particularly one doing business in stroller-filled Tribeca--would be so anti-children is truly unfathomable.  Sure, I've heard of a few snooty places in the city that aren't exactly 'kid friendly', but I've never heard of one so sleazy and deceitful that they would concoct lies and bogus $100 minimums to deliberately drive away families. Absolutely disgusting--please let other neighborhood families know to avoid this abhorrent & contemptible place.
No comment
The wines are fantastic, but the highlight of our night was our server Rodrigo. Thank you Rodrigo for a great experience! We'll be back soon.

Made a reservation two weeks in advanced for May 5.. cinco de mayo. As I am waking out the door I receive a call confirming for the next day which would be Sunday May 6th. When I originally made the reservation I repeated myself multiple times confirming for May 5th and the woman confirmed it back to me. When I told the woman who called to confirm that it wasn't for May 6th it was for tonight May 5th she said oh I'm sorry were bought out. After requesting a manager multiple times, finally a manager was put on, which I doubt because this woman did not seem to care at all. She stated I could go to the rooftop but she couldn't hold me a table, even though their employee messed up. She kept saying I'm sorry I cannot do anything. Will never make reservations at this play again, nothing but a waste of time and clearly they do not care about new customers.
Awesome place. Amazing drinks. Ask for Alexandria, she is attentive and pays much attention to details

Amazing views, even better wine and food!! The host greeted us and our dog so warmly and our bartender, Casey, was fantastic. She made excellent recommendations and made sure we had what we needed all night long. Thank you Casey!!! We will definitely be back.

I adore this location, it is the best cocktail hour in NYC. particularly, the server Alexandria is phenomenal. We really enjoyed our time and despite the place being so full, Alexandria made us feel like we were the only ones there.
No comment
Wine selection is top notch/ambiance (especially when the sun is shining) even better and all around worth your time if you get here early enough. Justin really spiced up the wine list.

One of the absolute best outdoor patios in NYC -- if not the best! Huge space with tons of tables on the roof and the bottom patio. Always have so much fun coming here! Service is excellent and everyone is so friendly! Will be back many many times this spring / summer!
Wonderful experience... Joe was our server, Justin was the drink server... gorgeous view of the water. Definitely will be back!

This place is always closing early, always under staffed and can never serve. It's so sad, it's such an amazing location and could do so well. Every time we come across the highway to come here we are sent home.

A gem of a find on our trip to NYC.  Spent the afternoon enjoying the food and the views, weathering the storm.  Great food, incredible hospitality by Antonio.  We felt like family very quickly. We will definitely be back!!
I came for the first day of spring, and Justin gave us a great rose tasting. City Vineyard was only second to Justin!
Justin is the best!!!! Did everything he could to make us happy and comfortable. Best customer service of all time. Strongly recommend. Food and all the wines were delicious.
Wow! What a cool experience in the center of the city. Great food and wine. Great hang out for girlfriends and even a date. Nice patio area (heated!) and now on to dessert.

If I could give no stars I would. I didn't even end up staying. I went to have a glass of wine and was told it was open seating then before I could  even fully sit in my seat another person ran up to me and told me to pick somewhere else. I think the servers were bickering, the last server shrugged when I asked what the problem was. Too bad nice ambiance is ruined by poor customer service.
No comment
Excellent service! Brian was absolutely amazing and attentive to every need. Great food and wine.
Completely disgusted by patrons allowing their dogs to drink out of the same glasses they use for humans and the manager not saying or doing anything about it.
Great for Brunch and dinner! The atmosphere is romantic and surroundings are beautiful!

This is such a great spot for brunch or weekend drinks! We had a great time and really enjoyed our waiter Brian's service. We tried the blood orange juice with our mimosas and it was such a good call! I can't wait to come back and bring all of my friends!

Rodrigo made our day! We came with high expectations after hearing what a great place this is, and we were not disappointed. Rodrigo gave us great wine and food recommendations, brought us a sample of the rose when we were unsure, and humbly respected our wishes to move inside to the air conditioning, out of his table jurisdiction. He was the epitome of good, flexible, attentive customer service.

Love the space, but both the service and food is mediocre. We had a long wait to put in our order, our waiter forgot our drinks, and both our meals were poorly cooked. I ordered a burger medium, and I received it well done. My husband ordered the croque madame and the ham was burnt. On top of it all there was a creepy security guy walking around and around the restaurant. Not sure we will ever go back.

We held a corporate reception at City Vineyard and could not have been happier with our selection. The staff was extremely professional, attentive and friendly to all our guests. The food choices are hard to narrow down because they all looked so appetizing. Luckily we had a beautiful night with a stunning sunset to cap off the night. Highly recommend it!
Just spent Valentines Day here and Rodrigo was the best server! So sweet and attentive! Loved it. He made the night wonderful!
Awesome!  Everything about it. View. Music. Ambience. Especially, the Food. And the best server ever, Alexandria did an amazing job keeping our baby boy very happy and entertained.
Great view, great food, great wine, great service. Antonio is awesome! Shrimp salad is fantastic.
Such a wonderful meal overlooking the Hudson River. We were served by the most attentive man Antonio Munoz who was lovely and went above and beyond. Can't beat the wine and atmosphere!

We had a great time here! What an awesome place to enjoy the sun coming out in NYC! Food was great and the cocktails were unique. Try the Dark side of the mule. Also, we especially had a great time because our server Rodrigo was so much fun. His service was perfect obviously but he also joked and made sure we were having a great time. Definitely will come back to hang out with him again.

One of the worst Manhattan experiences I've encountered.  Waited 20+ minutes to be acknowledged at the bar and service was so rude.  Will never come here again and was the first to tell my friends how excited I was about this place. Stay away

The place was crazy busy! Had to wait a bit to get a drink on the rooftop bar, but the staff and manager were super nice. At the restaurant below saw several families enjoying a beautiful afternoon together, and many many dogs and even a cat enjoying time with their humans. The food was good, the drinks (I had a Rose my co-worker had a Bloody Mary) were very nice, and I can't recommend it enough if you have the patience to not be in a big hurry and spend some nice down time with friends. Definitely a highlight to my work trip, made me take an hour or two and actually feel like it was a mini-vacation.

Visited City Vineyard on a Tuesday night in December and it was an excellent evening. The setting is fantastic, it is a small structure located on Pier 26 on the Hudson River with glass walls all around that provide great views of NYC, the Hudson River and New Jersey (during the summer they offer outdoor seating, and have an enclosed heated patio for the winter). Food was very good, the menu matches that available at City Winery which this is an offshoot from, and as the name implies there is a broad wine list with glasses and bottles available at many price points. But the single most important aspect of our visit was the fantastic staff. We were warmly welcomed upon arrival (best hostess ever) and our server, PJ, was awesome; professional, personable, attentive without being overbearing and those attributes applied to everyone we interacted with during the visit

What a lovely venue for after work drinks with incredible views and open air seating. Sat with friends at the upstairs bar and was served by an awesome bartender complete with bright orange sunglasses who was professional and entertaining. However, one caveat to mention which may sound silly but it is the City Vineyard. Key word, Vineyard. So it makes sense to me that whilst drinking our wine overlooking the Hudson and thinking... a snack would be great... the restaurant has a full menu but a small bar menu of 4 items. Now, I like French fries as much as the next person but no cheese plate??? The vineyard only serves the cheese plate to the tables next to the bar, not at the bar. Just a suggestion but.... wine pairs better with cheese than house pickled vegetables. But a huge cheers to Pat, the brilliant bartender!
Terrible food and service....  go for the view and a drink but make lunch plans elsewhere.

The view is great, the wine is good....however, I ordered Sav. Blanc and got Rose not once but twice even though I told them that's not what we ordered. Do NOT order the lobster roll, the roll was stale and we ordered four and all of them were gross. The lobster meat was very small and more mayo, more bun, more lettuce than meat....not worth $21 and I will pay for a good lobster roll. Oysters were good, coleslaw was the best part of the meal. Service was horrendous. Recommendation, come just for a drink and the sunset.

Nice place for a pretty view the place was a little unorganized I was greeted pretty well at the door by the host but I also found hair in my food must have been from the person making the food that's just bad hygiene!
We came during pride weekend when it was crazy, but I must the say the service from our waiter, PJ, was impeccable. He was super attentive and so friendly! Definitely coming back.

Made reservations a week ago on open table for 5/19/19, when I got there they said they don't have my reservations on record. Im not surprised, I read a couple reviews about their horrible reservation mix up. And they said I don't know how you can make reservations at that time because there is a private party present. Horrible, this place need to get their shit together. I even told the tall host I have a picture of the reservation receipt. She refused to acknowledge it; like as it never happened. So we had to wait to get seating. The waiter didn't bring out orders that I asked for. I had to tell them to forget it & to take it off the order because I'm tired of waiting.  They mixed up orders in the separate checks that was printed. And the table that we were seated at outside had a big puddle right under our feet. One mistake after another. Staff needs retraining or their reservation logistics need lots of work. Will not recommend to anyone ....if you want to have a smooth dinner/ experience.
Just ordered takeout, the burger was insanely good.  Exceeded expectations, and is now my new favorite neighborhood burger.  The delivery was super-fast

Rude people behind the bar. My bf and I went for drinks after dinner. We stood at the bar for a long time and not one bartender looked our way. They were not even that busy. We finally asked for the drink menu and the bartenders kept passing us to the next bartender to ask for the menu. Eventually we took it from a group of people standing next to us. We asked them first of course. We looked over the menu and decided to order one drink each and then go right after. We made the trip there so why not. Again, not a single bartender came our way or looked our way. Now I know they were not busy because they were laughing and talking with each other. At that point my bf and I just left. We got our drinks elsewhere.

Went here for lunch.  Friendly service great outdoor patio but long wait for outside table. Beautiful views great food. Ask for Laura.  She made our daughters engagement celebration so special. She was the BEST a great server caring and attentive   The wine and Haunted Hudson cocktails were delicious.  Food was served hot and everyone enjoyed what they had. Chicken Caesar salad with HOT fries on the side was outstanding. Lobster roll good. Grilled cheese hot melted and delicious. Quinoa green salad awesome. As we said. Laura made our day so special. Make reservation if you don't want to wait!
Great view and ambience. However, limited menu and slow service. If they can figure out the service then Id happily recommend.
Location is great, service and food is horrible. Come for a drink and a view, don't stay for dinner.

The chef here is superb! - yes, the place is casual, reasonably priced, service welcoming, but oh, the food!!  I'm a New Yorker, so expect good food as a matter of course, but the Vineyard is truly exceptional. You're in for a treat.

It started so well and ended miserably: We arrived at 7:30..Sun was setting on the Hudson. Decor, very nice...Beautiful but crowded and near impossible to get a drink at the bar. We ordered dinner around 7:45...8:30 I asked for bread and got a small bowl of nuts. By 9 an apologetic manager told us we might as well go elsewhere..no need to pay..explained that they couldn't get a kitchen staff together!!! What??? And we weren't alone..no one was getting served on a Wednesday night!  This was a first in 30 years living in  NYC..Come on. Someone has to take over this lovely location and do something..Look at the previous reviews!!!

I came here with my girlfriend for Sunday brunch and had an absolutely amazing time! The food was excellent as well as the service. Our waiter, Rodrigo, provided such a welcome atmosphere, was extremely knowledgeable about the menu items and was able to answer any question we had. Highly recommend the gorditas! Rodrigo's explanation had us loving them before they hit the table!! Will definitely return soon.
Must see the waiter, Rodrigo - Extremely attentive, always smiling, and genuinely a nice person. Made the experience an inviting visit.

My friend and I stumbled upon this place on an unseasonably warm day in April. The view is gorgeous, the atmosphere is chill, and it's equally great for groups or a party of two. Brittani, our server, could not have been more accommodating. LOVED the chicken liver mousse, but the oysters and Brussels sprouts were also on point. Grab yourself a table by the water and a bottle of rose, and love life.
Roxy (manager) and Argjent (server) were amazing as well as our incredible wine + food! Such a great place to come on a nice day or night. We love City Vineyard!

Amazing view, food and service! My friend and I had the best time here. It was a nice atmosphere with great music. We ordered the burgers and fries and although it took a bit longer than expected, manager Justin was incredibly accommodating, personable and made our experience here that much better! It was an extremely busy night and Justin took the time to ensure that we were satisfied and all our needs were met. We plan to go back in the near future and highly recommend this place. Thank you Justin and City Vineyard!

Great location on the water.  Most of the food was great, the lobster roll was a poor excuse for a lobster roll.  I was surprised at the small wine list, considering it's a wine destination.  But most importantly the service was the SLOWEST ever- took way too long for everything.

We love City Vineyard! The view is unmatched, the food is delicious, and the wine is excellent. Thanks to our server Iram for suggesting the rose- we got a bottled and loved it! If you can, try sitting upstairs, but the view is wonderful on the downstairs patio too! Can't go wrong here.
Great spot for drinks and food. Nice views of the river. Erin was the best!! Such a great server, very helpful, couldn't have asked for more!
This was a great place to eat. Pedro our waiter gave good advice on what to get and was quick and attentive to our table. The food was very good, especially the mussels.
Stay away! They will scam you with fine print that you have to sit inside and the cool outside be used for private events while you are stuck inside! Don't waste your time

Heard about the city vineyard from a few people. So when we went to go to grand banks and they were full we said we would try out city vineyard. Service was good. Unfortunately the wine pour was small for the price. We also tried the cheese plate which is 3 meats and 3 cheese chefs selection. Im giving 3 put of 5 because we paid for the ends of each cheese. There was no cheese on the plate. At $21 I though it was very reasonable but for a wine and cheese bar ok sure they must have had more cheese in their fridge.

Bad food and bad service. Food was bland and portions are very small. Waiter didn't pay our table much attention and wasn't very friendly. Great location and it's too paid we left with a poor taste in our mouth.

Been trying to get in here for months. Always told no availability, even in a few weeks. Finally got a reservation. Ironically, the weather was gloomy and rainy. Sat inside. No big deal. Not many people inside. Greeted indifferently by two poorly dressed young women. Greeted somewhat promptly by a nice waiter. Next steps were fine. First course of mussels and fries was ok. Needed salt. The bread for dipping should have been toasted. My main course, seared tuna over cannelloni beans, arrived over potatoes, no beans. It also had grape tomatoes in it, which was not in the description. I was not eating potatoes at this time so I called over the waiter. At first he didn't understand what was wrong. He caught on and took it back to the kitchen. Meanwhile, the two girls at the front desk were standing around eating. Tuna comes back over beans. It is now cut into three pieces and medium well. I had ordered it rare. The dish also contained fennel, which again was not in the description. I'm not a fan of fennel but I didn't say anything to the waiter. I just picked it out and left it very visible on the edge of the plate. My dinner companion ordered duck over puréed parsnip. Parsnips were lukewarm and the duck needed more of the fat rendered. We decide to share a dessert and ordered a chocolate hazelnut cake. Out came a scoop of chocolate ice cream and what could have been coffee or hazelnut ice cream. Called the waiter over and asked what is going on in the kitchen? He took it back and apologized. The "cake" came out but it was more of a moose on top and of a wafer but it was tasty. Overall our waiter was good and apologetic. None of this was his fault. As we left, those two girls at the front desk were nowhere to be found. So we left without so much as a good night. Final summation: enter at your own risk.

Such an amazing time here! I visited on my birthday and PJ was an AMAZING waiter! Super attentive and sweet. Made it such a memorable visit. Will definitely come back! Food was great, wine was nothing less than perfect.

The management at City Vineyard is AMAZING! We were there last night, a group of 8 on a very packed Wednesday, and were blown away by how attentive the staff was. Brittni in particular was hands down the best manager I've ever encountered in Manhattan. They went out of their way to accommodate our very large group, to make it a wonderful evening for everyone. Aside from the great manager, the food was delicious, wine on tap was a must, and view is breathtaking. Great ambiance + fun environment, reasonable price. Highly recommend!

I returned to City Vineyard yesterday. Samantha, the GM had reached out to me after my previous review, and offered me free entrees and a wine flight, so my boyfriend and I figured we'd try again. I spoke to Samantha on the phone and confirmed we'd be coming Tuesday at 6:30, and she said we are all set, and she looked forward to seeing us. When I arrived yesterday, Samantha wasn't there, there was no reservation for us, and nobody on staff knew what the heck I was talking about. I was nervous this place wouldn't redeem itself. Fortunately, they were able to seat us, and the manager on staff, Mario, was very nice and took great care of us. The food was good and served promptly, the wine was delicious, the views are still gorgeous, and our waitress was excellent! Thank you for doing right by your customers!

It all makes a difference as to when you go--as it can be obnoxious or peaceful.  The staff is still green, but overall getting it but the clientele can be really something awful.  You are paying for the view upstairs, as the wine list is overpriced and the cocktails not great.  Downstairs is lovely and better menu.

Fantastic view. Easy, satisfying menu. Had the burger for lunch on a snowy day. Others ordered salad and grilled cheese. Burger was fantastic. Melt in ur mouth. Service was quick and friendly. Good selection of beers and wines to wash it down. Very nice experience all around. Much different than summer roof experience which is hectic. But terrific real estate so hard to go wrong

Great spot and view to have a drink (when you are prepared to be standing as they are not able to manage all the free high seats close to the bar -all reserved- but for whom?). The food is very mediocre - don't try the ceviche - its raw fish, but nothing that even resembles a ceviche in taste. Asking for some bread took them at least 30 min to get the stalest bread I have ever eaten. To his credit the waiter tried hard (albeit unexperienced..), but 'mustard is out' felt like very strange thing when you order a burger. Whoever took on to manage that magnificient spot, get help by someone who knows something about restaurants or bars...
Should be called Sh*tty Vineyard. Hour+ wait for mediocre "food" and wine. Didn't even bring bread or nuts or anything.
I would rather go to the Gulags than return to this place. Service was torturous and food was not fit for human consumption.
Beautiful spot to enjoy a drink and views of the river ! FYI address above is incorrect- it's off of west side highway - pier 26 I believe
The food was amazing I had the grilled cheese and the place is so nice also I got an amazing service from Antonio and will definitely come back!!

Offer a wide wine selection including both bottles and on tap. The tap Sauvignon Blanc and Rose were both good. The menu is relatively simple, but had a wide variety of options. Got the Chili Sesame Brussel Sprouts to start which were absolutely awesome. For entrees we got the burger and lobster roll. Burger was very good - flavorful and well cooked - and the lobster roll was ok. I guess ordering lobster in NYC probably wasn't the best move in the first place. Great place to go on a nice evening or afternoon given they have a ton of outdoor seating and it is right on the Hudson. Will definitely return.

I really wanted to like this place....the location is amazing.  But it is severely understaffed and the bartender had a horrible attitude. We waited for 25 min to get a drink and it wasn't even crowded. All the beers on tap ran out and according to the bartender this was "not her problem."  I watched as she tried to convince a guy that the beer she poured into a wine glass was more than a pint. Pathetic.

I have been to City Vinyard a number of times and I must say that each time it gets better and better. My family and I had a late lunch there Labor Day and despite the giant crowd the staff managed to do a great job getting us settled and made us feel right at home. Evan the manager welcomed us graciously and despite a few of our party members being late he got us settled promptly. We were also lucky to have the lovely Alexandria as our wait staffer. She was super sweet dealing with my crazy extended family. And the food was great all around- even the  grouchy Aunts liked it.  It is the best place to while away an afternoon with friends and family.
Great view.  Good selection of wine.  Only hitch is you have to wait 1/2 at bar to get a drink. If you eat there don't expect to get water for at least 20 minutes
love this spot. perfect for happy hour and sunset sipping an aperol spritz. lucas is the best!
Inattenive staff, bread served with no oil or butter, fish entree was appetizer portion. Food was ok. Wine was expensive. Wouldn't have dinner again just wine and appetizer

Another amazing night at City Vineyard. You simply cannot beat the view. They also have their own wine here and it's great! The food is made with so much love, great to the last bite! We'll worth the small wait. Can't wait for the rooftop to be opened. Matt, our bartender, might have made the best margarita I've ever had. Summer is here baby!
beautiful views, excellent service (flor was amazing!), great food, cozy decor. great for brunch with a big group!
Third time here. Nice city and river views. Great wine selection.
Crowded but awesome bartender and didn't have to wait for drinks.  Standing room only tables.  Nice views.  Nice space.  I can see myself going back there. Haven't tried the food yet.

i give 1 star strictly based off of the food in this restaurant. our server was precious really nice woman from rochester NY has been here for 1 month- but if you come for dinner i would highly suggest going to eat somewhere else and then drink there afterwards. such a shame, great ambiance, great people who work there, subpar food. street meet is the way to go compared to this place. server gets a 5 star rating- such a sweet lady.
Love this place! Great views of the water and amazing staff.  Everyone is super friendly, especially our favorite bartender Michael.  Will definitely be back soon!

Service was attentive and friendly management was making sure everyone was happy. Perfect views, a must for locals and tourists. Rose on tap was my favorite plus a sunset can't go wrong, look forward when they unveil their full menu. thanks Niki for taking such good care of my family the other night

Lovely venue.  Went on a night without music; if there'd been some, it might have offset the poor service and disappointing food quality.  So, we sit at the bar for almost half an hour before we really get any service.  We ordered toasted nuts to nosh on while awaiting our dishes, sauted kale salad, mussels and falafel.  Tried the wines on tap - insipid.  Even their house-made bottled wines were only marginally palatable.  Pity, given they're trying to feature wines.  The nuts came out only moments before the rest of the food, even though they must've been sitting around available for quite some time.  The mussels were brought out cold; maybe they'd been sitting around, too.  They took the mussels and the fries and bread that had come with them back, and quickly had another plate of mussels in front of me, but sans fries and bread.  The latter took ages to show up, the bread too late to be particularly useful for dipping, and no bowl for the shells.  The falafel and hummus were passable, but I've had much better off errant food trucks around the city.  And the kale had been slaughtered in the pan; I've never had a vegetable cooked so much.  I doubt I'll be back anytime soon.

Had a great time,Marko was very knowledgeable,had some nice wine paring with food,we enjoyed it and had a great time.We will come back again for sure,I recommend the place to everyone.Great atmosphere!!!

Came here last night for dinner with my girlfriends and was left more than disappointed. I made reservations on open table days in advanced to ensure we got a great seat for sunset while we enjoyed wine and food. Upon arrival I was informed that all reservations made are for inside seating only and if you want to dine outside you have to be added to a wait list upon arrival (which had a 45 minute wait). I was disappointed by this but we sucked it up and sat inside and watched the spectacular sunset and moon rising from there. Now onto the food. The french fries were pre-cooked and re-heated and it was obvious. Seems so simple to pull piping hot fresh french fries out of a fryer and serve them but thats not what they do here I guess. Their pizzas are a far cry from what you're expecting. Served rectangular and on thin, under cooked crescent dough, as a New Yorker I was not only disappointed but grossed out. Their Brusselsprouts are not to be missed however. I will always give credit where due and their sweet chili brusselsprouts deserve a call out. If you order anything to nosh on here while sipping cocktails make it the cheese plate and brusselsprouts.

I visited City Vineyard with a large group of friends to meet them for lunch and then head to the bar upstairs on a beautiful Saturday. While I didn't have anything to eat - my review is about the service. It was the first warm and sunny day since probably October so the place was flooded with people and you could tell that maybe they weren't prepared or expecting the amount of customers they had (which is totally understandable!). This caused the service to be slower than normal which would then result us to wait in the long line for the bar upstairs. When we mentioned this to the manager he was MORE than accommodating. He was so receptive and understanding and without hesitation or question led us upstairs through a side entrance to make up for the poor service. We completely understood that they weren't prepared for the warmer weather crowd, sometimes you just have to go with it! Thanks for being so great and accommodating, City Vineyard!

Leroy's is our favorite neighborhood spot. Great place to grab a seat at the bar and enjoy cocktails, food, and elite vibes. My gf and I go at least once a week. The mussels and french fries are our go to's. High recommend coming to check this place out.
No comment
Came here for Sunday brunch. The place was very empty. Waited for 20 minutes and no one came by to give us menus or even take a drink order. Will not be back.
Ricotta toast was so so good! It was a nice place to sit outside and people watch with a drink or two.
No comment

My friends and I decided to get a pre dinner cocktail at Leroy's a couple of weekends ago - sans reservation on a Saturday, we had no issue getting a table for 3 outside. The outside is super cute - I love the style of their chairs and the plants really make the space wonderful with views of the action on Franklin. The inside is equally cute and I love the bar centered within the room - makes it feel like a nice communal space to gather with local friends. All 3 of us had the Double Derby and it was perfect! Refreshing on a hot day and an amazing blend of flavors. The presentation was also beautiful and an Instagram-er's dream. My friend had a craving for the Scotch Egg so her and I split an order. Amazing! The egg was perfectly jammy and a great sized pre-dinner snack. We snuck a peak at the dinner menu and it looked incredible so we made a mental note to come back for dinner and did just that last Saturday! We made a 7:00 pm reservation for 3 a few hours prior online. We were seated inside at a table behind the bar right near the kitchen - which was neither the best nor the worst. We still got to take in the amazing decor of this spot and I loved the grouping of plants hiding in the corner near the ceiling. Minus one star for the somewhat awkward seating location and very slow to start service. My friend and I both ordered the Double Derby again and our other friend had the Last Week I Was At This Other Bar per the server's recommendation - it looked tasty! He followed that with an equally delicious espresso martini. Our first round of drinks took an incredibly long time to reach our table - we saw them sitting at the bar on a tray for a while and I was tempted to go grab them myself. When they finally arrived we immediately placed our food order to avoid further delays. The three of us split an order of 6 oysters - they were tasty but on the smaller side. I could have easily done my share of a dozen. For dinner I ordered the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich and subbed the fries for salad. My friend had had it before and said it was just good. I definitely thought it was delicious; however, having recently been to Nashville, it was nothing like the hot chicken there so manage your expectations - this sandwich was tasty in its own way! I was also impressed by how good the simple side salad was! Greens with a light dressing, it perfectly complimented the kick of the sandwich (just a kick, I would not market this as hot or spicy). One of my friends had the burger with a similarly subbed side salad, and the other had the beef tartare with a side of Brussels sprouts - I tried some sprouts and highly recommend! I believe you can't go wrong with anything on the menu here and my friends and I want to go back to order some more dishes to share - it looks perfect for that. Minus the few hiccups, I cannot wait to go back to this cozy yet chic neighborhood gem!

Visited Leroy's over the weekend. Nice spot if you're looking to have a couple of drinks and relax. Was greeted and seated right away at the bar (we didn't have reservations, so no tables were available) . Bartender came over almost right away to offer us water and take our order. My friend had "The Burger" and I had their chicken sandwich (both orders came with fries). Food was delicious. I don't really care for fries, but their own were good, I ate it all. Music was good and staff was friendly. Would recommend.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Cute place, good cocktails, but food was just ok! Service was above average. I don't know if I'll be back but worth a try.

Great neighborhood place! Have now been here 5-6 times for both dinner, appetizers and drinks, and just drinks. All is spot on - love their little gems grilled Caesar and steak jus sandwich. Drinks are all some of the best cocktails I've had. Ambiance is super cozy and fun but also chill

Started with drinks to celebrate #59! Corner booth was a hit- appetizers a plenty included blistered Shishito peppers, olives, roasted cauliflower, and Brussel spouts started us off. We opted to share entrees. One couple shared the branzino and the hanger steak - so tender and NO bones. The Filipino garlic fried rice was so good- I was looking up recipes at the table. The other couple shared the ribs special on a mustard bed of coke slaw and fish beignets. The side of fries wasn't necessary!  Amaro Nonni to end a memorizable meal and chocolate chip cookies to go!  We will certainly make more trips here. You can't cook this too for yourself even with all the Covid practice. Trust me!!!  Jane, our server, steered us in the right direction with every choice!  Plus she was so welcoming and friendly- it felt like home! Don't miss out sitting I n the corner booth sipping a signature drink.
Delicious fresh food and super friendly. We asked for some modifications with the drinks and they were more than happy to accommodate. Nice outdoor seating as well.

My husband and I have come here almost once a week since they opened in the Fall. We LOVE it. Incredible cocktails, a great happy hour ($10 cocktails from 4-6pm), and amazing food. The service is also really great. Perfect for a date night, or a dinner for 4. No reservations, so get there early. By 7pm, it's bumping -- but that's because it's so dang good! They also have great music playlists and the ambiance is chill!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Really nice spot. Good cocktails and good snacks. Need to come here for a full meal but I know it'll be good. Any place that makes a good Gin martini is good in my book,
Great cocktails and great food! Went with a group of friends on a Friday night and had a blast! Cant wait to go back for the tuna poke and Brussels sprouts soon!
No comment

Leroy's is a great addition to the already amazing greenpoint food scene.. the food here is amazing, everything we've tried has exceeded our expectations. We are vegetarians and have tried all their vegetarian items and would recommend every single one of them. The vibe is amazing, service is great.. overall just an amazing time here each time we visit!
$16 for a mocktail is so psycho...... the burger is really solid and the mussels are great. May as well just drink while pregnant though.
Chic interior, with a nice big bar. Excellent food (we had the scotch egg, Brussels sprouts, and fried chicken sandwich) and service.

column3: Racquet Club West, Palm Springs, CA
column6: food is terrific. drinks are terrific. service is prompt and not too pushy. amazing place.
Very nice servers and amazing food!, wish I would have found this place sooner, and it's a great spot for ramen as well
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of the VERY few places with a cute/modern atmosphere that feels clean in Chinatown. We love walking around in the neighborhood, but the eating establishments there are usually VERY sketch. We were REALLY surprised to find this place and it turned out to be awesome in every way. Great service, food, drinks and an excellent value during happy hour. The Ramen was delicious, as was the rice bowl, the pork boa buns, shrimp shumai, an squid skewers.  Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

Definitely a new spot in the ramen rotation. Loved the tonkatsu ramen here, perfectly rich and full of pork flavor. Serving size was very generous. Pork gyoza were also 5/5 wonderful. Nice cute space that is well decorated and cozy.

Walked in here at 4:30 for happy hour and I was seated immediately!! I ordered myself a glass of plum wine and jalapeño chicken wings to start and they did not disappoint. The wings were crispy, flavorful and not too greasy. I wish there was a dipping sauce that came with the chicken but it's still one of my fave dishes! I also felt hungry after drinking my wine (which was decently strong and sweet) so I ordered Takoyaki! It was crispy, creamy with pops of umami and also chewy from the octopus. That was really fun to eat. I can't wait to come back here the next time I am in the area. There are so many more items on the menu I am excited to try.
No comment
No comment
The ramen broth was rich and filling, the service was quick we sat and place our order and got our ramen. I just wish they had more selection.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Really great happy hour prices, sake, and ramen. The spicy selection adds great flavor but isn't totally unapproachable. Great appetizer selection as well!
The ramen is decent. The appetizers were eh. Nice place to try. Won't be back. Broths weren't too salty but when I got closer to the bottom a little too much.
No comment

This place was delicious! We got a little worried cause it was in a random alley, but the food is great! The oysters were amazing, def try the barnstable. The takoyaki was some of the best I've had. We also got the spicy tonkatsu ramen and the katsu rice bowl, both were great!
Solid happy hour spot- lots of fun and delicious items to choose from. We tried ramen, octopus balls, wings and oysters. Staff are friendly.  Looking forward to our next visit!
No comment
No comment

A quaint little ramen shop that also has an oyster bar. The place can seat around 25 and an outdoor section (wasn't open when I was there). I ordered the spicy tonkatsu and requested with the noodles a little undercooked. Noodles were cooked to my liking! The toppings were very sparse. Pork was cooked to tender goodness but something with the broth didn't impress me. Wonderful service, clean bathroom, nice decorations.
It was great! Staff was nice, ramen was delicious, and apps were rich! They took into account modifications well, and I definitely want to come back and try the salt broth
Great ramen - light broth, could use a bit more seasoning. Would recommend and would order from them again.

Came in for some ramen on a crazy craving however something made me pause and I ordered appetizers first. Not too many as not to get full but enough to give it a try and see what's what. That's where the trying ended. Ordered a negori (yum! Actually a delicious unfiltered heavenly sake) then got seaweed salad, chicken bun and shrimp shumai. The seaweed salad was soaked in a unpleasant overpowering dressing that's usually just a footnote with others so the sesame flavor could shine. Then came the shumai which was drenched in sauce and lacking in shrimp flavor. The bun. The bun, it was nicely moist however the chicken wasn't crispy and resembled more of a chicken nugget texture/flavor. Overall the place wasn't a let down as the appetizer were edible it just didn't make you want to eat more.
No comment
No comment

$1 happy hour oysters are what lured me to this place for a second time. We got a dozen and they tasted fresh and they were cleaned and shucked very well. I got the Miso Ramen and it was decent but the broth did start to taste a bit too salty towards the end. Overall this place always has great service and decent food for an affordable price!

Tasty, unique and high quality ramen. Glad I discovered this and would definitely come back here on a cold day. I had the spicy Tonkotsu ramen and it was perfect. My partner bravely ordered the Salt Ramen and it was so unique and amazing - highly recommend. The ramen was essentially inside a uniquely herbed but still perfectly light chicken broth (no more salty than the other ramens!). We didn't do an appetizer but a lot of guests where there for an oyster happy hour which we'd partake in next time.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: $1 oyster happy hour, $5 plum wine, great service, and delicious ramen? I can't get enough! I wish I lived closer. Overall, solid place and great spot for a small group of friends to get a night started.

I've never had a good experience getting ramen delivered at home so was skeptical this time, but was really craving it. I'm so so happy I went ahead and ordered from Zest because it did not disappoint! I got the Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen and it just hit the spot! Would definitely order again

It's a SOLID 4. I don't know what to criticize other than well yeah you can go deeper and spend more budget on manpower putting details to the broth or watevs but THIS place has everything you need for a night out. They got the appetizers, booze and the table. You can dine with friends or date, atmosphere is there. Beautiful interior ambiance, more into traditional Japanese feel. Price is on the medium to affordable. Service is standard, nothing to complain. Very nice people.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I love ZEST! I must say that the food here is amazingggg! I love my pineapple fried rice and California rolls. I order all the time from here and they never fail me. They are super clean. Robin the server is such a sweetheart super attentive and very helpful in choosing what to eat. The ambience is very calm and quite. I will always come back and definitely recommend
No comment
Great food and service, best ramen I've ever had? No.. but it was at a solid level and the wait staff were super on top of making sure all went well.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Zest ramen is managed well and has good staff they are nice and tend to your needs , the ramen is good even tho most options are pork based (i don't eat pork) my ramen with chicken was good , and a good earthy meal , THE BEST THING I ATE ON THE MENU WAS THE THAI SPRING ROLLS  we had to order like 5 more orders it's a crispy on the outside and shrimp and crab deli on the inside ‍‍‍

I ordered the Miso, my wife ordered Tonkotsu and we both had two orders of the Pork Belly Baos. Everything was insanely good, the best in fact. My wife and I both woke up craving Ramen; which sucks because there is no good Ramen near us. The flavor of the broth was perfect for both soups. It actually gets a little spicier towards the end, but it's still very delicious. The portions are also perfect. The baos were so good that we ordered two each. The best part about the Baos is that the pork was not just a bunch of fat. It was actual crunchy pieces of pork. I highly recommend this place. If you can make reservations I would also recommend doing so. It's rather small so I can only imagine that it gets packed on a busy day. We will be back here the next time we go to NYC.

Whenever I'm in New York City, I figure out a way to get down here to eat ramen. It's my favorite ramen place in the city. Have I tried all of them? No. But I have been to several places that left me wishing I had spent that money on the Korean ramen I can buy and cook at home. But not Zest. Once I discovered this place, I am hesitant to try other places. The broth always tastes so good and not as salty as other places, and the noodles are always perfect. Their appetizers are also yummy but I don't usually get any because I'm so excited about the ramen and it fills me up!
Delicious! Ordered ramen for takeout and it was ready when I arrived. The restaurant looked super trendy and I would definitely go back.
No comment
This is an approved place to get ramen. The whole meal didn't disappoint except for the small sushi, but other than that . (I forgot to take a picture before I digged into my spicy miso).
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Completely unplanned visit turned into one of the best culinary experiences I've had. We got the pork gyoza and Shoyu ramen with the works. Hands down one of my top 3 ramen places visited to date. The gyoza was crispy and thin skinned, the shoyu broth gave me chills. It was rich, flavorful and full of umami. The pork belly was full of fat and richness. I never really finish a bowl of ramen and I almost licked my bowl at this place. LoL..highly recommended and I will be back 200000%.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite ramen spots In NYC. it's always not too busy which is nice and we get seated immediately. The food is amazing and I highly recommend the gyoza and yuzu salt ramen. The drinks are great too and service is awesome
No comment

Solid ramen. Went during happy hour, where drinks and apps are $5 each. Enjoyed the outdoor seating, casual ambiance, and yummy pork tonkotsu ramen. Portions were good, oftentimes I cannot finish ramen bowls but this one was the perfect size for me.
No comment
No comment

Absolutely love Zest!! I was so happy to see they opened back up and have outdoor dining. 2nd time here and I will definitely be back again. I had the Yuzu Salt Ramen with thin noodles instead of wavy. So, so flavorful and they give you the perfect portion. We also had the crispy & spicy appetizer. Crispy rice with spicy tuna on top, awesome! Love this place and will definitely be back.
This place is so good. My friend and I were visiting Chinatown and found this place best decision we ever made. The staff were so sweet and nice.
No comment

So happy. Memorial Day Weekend has been cold and rainy. A hot bowl of Ramen really hit the spot. Have been to Minca but wanted to try someplace new. Zest Ramen was comfortable insdoors and we were pleased to see they hadn't abandoned best practices even though COVID19 restrictions had loosened up a bit recently. The service was friendly and our ramen was delicious. So glad to have found this neat spot tucked away on the LES.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great place for ramen! The outdoor dining was warm with heaters. The ramen was delicious with great happy hour deals 4-7. Hot sake and ramen is much appreciated in the cold.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came in for happy hour on a weekday night! (Happy hour seems to last until 7 during weekdays) Got oysters, takoyaki, tonkotsu ramen, and some sakes. All were pretty good and i have to say i was very satisfied with $9 ramen! (The price seems to be normally $11-13 so i think even then, its not bad!) i had the plum sake which i really enjoyed, pretty sweet and went down easy.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Every time I'm in New York City, I always make the trip down to a Chinatown to come here. This is by far the cleanest, friendliest and best ramen stop I've come across. The ramen come in a beautiful big bowl and if you get the pork belly it just melts in your mouth. The Happy Hour specials are cheap and honestly amazing but even the regular priced menu is cheap. I took my boyfriend here on a date and it's cozy and comfy especially at night. I definitely recommend you give it a shot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is okay. If you're hungry and want noodle soup, this will do. But if you're looking for authentic ramen, this isn't it. The ramen isn't very flavorful. It's more like basic noodle soup, with some of the usual ramen toppings. The noodles were thin and seemed similar to egg noodles instead of what you would normally find in ramen. The appetizers were decent but nothing special either. Service was fast, but I went when there weren't many customers. The people there were nice.

Run to this place! Delicious food, cheap lunch specials and warm, friendly service. Nice outdoor setup. Bathroom super clean and well decorated (sounds funny to say) with a chalkboard to leave your message!
Love this place! Everything is fresh and always consistent! Flavors are delicious, friendly staff, cozy vibe! Been coming here for several years. So glad they are still in business!
No comment
No comment
This place was such a delightful surprise. Everything was delicious + they have an amazing happy hour! Will definitely be back!
The ramen was okay, the pork had a lot of fat on it (there was a lot more fat than pork meat). The staff are very friendly. We checked into the restaurant on Yelp and got a free sake!
No comment
No comment

Ehhhhh.....ramen was okayish but it had a hint of game in the flavor which made me queasy at times. The broth was very nice but the meat was not tender and very thick and fatty. The service was very nice even on a busy day. The water they give you I couldn't even drink it. The cup or the water smelled sooo fishy. The atmosphere in the place smelled very oceany because of the oysters thank goodness we sat near the open door.
No comment

They were sooooo good. I've already came here twice with my boyfriend in the span of a month. The ramens were delicious, and super super reasonably priced. I will definitely be coming here again. Also, both times I was there it was the same waitress. She was very nice both times and very good service. Very attentive on refilling water.
Raman is yummy but I like the family style service more , very cozy and will go back again !

We came here for dinner.  We started with the purple potato fries (5/5) which was cooked perfectly and not over seasoned.  We also had the pork gyoza (2/5) which was not flavorful and you could tell it was likely the frozen ones bought from a store.  For ramen, we had the yozu salt (4/5) which was unique and you can really taste the yuzu flavor but not too overpowering, and the tonkatatsu (3/5) which was ok. The noodles and soup were ok but the pork belly didn't have much flavor.  The place is small and crowded and a younger crowd. Music is on the louder side but you can still carry a conversation.  Not the best place for ramen in the city but for around this area, it is OK.
No comment
No comment

Okay, so this is a quiet, and unassuming spot located on Eldridge tucked away next to Vanessa's dumplings and across the street from the Flower Shop. And so, this local gem doesn't get the attention it deserves. I highly recommend their happy hour appetizer specials, that's how I came to know this spot, their shumai, takoyaki, edamame, oysters, and skewered squid take the cake. But above all, jimmy, Jimmy is a gem of a human who'll remember you from years earlier and will cater his time and attention towards every patron with the same cadence. He's a sweetheart who know how to serve you and your group! 10/10 recommend for the value! THANKS JIMMY
No comment
No comment

We went to Zest Ramen a few weeks ago. I must say I enjoyed my dish. I got the Spicy Miso Ramen. It was very good and full of flavor. The pork belly was tender and full of flavor. The ambiance is great. The reason why I give it three stars is because the other types of ramen that my GF our family got were not as good. They were eating out of my bowl more than their own. They didn't have too much flavor and were a bit oily. Maybe it's better next time for some one else.

Went there during their "happy hour" from 3:30 to 7 and had their $9 ramen. Very delicious and affordable! Love ramen. Flavorful broth and nice fatty tender pork. Also had their takoyaki-nice and piping hot and delicious.
This is one of my favorite ramen spots in the city. We ordered the tonkatsu ramen, spicy miso ramen, and the gyoza. All were excellent.

Let me start off by saying the food is decent. I loved the broth, the noodles but the chicken was extremely undercooked and scary to eat. The workers tried to ensure me that it was cooked a special way, adding to why it was that texture-- but I know raw chicken when I see it and I am just happy I didn't end up getting sick. They gave me the fried chicken as a courtesy for my comments on the food, but honestly I just wanted my money back. Great place if you want to be unsure or what you're eating.
If you are looking for great ramen, this is not the place. However, If you are looking for mediocre ramen with good price, this is it. Plus, bun is good.
Everything was great. We had the fried oysters, pork buns and calamari appetizers which were delicious. Ramen was also great. We came during happy hour and the prices were great. Service was fast.

This was the best vegetarian broth I've ever had at a ramen restaurant. Normally, vegetarian ramen is so bland and boring. They make their veg broth with tomatoes and it is so flavorful and rich. My boyfriend loved his spicy miso pork ramen. We shared the fried chicken appetizer and it was delicious, too. I loved the dipping sauce. We will definitely be back soon.

First time going to this location it was a very intimate place. I ordered the pork belly bun and Miso Ramen. The pork belly bun was amazing, it had the sour carrot and white raddish with hoisin sauce, which reminded me of a vietnamese sandwich. The pork belly was super soft same goes for the pork belly in the Miso Ramen. Their Miso Ramen was delicious too. I've cleaned the whole bowl! Their soup was so flavorful and light. The staff was also extremely friendly. They even asked if I wanted to try samples of their special wine or champagne. They were very welcoming!
No comment

I tried dontaksu ramen and shoyu ramen so far. Both are decent. I prefer thicker noodle and more ingredients in the broth. If you like traditional thin noodle with simple yet deep broth, this would be the perfect ramen spot for you. The service was great and the location is close to Grand St. Station. I would've given 5 stars if the price a bit lower, considering I can get a pretty good $3 to 8 lunch around Chinatown area.

Zest Ramen is a hidden gem. The restaurant has a nice vibe-Cool music, high ceiling, and large seating areas. Authentic Japanese Ramen noodles are the best! I would recommend this restaurant to everyone.
We had a lovely lunch!  Great service, delicious dumplings and ramen, we will be back!
No comment
No comment

As all Australians know, we can't be without our Asian food. As Australians in NYC know, it's notoriously difficult to find good, authentic Japanese food at a good price. Zest Ramen nails it! A perfect bowl of ramen. Noodles, broth and the soft boiled egg take the cake. Their appetisers should not be overlooked either - the Takoyaki is my favourite. My partner and l came here twice in one week due to the delicious food and delightful service. Give them a go, and bring your friends too. Cheers!
No comment
No comment
The best takoyaki i've ever try. The place in chinatown is small but so confortable and cute, the restroom is very different with walls for you to write. The price is great and  lamen very tasty.

I will never forgive this city if we let this place die during these difficult times. They are doing $4 drinks all night and they have a cover for the rain and very affordable apps. The ramen is great and the pork buns are insane. The whole meal with drinks was $30/person. There are cute lights so it would also be a great date spot. Go, even if it's raining. I swear. I will never forgive you.

Love this ramen spot! We got the spicy miso and tonkatsu ramen. It was a very generous amount of pork belly, ramen and broth! You can also add extra ramen for extra 2$ and other ingredients such as seaweed, bamboo shoots, etc for 1$ extra. The broth is extremely rich and the noodles are perfectly cooked. The price is very decent for the LES; ramen from 11-12$. Their pork belly bun was really flavorful too, 2 buns for 7$. Overall, I love this spot! Will be coming back for ramen fix.
No comment

Their Shoyu broth is delicious. The service is friendly. But overall, their ramen fell short of greatness. The chashu was overcooked -- rough and chewy rather than tender, as one might expect from slow-cooked chashu. Noodles were slightly undercooked. But the prices are good and I may come back to try their other dishes.

This is my favorite ramen in the city. Its leagues better than ippudo, with quality ingredients, great flavor. Zest has not only great ramen but appetizers are spot on delicious. I would give this place 6 stars if I could. My wife and I have come every other week since we have been so lucky to find it. And the cherry on top...Dollar oysters

How does this place get such a a high review?  It serves subpar ramen coupled with basic frozen Japanese appetizers.  Throw some oysters into the mix (I'd check tags before trying) but kind of busy-ish for a saturday night.

column3: Griffith Park/Los Feliz, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Mediocre at best. Ended up getting the spicy tonkontsu. The broth taste was not great and the pork ended up being really chewy and hard to eat. Ramen meat should be extremely tender since it is a soup after all. It was almost like I needed a knife and fork to cut through it. Left 2 stars because the noodles were cooked nicely. I'm sure there are better options in the east village.
I've ordered their ramen delivery twice now, and will order again! It's difficult to face a successful delivery ramen, but this certainly was. Perfect for that comfort night in

Terrible service, will never return. Food is ok. Went on Saturday, not busy a few tables. Read the strong reviews and was looking forward to trying this spot but was very disappointed. Got our apps before our drinks, when we asked the server about them she quickly said oh yeah which should have been a red flag. She got my husband's order wrong so we had to wait for his soup while I had mine. The server only said a quick and half ass 'sorry' bc I kept making eye contact while we waited for his food. It was rushed so noodles were under cooked. He didn't finish it. And after all of that nothing was taken off the bill. So we paid full price for everything and still left a tip even though it wasn't deserved.

The space and ambience is nice and our waitress was extremely kind. She was very attentive. I ordered the chicken bun, takoyaki and ramen. Both appetizers were good. I got the spicy tonkotsu ramen, the broth and noodles were flavorful. I think the price was very reasonable for the items. The only thing I didn't like was the char siu in the ramen as it was kind of soggy and chewy. Almost like the texture of raw pork belly although I know it was cooked. They give you a little sip of iced tea at the end which is nice! Overall good ramen and ambience, I would come back if I was in the area and wanted some ramen.

How often do you come by a good ramen spot here in Chinatown?! This is definitely one of the places you have to come and try if you're craving ramen. I had the tonkatsu ramen. It's a MUST! The pork belly literally melts in your mouth, soup base wasn't too salty, and ramen is bouncy and chewy - just the way I like it. I highly recommend this place!!

column3: South San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: This is the best ramen place. I ate here to catch up with friends visiting in NYC and the ramen was tasty, flavorful and so enjoyable. Definitely coming back for more. Also amazing customer service and they give a shot of tea at the end.

Delicious! They have a vegan Ramen made with veggie broth and veggies! Delicious! The waitress was so kind and graceful! Highly recommend! I posted a video on Instagram and all of my friends want to eat here! I will definately be returning!
No comment

Zest Ramen is a hip place. The ramen is decent, but the appetizers made it a complete meal. Big fan of the purple yam fries and the fried squid. The ramen broth was clean, the noodles were average, the meat was good, and the egg was perfectly soft boiled. The service was amazing.
I love this Ramen spot. Probably one of the best in NY. The atmosphere is amazing! I can sit here and chill with friends for hours. And the server is really sweet and kind.
No comment

3:30-7p happy hour DAILY - can't complain about that! You'd think it would only apply to apps but they discount their ramen so that it's only $10! The fact that they also have oysters may be interesting to some.. but I love oysters so it's a-ok for me! As for the ramen, I ordered the tonkotsu - it came out quickly and was piping hot, broth was delicious but I wish the cut of the pork was a little thicker and it had more of a char on it. Otherwise, service and  music selection was good, atmosphere is cute - small, but you didn't feel cramped, and there was a steady stream of customers.

Had only an opportunity for a quick oyster happy hour while awaiting a takeout order nearby, but look forward to coming back to try more! Great $1 oyster specials and a cute and welcoming Asian themed atmosphere.

The place is small but nice and cozy. There is not that many options on the menu but what we got was chicken ramen. Omg! Like a home made. For only $11 and if you would like to add any other things its $1 extra. The staff is nice, very attentive and fast. Always checked on us if we are ok or need anything extra. Great location as well.
Cute and cozy place. We only have sake here and the sake came in a real cute can. It is 7 and 10 dollar sake and it came in a 200 ml can. Very cute, sweet place to hang out .
No comment

Just dine at zest ramen and I must say their ramen was super delicious my tummy was very happy. I ordered their yuzu salt, tonkotsu ramen and takoyaki for appetizer. Their tonkotsu was rich in flavors and the right amount of fat. Their yuzu broth was out of this world good it was savory and light with a nice hint of yuzu it's a must try. The noodle texture was fantastic, it was nice and chewy. Their appetizer was also very delicious especially their takoyaki. The prices for their ramen ranges from $11 to $12 which is relatively cheap compare to other ramen shops in nyc as well as additional toppings for just $1 to $2 extra! They also offer extra soup for just $5!! And extra noodles for $2! Their prices are unbeatable as well as their ramen broths. I can't wait to come back and try out all their other items on the menu. This place is definitely on my top 3 for best ramen.
What a awesome experience. People in here are happy, and also the place is very consent. Give it a try u will be missing out in $10 ramen, and 4.5 apps/ sake!! Super yummy
Blew us away! Went in with an open mind, without any expectations. Broth was rich and savory, noodles were fresh and firm, with a pleasant chewiness to every bite. Scores 4.2 out of 5 stars.
