Name says it all! Perfect place to enjoy dim sum ! All of them perfect and delicious! You will over indulge... I'm drooling just writing this review!
This place was a disaster the food was horrible and the manager rude. The wait staff if allowed to do his job was very pleasant. I know this is a trying time but good food is good food.
A VERY good dim sum spot for those not willing to hit up Chinatown. Tasty, quality, authentic, affordable, and good value.

Ummmmm the place is very clean and cute inside. Food is very bland. The ratings are so high, came in for dim sum and the variety of selection is small. No variety and bland at a higher end price. If you want good food you're better off in a Chinatown... People are very sweet but coming from an asian home and hometown in California this food was completely disappointing. I'm not even so sure how it has such high ratings other than its atmosphere and cleanliness.....

The food is very average. Note, there are no carts and you order dim sum off a sheet. Not an authentic experience and it shows in some dishes like shanghai pork buns and certain dumplings. Some traditional dim sims unfortunately have been dialled down or just blatantly prepared in an odd way to suit a wider audience I guess. Very disappointing.

Everything was excellent! We tried 5 different dishes, I can't remember the names of all of them but the cucumber was great as a veggie and the steamed shrimp and pork dumplings were sooo good. The fried spare ribs were also good. Great and friendly staff. Some of the best service I've had in the village.
Really good experience. Dumplings and cho fun were delicious and the service was excellent. We stumbled in here on a snowy, windy night and it hit the spot.

Went here for a quick friend date and we were not disappointed. We got two orders of dumplings and chicken and broccoli and it was more than enough and pretty affordable. The flavors of great the places smells delicious and the food is great
Pretty authentic foods and great service! We really liked the house boiled soup and cucumbers, as well as all of their dumplings.

The food here is good, but we only got dim sum. We ordered 4 dishes which included pork soup dumplings, pork steamed buns, shrimp and pork siu mai, and egg custard buns. The soup dumplings were pretty good but the wrapper was a bit too thick and the soup flavor was a bit lackluster. I would say these were not a meal highlight. The siu mai were delicious with nice thin wrappers filled with big plump pieces of shrimp. I was pleasantly surprised as usually siu mai are mainly filled with pork rather than shrimp. My favorite dish was definitely the egg custard buns. The buns themselves were fluffy and soft and filled with a gooey perfectly sweet egg custard. So good and definitely a must order. I might come back just to order these some time. The prices aren't as cheap as Chinatown or Flushing, but it's to be expected given that this place is in the East Village and real estate there don't come cheap. If you're in the area definitely give this place a try.
It's  a good dim sum restaurant, the taste is the same as that in Hong Kong, the waiter is enthusiastic, I will definitely go again.
This place is amazing! Foods are delicious, workers are nice, and the place is very clean. Would definitely come back.
Really slow service, on a day with few patrons. Food is just ok but when it takes 25 mins to receive soup appetizers, something's wrong.  Won't dine here again.
More expensive than dim sum places in Chinatown. The quality of dim sum is good, although I would only eat here to optimize for convenience of location.

Amazing experience in Dim Sum Palace with my friends!!!!! When I was hanging out with my friends around East Village, we found this grand new open Chinese restaurant. We tried the bbq pork bun, shrimp dumpling, chicken dumpling, Shanghai juicy pork buns, and the pan fried tiny bun. I can say all of them are perfect for me. I am a native born Chinese from the south of China, who grew up with dim sum as daily food, but since I moved to NYC three years ago, I miss my hometown food so so much. I couldn't find that kind of tases even I am in Chinatown. Dim Sum Palace is different, their foods recall my memories when I was in China!!! Definitely come back again!!!!
This is a great Chinese restaurant. it tastes authentic and the service is very enthusiastic. it is worth recommending.
Food is served with tons of MSG - have a gallon of water after the meal. $$$$ for fake Dim Sum.

The place was very clean and nice. The service was excellent. Food was also super good. I thought it was a bit overpriced though. Other than that, however, I think it's worth checking this place out. Like I said, the dim sum was super good.
Good dim sum good juicy beef mmmm soft meat very good doesnt come with rice tho  haha was good but it was really good and the service was ok
Quick and friendly service, and AMAZING food. As simple and ubiquitous as scallion pancakes are, this place  has some of the best. The rice noodle rolls were exceptional as well.
Had a chance but left off hoisson sauce for moo shu pork, and gave us a half mini cup of soy sauce / no duck sauce for a $65 order. Not getting it done.
Good service. Food met standard taste for Cantonese dim sum. The lotus leave sticky rice was good except it was overpriced.

Best Chinese restaurant in Manhattan, such cheap price with prefect traditional Chinese food. As someone who has been growing up In China I am very picky about Chinese food, this place satisfy my demand.
It's been a while, so I came here tonight for late night food. It's still so delicious !!! Love this place, the shrimp dumpling and bun are so good! Service is great too! Can't wait next time!
No comment
Just delicious! Everything was perfect. The skin is particularly good. The lotus dessert and coconut were also good.

Had a great dim sum brunch there earlier today. Everything was delicious, service very good. We got in at 10:30 am just as they opened, and were seated quickly. Took maybe 15 minutes for dumplings to cook and come out to us. One orders off a menu with pictures and descriptions, with a dry erase pen - super easy and convenient. Fun music on, place was clean and has good rest rooms as well. Nice to see their other locations. Since dim sum are a huge family favorite, and they do theirs so well, we will definitely be back!
No comment
Love the food here. Ordered delivery several times and my favorite is the steamed spare ribs with olive sauce. The shrimp dumpling is delicious.

A bit pricey but great dumplings. We ordered the hot and sour soup that wasn't that great to be honest. But the rest of what we ordered was really well done! We ordered the soup dumplings, the Buddha delight dumplings and some pork dumplings as well as pork buns. They were all really good.
Delicious and open late! All of the dumplings we had were wonderful and piping hot. Reason for 4 stars is price which was very high.
I ordered pretty much every variety of their dumplings in on sitting.  Quite impressive flavor.  Must try.

I'm this restaurant, the way dim sum works is you order all the food first instead of ordering while eating. The food was decent. Some of the food ordered was too salty for us. Price was way more than expected compared to other dim sum places

This is a great place to go for early morning tea, they have a variety of dim sums to choose from and each of the dishes are pretty good. Especially the shrimp dumplings and their custard/red bean/ roast pork buns are superb.
Quite expensive and the waiter "accidentally" gave us more foods than we ordered. We ordered 1 bowl of soup, he gave us 3. Quite the accident

I had high hopes for this dim sum place near my home, but only disappointment results after my initial order. My usual fave, the char siu bao, here have a vinegar aftertaste, most unpleasant. The har gow shrimp dumplings are decent, and stuffed full of shrimp. Shredded duck rolls are slimy and fried shrimp rolls are tasteless. Beef congee nasty, and could use some mustard greens, and again with a bad aftertaste. Other dishes hugely overpriced. Won't be ordering again. Chinatown is not that far away, for better and cheaper.
This place was really good! The shredded duck rolls and juicy dumplings were my favorite! Also nice decor, clean bathrooms, great service, ended up staying there a long time.

I ordered two different dumplings, fried rice, chow fun and chicken with broccoli (spicy) with extra soy sauce, duck sauce, and hot mustard. The chow fun tasted burned as if sautéed in old oil. The fried rice seemed reheated and also wasn't very good. They gave me 2 packets each of soy sauce, duck sauce, and hot mustard for 5 dishes. Lame. This was my first and last order from them.

First of all, this new dim sum restaurant gives Tim ho want some much needed competition. They have much more selections and is offering 20 percent off all dim sum. We have been here back to back weekends and have not been disappointed yet. The egg yolk bun, shrimp dumplings, Shu Mai , were perfect. The chow fun was excellent as well. I always judge a Chinese restaurant by how they prep beef chow fun, and this did not disappoint. Not too oily, and just the right amount of flavor.

Excellent.  So good it got our family to stop bickering.  Authentic, understated and cozy.  Highly recommended.  The General Tsao's chicken was perfectly crisp outside and tender and moist internally.  Shrimp with Bok Choi was exquisite.  Beef broccoli took this mundane staple to a whole new level. To top it off the staff is friendly, professional and attentive without being obsequious.  Quite possibly the best Chinese food in Manhattan.  Lovely.
Dim sum palace is my new go to! Dumpling were sooo delicious! Fresh, tasty and the staff was great! Perfect for date night or big group dinner, or late night eats! Open late. Will be a staple for me!

Delicious no-frills dim sum in a nicer than usual restaurant. Started with fried garlic ribs, which as expected were great, and tried a variety of dim sum dishes. Pork buns were amazing, soup dumplings good, duck dumplings great, shumai very good, and the pan fried dumplings (ordered the pork/chive) were delicious. The service was quick and friendly, and they were running a 20% off all dim sum special! Will definitely be back.
No comment
Good dim sum. Would recommend green tea rice balls after the meal. They come hot and are filled with a peanut sauce.
Fantastic place and happy hour deal; pretty standard dim sum fare in terms of the menu but rivals Tim ho wan at a fraction of the price

Great place to hangout with friends , the most traditionally Chinese dim sum restaurant around this area , the shrimp dumplings and steamed soup buns were amazing very juicy. Also the serve was so good , definitely will come back next time .
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I recently dined at this place with my husband. The atmosphere was cozy but the limited space made it difficult to move around. We ordered the Rigatoni alla Carbonara and Mafalde with Lamb ragu. We were highly disappointed to find both dishes overly salty. However, the Mafalde with Lamb ragu was still edible, while the Rigatoni alla Carbonara was unfortunately inedible. The pasta was too hard. I had to send it back to the kitchen to be remade, but the second attempt was not any better. I would never come back to this place. Also they present the wine selection in an unique way, but does not disclosure any prices.

Spes is one of the best restaurants ever! My boyfriend and I went on Friday night and loved it so much we went back again Saturday night! The staff is excellent, the ambiance is very beautiful and romantic, the food is terrific, the music is such a vibe, and the wine experience, knowledge, and taste is wonderful. We had Andy as our server and he was just so kind and amazing. The staff really improves your experience there. I look forward to our next reservation!
No comment

This is an adorable little restaurant that was recommended to me. The ambiance is nice, the food delicious and service was good.  It's very tiny! Only a handful of tables inside. Will definitely go back.
No comment

Spes is an amazing relaxed, small, intimate and dim lit wine bar with delicious food. Loved the octopus and carbonara! Attentive service and overall perfect experience, highly recommend for a cozy winter weeknight dinner with a glass of wine.

Absolutley loved the ambiance for dinner at Spes! The wine mood wheel was such a fun experience and the pastas were fresh. The servers were clearly very knowledgeable about the wines and we loved our server Beatrice, she was great!
No comment

We sat outside on a crooked table but 5 stars for sure! The server was excellent and took very good care us even with a packed house. We tasted the wine before ordering two glasses (bottles were $90+). The food is superb. Definitely a city favorite.
No comment
No comment
This place had the cutest dang ambiance. It's such a fun vibe & intimate space for dinner with friends. The wine was delicious & loved the carbonara.

Had a great time here! I'm not a wine connoisseur so I really appreciated their untraditional wine menu (you let your server know what color+mood you're looking for and they'll pick something for you). I loved the two wines I got, and they did a good job of picking out wines for the rest of my party as well. Overall, a relaxed and cozy spot to enjoy a drink.

Passed by this place 2 weeks ago and was drawn by the music - they have a live band every Thursday! Came back last night and it was lovely: the service was great, warm atmosphere with candles and wine on shelves everywhere, small tables. Very intimate!

As an Italian coming straight from the mother land, I can tell you this is IT! From food to wine pairings, to ambience and staff. This is LEGIT Italian food, prepared just like we do it in Italy with actually Italian staff. Couldn't believe it when the past was actually "Al dente"! Totally worth it!
No comment

Don't understand how this place has such high reviews. Pretty bad experience start to finish. We had a reservation and they said all the tables were taken and tried to cram us in 2 barstools in the corner. They have you spin a wheel to order a wine (they don't give you a wine list) and you end up massively overpaying for a wine. The food was also bland and incredibly disappointing. The crab ragu pasta was just linguini in olive oil. Such a disappointing experience and waste of $200+
Spectacular food, wine and ambience. Really is a level above many other places in the city.

Went there last night with 3 friends. The place was at maximum capacity and they put us at a shared table. The waiter could barely get to us, in order to use the bathroom we kept having to interrupt the other patrons to squeeze by. The food was just ok, and the wine was subpar and over priced. They don't have a wine menu so you have absolutely no idea what your paying. I truly felt bad for the server, he did his best with the circumstances. I wouldn't recommend this place especially if you're going with more than just one other person.

What a great experience and lasting memory. They guided me on the Italian wines, and the charcuterie board was one of the best I've ever had. They also had a live 4 piece band that was phenomenal and the staff is very nice and accommodating.

this place has the best espresso martini that I've tried in NYC, which is wild because I've had a lot. The burrata appetizer was fantastic, and the waitress was lovely. Great atmosphere and cute vibe. Would be a really nice date spot. Will be back!

The secret is definitely out so make sure to get a reservation here! We tried walking in on a Friday night and while we expected a long wait, we didn't expect to keep getting passed over for reservations that were showing up literally hours early. One example: we put our names down at 7:30 and after we waited about 30 minutes, another couple came in and asked if they could be seated for a 9:30 reservation. They were seated pretty much immediately. This kept happening, so we eventually gave up and came back on a weekday night with a reservation. Food and wine are excellent, but reservations are a must, especially since they'll just seat you whenever you show up as long as you have one. They also wouldn't quote us a wait time, but just kept saying that they'll "see what they can do," which was pretty frustrating since they clearly weren't going to seat walk ins. Fair enough, but let us know so we can go put our names down somewhere that does!

I liked the outdoor seating area and the weather was very nice on the night we went. I wasn't sold on the concept of choosing wine by the color and mood and letting the waiter choose from there, though. I'd suggest that they at least have the option to choose a wine from a regular menu. It was also overpriced but that was also more or less expected for a wine bar like this in Manhattan. Overall not too bad but I'm unlikely to return either.
some of the worst service in the east village which is a shame cuz they don't have their food to fall back on, would never go back
LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! The vibes are great, perfect for an intimate dinner or catch up with close friends
incredible vibe , wine , aesthetic , food everything was excellent and the waiters are phenomenal

One of the best dining experiences I've had in recent memory. We walked in, were accommodated immediately and treated to some unreal food and service. Trust their wine recommendations because they have an incredible selection. The pasta was next level! I'm not usually a dessert person but the chocolate almond cake with habanero peppers and gelato was one of my favorites from the meal. Everyone was so nice, the atmosphere was fantastic, and I was Shazaming every song off the playlist. Go here immediately! But don't tell anyone, I want to be able to get a table in a few months time.

There isn't much to say about Katz that most people wouldn't already know! From being featured in countless magazines and articles online for being one of the best pastrami sandwiches in the country to being featured in movies, Katz is a NYC icon. That being said, the pastrami sandwich is excellent. There is some level of customizability with the sandwiches, but I would often recommend to go with what the 'cutter' recommends especially if its your first time. The cutters will also give you a slice of the pastrami to try and if they don't feel free to ask as they are fairly friendly given how busy the restaurant often is. The sandwiches at Katz' are large and easily sharable so I would recommend splitting a sandwich between two unless you're famished. Outside of the world famous pastrami sandwich, make sure to try their array of pickles that come with the sandwiches. While Katz' Delcatessen may always have a long wait, it is surely worth the trip for an excellent sandwich!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

LOVE LOVE LOVE Pastrami. And Katz's Deli delivered. Aside from being super crowded I would say we had a good time here. I loved the pastrami sandwich of course-the meat was super tender & delicious. I tried matzah ball soup for the first time and oh my goodness...it was the BEST! We also had pickles and a hot dog lol. The hotdog bread was little dry for my liking so won't be ordering that again. Food was great & beer was cold-I would definitely return!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Do not lose your ticket even if you don't order anything. You will be penalized. We waited over an hour to enter the restaurant and order at the counter, but that was on a Saturday around lunchtime, so maybe it was to be expected. The place has a big communal seating area and in the back there is a small space where you get served, but you pay extra. I ordered the corned beef and hubby ordered pastrami, and both sandwiches were amazing! The servings are more than filling. I ended up feeling too full eating half of the sandwich. Definitely worth the wait. My mouth waters every time I think about this place!
No comment

Whoever hears that Katz is an overpriced tourist trap with rude staff, let those unfounded rumors die. I occasionally visit when there's room in my diet and stomach, and it's always great. Today my sandwich guy politely said that he had to make a few sandwiches for an order so I would have to wait a few minutes. It took maybe ten minutes, no big deal, and he rewarded me with two plates of pastrami samples, not one. "You're patient, I give you love". Not only that, I got a fresh piece right out of the oven that was nice and fatty, tender and extra  flavorful. The house pickles never miss either. This time I also tried a round potato and broccoli knish - delicious with brown mustard. As I was paying, the cashier offered me a paper bag for my wrapped leftovers. Can't ask for anything more. They do a kick ass job and run a tight ship.
No comment
No comment

column3: Coral Gables Section, Coral Gables, FL
column6: Let's start off how famous this place  came out on a lot of movies and so when you walk in they give you a ticket you go get your food you pay on your way out and the beef is not as good a lot of meat meat plus if you lose your ticket they charge you $50 so make sure you have your ticket  the place looks nice inside

What else can you say, it's Katz. Coming from the west coast I knew I had to make my way here when I came into town. There's always a line so be patient. When you order they give you a little taste of the meat that you ordered which was awesome. Pastrami was super tender and flavorful.

What a great, iconic NYC experience, not to be missed.  The full sandwiches are not cheap, but they are easily two meals each.  The beef brisket and cole slaw were outstanding. The corned beef unfortunately we found a too salty and dry.  Also enjoyed their store-branded lemonade.  We arrived mid-week in the afternoon and did not have to wait.
No comment

Excellent food as always! Been coming here for over 35 years! I always get the 1st cut brisket & pastrami on a roll w/ coleslaw & a side of fries.  Their light beer selection is pretty good too.  The person who took my beer & French fry order was so kind to help me carry the beer to my table! It would have been a huge disaster had I carried it! I don't know his name, but I included his photo in my review.

Another must just next to Russ and Daughters, Katz delicatessen is mostly known to the out-of-towners from "When Harry Met Sally", even though millennials and gen-Zs don't really know this anymore. The last time, I had visited before that was in 1988. At this time, the food and the packed noisy inside did not really convince me to stay. But visit to have it checked off.
Their pastrami is 5-star, but matzo ball soup and knishes are embarrassingly bad. I don't understand what people line up for.
No comment
Pastrami is AMAZING!! I definitely know I won't be able to find the same taste and quality as this place. Service was also good. The system is very well organized. And they serve you quite quickly.

Iconic, a must-see. The pastrami was incredibly good, delicate, and they take time carving and serving it. It must've been salty, because I've never had to get up 4 times in a night to drink water after! The split pea soup was wholesome, though no spice or added flavors.
The real deal. Sublime pastrami. Spot-on pickles. Worth the trek, worthy of the hype, worth the wait.

I've heard that Katz is very famous and well known for their sandwiches. I went to try it. I ordered a 1/2 pastrami sandwich with matzo ball soup. The second I took a bite on the sandwich my expression was WOW!! It's definitely one of the best sandwiches I've had. Their meat was soft and tender. The order didn't take so long to arrive. I highly recommend this place.

Worry the hype!! The sandwiches are amazing. It may seem expensive but they are very generous on the amount of meat you get. It's worth the line, wait, and visit. Indoor seating is available. The workers are all very kind and helpful, even to tourists

Katz was mouth watering yet very expensive! We came to try the famous sandwich and waiting in line (which was not too long of a wait compared to most days) but made it in and they had a cafeteria styled service to order, grab and seat yourself type of environment. Don't get me wrong, the sandwich was delicious, the samples they give you while you wait, chefs kiss! Just overall would not come back often to spend $25+ on a sandwich

Take all my money. I love the pastrami at Katz's! I make homemade pastrami and Katz is the only place who can top my own! I don't need to write anything else, just come and see for yourself! Top notch service and old school vibe inside, doesn't get better.

Katz's is definitely worth the wait. Line took about 35 minutes and the energy to restaurant was great. I read somewhere online that when ordering you have to ask to, "Make it juicy." Food was amazing, will definitely visit again the next time I'm in NY.

Had to try Katz after all the hype! This review is for a pickup order experience. Tbh I had never had pastrami before and was nervous to try it so I got the pastrami sandwich. I really liked it and the mustard but it still seemed like it was missing something for me. The sandwiches were big but I would say it's enough for one person if you don't get any sides. We got steak fries which were okay. I liked the sour pickles a lot. Overall, the meat was pretty good and the mustard was a nice complement. I don't know if this would be my go to spot because of the price but the food was decent.

First time here! First time seeing it compared to all the hype it's come around. First, of all be prepared to wait as there's a line outside and once you get in it's another line to the deli cutter of your choice, but once you've had about 30-45 mins of waiting fun begins! I got a basic pastrami sandwich on rye and it was very very juicy the pastrami is always fresh and cut to perfection! Like my god I couldn't have a better basic sandwich which will set you back 25 dollars and come with some pickles but I swear it's one of the best pastrami sandwiches you can eat worth the wait and would come back here anytime!!it's always busy here and kind of noisy but that's a small con to the pros

You don't come here for feel good service. This is the NYC service industry stereotype at its best! Haven't decided on your dish, don't waste the server's time. Sitting for too long after finishing eating, you will hear about it. Worth the experience; just don't expect midwestern hospitality. Matzah ball soup was good, but don't really have anything to compare it to. The sandwich was amazing! Beer was good, but have no clue what it was. The choice was "light or dark". No questions; just chose one

If you're in NYC at all...make the subway ride. Soooo worth it, best sandwich of my life. It's very busy but I take that as a sign of great food!

As expected, when we got there it was packed. The line moves slowly, but they have many windows for you to order. I recommend this place for you to try, but personally, I will not go back for the second time. Not because the sandwich was bad, but because I've already know how it tasted. Overall, the sandwich was good. Generous portion of meat. Very tender. It's expensive because you're pretty much buying the meat. They packed the sandwich with meat, which makes the price worth it. If you are visiting NYC for the first time, definitely give it a try. You won't regret it if you're a meat lover.
The center of the pastrami universe never disappoints. Thicker cut, juicy, spiced perfectly. Matzo ball soup is standard, even the snap frankfurter is the bomb

I got up, jumped on the bus, got off 15-20min later, placed an order and was back on the bus going in the opposite direction. Round trip to Katz from the meat packing district in just over an hour. I was pretty impressed with myself. And, I was pretty impressed with their food! I LOVED the bright green pickles-my absolute favorite! The pastrami was really tasty and I loved the steak fries. I also liked the coleslaw and their selection of pop. Black cherry is the best!! Fun decor on the walls and fast and furious! Definitely a place I would pop into on the regular if I lived here!
No comment

Who hasn't heard of Katz, right? Whether you've been there or not, you know it's  such an iconic place known for its legendary Pastrami sandwich. That sandwich was so massive,  t'was good for two people, really.  As you walked in, friendly staff would be by the door to greet you and give you a ticket. This ticket is crucial for them writing down what you ordered, so when you leave you show it to the cashier.  Akin to a cafeteria, there were separate counters for sandwiches, hotdogs and soups, sodas and coffee. Those preparing your sandwiches are called "cutters"- Best to tip them before you order, for best cuts and maybe for sampling. I love their Matzo Ball Soup - so far the best I've had. My sandwich was very good, as well, but honestly, a local deli near my town could give Katz a run for its Reuben. Nevertheless, our impromptu visit here made everything alright on an otherwise frustrating night.
No comment

No comment

Stopped by around 1115 on a Saturday and only had to wait in line for 5-10 mins! Once we were in we were given a ticket and told to stand in any of the counters to order. I tried the classic pastrami on rye and it was delicious. The meat was juicy and well seasoned. You can pay in the back with card or pay on your way out with cash. Don't lose your ticket, they collect it when you leave!
No comment

I have been here a few times and I have not been disappointed. The portions are filling and taste is amazing. I have only had the pastrami Sandwich. I enjoyed every single bite. Service was great. I'm not a fan of mustard and forgot to tell him not too put any. But I can hardly taste it. One of the best pastrami I have had so far.
No comment

Katz! So good are their sandwiches and OG concepts. The fries are thick with their own line ordering. Sandwiches are several lines with many employees making your sandwich right in front of you, with a sample of the type of meat given to you. Appetizers such as dessert, blintzes & latkas with applesauce and cream cheese, are towards the back of the room. It can get very busy when dining in, but there's also seating around the cook stations that's hidden by their setup. Keep an eye on your ticket as that's your receipt to get outta there. Anyway food, it's all good!!

We always make it a point to go to Katz's when we come to NYC. The pastrami sandwich is a must. We also had coleslaw and a toss green salad. One stood in line to order the food and the rest of us found a table. Oh the pickles were great too.

Forever a classic landmark of good, authentic, LOADED sandwiches. Service is still top notch, I still get amazed how packed it is when I stop by, and I never have to wait too long. Nothing but tradition when you step inside, you can just feel the history and can tell by the ambiance. If you haven't experienced this place, you and your friends deserve to check it out immediately. One of the hearts of lower east manhattan.

This is a must eat when you're in NY. You go in and get handed a ticket, and then wait in one of the lines to place your order. They make it in front of you and then you move onto the next line for drinks. You eat and pay for your food afterwards. Make sure you hold onto your ticket because they collect it on the way out and will charge you if you lose it. I recommend the classic Reuben sandwich with pastrami and chase it with both kinds of pickles. It's melt-in-your-mouth goodness!

After always watching TV, and seeing this restaurant, definitely iconic place to eat ! Really enjoy it !
Corned Beef was fresh and reminded me a lot of brisket. Service was fast and friendly for this first timer

Meg Ryan fans can't miss this place!  They've got the biggest Scooby Stuffed Sandwiches I've ever seen.  Everything is homemade here.  We come here for the roast beef and pastrami sandwiches on Rye.  It's popular with the tourists but so worth the wait.
Iconic New York City staple.  Everyone should make a pilgrimage here at least once.  No frills deli where you order is meat and bread.  Maybe a little mustard too but not much else...just the basics.

Katz Deli is all things good in the world. You cannot go wrong with the pastrami sandwich. I didn't understand the hype before I went but I always mention it to friends who are visiting the city! The meat is so tender and delicious. I love that they give you a little sample of meat as you watch them make your sandwich. I even tried the egg cream soda and it was good! I usually share a sandwich between two people and get a side of fries.

column3: East San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: I'm not a pastrami guy but eating this, you know it's genuine. Straight fire. The meat is tender and good flavor. The combo with bread is fire. I enjoyed grubbing on this. I recommend getting it only meat with melted Swiss. Simple and good. Potato knish is good but I'm not a big fan. Try!

Tried Katz for the first time with the family. Got the pastrami on rye and the Ruben pastrami on rye. I liked both of them. The Russian dressing was different than I have had in California but it was ok. The meat was cooked perfectly, juicy and tender. The sandwiches are heavy. I got one for the kids to share and it was plenty. I would have been good with just half a sandwich instead of a whole. One thing to note, if you are going with friends or family ask them to taste the pastrami sample prior to ordering. My niece ordered a whole pastrami and didnt like pastrami. What a waste.

The best. Don't expect to be treated like a king though. The food here is excellent in this NY institution. The waiters in table service can be gruff, but isn't that the charm

Great pastrami sandwiches with tons of meat! Make sure you go here hungry because the sandwiches were stuffed with meat. I couldn't finish my half of the sandwich. Ordering is a little confusing at first but an employee was able to explain it to us. There were a lot of people here when we visited and it was hard to find an open table so keep that mind when visiting.

Heyyy "I'll have what she's having!!!!" Hahahahha So fun!!! This place is a must if you're ever in New York ! Delicious food, fun ambiance and quick and friendly service!

If you like traditional Jewish deli food this is the place. If you're worried about price then skip it because it is pricey but in return you will get a great sandwich and food. The pastrami us the best. Make sire you tip the cutter who makes your sandwich

Came here for the first time during my New York vacation and wowww it was so good! The garlic pickles were perfect!!! It was so tart and sour with perfect texture just the perfect pickle accompanied with the pastrami sandwich I ordered. It was really good, hearty, just really high quality meat here. Do not be turned off by the long lines, it isn't as long as it seems, the staff here works hard and fast which makes the time really fly even when thee lines are around the corner. Unfortunately the whole dining experience was particularly soured after one of the workers dropped a salad plate next to me, spilling dressing all over my shoes, my jeans, and my sweater. It just really made me upset and uncomfortable, and they offered me a cheesecake as a sorry after ruining my clothes. Then they proceeded to pour this rice grain thing all over the floor even while we were still seated and eating?? Felt so incredibly unprofessional and just ruined the whole experieGood food, amazing place, just sad to have it be soured by this experience/exchange.

6 stars!   Katz's is an institution.  A must-go when in New York and the Lower East Side.  They give you your "ticket" when you enter, you must present to the food preparers after they make your sandwich, etc.   Pay on the way out by presenting your marked-up ticket to cashier.  You can only get half deli sandwiches with soup, an entire sandwich is a lot for 1 person.  Slather the deli mustard on the pastrami, hot dog, everything else.  Leave the sandwich makers a nice tip, they'll give you samples of the deli meat while they're making your sandwich.

If you know, you know...there is something truly magical about getting a pastrami sandwich at Katz Deli in New York City! Not only is it famous because of one of my all time favorite romantic comedies, When Harry Met Sally but also the meat is out of this world. Yes the prices are a bit steep.  Paying over $20 for a sandwich which over the years has shrunk in size but it is still the best tasting pastrami sandwich out there. While you are there don't forget to get an egg cream. So delicious!
No comment
Good pastrami sandwiches and pickles. The latkes are a bit dense for my preference and the entire restaurant can feel a bit chaotic.
No comment
Literally got off the plane at JFK and went right to Katz's delicatessen. The pastrami was incredible! The brisket was really good. The hotdogs were PERFECT! I love it!
No comment

Oh my! What an experience! I live in Houston and we have a Katz's here but the experience is completely different. We started off waiting in a line outside. As people came out people were let in. You receive a ticket (make sure you don't lose that!) and you get in one of the deli counter lines. You order the meats/sandwich you want and they assemble in front of you. If you're nice, they will give you a sample of other meats. The staff was extremely friendly! We ordered the Reuben with pastrami, coke slaw, and I requested a sample of roast beef and pastrami. Everything tasted absolutely amazing and it was an experience like no other!

Just as fast and crazy as I thought LOVED IT!!!  Have been living in the area for about 8 years and never went. Finally one late evening after Saint Paddy's we stopped in for a classic pastrami on rye and it was delicious!

I am 63yrs old and have been a fan since I was a kid in the 60s.  Love Katz always. Same place same friendly yet scurried atmosphere. It's a Native New Yorkers must go stop

The food here is incredibly good. The brisket, pastrami and burgers are out of this world. Definitely worth waiting on line to get in.

Best Reuben I've ever had!  My hubs and I were visiting Nee York for our 30th anniversary and Katz's was recommended to us by a local. We didn't know about it's history until we visited. But seriously the food was amazing. Be prepared to wait in a long line, though!
Really enjoyed our lunch here! Fresh made pastrami was the best! It made our trip to NY worthwhile! The pickles are also the best!

Once you get in the line, it's like waiting for a roller coaster. There is this exciting feeling as so much is going on at every cutter station as they serve the locals and tourists in a organized chaotic way. When it's your turn to order, be sure to have your decision made. I've had a few sandwiches here in the past so it's hard to say which is truly my favorite. This time went with a half Rueben with pastrami added and also got a corned beef with mustard. Be sure to get both kinds of pickles and definitely add a matzoh ball soup if you got room for it. I sure did and it was Perfect for a cold winter day/night. The ambiance feels super nostalgic with pictures of past and present figures in entertainment.
Long waits but huge pastrami sandwich! Up to you if you want to wait up to an hour for some meats!

This is the real deal. Mobbed busy and yet very NYC organized. Get your ticket at door from a big gruff bouncer guy and make sure you get it back to him with the receipts on way out. Very old school. Very 1940s vibe. Great authenticity in staff. Food. Service. Continuous bussing. Pickles. Beer. Pastrami. A riot of delicious crowded noisy New Yawk confusion.  It ain't cheap but you're having too much fun to notice.
I ordered the lox bagel here. I have to say, I was pretty impressed. The lox was flavorful and bagel was delicious. I would definitely recommond this place.

One word : overhyped ! Native New Yorker - stopped by with two friends. The pictures online looked bigger than what was actually served. I was disappointed because my pastrami had too much fat in it. The payment system is weird ; splitting checks is frowned upon This place caters to tourists only.

We got there at a good time and there was no line or wait. The guys behind the counter were great and kept offering my wife and I samples. I thought I was going to full before I got my order. I don't eat pastrami, but my wife does occasionally, and she said it was the best pastrami she has ever had.

I'm seriously pissed right now. At all the people behind the reviews that claimed that is the BEST PASTRAMI SANDWICH??? And made me walk 40 minutes. It is SO NOT! And for $30? F* off! The pastrami was DRY and RUBBERY and majorly LACKING FLAVOR and it TOOK EFFORT to SWALLOW it. Was there Friday at 6 and the wait took about 20 minutes.

Good food here with nice staff, but I suppose you could find similar food without the 75 minute wait. Like everything else during this frickin pandemic the cost of eating a simple pastrami became a small fortune. We went just to say that we went.

The food was good but $25 for a sandwich on regular white bread with pickles is a bit extreme. However, this is definitely a tourist attraction so you should expect that. Overall I'm glad I visited and the amount of corn beef on the sandwich was enormous and the meat was obviously top quality. I enjoyed it but for the price I most likely won't return .

Best hot pastrami I've ever had. It was HUGE! Well worth the price and I would purchase again in a heartbeat.

I recently went with my parents after years and years of them talking about it and referring to it whenever they say, "It's good but it's not Katz". And let me tell you, they were right. Going there is an absolute experience. When I went, no joke, there was a line around the building. But it went surprisingly fast. When you get closer the aroma starts to make you drool. It is so organized and well run, and I wouldn't want it any other way. Everyone who works in there cooks everything with love. If you are lucky, you will get a piece of meat when you are waiting in line. When you sit down and have the first bite, you forget where you are and what you are doing. You drift into your own world. You cannot go wrong with anything you order. But after you eat there, you are never going to forget. Everyone who is able to deserves to go at least once in their life.

Tell me you're a New Yorker without telling me you're a New Yorker. Katz's has been a staple for us every visit home. Even if it's an hour wait, it's worth it. I've ordered delivery to California from this delicatessen and I don't really like sandwiches. The feeling when you walk through these doors with the ticketing system takes you out of the everyday digital world we live in, and I'm extremely grateful for that. Keep doing what you're doing Katz's, we'll keep coming back.
10 stars. A real NY experience. Been here all my life. Bring cash. Order anything. I dare you to not like it.
I can't believe I have never been here. I went expecting to check it off my NYC bucket list, and then just devoured the pastrami on rye and loved every single bite.

Bro! You want a pastrami sandwich that will ruin all pastrami sandwiches for the rest of your life?? Then eat this one slowly and enjoy!  This place is awesome, the food is amazing and the atmosphere is just so old school and alive here. The guys putting the sandwiches together are cool dudes and funny as hell. Mi gente! I can't wait to go back.

Some places are institutions for a reason. Came in for my first visit at 3 am on nye and had an amazing experience. The pastrami on rye with mustard was superb. Brisket was fatty moist and very tender. Not a meal id soon forget. Certainly expensive but worth it if youre splurging.

Ok this was amazing! The line wasn't too bad to get in. Once you're in you pick a line to order from. We ordered the Ruben and pastrami. I'll say that the pastrami is the way to go! It was amazing! Seriously some of the best meat. The pickles were also incredible. It's definitely an old school restaurant with sawdust on the floor and you find a seat at any table. This place is a must!!

First timer - came here on Saturday morning around 10 expecting a crush of people. No waiting! Cutter was funny and efficient, and everyone else was nice or nicer - and patient as you navigated the various counters to get your various food items. Food was de-lish, portions on the larger side, with a price tag to match. Only one disappointment: found a hair underneath my sandwich - ugh. (Well, at least I didn't eat it!)

What can I say about Katz's Deli that hasn't been said 1000 times before - it's amazing!  Lives up to all the hype and more.  We got there with no line outside (thankfully) but still really busy inside.  Was a full sandwich too much for each of us?  Probably - but one I caught sight and had a taste of the pastrami, there was no way I was getting a half sandwich. I don't know how they do it, but their pastrami is other-worldly.  We each ordered a pastrami Reuben, but served on rye, the bread got way too wet - so much so that I had to eat it with a fork.  My fault, but even if I couldn't pick it up, it was delicious.  We got sides of Cole Slaw (so incredibly good) and fries.  Perfect in every way.  Truly the tough part is finding a table, because even after people finish eating, they just want to hang out.  We did, too!  Cash only at the front of the store but in the back they'll take credit card payment.  Katz's was blocks from where we were staying, so we walked by it often - but there was no way I'd be able to eat more than 1 sandwich a week / or a month if I lived close by.  Incredible yes - but so heavy.  Loved every bite.
No comment

There's not much really to say about Katz's that has not already been said but I'll say something anyway. Although the pastrami was delicious and there's hardly a sandwich more iconic, the most important aspect of Katz's is the environment and the history. All of the pictures on the walls and the high paced and busy environment is what you're paying for. And boy, will you pay. I've never payed so much for a sandwich and I don't think I ever will again but the experience was worth the unaffordable price tag.

We came at 11am. It was before the lunch rush. There was 9 cutting station. You get a ticket at the door which you use to pay at the end. Don't lose it . The whole process was smooth. The cutters let you sample the meat while they are cutting it. We got the pastrami and brisket. Both were delicious and juicy. Definitely worth a try. It was about $25 a sandwich. It was like a pound of meat on it.

Finally tried THE Katz's deli and yes it lives up to the hype and more!!! The decor inside is super cute and they have the sign from When Harry met Sally!! Ordered online and it was fast to pickup. Got the Reuben with pastrami on rye and it was MASSIVE!!!! Could be shared with 2-4 people. I ate half and probably could've gone the rest of the day without eating. The meat is so flavorful and just melts in your mouth. The pickles were great to cut the heaviness and extra sauce is a must!!! Do yourself a favor and go!!!!
Sodium attack forsure. Got the pastrami sandwich. Super tender meat and was delish. One sandwich can fill up 2 people. Plenty of food. Definitely on the pricier side. $25 for pastrami sandwich.

Absolutely delicious. This was my first time going to this deli. It is definitely an experience. It was so packed, we could barely find a line to stand in. I went straight to the line furthest from the front door. You could watch the servers pull out the large pieces of meat from the cooker and freshly cut the meat. They will also give you a sample of the meat that you request. Definitely appreciated that. I ordered French fries, a hot pastrami sandwich with their spicy mustard and Munster cheese, and some pickles. Unfortunately, the pickles weren't fully pickled. Everything else was amazing! A huge portion of well seasoned meat on fresh rye bread. I honestly could have made two meals out of what I was given. I will certainly be back.

This place is definitely worth the hype. Got lucky the line wasn't that bad when I came by. Ordered the pastrami and was not disappointed. For sure the best I've ever had. The pastrami was so juicy and tender wish I had gotten more.

This was my first visit to Katz's. It was a Tuesday at 11:15am. I received my ticket when I went through the door. I gave my ticket to Cutter #7 and he wrote the cost of the pastrami sandwich with mustard on it and returned it to me. I tasted my sample Pastrami too. I found a seat, somehow, and started to chomp down. I'm a fan of the pastrami but not of the sandwich experience. There's no way that much weight can stay within the confines of two brittle and small pieces of bread.  Not that the meat was dry but I needed a soft drink to get it all down. I think my body was fighting back against pastrami overload. I'm not a fan of the pickle and they gave me so much of it to eat. I had not eaten breakfast nor did I have a need for dinner later on. I had planned to get steak fries but there was no way that was going to happen.

My son and I came to New York to spend a few days being tourists. At the top of his list of things he wanted to do, eating here was one of them. We showed up at around 1145 on a Tuesday. There was a long line on the sidewalk and we were worried it would take forever. But the line moved relatively quickly. When you walk in the door, you get a ticket for each person in your party. Don't lose it. This is what gets you back out the door. You can go up to the counter and order and then try to find a place to sit in a large area with many tables. Or you can go to the back and be seated for table service. We opted for the table service. Our server was quick to greet us and quick to bring us everything we needed. They bring you a plate with two kinds of pickles. I only wanted a half sandwich so I opted for the menu item that was a bowl of matzo ball soup and half of a Reuben sandwich. The soup was very good and the Reuben sandwich was incredible. I have never had more tender corned beef, and everything was put together perfectly. Come hungry because the portion size is large. My son got a pastrami Reuben, and said it was the best he had ever had. It was definitely worth coming in for and I look forward to coming back.
No comment
The best pastrami in town. This restaurant is an icon. You must visit. They take credit cards now too and not just cash. Its so much food and so yummy.

Visiting New York and we HAD to eat here during our visit. Everything we ordered was amazing and my mouth waters when I think of this dang Pastrami Sandwich. First off, when you go in they're gonna give you a ticket. Don't lose this ticket. Each cutter/slicer has their own line. Tip your cutter lol. I got the Pastrami on Rye (I think) with mustard and I asked for it juicy (fatty). Then, they're gonna give you some pieces on a small plate. Grab it and eat it. Then order anything else, they'll mark your ticket then sit, eat, enjoy and before you leave, that's where you'll pay. Hope you love it as much as we did! Also, good vibes bad you can learn a lot while standing in line.

How can you not recommend this place?  Apart from waiting in line for 40 minutes and spending $25 for an enormous sandwich, it is definitely worth it.  Get the pastrami sandwich and put mustard on top, then enjoy arguably the best sandwich in the city.  It is very expensive but you're getting the best quality meet that could be eaten on its own. Hard to not recommend this place as a must try if you're in NYC.

The amazing food, service, and clean and quick service. I loved that no matter how slammed they are, when you're next in line, they act like you're the only one in the restaurant. Love it! Worth the trip!
Been coming here a long time and the food is not like it used to be but still pretty good considering how super crowded it usually is,

Holy sh*t!!!! I had no idea how much I would love Katz's. Walking in and lining up was already an experience. The service at the counter was friendly as they usually offer you to taste some of the meat you ordered for the sandwich. I ordered the brisket sandwich and fell in love. The brisket was so soft and the marinade was 10/10. I wish I could have eaten more in one sitting cause it was so damn good! Happy I had leftovers but will never forget my first time having a sandwich at Katz.

Unsure why everyone goes crazy for this place! Definitely too hyped out and overly expensive for what it is. My sister's bf really wanted to go so we were all dragged here. The line was long but moved quickly, you have to be quick and seat yourself at the tables. We got 2 sandwiches: the pastrami and the corned beef, as well as a matzah ball soup and pickles! The matzah ball soup was pretty decent, but it's also hard to mess up such a simple soup. The pickles were my fav thing to have here, they were crunchy and juicy and salty! The sandwiches were really hearty and filling, but 25USD for one? That's really expensive... not sure how I feel about it. I guess it's worth visiting once but I wouldn't necessarily come again.

I was disappointed in the food, but loved the vibe and craziness of the restaurant. All the employees seemed like they were having a great day, interacted with each other and the guests, too. I recommend Katz Deli not for the food, but for experience!
I understand why Joey Tribbiani is obsessed with pastrami now. Their pastrami is so tender and flavorful without being too salty. The wait is extremely long but well worth it.
No comment

Try he food here is simple amazing--and service is great!  My husband lived his classic pastrami sandwich and my son loved the bagel, egg and pastrami too!  The ticket process is tricky to us "outsiders" so that's the only thing but in time and with subsequent visits, we figured it out!  Super delicious!!

I came on a Saturday night after bar hopping, and this place was packed!! I would probably recommend skipping this place, but would also recommend coming here if you don't have anything else to eat. It's good, but not the best. I felt like it was a littleee dry and not worth the wait!!

column3: South San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: Kat'z Deli is in my top 3 restaurants I've tried in New York. I am not the biggest fan of red meat so the huge sandwich looked pretty intimidating. I ordered the Pastrami on Rye and it was so good and flavorful! Probably the best sandwich I've ever had. It was well worth the $28 (including taxes). I also don't like mustard, but for some reason the mustard here was amazing. It really blew my expectations. There was a line during lunch time on a Sunday, but it moved really quickly. We waited in a short line that was out the door, then once we got in, there were several lines inside to choose from to order.
Food is amazing! I do not like pastrami and the only place I eat it is at Katz that's enough said especially for a non pastrami eater!

Good & Pricy Jewish Deli Meal of Meats Knish's  Franks salamis and soup.  Parking sucks but you often get lucky depending on the time of your visit.  Better than the Brooklyn location.  P.S.- don't misplace your ticket upon entry or they act like your trying to steal something.
No comment
The pastrami sandwich is the best I've ever had in my life. The meat is perfectly prepared with the perfect flavor and texture.
No comment
Great food! It's a must visit if you are in NYC. A classic NY eatery. Yummy corned beef sandwiches!
It's Katz. What else needs to be said! NYC staple. Pastrami on rye with mustard is all you need!
